description:
Judgement-free zone where one could enjoy a pre-dinner ice cream and chase it down with a burger, fries, shake, and wine (or beer. or tea. or water.) 

I'm particularly fond of adding grilled onions to my burger because I'm fancy like that. 

Is this my favorite place for burgers? Yes
Would I fight someone to defend its honor? No. I don't like violence.
Do I really need to have a pre-meal ice cream? No. Sometimes a shake will do.

The ice cream here is hella good and if you want to order a kid-sized cone, you can. Because that's how cool this place is. 

Wine, beer, burgers, ice cream, and compostable food wrappings. All-around fabulousness. Also, the walls are fun to read.
author: Loli L.

description:
I have been vegan nearly 20 years. I went vegan before it was cool. I became vegan in a small beach town in FL that was more famous for producing world champion surfers than innovative veggie burgers.

Fast forward many years on & I am now living in the SF Bay Area. I was already a fan of Super Duper Burgers after visiting their branch in Berkeley so found a similar experience here in the Castro.

I recently went to Super Duper Burgers in the Castro. They have two locations in the East Bay & six locations in San Francisco along w/ a dozen locations in the SF Bay Area. The location in the Castro is a short walk from the Church St MUNI for those w/ the car-free lifestyle like myself.

There motto is "Fast Food Burgers, Slow Food Value". They use artisanal buns, homemade pickles, organic, & 100 percent compostable packaging. 

The staff was helpful to help me navigate the vegan options on the veg-friendly menu. Enjoyed the veggie burger, fries, & homemade pickles. Solid meal that was satisfying on the surprisingly sustainable eco-conscious menu.

I pretty much ordered everything that was vegan. My Veggie Burger was an organic patty w/ hummus, cucumbers & omit the super sauce to customize it vegan. It comes w/ lettuce, tomato, & red onions. Be sure to also ask for grilled onions, pickles, & jalapeño peppers if you are okay w/ spicy. I also had them add avocado & roasted portobello. The avocado was a small portion yet still enjoyed the veggie burger. Kudos for using quality ingredients!

I paired the veggie burger w/ french fries & loved the homemade pickles as they are quite alright. I like that they use Sir Kensington's ketchup & mustard which is quite alright. 

They do have organic straus shakes along w/ soft serve yet it would be nice to have a vegan option.

I have had better veggie burgers before yet this one was solid. I appreciate the care to use quality ingredients along w/ being eco-conscious. 

All in all a positive experience here & look forward to returning.
author: Shane S.

description:
Yelp says they don't have free Wi-Fi. But the one on Market near Castro does.

My small 4 oz. burger was of high-quality, but on the small side for the money ($6.78 with tax, no fries). But you know, quality costs, not to mention the ridiculous price of everything nowadays.
author: fp c.

description:
Simply delicious! We are not from SF but we basically tried the place because our Lyft driver compared it to In-N-Out. Why do people have to compare simple delicious burgers to each other? Although I don't agree that it compares, the burgers did hit the spot. Patty was nice and juicy and it had all the right fix-ins to make it a great burger. Came out in about 5 min. Can't go wrong with the fries. Also have self serve thick pickles but wasn't really feelin em.

Overall pretty bomb! We left satisfied. Prices aren't bad. Under $8 for a burger
author: Deanne L.

description:
I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!! It makes me really sad that I can't have it all the time (being from Davis and all), so I get really excited every time I'm in the city and I'm able to get a burger. This place never disappoints! The burgers are always super juicy and definitely hits the spot. I also like how consistent Super Duper is between locations. I have come to this one as well as the other location that is near a Target that's also on Market Street and I don't feel like there is a difference in quality in the burgers between locations. 

My go-to order is the mini-burger with lettuce, red onions, and grilled onions. Oh, and a side of fries of course. My favorite part about coming to Super Duper is THEIR KETCHUP!!! It is soooo good. It's unlike the traditional Heinz-type ketchups you would get at other burger joints. This ketchup is not as sweet and looks "grainy", like it's homemade. IT'S DELICIOUS!! I like to dip my burger and my fries in the ketchup to get as much as I can.

I can't wait to be back in the area so that I can get another burger!!
author: Amberly H.

description:
I used to really enjoy eating here.  I loved how the burgers tasted, how you could sit outside, on a great corner, and eat your burger and enjoy the crispy fries.
Then sometime over the summer, that all went downhill.  Yesterday, after two bad dining experiences this Fall, I went back with a friend, hoping they'd gotten better.  Nope.  My burger was raw in the middle (I wasn't even asked how I wanted it cooked) and I had an attack of the squirts half an hour after eating.  At least my fries were not stone cold this time.

Note to Owners:  I see where your manager is only replying on the favorable comments.  Nothing like keeping your head in the sand.  You need a new manager ASAP.  Also, your suggested tip on your e-pay options is insulting.  You're a glorified burger stand.
author: Charles M.

description:
I was so hyped for this burger chain in SF but it fell short and I was highly disappointed. Could this be the place to beat shake shack, five guys, or in n out?? No.. this didn't even beat mcdonalds. 

My boyfriend and I both got the super duper burger, fries, and a drink. One burger, we added roasted portbello mushrooms and the other an egg. 

Our first problem was the cup they gave us for the drink. It was dirty and had scraps of food attached to it. Yuck? Gross? Do the cups not get washed?

Our second problem, we got the burgers and the one with portbello mushrooms didn't have any. They showed us it was under the patties at the bottom of the burger and there were only a few slices so they gave us some "extras". Why am I paying an extra $1.25 for 2-3 slices of portbello mushrooms??? 

Then when we finally got settled to eat the burgers, it was just disappointing. It tasted healthy but it's not...wait no bland would be the better word for it? It just didn't give you the taste or satisfaction of a burger. I much rather prefer a Mcdonalds burger over this. I should've just went to in n out to be honest. 

Fries were good/okay. Nothing special. The sauces were not appetizing to me. Even the ketchup was kinda off ( i think it's homemade, not a fan).

I will not be back! The burger was so MEH that I didn't finish it and was hungry right after.
author: Flora L.

description:
Um yes the garlic fries and the burgers are freaking addicting. My wife and I were walking around and hungry post travel and flight and these burgers with the garlic fries were just what we needed to feel absolutely blissful and in burger heaven. So juicy, almost too juicy to the point that I got some of the burger juice on my pants! :(

Clothes crisis aside and garlic breath for the next firebreathing 24 hours notwithstanding, I definitely recommend Super Duper Burgers for a delicious fast burger!
author: Alex L.

description:
Fries, a mini burger, a super burger and one chicken burger. All four of us were keen on super duper but was sadly disappointed as it was super greasy. 

Patty was not very flavourful and nothing really stood out about the burger. 

We were comparing it to In-N-Out and unfortunately this was a miss. 

Lemonade was super sour and was a finish to the meal.
author: Carmen P.

description:
Arguably the best burger in San Francisco. 

The ones who disagree just don't know anything. 
And this one, THIS one in the Castro is the best Super Duper of them all. 

It's huge and super cute and super fast and totally perfect. 
If you like juicy burgers and creamy milkshakes and you're open to some egg on your burger, this place is gon' hit The Spot.  

And oh yeah, them garlic fries are just a dream.
author: Earl R.

description: Order a mini burger, which is basically just a regular burger without the double patty. It was medium-well done & it was delicious!! The only issue I had was that I asked for grilled onions & instead got regular onions (purple onions). I got fries & the three side dipping which was a little extra like a buck or two. It wasn't worth it tbh, the chipotle sauce was pretty good but the other two were OK. My friend got garlic fries & those were good! I'm posting a photo of his food, since I ate away before taking a pic. Also, the employees were super nice!
author: Vanesa D.

description:
This place has been bookmarked forever but I've never had bc the locations are just not super easy to park (kinda  to say bc parking everywhere is challenging). Perhaps I had too high of expectations for this, but it was just fine. Will I be back? Likely not.

Ordered the mini burger with everything & the super sauce, and the garlic fries with 3 sauces. Was really dissappointed that the garlic fries came covered with cheese, even though it wasn't listed on the menu, and it seems like the cashier should have said something about it after I ordered 2 burgers without cheese & said it was my first time there...but the cashier made good and gave me regular fries instead & did it quickly! That chipotle sauce is  and so is the ketchup!! Didn't really like the other sauces. Unlimited pickles were fantastic too, but we're a little too chunky to put into the . All in all, it's good, I'm glad I went, great price point, but definitely not crave worthy.
author: Kylie F.

description:
Man this place is good!!! If you have even been here... you don't need me to tell you just how good it is!!! They are conscientious about using quality, fresh and sustainable ingredients! They use sustainably farmed vegetarian fed beef, farm fresh free range chickens, artisanal buns, homemade pickles and fresh baked cookies/pies! They even have organic soft serve ice cream and shakes!!! Yum!!! 

I don't give 5 Stars very often but this place deserves it! Lots of seating, great atmosphere, friendly staff and food that makes your stomach very happy! Plus, you don't feel over stuffed after leaving! The food is that fresh, tasty and healthy!!! Oh and best of all... the prices are very reasonable!!! The Super Duper Burger is $8.00 and the Chicken Sandwich is $8.00 as well! You get your moneys worth and you leave with a smile on your face! That and your stomach will love you for it!
author: Matt C.

description:
$12.50 for a chicken salad with bacon but 8.50 for a chicken sandwich with bacon. Where is the logic there? 

Plus they only give you 1 very small piece of bacon with the salad and the chicken was very dry. 

I usually never write a review for a restaurant but this place has a lot of hype in the bay. It's definitely not worth the price.
author: Mike A.

description:
Food here is affordable as expected from a chain fast food restaurant.  Burgers are good for a solid 5 dollar note and above. It's a degree up from MacDonald's. Fries are obviously very good. It's heaven if you add lots of ketchup.

Unfriendly staff -it's fast greasy food after all. Staff is sometimes handsome techie look-alike. Straight. Whites. Ladies, ladies...hold on. It's Not cruisy place here at all. Is it a "new" innovated Castro?... Surprisingly you wont see homeless folks occupying entire tables or stinking up the restaurant.

Patrons are either drunks, straight or people like me...lol...Occasionally your way will get blocked by a gigantic stroller.  No glitter. No glamour.  Again, not a cruisy place :'( 

Plenty of space to sit down. Free tap water.
author: Emir A.

description: Best burger I have had in a long time.  Got a single works with cheese.  Must be the secret sauce that gives it the flavor.  You can actually taste the meat.  The garlic cheese fries smell scrumptious but saving that for next time.  Reasonably priced.  I think they are better than In N Out.
author: Diane L.

description: Taste was super great. Staff are really nice and helpful. I ordered chicken burger with extra cheese costed only 10 USD. No one would be disappointed Highly recommended ^^..
author: Masarus T.

description: Probably my favorite super duper in sf. It's my first stop every time I go to the Bay Area. Great customer service. Food quality is excellent. Very helpful staff. Keep up the good work.
author: Brian D.

description:
The good ratings is not a lie. 

Had the Super Burger w 8oz two patties. It was very delicious! Burger tasted like a home cooked meat. 

Just come and visit! We don't have this in Seattle, so definitely a discovery for me. :)
author: Keith M.

description:
I come here occassionally. Good burgers, delicious shakes, tasty garlic fries, and friendly staff. I think the utensils are compostables which is incredibly eco-friendly.

I strongly suggest Super Duper Burgers to anyone who isn't from San Francisco or living outside the Bay Area.
author: Dan Mark D.

description: Gio & I got 2 mini (4oz.? patty) with cheese  can't compare to In N Out!! sloppy presentation...funky tasting beef...asked for sauce on the side...  nope! requested xtra crispy fries no again....won't return!!
author: Bob W.

description:
What's better than a bowl of piping hot ramen after a night of drinking?  A good old greasy burger!  Yeah!!!!  

I was actually interested in locating a Habit Burger Grill, but they're not in the city.  Thankfully our local friends knew of this SF startup. 

ATMOSPHERE:
I walked by it numerous times but never noticed it due to its nostalgic look and signage.  The inside has a few tables with more outside along the sidewalk.  No drive thru. 

MENU:
Burgers, milkshakes, soft serve, wine, beer. 

FOOD:
Roasted Portobello Mushroom Cheeseburger - $9.50.  Like Five Guys, their stated "cheeseburgers" are double patties.  Juicy, tender and full of flavor.  Man, this was a damn good mushroom burger!

French Fries - $2.75, one size only.  No combos here, but these natural-cut shoestrings were affordable, crispy and tasty.  

Soda - $2.25, one size only.  

SERVICE:
It was Pride 2017 weekend so the place was pumping.  Time from order to delivery was a quick 10 minutes or less.  

OVERALL:
$14.50 is a little pricey but so worth it.  This burger fan approves!
author: Vince N.

description: The burgers are on the smaller side but they are oh so good! I am a big fan of Super Duper ever since I had it for the first time.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I thought this place was alright. My friend kept saying it was like the In-n-Out of SF, but that just makes me feel really sorry for SF.

The garlic fries were really good, so I'd highly recommend getting those. I got the veggie burger - the patty was actually pretty good, but nothing else about the burger stood out to me. The bun was that weird in-between of crunchy and oily, and it was slipping all over in my hands. The bread is also thick and very "bread-y", so each time I took a bite I couldn't help but feel like the patty to bun proportion was off. My boyfriend got the regular burger with the meat patty, and said it was alright. 

Their ketchup is WEIRD, chunky, and almost sour. I don't know if that's a signature condiment thing they have going on or just gross old ketchup. It's also super loud in here.

BIG PLUS: They serve beer by the pitcher!
author: Wendy G.

description:
I first popped my Super Duper cherry at their Marina location where the cook preparing the food must've been super duper sick or something because whoever prepped the food that day was heavy-handed with the salt. And we all know how firsts aren't always the best experiences... 

So, after multiple visits to the Castro location (which is the OG location that started it all BTW) I'm officially a fan. I think it may be because everything in the Castro is just "happier"! That was my attempt at being pretty and witty and... well you know the song.

Indeed their burgers taste great because they use fresh ingredients from local suppliers and sources. Their beef comes from humanely raised cows that are fed a vegetarian diet, the buns are made by a local artisan SF baker, and the cream for their ice cream comes from a farm in Tomales Bay.

Due to these fresh sources, their burgers are not cheap... And one of their slogans is that a burger should not cost $3. Mostly agree, with the notable exception of that place with no heat lamps...

Their Mini Burger with cheese, a burger with a 4-ounce patty, costs $6 and their Super Burger (two patties) with cheese will set you back $8.50. However, I don't mind paying more because I see nothing wrong with paying extra for quality. There's a reason that if people had the budget, they would choose a Lexus over a Kia anyday. 

The regular fries ($2.75) are good, but I recommend splurging 50 cents more for the garlic cheddar fries. Another car analogy here... why settle for the LX when the EX comes with leather seats? You can thank me later. 

But the real reason I keep coming back to Super Duper is that I'm addicted to their free pickles. Seriously, these pickles are what makes Super Duper, super duper and duper super. The free pickles are like getting AWD for no added cost... like a Subaru. Score!

I'm rounding up and giving them 5 stars because they are planning to open 2 new locations in the East Bay in Concord and Berkeley. 

* This flagship location is in the process of super-duper-sizing because they are taking over the former Check Cashing store next door.
author: Richard K.

description: Blech.  This is the worst Super Duper I have been to.  The quality of ingredients they use are good, but that is about where it ends.   Came here last week and ordered the super duper burger (two patties) and the garlic fries.   Everything was drenched in grease.  The burger patties kind of disintegrated into mush, the bun was too small and ended up collapsed under the weight of the beef and the saturation of oil.  The fries were, again, greasy and soggy.   I felt gross after eating here.
author: Christian C.

description:
Always a reliable quick burger. This particular location recently expanded into double the size with much more seating, so you definitely don't need to worry about whether you'll have a table or not. 

My go to order when I've had a stressful day and want to indulge myself: fries, mini burger and a strawberry shake.

Some tips:
- They also have good soft serve if you're in the mood. I've come in before just to grab the vanilla soft serve (you can get it dipped in chocolate too!) on hot days. I get the kid sized cone since the regular is quite large 
- You can grab your own homemade pickles in their jars. The pickles remaining on the bottom of the jar tend to be the most sour ;)
author: Claudia C.

description: One of my favorite burger joints!!! This is the very original store and looks like they just expanded so it's roomy and sunny now. It's clean. It's also fresh made to order, farm to table, and locally sourced. Oh and grass fed! Almost forgot. Tastes bomb.
author: Katherine C.

description: Killer burger! Much better than In-n-out imo. The patty is nicely crispy but juicy and moist on the inside. The bun is toasted with sesame seeds. It's very much a thin patty though, so you might want to double up. Also a fan of the garlic fries, yum!
author: Judy S.

description:
I gotta tell ya, I remember these burgers being a lot better. I popped in this past weekend for an all american meal (burger & fries) and left feeling just "A-OK". 

The quality of ingredients isn't in question as everything was super fresh but, the burger itself was pretty greasy. My favorite part of the meal, the free pickles! They must be house picked because they have a nice spice to them too. Mad props to any business that has limitless pickles (see review of Tommy's Joynt). 

I like super duper so I'll totally be back but, for the chicken sandwich.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
The burgers are very good. We got the super duper burger (2 patties) and garlic fries to share. I was very impressed. I also liked the pickles that you can grab with the condiments.

The restaurant was kind of dirty. Recommend they have someone monitor the tables and scrub it down for patrons coming in to eat.
author: Ellen C.

description:
Omg! 

Didn't even know about this place. My friends from out of the country suggested it. I was iffy cuz I hadn't heard of this place, but am I freakin glad I went!!! 

They really know how to do a burger. 

Get the double, pint of beer, garlic fries and a huge heaping bowl of their super awesome organic ketchup. This stuff is bomb!!!!!!!!!!! 

It's pricey, but so worth it. 

Service is good. You order, u sit down, u get a number and they bring u ur food. Wait, or do they call out ur number?  I don't remember, I was blown away by the deliciousness of the perfectly cooked double patties and the smooth wheat beer they had on tap. 

When I say just go, just freakin go. It's damn good.
author: Panuly F.

description:
One of my favorite burger joints in SF. 

They just recently expanded this location to include more seating.

Like: Delicious burgers with a bunch of toppings to choose from. The garlic fries are also pretty amazing.
Dislike: Their salad is a joke. Don't waste your money.
author: Steven W.

description:
Positives: excellent, quick service. I asked a woman cleaning up the side of the store with a second door wide open with frigid air blowing in, if it was ok to shut that. She agreed and promptly closed it soon after. Food and drinks were finished quickly. Prices from what I recall: burgers ranged in the $7-$9 range, fries ranged in the $2.50-$4.50 range.
Got the garlic fries and my gf got some burger meal with a drink. You get your own straws, paper towels, ketchup, mustard, and pickles at the supplies station.
Restrooms are also excellent, which I've found, is rare for an eatery of this type.

Negatives: NONE! This place is 10/10!!
author: Charles F.

description:
SO good! I'm a huge fan of this place.
Pros: 
- fast, friendly service
- super tasty food and shakes
- excellent menu variety
- unlimited pickles
Cons:
- the guilty feeling after finishing a burger, fries, and shake!
author: Anne G.

description: After a wonderful night out with friends and cocktails, we ended up here. It totally hit the spot! Food was great and staff was fun. The music was right up my alley but some might not approve. Enjoy a great burger and head on with your day. :) Fries are also very good too.
author: Richard R.

description:
I am so disappointed with Super Duper. I took a double burger. The burger wasn't cooked enough and it was almost impossible to eat because of the large amounts of beef fat that came from the meat.
I had a bad taste in my mouth for hours.
author: Alex G.

description: Super good, clean inviting place.. loves the mini burger and the French fries!!! Definitely coming back.
author: Precilla T.

description:
Update:
We came back (another location) after we received a coupon from the above review. The veggie burger was tasty and the ice cream was excellent
author: Matthew J.

description:
We discovered Super Duper Burger on our last SF trip back in September for a wedding. We decided it had to be our first stop for late lunch when hubby and I returned in February. 

Love that fact that they use organic grass fed beef. Everything is made fresh to order. There's many locations in SF. We've been to this one and the one on Mission. 

Fantastic, fresh, flavorful & budget friendly food option in SF! 

Must try if you love burgers.
author: Nikki A.

description: The lemonade is perfect, a little tart, homemade pickles are delicious.  The burgers are juicy with all the toppings you could want. Great food , great service, what more could you want
author: Barbara S.

description: This place was great! Looking for a quick (or not so quick place to eat)? Come to Super Duper's. I highly recommend the chicken sandwich, so good!!!
author: Monserrat S.

description: I put bacon, cheese, and "everything on it" with super burger. It was amazingly delicious. A vegan burger for vegetarians was impressive on the menu. After eating this, the in n out burger is no longer in my sight. You must try the galic fries and chocolate & fresh strawberry super shake. Also normal french fries are pretty delicious, and try to eat toppings with pickles.
author: John L.

description: I chose not to eat here because the second I got inside I went inside to use the restroom the doors were locked and I had to wait for longer than I should have had to wait. Then when I knocked on the door the man responded by knocking on the door back. Then a employee decided to add her two cents by arguing with me about using the bathroom asking if I was paying customer and saying they were busy in there. She should have kept her mouth shut
author: Alannah W.

description:
I had my first super duper burger this past weekend. It was delicious! Hot and fresh!

It was good, we got the minis and the patties were pretty damn mini, like would probably appreciate a little more meat on these burgers, but the bun was good, and the lettuce was crisp. The toppings and sauce mixed really well together! I got jalapenos, and my complaint for that was that they did not spread them out evenly, so i straight up bit into a fiery pit of jalapenos, girlllllll, needed a milkshake after that, probably a marketing ploy?? ahha jk. The pickles are really unique, you have to get them yourself and they come as thick wedges, not slices. That made eating them with the burger pretty difficult. And they were definitely homemade pickles, had a different brine than what I'm used to. Also got the fries too, so good! They were cooked to perfection! Crisp, but not dry, crunchy, but soft.

Price point is okay, it's about 6 dollars for a mini burger, and 3 dollars for fries. You'll leave satisfied for about 10 dollars, but if you want to get wild and get the delicious looking milkshake for 6 dollars, then go in girl!
author: Eva C.

description: This place is delicious! I was visiting from Sacramento and stopped here to have a meal. I was walking down Market St. and just stopped snd saw it. I went in and omg best decision ever! The burger was SO GOOD snd not to mention the garlic fries + 3 dips! We got both a chicken and s beed burger. I liked the regular beed burger more. Also staff was SUPER attentive! Will come back!
author: Joanna M.

description:
For a chain burger place, they make some pretty damn good food!
I took the mini-cheeseburger with bacon. The meat is hand-made, and you can taste that it's fresh and wasn't frozen for years like other places.
The burger bun is fresh and at just the right size and texture.
Plus the Garlic French Fries are super good.
author: Or K.

description:
I was skeptical about how good a chain restaurant can get, but the burger and fries here are absolutely fantastic! Per a friend's recommendation, I decided to come try it out. I ordered the Super Burger (8oz) ($7.75) and cheese for an additional 50 cents. Also, do not forget the Garlic Fries ($3.25)! For one, this is a lot of food for one. The burger comes with two juicy patties stuffed with tomatoes, lettuce, red onions, jalapenos, grilled onions, and their special sauce! Just a warning that this burger is super greasy --but hey! The best type of foods are the heart-clogging ones, yum! On top of that, the garlic fries here are out of this world. The melting cheese and garlic is topped all over their crispy fries --honestly one of the best garlic fries I've had and that's saying a lot from me.

On the side, they have fresh wedges of pickles too!
author: Cindy Z.

description: This is my favorite burger place in the Bay Area. I can only eat the small though. Two patties ruin it for me. Order well done
author: Stanley J.

description: Sure the place is amazing and the food is wonderful but if you're at this location the real treat comes in the form of Luis! Most beautiful and dedicated costumer service I have received in a very long time! We took forever and were super complicated and he was nothing but smiles and patience! He need to be recognized and rewarded for his professionalism!
author: Johnny A.

description: The veggie burger is great! Also, if you ask, they will give you a ciabatta bun instead of the normal one.
author: Francie J.

description:
One of the best burgers I've had from a more "fast food"-like establishment. Only Shake Shack has a comparable burger in my opinion. It's similar to a Five Guys in terms of how long you'll wait for a burger, but this burger far surpasses Five Guys. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying other things on the menu. 

Taste: 4.5/5 
Bang for buck: 4/5
author: Lander L.

description:
Free pickles. Need I say more?

Prices aren't the cheapest, but what you get in return is quality burger, fries, milkshakes, and whatever else you'd expect at a burger place. Did I mention free house made pickles? I'm pretty sure the ketchup is house made too. 

The 4oz burger (w/ 'everything on it') was fresh and juicy. The garlic fries were garlicky and covered in cheese to balance the zing a little bit.. so good. To wash everything down, I had a cookies & cream milkshake that was cold, creamy, and delicious. 

Did I mention free pickles?
author: Albert I.

description: DELICIOUS! I've been living in the City for quite some time now and this has to be one of my favorite places to grab a burger. Juicy, tasty spread, and just all around great! The mini combo is my go to and it is more than enough for me! If you're a little more on the hungrier side, definitely try the garlic fries, they're soooooo good!!
author: Karina R.

description:
The food here is pretty good - reminds me a bit of In N Out. They have a nice setup where you order and pay for your food, and then you are given a buzzer and can find a seat and wait until your order is done without having to line up and stand at the counter to wait for your food. The service was pretty fast as well.

I ordered the following:
Mini burger (one 4oz patty, $5.50): I decided to go with the mini burger because I didn't think I was hungry enough for the super burger, which has two parties instead of one. I'm glad that I did, because the mini burger was pretty much the size of a standard burger (despite the misleading name). You can add on a bunch of toppings for free (lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, grilled onions, jalapeño peppers), but cheese, bacon, avocado, mushrooms, and eggs cost extra. The burger itself was quite good, although the meat was packed more loosely than other burgers that I have had. I like their special sauce and the grilled onions added a nice texture and flavor to the rest of the toppings.
Garlic fries ($3.25) with 3 dips ($1.50, comes with super sauce, mayo, and chipotle): the garlic fries were just okay, in my opinion. The garlic flavor was really strong and pretty overwhelming, and my breath smelled like garlic for hours afterwards. The garlic flavor is so strong that any additional dipping sauce is overpowered and too much. I actually felt pretty heavy and greasy after eating this.
Strawberry shake ($5.75): the shake was very good! Super creamy and rich, and with a strong strawberry flavor. I really liked the tall glass that it was served in, which added presentation points.

Overall this was a decent burger place, but wasn't mind-blowing.
author: Amy C.

description: I love burgers and I usually get them at least once a week. I frequent places such as In and Out, The Big 4 and a few other ones that kick ass. When it comes to burgers only the best of the best satisfies me and Super Duper definitely gets on my list. Not only the burgers they make are delicious but they also have the best garlic fries. I also love their strawberry milkshake, I usually get it as a dessert. Anyone who likes burgers should try Super Duper Burgers.
author: Abel K.

description: So so gooodthe only thing is the portions are small for how expensive it is!! I had the super burger with 2 patties and it did not satisfy my big appetite but other than that it tasted really really juicy and good!! The staff is very nice and they get your food out fast!
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Great juicy burger. The super duper with grilled onions and an egg is a must try!

The patty comes medium, unless requested otherwise.
author: Pavel Y.

description: Really great burgers for a reasonable price. I had the mini burger (1 patty) with fries and their amazing dipping sauces on the side. Also got their lemonade on the side, which was good.
author: Kelly I.

description: Wonderful hamburguer. Nice place, and nice attendents. I will eat in Super Duper again!
author: Marina C.

description: We decided to stop by this place for an early dinner, and with no expectations, and I am very pleased!!! Ordering is smooth and easy, and the service was very fast. The food is amazing and different, I love that everything is locally sourced and super duper sustainable! I would recommend this place to everyone, as the vibe is quite enjoyable, and the short menu is perfect for a quick bite, with great veggie options. Definitely coming back when I'm in the area!!
author: Evie D.

description: This place is perfect- low price, good quality, and sustainable! The garlic fries are delicious, and everything tastes fresh. The vibe in here is fun too; they're always playing good music and the restaurant is nice and clean. I support any place that is environmentally conscientious, and I love that all of their packaging is compostable and their food is locally sourced!
author: Karyn T.

description: Super duper greasy burgers.  Not much that is special here. Just a typical burger with an extra bit of added grease and oil. The patties weren't that flavorful and was not very impressed with this place.
author: Jacky C.

description: The music is great at this location lol. Lots of 70s and 80s R & B lol. Otherwise this spot is less busy than the Market St. Downtown one. The beef is pretty fresh and no extra charge for grilled onions, jalapeños, and pickles. The milk shakes might be the best here.
author: Ben L.

description: I have been looking for a Burger place that had good Vegetarian Burgers and i found it. This is the Best Veggie Burger I have had yet!!! Garlic Fries on point. I definitely will be making this my new veggie burger spot.
author: Asha A.

description: Your voicemail message says your "Super sorry because your super busy and can't take a phone order. But then and I where is yet one more time where I again get there and there's literally zero people in line and hardly any customers because its 1040pm, 20 minutes from closing on a Thursday. The kitchen crew never stops working so why do the cashiers get to stand around doing nothing- which is literally losing you customers (people who don't have time to walk in to order then wait). Or maybe some of us know that from the very beginning superduper has been like this- Super Lazy when it comes to answering the phone.
author: Chris R.

description:
Absolutely amazing. This place deserves 5 stars based on those Garlic Fries alone! Burger was also delicious, service was quick. 

First stop when I got to SF, and very happy about it!
author: Sergio R.

description: The burgers here a sooo good. Very flavorful. I came here as my first meal when I arrived to SF on a mini vacation and it is as a great start to say the least. Give this place a try if you're ever in the area.
author: Maria A.

description: I came in yesterday with my boyfriend after visiting Twin Peaks. This was the greasiest burger I've ever purchased. I should have taken a picture to show. The bun was soggy with grease. They pride themselves on being all natural and you can tell the ingredients fit that.  The beef tasted like they didn't use many seasonings. You get that real beef taste but it ends there. The fries were fantastic. I enjoyed the bar seating in the back so we could people watch everybody walking by. Great customer service. It took 5 mins or less to get food. All in all I won't be returning.
author: Rylie M.

description: This place is amazing ! I've been here a couple of times and everyone that works there are so nice and friendly, and the food is always on point !! I recommend it to anyone wanting a juicy burger.
author: Juanita M.

description:
Plain and simple. 

Burgers + Fries + Vanilla shake = Heaven!!! 

Place is perfect for kids.
author: Chris H.

description:
Finally got to try this place in the Castro with some good friends on drunken night. You get in line to order and take a seat. This one has both indoor and outdoor seating. The line wasn't too long. My friend ordered my a super burger with provolone cheese and added avocado with a side of garlic fries. 

The burger came with 2 beef patties! It was massive. The bread and everything else was soggy which caused the burger to fall apart after the first few bites. The patty even started to fall apart. They provide free pickles which was awesome! I had like 2 paper trays of pickles. The fries were crispy but the garlic wasn't smothered on each fry. 

Not my favorite burger joint, but I'd come back again to try a different burger to see if it would make a difference. I don't like soggy buns or it completely falling apart after only a few bites. At least this means it was juicy!
author: Jenna T.

description: I probably eat here more than I should...but honestly can you blame me? Burgers are always bomb, staff is always extra nice and price is on point. Highly recommend!
author: Raquel S.

description: I was expecting based on the review to have better Experience, it was not bad but definitely I will not try it again,
author: Shachar S.

description:
Best burgers ever!!! 
Every time I am in SF I make sure to stop for a meal.
When I went on MLK weekend is was fairly busy and my egg was a little runny, still a great burger, meat was cooked medium well and staff was very friendly
author: Alberto D.

description:
"You have to go to Super Duper Burger when you come back to the Bay Area!" This was told to me by a friend who is also a foodie. I quickly bookmarked this restaurant and made sure I ate here during my visit. I was advised that it's a very busy restaurant and it would be hard to get seating during the lunch rush. They have several locations all over the city and I picked this location because I figured they wouldn't be as busy as the other locations. 

The restaurant was clean and offered indoor or outdoor seating. I opted to sit indoors to appreciate the decor of the establishment. This location had free street parking around the residential area which was a nice plus. The menu is basic and straight forward on the left as you enter. Cashiers are to your right and they are very helpful if you have any questions about the menu. 

I ordered the Super Burger with Bacon, Cheese and Everything On it. To compliment the burger, I got Garlic Fries with the 3 sauces and an IPA beer on draft. The burger was good and so were the fries. Personally the fries were a little greasy for my taste but the IPA helped wash it down. It was good to be able to try their 3 sauces but I didn't care for it and probably wouldn't order it again. The ketchup was a better pairing with the fries. 3.5 stars...maybe not Super Duper Burger for me but it was a good burger.
author: Daniel C.

description: Great fresh made hamburgers. Very busy area to go if your looking to dine in because street parking is horrible. Fairly fast service and employees are pretty evident efficient considering the traffic they get at night. Lover the burgers and garlic fries.
author: Desi B.

description: First time at Market Street SDBurgers. Should be called Super Greasy Burger. Bun so grease-soaked I couldn't eat it.
author: denise a.

description:
Always solid. Consistently "good", thought never "great". Unlimited pickles are bae, their buns are bae. Meat is usually under seasoned, sometimes toppings are bleh. 

But usually a good grab.
author: Brandon M.

description: Ramp up your fries & start making them fresh. That means not old and cold. Ridiculous !!!
author: Henry K.

description: Super good, nice super juicy burgers, and if you're a guy like me, who needs that right after drinking all night it's perfect. Hits the spot everytime, always get the super burger with cheese
author: Marcus-Alex G.

description: We're from out of town and decided to give this place a try. They forgot our order but they gave us a gift card to come back. We're more than happy to come back because the food is AMAZING!!
author: Candice N.

description:
Ordered some delicious burgers after a long night out and they definitely delivered. 

They don't deliver but, use door dash so you can enjiy this greasy goodness from bed. 

Make sure you ask for ketchup!
author: David D.

description:
Loved the super burger combo with garlic fries. Very juicy and tasty. Their ketchup is also good :) A little pricey compared to fast food burgers but you definitely can taste the difference of quality and deliciousness. 

I hope they expand to Los Angeles area soon.
author: Volkan D.

description:
One should try all other food options in SF before you step here.. because once you visit Super Duper, you wont go anywhere else! Its a place of no return - truly ADDICTIVE. 

Simple menu, limited options, but you wont feel you are missing anything, because the stuff is soo good! Veggie Burger, garlic fries,  fresh lemonade and soft serve ice cream - I am already drooling!
author: Crystal P.

description: Not impressed. I paid almost $15 for a burger (far from super, small ass burger), fries, and drink and still left hungry. I honestly felt gypd! You're better off at McDonalds!
author: Dee G.

description: I got food poisoning from a veggie burger here last weekend.  I tried calling to report it (multiple times and at multiple locations, but no one answered.)
author: Grasshopper R.

description:
Nothing special about the burgers.  
My issue was the fries. I ordered the garlic fries,  they were  greasy generic and I didn't see any garlic, probably just garlic powder and the portion was too small for almost $4.  And were served very cold so  I asked for a new batch,  which they did happily accommodate 
But won't be coming back.
author: Dan B.

description:
This is my go-to spot for bugers. Nothing beats Super Duper burgers when I have a burger craving. I love the simple menu, fast and fresh food, and value-conscious prices. Compared to their competitors in the neighborhood, this restaurant is best in my book for hamburgers.

Pros:
* good burgers and good burger options
* good fries
* homemade pickles
* homemade cookies
* shakes

Cons:
* no onion rings
author: Michael S.

description: Burger was good but greasy homemade pickles were good in cutting the grease, fries were disgustingly blonde and limp the three sauces tasted better on my fingers so I have one finger left for the garlic fries
author: Brent B.

description: It's a typical super duper, came here late night, got my food fast and it was really good. I am glad the chain is expanding, more places to enjoy their great burgers.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place is usually amazing but I was heavily met with a rude associate. She rolled her eyes when taking our orders when we asked for particular things. I ordered the chipotle chicken sandwich and it was horrible. My sister halved her burger with me and it was even worse. The garlic fries were also super dry. Perhaps it was because we came in 2 and 1/2 hours before closing or perhaps the staff just didn't care. It was the first time at this location. The marina districts location is hands down the best. 

Update! 
The GM kindly messaged me and was extremely nice. He mentioned that he would talk to his team and make sure they were aware of this experience. Thank you! For that I changed my rating. Not because he offered anything, but because he messaged and cared enough to understand what happened. That's great service in my opinion, and with a GM like that, I'm sure that it will help the team realize what great service can accomplish. I also made sure he knew that I usually always recommend this establishment, even being that I don't live near enough to go often (so obviously my usual experiences have been consistently great) but this time was something else. Again, thank you to the GM who took his time to make sure this was resolved. I'll be back soon.
author: Janna G.

description:
This place was hyped up pretty good before I made my first visit and...the stories are true! 

I had the super burger with cheese. I'm not the biggest carnivore and can be a bit of a meat snob, but this place uses quality ingredients and I'm happy to report the burger was delicious.  It was decently sized, had a good balance of toppings, and is reasonably priced.
author: Charles R.

description: I've continued frequenting this location (and other locations too). I'm happy to say that the management at this location is great and their customer service is superb. While I haven't ordered another boozy shake, I have ordered many a burgers here and am very pleased with the quality of them lately. The staff have been very pleasant and prompt my last few visits too.
author: Carina F.

description: Highly recommend the garlic fries at this place. Really greasy, flavorful. They also offer 3 dips to try with your fries (Super Sauce, Housemade Mayo and Chipotle) which offer a neat twist.
author: Kishore N.

description: Best chicken sandwich and great burgers. Love the home made pickles. Great service clean place and looks like just open
author: Phill B.

description:
Great reasonably priced burger. 
My burger was cooked to my specifications and their housemade pickles are delicious.  Wonderful service and quick turnaround time.
author: Jessica R.

description: Stopped by here like most...drunk or just try to grab a quick burger coming thru the Castro.  What can I say? The burger was ok but nothing special. French fries were tragic. I don't think experience can be good when only one part of meal good.
author: Jonn D.

description: One of the best burgers I've had! Highly recommend and their lemonade is great!! Their fries could have been cooked a little longer to make them crispy but other than that it was great!
author: Lana M.

description:
Always come to here before work nearby for lunch and they always come out with good food. In particular or better than in-n-out or shake shack. A little on the pricey side for a combo but quality wise is top notch!

Always go for the mini burger or chicken burger with occasionally double fries since they're sooooo goooood! easily comparable to McDonalds fries without all the grease and sogginess and staleness it comes with. Usually piping hot shoestring fries straight out and not soggy as soon as it hits the bag :)
author: Anderson H.

description:
Delicious delicious delicious! A little pricey, but did I mention it's delicious? A little salty...be sure to drink a lot of water or you'll be parched in the middle of the night, but man, it's delicious!!!

Oh yeah...and the staff is super nice! It helps if you know what you want when you get in line though. Don't stand at the register and read the menu. People behind you and the cashier hate that!
author: Jen J.

description:
Back to my favorite spot !!! Amazing staff and especially Jocelyn she was able to make my experience even better I had forgot to say no onions and she saw me not really enjoying my meal and she ask what can I do to make it better , I was embarrassed I explain it was my fault but she took the burger and brought me a new one . Oh it was delicious ! Thank you so much 

Your ice cream cones are to die for
author: Rodriguez J.

description:
Loved this burger joint. It was the first place we ate upon arriving in the wonderful city of San Francisco. The decor kind of reminded me of Shake Shack. My bf and I got the super burger (2 patties) I didn't think I can finish it but I had a lot of help from him after he was done with his. It was super yummy, you can just taste the juicy meat. We also got the garlic cheese friends. Very yummy but I think I would of appreciated it more had I not had so much of the burger. It also came with a lot of different yummy sauce. Maybe we were starving but even their mayo tasted very good. 

As for drinks. Although recommended to get the milkshake, I really did want to but because I knew I was going to be full from all the other carbs we decided to save it for the next trip. We both got fountain drinks (club soda) to help digest the massive amount of food we ate. 

Service was pleasant, they were very helpful and not too long of a wait for burgers.

Would I recommend this place to my friends? I don't see why not.
author: Yuena L.

description:
Housemade Pickles 
 Organic Ice Cream - Swirl is my fave 
 Veggie & Beef Burgers - Request blue cheese
 Garlic Fries 
 Family Friendly :)
author: Brittany N.

description: What can I say about Super Duper burgers they are so damn good. I love  there fries and mini burgers. This was my first time at this location and it was small but there doing construction to expand the dining area. Food was hot and fresh service was great I will most definitely come back.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Great burgers and shakes!!! Reasonable prices and great location on Market! Keep up the good work guys.
author: Wade W.

description: It's a good  burger joint better than in n out or habit the garlic fries are great and the hand dipped ice-cream  is fantastic perfect lunch on a warm day in the city very good burgers as well
author: Haplo B.

description: This place was packed when I visited; had to wait a while for my food, but that was fine as I knew it was very popular. I got the super duper burger with everything on it and paid an extra $1.50 for an egg on it. Also got fries. It was absolutely delicious and tasted fresh. Will I say the wait was worth it? Maybe not. But if you are in San Francisco and never tried this place, I would definitely recommend it!
author: Kevin N.

description:
I went here after playing in a Sunday night basketball game to grab something slightly greasy because of all the calorie burning I did during my game. I found this place just walking around the city so decided to stop by. 

Simplicity at its finest. Nothing over the top seasoned or special but a simple burger makes a good burger to me. All burgers are cooked medium so it tends to make the burger juicer and a little messy (I never complain about a messy burger). I ended up getting the super burger, which is 2 4oz patties and you have many options to dress your burger how you want to. I do recommend trying their super sauce, it is what they are known for and I think it tops the burger off. Also their shakes are really good and I did see several people just coming for the shakes.
author: William W.

description: The food is always great. Staff at the Castro location is lack luster and don't go out of their way to welcome you to the establishment. Luckily I usually go to the one on Market Street downtown. They're always friendly attentive and smiling. The girls at the Castro location are just there for a check and a free meal. Kind of sad maybe they should shuffle great staff to show the other location how it should be done. Also there are so many signs you don't know where to place your order.
author: Rey B.

description:
Sunday morning at opening, there's already a line for this place. It has to be good, right?

Garlic butter fries: served lukewarm, yuck. The cheese on top was nice, but then the bottom of the tray is a pool of butter that makes the fries inedible.

Double burger: this fared a bit better, though it wasn't as moist as I was expecting it to be. Not enough super sauce, but the grilled onions were nice.

The fries ruined the rest of the meal for me, which is a shame. If I ever come back, I'll get a shake over the fries.
author: Ehow C.

description: Fantastic customer service ! I got a a double patty burger to go and it was extremely pink , but I gave them a call and the manager offered to replace it and insisted on giving me a free item. Tasty burgers !!
author: Veronica R.

description: You are always welcomed by friendly staff who are not in a hurry to answer your questions and help you choose what you like. The vegetarian burger I ordered was delicious. I will definitely be back next time.
author: Presley M.

description: Friendly service, there were a couple ladies who helped us order. The place was clean and not too crowded. My only issue was that my burger had a hair in it and when I saw it, I lost my appetite. I took it back up to the kitchen and the girl who took my burger kept asking where the hair was... that was a good 10 seconds of awkwardly waiting for her to find the hair in my burger. When they asked if I wanted a refund, I said yes but the woman only refunded my burger not my full meal but she gave me a free cone w/ purchase of burger card... Probably won't come back here but it was an okay experience.
author: Rasela L.

description:
Sometimes I wish I could tip after getting my food. Sometimes the cook pours the salt on the meat. Sometimes a chicken sandwich takes 20 minutes. 

04/28 8:30pm
Went back for dinner.  I saw that they had some special burgers.
I love Cesar salad and I saw that they have a Cesar double burger for about $9.75. So I ordered one. 

Got home to find a single burger with only a slice of tomato and some lettuce.

I'm done.
author: Max K.

description: Great place! Good food, atmosphere is always positive whenever I go or whenever I take others with me. The burgers are the best I've had in a long time.
author: Cade N.

description: This place is the best!!! It has amazing soft serve and really good burgers, milkshakes and fries!!! The veggie burgers with eggs on top are heaven!!!!! Love the food so much, super good service and nice clean area.
author: Jason R.

description:
Hit the spot!
I haven't had a burger in 2 years, and came here because I just wanted a solid, good burger.  
Super fast, super nice employees, super duper burger and fries!
author: Chelsea D.

description:
Below-average burgers...if they were closer to fast food prices I might come back, but I expect a restaurant that charges the same price as a burger in most restaurants in SF to taste great.

+1 for the good service.
author: Neha S.

description:
This location does not cower in the face of mayo.
They embrace all its potential goodness and glory and aren't afraid to slather it on their burger.
To which I must say, true that.  True that.

Burgers with that extra smidgen, or maybe a dollop, of mayo are so good that I've forgone the almost obligatory order of fries and now am ordering two burgers instead.
*Mind you, I make sure to get the regular size burgers so that I don't come too dangerously close to being acutely doughy on the BMI scale from hell.

Moreover, this location doesn't get too overly crowded (knock on wood) which means I can savor every delectable morsel of my burgers and not worry about the table vultures circling and waiting for me to leave.

So what are you waiting for?
Go get your burger on.
author: Dan B.

description:
Curiously juicy burgers. That's how I described the place to some friends recently... only it came out of my mouth with such enthusiasm and approval and with my German accent more heavy than normal they were equally amused and interested.

I said, "Zuuuper Duper!!! Curiously juicy burgers!!!" that line never got old the whole night. I'm sure at one point I was videotaped for it to be on Facebook for eternity. Apparently I should be the spokesman for this joint.

 Just as I said they are very juicy and one only wonders where all the juice comes from? I think we have all gotten so used to frozen old reheated stuff we get the good stuff and are in shock.

The burgers are cooked perfectly and are from bun to condiments to veggies perfect. Service is also great considering the popularity of this place.

Jump on the banwagon and get some juice in your life.
author: Stefan T.

description:
Sorry not a fan. I stay loyal to In-n-out. 

Ok I've tried almost every burger chain out there--in-n-out, habit, shake shack, etc. I've been waiting to try Super Duper and had very high expectations for it as many have told me that it was to die for. 

It's one pricey burger that's for sure. $5.50 for a mini burger (basically a burger with one 4oz patty). 50 cents to add cheese, $1 to add a little bit of sautéed mushrooms. It comes with lettuce, tomato, jalapeños, and onions. It was just way too greasy! Garlic fries were swimming in oil as well. I felt disgusting after this meal. 

Tip: The best part is the pickles and it's self serve! If you are a pickle lover like I am, then Super Duper is for you. Crisp, sweet pickles with a little hint of heat at the end.
author: Jen P.

description: Great food.  Best burger I had in San Francisco.  Great service.  Very tasty
author: John P.

description:
This is definitely one of the better burgers in San Francisco. Their meat is of really good quality and their pickles are to die for. I don't think I've ever pickle that is so perfect to the crunch. 

They also just expanded the restaurant so there are more tables!
author: Timothy N.

description: This burger spot took me by surprise. The pictures definitely don't do it justice. I got the mini burger combo for around $10. It comes with a mini burger, fries and a drink. I upgraded to garlic fries, which is a must! The burger was juicy and the flavor was on point! The garlic fries had a pile of garlic and cheese on top!! Simply amazing and done right! Come and you won't be disappointed.
author: Vy T.

description: Great burgers and fries and the best soft serve I have ever tasted!! Def worth the trip!
author: Lizzi L.

description:
Super Duper must not be skipped, whether or not you live in SF.

I try not to eat it too often, for fear of getting sick of it.

Favorite Aspects:
-Modest Price Point
-High-ish Quality Meat
-Compostable To-Go Packaging
-Housemade Pickles
-Dem Garlic Parmesan Fries, Tho

The location over by Powell is where I frequent more often, though this one is closer to where I live. Came here the other day to treat myself to a burger, fries and (~alcoholic~) milkshake. I've never gotten the "super" burger, the mini one always is enough to fill me up. Love to add avocado and/or grilled mushrooms or bacon. Light sauce please! This place is similar to In-N-Out in that they can go a bit hogwild with the sauce, which can give me tummy troubles in excess amounts.

The garlic Parmesan fries are out of this world! Definitely not to be missed.

I finally tried an alcoholic milkshake (they add Soju to any flavor for a few extra bucks) and picked cookies n cream. It was a bit strong tasting, think if I were to do it again I would go for strawberry or strawberry AND cookies n cream. ;)

Solid place for lunch or dinner. Their Arnold palmers are also very good here.
author: Megan D.

description: Great burger.  Quick service.  Reminiscent of a place called Krazy Jim's in Ann Arbor, Michigan.  (How I miss it.)  Will be back.
author: Andrew P.

description:
Super? Hardly. More like greasy and overcooked. 

On the menu wall there is a misleading sign that reads "our burgers are cooked medium and are very juicy... could be messy business!!" This sign should really read "our burgers are well done and soaked in grease... will be messy business!!"

That's right, the burgers are soaked in grease, not juice, and there's a big difference. That liquid film you see on your patty, buns, plate, and all else is not the juices from the meat itself, the patty is way too thin and overcooked for that to be the case. No, this liquid is from the grill/place the meat is being cooked. It is either due to a large amount of oil being used, the chef deciding to pour oil on top of it while it is cooking for some odd reason, or, more likely, the stove/grill is not cleaned.

So my burger came dripping wet in grease that clearly was not juice from the meat, and the patty itself was overcooked as well. It was well done, not medium. Honestly, if a chef at a burger joint doesn't know how to cook a medium burger he should get another job. This isn't rocket science. 

The fries were good. I'll give them that. 

I would not come back here. The food is mediocre, getting your hands wet from greasy buns is gross, and my stomach was very upset after the experience.
author: Aiden S.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is super indeed. This is a fast casual restaurant, with a simple menu. Pick your burger, toppings, fries, shakes, and everything is made to order.

I went with the super burger with cheese + grilled onions, plus a side of garlic fries. The burger was cooked a perfect medium on the inside, with a nice crispy char on the edges. My fries had a generous pile of garlic, cheese, and parsley, and were so good, my friends couldn't keep their grubby paws off of them.

Overall, everyone's burgers were cooked perfectly, and the only complaint of the night was that they were out of vanilla soft serve.
author: Jonelle T.

description:
Good, juicy, fresh burgers. Free pickles too!
Strawberry shakes are wonderful. People complaining of grease must be used to McDonalds freeze dried.
Beware your waist size eating here often though...
author: Joel C.

description: I have been to a few super duper locations and I have to say this is my favorite. There is one by the metreon that cannot compare at all. I enjoy the mini burger with all the toppings. Ask for a side of ranch with the fries you can also try the spiked milkshakes which is very sweet. I usually order the mini burger with french fries and a water cup. You can add avocado, egg, bacon, or mushroom for an extra cost. There are two levels of seating one on the normal for where you order the burger and the other upstairs. If you enjoy pickle you can grab extra pickles by the condiments bar. I do not recommend driving to this location but there is a BART station nearby, Powell. Usually the lines are long but the order is very quick and the cooks make your order very fast. If you are craving a milkshake on with her but are watching your calories you can order the kid sized milkshake.
author: Amy Y.

description: Visiting from out of town, we decided to see what all the hype waa about. We were very disappointed. The burgers were cooked medium, which wasn't our preference. The fries tasted as though they'd been cooked in old oil. The wait was long and the cost was way more than what it should've been given the quality of food. Won't return. The next time we're in the mood for a good burger, we'll just go to In-N-Out.
author: Shanee' D.

description: It's everything you expect a late night joint to be - and then, SD kicks it up a notch!
author: Nick S.

description: I eat here regularly, they have the best burgers and garlic fries. I'm sure the rest of their food is just as great.  Make sure you get the chipotle sauce. It goes really well with their burgers and fries.
author: Art C.

description: Husband and I had lunch here. Ordered 2 super burgers and shared a garlic fry. Burgers were great portions, super juicy and the super sauce is delicious. Burgers are cooked medium so they will have pink inside. I like mine this way, if you don't you need to order it well done. Homemade pickles were good but just a little too much vinegar for me. My husband loved them though. Garlic fries were absolutely out of this world and we're much less greasy than I thought they would be. Outdoor seating was great and had nice heat for the cool day. Staff was quick and polite and proactively asked if we'd been there before and when we said no they gave a quick rundown of where to find napkins, ketchup etc. Overall, we would definitely recommended this spot for a good burger, nice atmosphere and good people watching options! :)
author: Ashlee A.

description: This is a very nice place for eating pure beef burgers. The place was very clean and the service was great!
author: Martin C.

description: Delicious burgers, friendly service and atmosphere! I've been to multiple locations of Super Duper and feel like they can't go wrong!
author: Emily B.

description: Ok, it's fast good easy to meet people oh and did I say good. Ok the burger will get drippy towards the end. Oh but did I say how good they are also the organic ice cream...yeah GOOD till the last
author: RICHARD J.

description:
Such a great burger joint. The burgers are so juicy and cooked to a perfect medium well. They go great with their garlic fries and one of their thick milkshakes. I'd recommend the chocolate-strawberry one because it tastes like a chocolate covered strawberry. 

This place is exactly what I think of when someone mentions that they want a cheeseburger and fries. They have self serve pickles and condiments for all to enjoy. Minus one star for the size of the location because it's just so popular that it can be hard to find a place to sit and enjoy. But it's only because they're that good.

The whole meal will cost around $10-15 bucks, depending on what you get. But it's worth it. Must go!
author: Stefanie S.

description: The BEST hamburger I have ever had. If you go you must try their pickle bar - spicey and delish!
author: Adriana R.

description: My go to for lunch and dinner. With the new expanded dinning room area it's now even more comfortable to sit and enjoy the scene of the Castro area. Staff and especially management are both amazing!! This is a must if you're coming to San Francisco for sure.
author: Alex C.

description:
Recommendation: Go check this place out for a tasty affordable burger in a comfortable expanded space centrally located in the Castro District.

Pros & Cons: I recently returned to Super Duper Burgers in the Castro after avoiding this location for many years due to poor customer service, chronic issues with cleanliness, and overall poor food quality (I wrote to the owner on two occasions but he never responded so I just stayed away). After two recent visits, I am pleased to report that this is not the same Super Duper Burgers I have avoided all these years! The food and customer service has greatly improved with friendly staff and cooks that actually put some effort into the food. The new expansion is great and offers ample seating in a bright clean space with large windows through which patrons can enjoy the sights of the Castro District. On a recent visit, Luigi was the only counter staff and a master of multitasking answering phones as well as serving walk-in customers. He was welcoming, polite, and very efficient. I ordered a double burger combo with soda, fries and enjoyed every bite, especially the fries! They still offer what's best described as a 'loose meat' burger which gives it a homemade feel. Historically, the burgers were haphazardly prepared and heavily salted causing me to throw the whole thing in the trash which thankfully, was not the case during my last two visits. Similarly, I found the fries to be dry and inconsistently prepared in the past but thankfully, that too was no longer the case. However, I was a little bummed that there were only a few unappealing pickles floating in a container on the condiment counter which clearly needed to be replenished and kept me from including them with my meal. My lingering complaint is the floor in the original section of the restaurant that chronically looks dirty. Perhaps it's the choice of tiles or something else but I've always found it to be unwelcoming. For my money, the best Super Duper Burgers has been the one by the Metreon. The staff have been consistently efficient, the space clean even though it is often inundated with customers, and the quality of food excellent. Thankfully, with all of the upgrades at the Castro location, I no longer have to travel downtown to enjoy a great burger in a comfortable environment!
author: Thatwasme T.

description:
Super duper gooooood!!! 

A little pricey, extraaaa oily, but you just can't stop thinking about it days after.

Garlic fries were pretty cheap. didn't really taste the garlic, but maybe it's just me. 

But the burger though.... it was just amazing. The patty (double) was even greaterrrrr

Maybe not the best place to take children lol because the burger is really oily
author: Amy V.

description:
straight up no nonsense amazing fresh burgers. garlic fries real good too. wine and beer!

The spot on Market is not large but it looked like they were about to expand. The service is friendly and fast, and eat-in or take-out both work great as a fast delicious meal with friends or kids.

Really an astonishingly good fast-food style burger, ingredients are top notch.
author: Craig S.

description:
Burger: juicy  and flavorful 
Chicken sandwich: soft and tender 
Garlic fries: packed with garlic flavor and melted cheese

I need to try the milk shake next time
author: Bryan N.

description:
This review is encompassing the food itself, as a coworker ordered these for lunch one day!

We placed a huge order. In the description we put names so that we could identify whose burger was whose. They gave us our order simply by numbering the burgers. And that was it. We had to sit for 15-20 minutes and stare at the receipt and figure out which number burger corresponded to who. Pretty sure they got our order wrong as well, as once we finally figured out whose was whose, the burgers included ingredients we didn't ask for, or were missing ones that we did ask for. -2 for organization and customer service.

Now on to the food. Very plain. Maybe it would have been better fresh at the actual restaurant itself. Burger taste did not stand out to me at all. I had to add Sriracha to give it a kick. The fries were also kind of meh. I think overall I would rather go to In-N-Out or McDonalds.
author: Genevieve M.

description: I came to this place just passing it by and it was such a great find! The burgers were really juicy and delicious. Though the star of the show may have even been the ketchup! I wish they sold it by the bottle. I'd take one home.
author: Oscar P.

description:
My partner and I went here for dinner Saturday evening a little before 7 p.m.  To my surprise, there was plenty of seating.
My partner had the burger with bacon, fries and a soda while I had a mini-burger6 with blue cheese and fries and ice water.
My partner enjoyed his meal very much. I liked my meal. My only complaint is that the blue cheese was put on only a third of the burger so it was not sprinkled evenly.
For dessert, I had a kid's vanilla soft ice cream cone, thinking it would be pretty small. It wasn't, but I managed to eat the whole thing.
The service was good - prompt and friendly. I will be back again!
author: Philip C.

description:
I love me a burger and Super Duper might just be my favorite one.

Location and Parking: Parking is tough in this area. Market street is always busy and everything is meter parking. I usually park a block or two away at my secret parking spot.  The actual place isn't very big, but you should have no problem finding an open table. Worst case scenario, as you wait for your order tables will open up.

The Burger and Garlic Fries: Oh my it is AMAZING! I order the super burger which comes with two patties.They cook their patties medium rare and man it is tasty and juicy. Their homemade mayo is not for everyone, but I LOVE it. The bun sometimes may be a little too greasy but it's toasted and delicious. Their Burger is simple but yet soooo good. You have to try it. The perfect compliment to a good burger, their garlic fries. They sprinkle some cheese on top and for some reason these garlic fries are like heaven to me every time lol There milkshakes and chocolate dip soft serve be on point as well. Don't expect a fancy gourmet burger, but trust me this simple burger packs a punch of deliciousness.
author: Alexander L.

description:
They make good juicy burgers.  Just as good as their other location on Market street. I like the super duper burger (8 oz) with all the toppings plus the organic egg on top.  Their burgers are cooked somewhere between medium to well down. The toppings and bread are fresh.

The bacon they used is very good, not overcooked. However, the Cambozola cheese tasted a little bland. It was very creamy. But, I could not taste the blue cheese.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
BEST BURGERS EVER! I have never in my life tasted such a juicy, tasteful, perfect burger. I usually get the the super burger with cheese, and garlic fries, BEST GARLIC FRIES EVER! After eating those fries you are guaranteed to be stuck with garlic breathe for the rest of the day! So worth it! 
Oh, and they also get 5 stars for their take-out packaging. They place the burgers and fries in a foil pouch and by the time I get home, everything is still warm, just like eating at the restaurant.
author: Nini M.

description:
My experience at Super Duper Burgers was super duper!!
Street parking...but it's SF so you probably already knew that. We parked pretty far from Super Duper but it ended up working out because you get so hungry on the walk there, then you eat and get really full and it feels great to walk a little before getting back in your car.
You can't really compare super duper to In n Out because well, it's different! But both delicious in their own ways, depending on what kind of burger you're craving :)

The staff are very friendly and helpful (asks you if it's your first time trying super duper).
I ordered the mini burger with cheese, really wish I added an egg and jalapeno peppers in it!! Next time I go, I'm going to do that. I also got garlic fries, and their vanilla malt shake.

This burger is so juicy and flavorful, and what really is the cherry on the top is their homemade pickles! I took a bite of the pickle after every bite of the burger. Mmmmmm!!
Their garlic fries are delicious too, very garlic-y just the way I like it.
I'm not usually a milkshake kind of girl, I prefer smoothies just because milkshakes make me so thirsty. BUT their vanilla malt shake...omg! It's perfect. I would go back just for their milkshake. I got a little more upset the closer I was to finishing it.

Go to super duper!
author: Christine Y.

description: Amazing hamburgers. Small, but very high quality.  Will definitely return some day. Really good fries and a great atmosphere too!
author: Cameron C.

description: This burger joint is prob one of the best ones I've been to. The burgers are super good and are made with quality ingredients. The garlic fries are a must try. They're super tasty-- the melted parmesan​ cheese makes them incredibly delicious. Food is reasonably priced. Ambience is cool. The only drawback is the street smell lingering inside the restaurant.
author: Hilda L.

description: The restaurant was filthy and the veggie burger was not good.  You'd be better off with a frozen one from the grocery store.  Very bad.
author: Amy M.

description:
Looking for a quick bite? This burger joint is the place to be! Found this gem randomly walking around the city. One of the best veggie burgers I have had in the States! I loved it so much that I went back the next day to get another burger. That should tell you how awesome it was - the right amount of greens, the right amount of sauce, and the perfect patty. I also love their double chocolate shake (tried it on the second day for lunch). It is delicious but a little too heavy for me to finish on my own! The garlic fries were a little too garlicky for my but if that's your thing, you'll love it!
The staff is quick and friendly and the ambience is nice too for a quick bite joint. We were served our beers even before we finished ordering! There is always a line so be prepared for a little wait but it moves pretty fast. 
This place is my go-to for veggie burgers!! Full score from me! 
P.S. keep an eye out for combos; they do have great combo deals (with beer!)
author: Nikita C.

description: The kids wanted to get something to eat before we start looking for Pokemon.  We stopped by here for lunch and they were very busy.  We've been here before and we love their garlic fries.  The burgers are also very good.  Their organic ice cream cone is really good also.  We will definitely be back here for some good burgers.
author: Mark R.

description: I would give ten stars if I could. These are the best burgers I have ever had in my life: fresh, juicy, flavorful. The garlic fries and milkshakes are similarly delicious if you have a couple dollars, or room left in your stomach after a burger. It's a bit more expensive than McDonalds but by god do you get what you pay for.
author: Elaine T.

description:
My favorite burger spot! The burgers are so tasty, juicy and just the best. Their chicken sandwich is also very good and tastes very organic.  
Their milkshakes are the best, if you are a pickle lover like me you will LOVE LOVE their pickles that they have available in a jar, the very best!!! 

Parking can be very hard to find especially at particularly anytime of the day and on any given day. 

Custom service us awesome, every cashier that has helped me has had the most awesome customer service. It's a bite pricey, but it's so worth eating here for the great quality of food you are getting.
author: Rosa R.

description:
Burgers are super. And duper.

Found this burger chain on Yelp with the help of recommendations by fellow city friends. Great alternative to a restaurant burger with the fast-casual environment. You probably know what you should get: burgers and fries. 

The burger was nicely presented and fair to the palate. Be careful of how many patties you want: mini burger is one patty, and super burger is two patties. Customize your toppings are be the best by getting everything.
We ordered garlic fries. Fries are topped with garlic and shredded cheese. I wish the fries were actually tossed with the garlic for better flavor and taste. 

Big plus: the pickles! Self-serve.

They have indoor and outdoor seating. Parking is a nightmare aka drive around and around for street parking.
author: Steven N.

description:
Best burger place I have EVER been to.
The garlic fries are addicting, burger outstanding & the spiked cookies & cream milkshake
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
have you smelled the well-to-eat
up and down market street
on that 7x7 thoroughfare
with their cameras in the air
trucker hats and popped collars
swipe cards & lots of dollars
spending every day
for a wonderful yay

if you're right and you don't err
where to eat at why not order
where burgers brood?
photograph your food
different types who eat a day lunch
buns with beef and cutaway munch
perfect dude
photograph your food

ate up like a million dollar trooper
eatin hard to kill like meat is murder
SUPER DUPER
come let's mix where burgerfellers
eat with chopsticks or umbrellas
in this hood
photograph your food
photograph your food
author: Dan B.

description: I really enjoy this place. The veggie burgers are pretty good, so are the milkshakes and the fries. So wonderful that they made the place bigger by taking over the store next-door. I also like that they are open late. The price is also very reasonable.
author: Lucky S.
