description: Honestly the best burger I've ever had and the garlic fries were great, too! Everything was just so fresh & delicious. This place has kind of ruined me on burgers, because nothing else will ever compare.
author: Jess S.

description: This location has excellent service! They are very friendly and want to make sure that your experience  is as good as possible. The most recent time I was there, my order was taking a significant amount of time longer than my friend's and it turned out that the order hadn't been put in. As soon as the servers realized this, they got my order for me as quickly as possible and gave me a free milkshake.
author: Paige R.

description: Read some of the earlier reviews for Super Duper Burgers and figured I'd give it a shot. We went around 5pm on a Sunday after a Giants Baseball game and I'm not sure if it was busy because of that or maybe the extremely small location made it seem like everyone was sitting on top of each other. We luckily ordered within two minutes of walking in and decided on the Super Burger and Mini burger with a side of garlic fries. There was little to no seating so we had to sit next to a stranger in an extremely close proximity. I mean, my boyfriends elbows were almost touching the man next to him. The food came out very fast for how busy they were so in that aspect I was impressed. The burger overall was decent but in my opinion a little too soggy/messy for me. The garlic fries were amazing and made me have a change of heart about this place but the homemade pickles they are so proud of.... can't say the same. As we were leaving, I noticed a sign on the wall saying there were expanding early May 2017 so hopefully that helps the seating situation!
author: Emily B.

description: The food is always fresh, the staff is always very friendly. They've recently expanded so seating is always available. The only thing I don't like is the ketchup.
author: Cory T.

description: Incredible find. Medium burgers, excellent flavor, juicy. Had the four cheese special and a super burger. Both delicious. The garlic fries were spectacular!! Crispy, cheesy, and garlicky. Will return.
author: Blair R.

description: the response below from super duper shows they don't get it. this is customer service theater, not actual good service. I would never expect a cashier at a restaurant to recognize me -- and so the nonsense continues every visit.
author: C W.

description: So someone in management did reach out to me and offered a gift card. They did seem to have a glitch with a different beef supplier at that time. The burgers have been tender and juicy since as always. Nice service SD!
author: Chanel B.

description:
This is some of the best burgers you can get in SF, especially this location. I wish they were open past 2 AM so I could come when the bars close in the Castro.
Today I came in and was greeted and helped by Brianna. She was very smiley, polite, and helpful. Incredible customer service and was patient with my order which had quite a few modifications and requests for how my food should be cooked. 
My food came out great as usual. I ordered a super burger with an egg, bacon, and avocado. The burger and egg especially, came out looking straight out of a magazine, and the taste matched!
I came back some hours later with some friends who are visiting San Francisco and saw the waitress again, who continued to have a bubbly outgoing incredible attitude delivery great customer service, and helped me to bus my tray since she was changing the garbage bin. Really refreshing to get such great (and sustainable food with integrity) and customer service for such a great price, especially in San Francisco. Please make your way here if you are visiting or not, you won't be disappointed!
author: Adrian S.

description: Not super duper.  More like only duper
author: Asper K.

description:
What a great burger joint in middle of busy market street. The line was long, but the sign said the wait was only 5-8 minutes and they were right. It went by quickly. You order and pay at the register then find a seat and wait. I tried the homemade pickles, and they were not my favorite. Too much vinegar for my taste, but they were crispy and juicy.

I had the small burger with cheese and extra onions with their homemade mayo on the side. The burger was delicious, cooked a perfect medium, and nice toasted bun. The homemade mayo was great as well, not too thick and had good spices in it. I dipped the fries in there. A lot.

Oh my garlic goodness. I am pretty sure my breath is still kicking from those garlic fries, and I don't care they were so good. I wish the white cheddar had melted a bit more, but it didn't stop me from eating them all.
author: Leslie D.

description: Burgers are excellent. Super friendly staff. Not to mention the garlic fries. Everything is just great here. Will definitely be back soon.
author: Jaret A.

description: The never awanser the phone and they are always let's with orders. I used to be a regular but since the expansion the business has gone downhill it's time I found a new place to get my burgers, preferably a place that has better service and knows how to answer the phone, which won't be very hard at all.
author: Arjun G.

description: Order the super duper burger w/ added cheese, grilled onion, and bacon and you will solve all your life's problems! Okay... maybe this burger won't solve world peace, but it comes pretty close! The garlic fries were good, but the taste kinda fizzled out at the end. The service was pretty friendly. Half of the store was closed off due to renovations. This place gives In-N-Out a run for its money!
author: Michelle T.

description: Bomb food. Fast service. What more cld u need? I wld have liked the beef to be a little saltier but I'm a salt fiend so I can't really knock em for that. I definitely wld urge yall to try this place though.
author: Melany T.

description: I'm not usually one to complain (or even to really write a Yelp reviews) but I had such a terrible experience today at this location. I've been to Super Duper tons of times to both the downtown and Marina locations but service at the Castro location could definitely use some improvement. I was in there this afternoon for a burger and fries and was served cold, gross, greasy garlic fries. I brought my fries to the tall, blonde woman that was working the front counter and before I even ask, she sees me & the fries and barks "What is it you want?!?" I politely asked if there was any way I could get a fresh thing of fries since they were really cold and greasy. She rolls her eyes, takes them from me, shouts at the men in the back to get me a new order. She stands there looking extremely annoyed while we wait and a minute later just puts the new tray down in front of me. No "sorry about that" or even "here you go". Terrible customer service!!! When I get back to my seat, I realize they'd totally botched my burger order as well (sauce on a no sauce order, charged me for bacon but there was none on there). After the "warm and helpful" tone they'd had with me before at the front though, I wasn't about to make a peep and kicked myself for not noticing from the get go. I'll keep going to Super Duper, just never again this location even though it's the closest to where I live. The last thing you want as a customer is to feel like you're a nuisance for paying your money and expecting a decent meal.
author: Rori J.

description:
Average at best. This is the 3rd time I've came here. I know my burgers pretty well I like to think. But every time I go I see the sin that says "our burgers are always cooked medium and are really juicy". Well every time I've gone I've had a slightly well-done burger with minimal "juiciness" and was overall pretty disappointed. I don't even think they season the party very much if any at all. Taste pretty bland which is disappointing because I always hear such great things. 

Just another overrated SF based restaurant chain.
author: Wyatt S.

description: I don't do sauces so I can't speak to how good the burger is with the sauce, however, the burger I had was still pretty tasty. The fries were good. Although it was close to closing time, when I ventured in after watching the Warriors win the NBA Finals and consuming copious amounts of wine, the staff was very nice and didn't rush us at all.
author: Lekecia B.

description:
Burgers are good and priced accordingly. They can get a little pricy with all of the fixings, but worth it if you have the appetite for bacon and avocado. Fries were good, both the standard and garlic variety. 

Only knock against this location was dining room cleanliness. Floor needed a really through mopping and didn't look much cleaner than the sidewalk outside.
author: John M.

description:
I'll be honest. There are two reasons I went to Super Duper on my way out of SF:
1. The name. It made me smile. "Hey guys, lets go to Super Duper Burgers!" is just kind of fun.
2. I saw a previous location in the financial district at lunch time, and saw a big ol' line out the door and down the street. Now that's a good sign. 

I played parking meter roulette when coming to this Super Duper. I was happy to find no line, and ordered a standard favorite burger of mine, double meat, double cheese (here a Super Burger) with bacon and grilled onions. I was also able to get garlic fries, which in my book are an insta-order any time I see it on a menu. 

I was so stoked to see my order come out quickly, and be MASSIVE. The patties were bigger than I expected, cheese not junky american grade, onions freshly grilled (and red), and finally bacon crispy. The patties were also still pink, so any fast burger that gives me a medium/medium rare patty already gets a leg up. 

Eating the burger was defiantly great. While it was not an earth-shattering burger, considering the price, and speed, it is quite hard to beat. Quality meat and ingredients with friendly fast service goes a long way. The garlic fries were super tasty, and made me feel guilty of whoever I was going to sit next to on the impending plane ride. I wish there was some minced garlic on them and not just oil, but that's just being picky now. 

I even oppted for a dipped cone afterwards. The soft serve was nothing special, but the dark chocolate dip was for sure above average. 

All in all, no parking ticket, a great last SF meal, and a place I would be happy to take friends back to next time I visit the bay.
author: Joey T.

description:
I have eaten at Super Duper, at this same location, many, many times.
You were making the perfect burger and the perfect fries.
What happened ?
Today, the fries tasted like you fried them in some bad oil or a different kind of oil, or maybe you seasoned them with something funny.  They were good, but not great.
The burger tasted like an ONION sandwich, with no sauce.
It wasn't just my imagination.
I'll be back, some time in the future, to give it one more try.
author: Eddie W.

description:
You know what, I'm fine with people not liking super super duper burgers. That'll mean less people crowding up their space! I love this place! I always go for the chicken sandwich with cheese and regular fries. I tried the garlic ones but they're way too mushy. 
This place is on the expensive side...I spend a good $20 each time on a full meal with my kiddo but I come from sac every few weeks and this fulfills our craving!! 
Note: their vanilla milkshake is to die for!!
I've been to a few of their locations ...the one on chestnut has been consistent. The 721 market one I wasn't happy with because the chicken was burned AND both slices of the ciabatta (?) bread too. 
A few pickles from the pickle jar are a sweet addition while waiting for your food! 
I'm not sure I can wait another week to visit Super Duper Burgers!!
author: Jules S.

description: 10/10. Seriously one of the top three burger places I've ever been to. They have such fresh and high quality ingredients despite coming in later at night. I ordered a super burger (2 4 oz. patties with their special sauce) with cheese, bacon, portobello mushroom, and "everything on it" (lettuce, tomato, red onions) You can even add avocado, an organic egg or cambozola blue onto your burger! They cook the patty medium so they're very juicy. Also tried the three dip fries  which is super sauce, housemade mayo and chipotle. Love the ambiance and vibe of the place, it's a smaller restaurant but it's definitely a step up from most burger joints. They also serve alcohol here and other things on the menu like vegetarian options. Also tried their organic soft served dipped in chocolate! So good.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
Oh-la-la! I am not a burger fanatic, but I am definitely a fan of this place! We were visiting the Twin Peaks and got super hungry and found this place!

PARKING: NA. Street Parking, metered. 

SERVICE: 9/10. The dude taking the order was super friendly and patient for us to decide what we wanted.

FOOD: 9/10. We ordered a veggie burger and a cheese burger, an order of garlic fries and two orders of french fries. The veggie burger was delicious, so were the garlic fries!

PRICING: 8.5/10. Good value for money, not too expensive. Did I mention that the veggie burger and the garlic fries were delicious? Well, it was worth every penny!

I am sure to visit this place again if I visit the twin peaks!
author: Rupayan H.

description:
I love super duper. Like truly Love the burgers, fries and service here. 

I normally get a mini burger since the 2 patties are a bit too much for me. The garlic fries - the one of the best things in the world. The chicken sandwich is pretty good too. I've had the veggie burger as well, and with the avocado, it's actually pretty good. If I could have a super duper burger for most meals, I could probably go vegetarian. 

I did have a time when I had ordered fries and a burger to go and they definitely didn't give me the fries and I didn't notice until I got home. That was rough. Oh well. It happens. 

Eat in, burger and fries!
author: Nina Y.

description:
This is my second time here and I have to say this time wasn't as enjoyable as the first time. I took my cousin here who is visiting from Chicago and he really enjoyed his meal. As for me, not so much. 

I ordered the superburger, everything on it, added bacon and avocado. I was overly excited to notice how much grease was on my burger. After eating it I immediately felt like I had a stomachache. Although it was really tasty and delicious, I feel a little sick. Me personally I might get this place sometime before I go back again
author: Rommel A.

description: The line was short and the woman behind the counter was friendly and efficient. We spent $21.16 on two mini burgers, an order of garlic fries, and a lemonade (made with brown sugar). The ketchup, mustard, and pickles are self serve - which I thought was cool. Whoa are the pickles spicy! The ingredients seem high quality, even down to the upgrade from iceberg lettuce you find in typical burger joints. The fries themselves are decent, but the garlic definitely adds to the experience. We ordered avocado on our burgers and realized a few bites in that it was missing. When I went back up to the counter they were apologetic and hooked us up with two sides (which was a whole avocado between them!) All in all we approved of the dining experience. We went back to the counter for a chocolate shake to-go. It was pretty awesome! You can taste the real chocolate and it has a great texture. Totally worth ordering twice for!
author: Nicole R.

description: Holy Cow!!!! Literally. This burger joint gave me and my buddy a spiritual experience. Don't waste your time anywhere else.
author: Mike B.

description:
I have no idea why the first time I came here I was not impressed. Maybe I'm becoming less open minded and more stubborn as I get older; but man am I glad we kept coming back! I freakin' love this place! For me it's the noticeable freshness of their ingredients that make a difference. Being able to top off your burger with an egg is an added bonus as well. Something about the flavor or ketchup mixed with egg yolk brings me back to childhood, if that isn't comfort food than I don't know what is. The burgers, garlic fries, milkshakes, and dipped cones are highly recommended. Their pickles are pretty good too!

The staff is always great, even when they are busy.
author: Jose U.

description:
First time here and I loved it. I've been wanting to eat at super duper burger since I arrived in San Fran. And on my last day here, my girlfriend and I finally got to try it. 

Got the mini (4oz) burger with cheese, grilled onions & "Everything on it". my girlfriend got the same but with bacon. 

They also have a station where they serve homemade pickles. They were nice and crunchy. 

Overall great place to eat. Next time for sure I'll try the super burger which is 8oz.
author: Joseph R.

description:
My rating: 3.5 stars
Boyfriend's rating: 4 stars

My take: I ordered a mini burger with cheese ($.50 extra) and bacon ($1 extra) and lettuce and tomatoes only. We also got garlic fries and I was hoping to have room for a soft serve cone after. Anyway, they got my order wrong. I received a burger with everything on it (including onions and sauce) and looked on my receipt and I guess the cashier didn't enter in my lettuce and tomato only request. Minus 1 star for me. I had to pick out the onions and luckily I was okay with the sauce so I just didn't bother with asking for another one. The burger itself was good. Very greasy but good. I could do without the sauce though which seems like some mayo sauce. The garlic fries were good but they look like they're sweating oil which I don't personally like. I liked the texture of them though! 

My boyfriend's take: He got the regular burger with everything on it and jalapeño peppers. He really enjoyed it and really liked the fries because greasiness when it comes to burgers and fries doesn't bother him. It's expected.

We'll probably come again (I wanna try that soft serve!!) but the fact that it took like 20mins to park on a Sunday around 1pm is enough to keep me away (not my bf though!) Tip: We found a bunch of spaces on 15th and Castro a few blocks away. It's on a hill but if you're comfortable parking on a hill, check it out if you're tired of looking for parking closer.
author: Amanda L.

description:
The name speaks for itself. Juicy, simple, burgers = super duper good = Super Duper Burgers. 

I usually order the Super Duper Burger (2 patties) and garlic fries. Their garlic fries are so delicious - you must order them! Their burgers totally hit the spot. I love love LOVE that their patties are juicy and tender. I wouldn't say it's the best burger, but it's one of my favorite burger joints in the Bay Area.

I'd come here again and again and again.
author: Kristal D.

description:
Just the consistent local burger place. 

Only thing I really don't like (but most burger is they precook a bunch of bacon. It doesn't have that crispy crispness that makes bacon such a perfect addition to a cheeseburger.
author: Andrew S.

description: It's a very juicy burger.  The flavor was good, but not as good as other burger places.  The soft serve chocolate ice cream was excellent.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Disappointed. Big hair in my shake (which they forgot to make I had to ask twice for it). 'Super' Salad was a few limp Lettuce leaves, 2 slices of cucumber, 1 tiny slice of a tasteless tomato. Not coming back
author: George D.

description: About once every week or so I have a craving for a burger. But only certain burgers satisfy that craving.   This place has mastered it.  I love the mini burger which is perfect sized and amazing fresh toppings.  The bread is fresh, the meltiness of the cheese into the bread and onto the meat is great.  Fries worth the calories.  Good wines on tap.  Good value.     One of the best burgers in the city.
author: Scott H.

description:
Juicy, delicious burgers! I will try no mayonnaise next time though, it was a bit much. 
Not a fan of the pickles though, but the fries are good!
author: Victoria V.

description:
Exactly what I needed!

My $7 mini burger was perfect with a fried egg.  The ooze mixed well with the super sauce.  Pretty satisfying with shared garlic fries!
author: Chris L.

description: We came from Texas where everything is big in Texas. These Burgers were great and the fries were too but my only complaint is the environment isn't so family friendly. I came in with my family hoping to sit down and enjoy our meal. It was 7 of us and there was absolutely no seating. Not even if you waited would you find a seat. Another observation I made as I watched the tables Free up with one or two seats people would rapidly sit down even thou there was no one to wipe down the crumbs so if you're looking for a place to sit down at a clean table and enjoy a burger with your family this isn't the place. This is more of a take out.
author: I V.

description: Quick, simple, and good. I like the burgers and garlic fries. My vegan daughter likes the veggie burger. The milkshakes are yummy!
author: Mark G.

description: Vegetarian fed, Grade A Beef burgers! Doesn't get better than this place I don't think. My girlfriend and I decided to stop here on a whim before we headed back to Sac, and thought these were one of the best burger's we've ever had in terms of beef and fresh produce. They have great ice cream here as well.. Order a super with cheese and fried egg, you won't be disappointed
author: Brandon T.

description: Soooooo much better than that garbage they serve at In-n-Out. This is what a burger should taste like! Kept it simple with a mini with cheese and bacon, and it was simply delicious. The fries aren't the best, but that burger is near perfection. Super duper burger indeed.
author: Hugo C.

description:
***WARNING MOLDY BREAD***

Caution to all patrons of this restaraunt: there is MOLD in their bread. The sheer carelessness of this establishment to serve moldy bread is frankly abhorrent and reflects their kitchen staff's extreme negligence. I warn all people to stay away from this restaraunt for their own health, and I would be wise to heed my own advice.
author: Tyler W.

description:
Out of all of the Super Duper locations where I've enjoyed a tasty, juicy burger,  this location is by far my favorite. The clean, fast, and friendly environment makes the extra Muni ride it takes to get there instead of the downtown Market Street location totally worth it! 
Obviously Super Duper burgers, fries, and shakes are unparalleled by any other burger spots in the city so this review isn't exactly for the food quality. I've thoroughly enjoyed the Super Burger with everything on it and the garlic fries every time I've ordered it. I had it yesterday and am already craving it again. This review is for the awesome atmosphere at this location. 
Firstly, they renovated and expanded their space to better accommodate the large crowd this location draws. The seating area is always spotless and maintained much nicer that you would expect of a "fast food" joint. I've never had to wait around for someone to clean a table as I have in other locations. 
Secondly, they are always speedy and accurate with my order. Always. Sometimes I order with no bun, sometimes with an egg and no cheese, sometimes with everything but sauce. And they get it right every time. No having to bring my tray of food back for them to correct the order. Greatly appreciated! 
Lastly, and perhaps most importantly, this location has the friendliest staff around. Every time I go, there is an amazing cashier, Madalena I think is her name (spelling might be off,) that perfectly embodies GREAT customer service. She just knows her stuff and always has a smile on her face while still maintaining an efficient ordering experience. I think she is Brazilian or something because she also has a cute accent. She always makes sure that customers are taken care of and leave happy and satisfied with their experience. That's very hard to come by and I wish everyone in the customer/food service industry took a page out of her book. 
Overall, this place gets an A++!
author: Iustina S.

description: Changed my mind. Best burger ever. No frills. Super clean. Free pickles. Deliciously greasy garlic fries. Perfect size for me to not hate myself after
author: Juliette W.

description: This place was fast to order and clean the burgers were yummy i have a avo burger with cheese and bacon. And ff
author: Kelli H.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is my go-to place for burgers in the city. I enjoy Burgermeister, have indulged in Barneys, tasted the Umami, but no one makes a juicy, moist (yes, MOIST), and savory burger like Super Duper.

I tend to get their 4-cheese mini-burger. The Castro location is one of the only locations in the city that advertises it. You can ask for it at their other locations, but it has to spelled out. The 4-cheese just has all the cheeses on their menu: Cheddar, White Cheddar, Parmesan, Gorgonzola. I tend to go with the mini due to the amazing bomb this already is with the cheese. Plus, their regular burger size is a hungry person size, so unless you're starving, the mini is the way to go.

The Castro location is great, but it does get a bit crowded. You may need to go during off-hours to enjoy a seat, but the staff is always awesome.
author: Steve R.

description:
Almost like walking into The Habit Burger Grill except this burger joint offers additional fancy-fun extras. Think spiked milkshakes, organic ice cream, dirty fries and free huge ass housemade pickles. 

The outside of Super Duper kinda reminded me of Shake Shack in NY. The decor and vibe is very similar. But of course, pricing here at Super Duper are unbeatable! Just like Habit Burger.

I had the mini combo meal meaning I had a regular 4oz patty burger with all the fixins, some garlic fries and a drank (which I just got my usual water). When our food came out, I was pretty astonished at how neat everything looked. Not messy, not greasy. Garlic fries were bomb and plentiful. My burger was quite juicy and surprisingly, even though I cant stand sesame buns, this one was pretty amazing. Wasn't soggy from all the sauce inside the burger, yet was still soft and airy.

I also had a sip of the SBBF's double chocolate milkshake. It was bomb dot com right thurr.

The place was uber packed on a Saturday afternoon, but why wouldn't it be? Burgers and ice cream in the city for a cheap price? Hellz yeah! I'd be there every weekend. 

There are a few other locations within SF. I'm glad we chose the Castro location. It's a great spot to gay-people watch. Gay peeps are so pretty. :)

Our Food Crawl video footage: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RfUF01tvtNE
author: Michelle V.

description:
I've been here so many times and my experiences are just getting messy.

Tonight. I had 4 mistakes with a simple burger order. 

My order sat on the bar because they called Caleb and not Jacob. I glanced at the order and rest assured there was a bun so I knew it wasn't mine. But we figured it out and so they fixed it. And then it was plain and forgot the fixins. And then the sauce was gone. And then they didn't cook the burger. 

If you want raw meat all wrong, check out this place! Bye Felicia.
author: Jacob D.

description: I've loved Super Duper since this specific location opened but last night my burger was overlooked and dry, the fries were bland and the ketchup was super vinegar-y and tasted horrible. Don't start sucking, SD! But so far the other locations have still been good. And everyone working at this location and others are all super friendly. Hope it was just an off night.
author: Chris O.

description:
Comparable to Shake Shack...Maybe.  Better than In n Out.. No.  But Super Duper is pretty freaking good. 
They don't try to go too crazy or do to much with their burgers.  Just good ol juicy perfectly sized burgers. Their shakes are just a little to "organic" tasting for me (It tasted kinda grassy) but I think that's what a lot of San Franciscans like... but they got Dad's Rootbeer!
For a burger chain, Super Duper is really good and perfect for the fast paced SF lifestyle.
author: Tim L.

description: Delicious burgers, significantly more greasy than some of the alternatives. The  housemade pickles are a highlight.
author: Jakob S.

description: I got a super burger with cheese + fries with 3 dips and it was AMAZING! I highly recommend it. I tried some of the garlic fries and didn't like it much cuz it was way too garlicky
author: Sydney X.

description:
Free homemade pickles in a big jar!  Juicy Niman Ranch burgers ground daily and cooked medium.  Hot, crispy, fries.  Ice cream cones, floats etc.  Free range chicken breast sandwiches too.  Many other items to choose from.  Beer and wine.  Steely Dan playing overhead.  Very cool and personable staff.  Health rating posted by the door has a score of 100!
I loved my food.  I loved my burger!
author: Thomas D.

description: I was starving so what better place to come to then superduper. I love coming here it's very clean and the staff is nice respectful it's never too busy. The food top quality. The burgers are awesome I always add bacon to it. The fries I could eat them all day.
author: Zack T.

description: These burgers are awesome! The meat is organic & the veggies are fresh. I always add an egg. Ooooh & the milkshakes..yum! :)
author: Celeste C.

description: The beef patties were not cooked medium but rather medium well or just north of medium well.. and what is concerning is just how greasy the entire burger was.. and I mean added grease from the cooking process or oils used and not juice from what should have been soft and not overcooked meat.  I literally could squeeze the burger and with each pulsing squeeze a solid stream of grease would hit my plate.  Added bacon was discarded. It was under cooked in my book and more gristle than anything.  I've had worse but this just didn't seem quite right for a $12.50 meal I would have liked one thicker patty that was cooked properly and not too thin overcooked greasy patties.
author: Patrick O.

description: Had a veggie burger with garlic fries. The burger is tasty and juicy. Would be better if there was more garlic in the fries. Overall a good place and the ambience is good
author: Karan M.

description: Every time when I coming here I become so happy!! It's really delicious burgers. And on my opinion this guy's are best in San Francisco.
author: Vadim R.

description:
Susy C: "Meet me at "Super duper"... It's a Nor Cal Burger joint. "

If you were to combine Umami Ambiance + Shack Shack burger = Super duper burger. 

*I wasn't too impressed. The burger tasted exactly like Shack Shake from NYC. Ordered the super Duper Double patty burger and it was not very satisfying. The burger was greasy and very forgetful. Next time I'll just stick to In-n-out.......... Why is there only one In-n-out in all of SF and why is it only in Fisherman's WARF?!?! SOMEONE GET ME A DOUBLE DOUBLE! 

J to the Y. 

Thanks JY for the burger.
author: Justin Y.

description: This burger joint hits the mark on many levels. First of all to make a great burger you need great meat and bread and Super Duper has both. The meat is flavorful and juicy and comes in 2 4oz patties. You can also add bacon,eggs, and avacado in addition to the standard lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, and jalapeños.  On the side pickles are free and plentiful.  But the garlic fries covered with aged white cheddar is a must. As for beverages kids and adults alike can be happy with soda, beer, wine,,and delicious shakes. The latter tastes like it's made with Häagen-Dazs  and may be topped with chocolate chips and cookies. Awesome.
author: Eric M.

description: Terrible burger, no seasoning or sear. Fries were not crispy and they even forgot the dipping sauces that costed $1.50. There was clearly little attention to detail or care by the kitchen. I bought 2 mini burgers and threw them both away after 2 bites. Not recommended especially with In-Out not too far away.
author: Gilbert P.

description: 10pm on a Thursday, called 6 times and no answer. There's no way it's SUPER busy right now. The phone neglect makes me not want to eat here. Waiting for my order instead of ordering ahead is not convenient. I've worked in restaurant ms for 13 years and have ALWAYS been told to answer the phone, even if it's just to put someone on hold. I just want to eat a burger, why are you making it so difficult for me?!
author: Ash G.

description: This is one of the best burgers I've ever had and it was cheap too. I had a mini cheese burger , which is basically the size of a normal burger with lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, jalapeños, and their sauce.  The burger was nice and juicy . You can really taste the difference in their meat too. The only thing is their restrooms aren't clean
author: Velia J.

description: My office ordered from this location by accident so it was a mile back and forth. The burgers and fries were still good even though they were not very warm by the time they got back to the office. I enjoyed my bunless double patties with a fried egg wrapped in lettuce. It was juicy and a little pink, just the way I like my burgers cooked. One person complained because she only wrote down "peppers" and they put jalapeños on her burger vs. roasted peppers but I think that's partly her fault though the restaurant should have checked when they went over the order with us. And they missed an order of fries but didn't charge us either. We ordered seven but we were charged for six and only got six.
author: Jen L.

description:
I've always heard great things about this SF burger chain, and now I know why. Super Duper is a nice twist on the traditional fast food burger joint. They serve fast food style burgers, fries and shakes but with great quality and ingredients. They have super burgers (8 oz.) and mini burgers (4 oz.). Regular fries, garlic fries, and fries served with house dips. I LOVE it when a restaurant creates their own house sauces, it just shows that they really care about the details. Not only does this place serve burgers but they also serve chicken sandwiches and have vegetarian options.

I ordered the Mini Burger with everything on it (Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, Super Sauce, Jalapeno Peppers, Grilled Onions, Pickles) and the French Fries + 3 Dips (Super Sauce/Homemade Mayo/Chipotle). The burger was probably one of the juiciest burgers I've had. The dipping sauces that came with the fries were also very tasty, my favorite being the Chipotle. Kudos to the owner for going with 100% compostable packaging, saving the environment one order at a time. For a burger chain that first opened 2.5 years ago to now have 4 locations throughout the city, they must be doing something right.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Oh.Em.Gee!!!! Absolutely delightful!!! I cannot emphasize enough how DELICIOUS the food was!!! 
After a long Friday night, filled with partying and booze, this place was perfect for the "next day re cooperation"! 
I ordered the chicken burger with chipotle aioli sauce, and a side of fries, ABSOLUTE HEAVEN!!!! The chicken patty was cooked to perfection! The chipotle aioli sauce was rich, creamy, and smoky. The service was relatively speedy. Customer service at the registers was helpful, and informative about the menu. Please check this place out!!! Five stars indeeeeeed!!
author: Kirandeep S.

description:
I hate to say it but growth has not been a good thing for this local chain. I hate a horrible experience at the one on Market near Castro. I then contacted them via the online form but no response and so tried again. They seem clueless about customer service and i am left with a bad memory of a dried out burger and cold undercooked fries.
 
Update: they do have customer service. After my review, They reached out to  me and so i will update my review by adding 2 stars for customer service. I will return  and hope to add stars for food as well. I will even try same location though I am a little afraid of that after my last experience. Stay tuned.
author: CJ C.

description: My first visit to Super Duper burgers was super duper delicious. For any garlic lover, the garlic fries are a must get. The burger was good but nothing spectacular. If you want a good meal, then i would suggest to come here.
author: Daniel W.

description: The staff was super friendly. Made the visit amazing. Asked questions, made suggestions, really made you feel like family and in a fast paced environment. I couldn't be more satisfied with the wonderful customer service.
author: Sutton S.

description:
We came here due to a lot of great reviews. The service was nice, the facility was clean, and the presentation of the food was  appetizing. The first bite was ok, but I could not finish this burger. It was beyond greasy! i had 4 napkins filled with grease, and the burger was still filled with oil and grease. This did not sit well with me or my boyfriend for the remainder of the night. It's a shame, because this establishment reminded me of Burgerfi - which is my favorite burger joint! 

if you like greasy- this is your place. If greasy is not your style- AVOID!
author: Amanda G.

description:
I Came. I Ordered. I Ate. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=bPlpBM1TDNNoI1KJ7ZlRGA 

I bowed to the porcelain throne AND yacked...EVERYTHING OUT (Umm, at least it saved me a trip to the gym.)

Super GREASY. Super OILY. Super SALTY. Sorry, but there's NOTHING Super Duper about that ménage a trois. 

One Star for the House Pickles. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=bPlpBM1TDNNoI1KJ7ZlRGA#xDVdm4tbYzjEWAdyi_v4yQ

One Star for the Chocolate Dipped Straus Vanilla Soft Serve Ice Cream.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=bPlpBM1TDNNoI1KJ7ZlRGA#mM8tiPp1aG9ic1Wv5JdIWg

One Star for sobering up my drunk ass without sending me to the ER with a heart attack.

OTHER NOTES:
*Fast service by curt employee(s).
*100% Niman Ranch Beef, Organic Straus Cream and House-made Pickles, Pies & Cookies. 
*Get the Mini Burger, the Super Burger's double patty was disgustingly oily (like a Crisco tub exploding in your mouth) and nearly inedible after several bites. This is what caused the hurling session. 
*Our patty was cooked to a well-done so make sure to request your preference. 
*Garlic fries lacked a crispness and garlickyness. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=4he9TqIwTyScIPHctE2IxQ#4he9TqIwTyScIPHctE2IxQ
*Modern retro decor with seating for about 30 people and outdoor patio seating.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Seriously delicious! 
Came here for lunch about 2 weeks ago on our trip to sf from hi. 

Story: Was really hungry and wanting something great for lunch. I yelped burgers and super duper burgers looked fantastic. (It was!!) I GPS my way down from ashbury and haight (another great time) and bam awesome parking. We walked in and wow what a nice place. I love the windows how they can open up and make it feel more outdoorsy. We ordered the regular double with the delicious garlic fries and ice cold great white beer!  (I think that's the name) omg. Best meal in sf. (I really love burgers)
author: Paolo M.

description:
These burgers are very respectable, with good flavor. The homemade pickles are delicious! The fries are good too. And they serve beer - always a plus.

I would give four stars, but my burger was too greasy. I had to wipe excess grease off the bottom bun.
author: Jeff G.

description:
It was my first time trying it and I was definitely not disappointed. I ordered a mini meal with garlic fries. Even though it's a mini meal, it's pretty filling. It was super juicy and the bread complemented the patty well, along with the cheddar cheese, tomato, lettuce, and grilled onions. It was, as expected, really messy but what's the fun in eating burgers without the mess? 

The service was amazing, not to mention the cashier was attractive. ;) They're super friendly and delivered your meal to your table too. Overall, chill environment and definitely a place to try for their burgers and garlic fries.
author: Adrianne T.

description: Pretty Good American food. The interior is Quite modern. Plus the food is not Non GMO modified so that's a plus. Overall, that's pretty good.
author: Vinson L.

description: Very good quality. Everything is organic and reasonably priced (although the shakes looked extremely small for the cost). But burgers are juicy, fries are crispy and ingredients are fresh. Homemade pickles are tasty!
author: Jesse C.

description:
Maybe it's just my hunger but this burger place is bomb. Came here after exploring Land's End. I've been to this joint a couple times in the past and I remember that last time was just as awesome of an experience as this time. Like last time, i got the mini burger which is $5. Add cheese and it's $0.50 more. So totally worth it. I think the mini (4oz beef) is enough for me. My friend got the super duper (7oz) and it was enough for him. They claim that they use organic beef and ours were cooked perfectly. It was tender and juicy goodness. The veggies might not matter to people, but the lettuce on ours were fresh and crisp. 
To come and think about it.. There is actually nothing special about this burger.. Pretty basic ingredients plus the super sauce. But it's the quality of these ingredients combined with just the right technique in cooking the meat makes this place really great.  

Do not forget to get the garlic fries. They are soo good too. 
Next time i'll try their shakes and soft serve. 

It's a little bit more expensive than in and out but less than other "gourmet" burger places out there ie. The counter, Umami. 

Totally worth checking out. If im in the SF area and cravin some burgers, this is my #1 choice.
author: Stacy P.

description: Yum! Had a fab lunch with my mom. The garlic fries are terrific. I would have loved it if American cheese were an option. I know they are all about local and fresh, but I do love my semi fake cheese on a burger. My mom enjoyed her veggie burger. The staff was super nice.
author: Alison M.

description:
Friendly staff, really tasty hamburgers and for San Francisco they are pretty cheap. 
When we entered in, it was really crowded and found out only one chair then the second one to take a seat. Bear in mind, maybe there can be no space.
author: Es L.

description:
Very delicious. The selection is minimal, as is the decor. But the burgers are very tasty, and the fries are very potatoey. So that's all I'm looking for and that's what I got.

Yay!
author: Peter L.

description:
The Castro isn't much of a foodie neighborhood unlike the Mission or downtown, but it makes up for it with familiar American food and what else?

Sexy. Castro. Men.

Well, with the dim lighting in here, everyone looked sexy.  =P

Alcohol is never a good thing to have in your system without proper sustenance so a good ol' cheeseburger and fries combo is the way to go.  They only have 2 beers on tap if you need to sober up, but after heavy drinking, my body craves nothing but ice cold H2O.  

Their burgers are compact in size simply put together with lettuce and tomato, but the secret sauce made it special. It was cooked medium, very little pink in the center, seasoned well and I like the soft sesame bun. But what I really appreciate about this burger is the fact that it's well assembled and didn't fall apart while eating. Oh, you pickle fans would be ecstatic that there is a pickle jar that you can help yourself to! The fries were thin cut, almost like shoestring fries, served hot and well salted. 

Super Duper pulled me out of a potential next day hangover stupor and I think that's just super!
author: Janice C.

description:
Have to give Super Duper another 5-stars for their consistently delish Veggie Burger

Stopped by this location for the 1st time, after a movie at the Castro & let's just say at 9pm, the place was completely hopping.  Every table filled & the line was out the door - but we knew it'd be worth it

Veggie Burgers w/ "Everything", add Avocado & Cheese & Jalapenos & it's our go-to burger combo.  Wash it all down w/ their irresistible Garlic Fries

Being in such a small space, we were initially concerned that there might be meaty grease contamination.....since everyone & their brother were ordering regular burgers & the place was just saturated w/ "hamburger"  ( you know what I mean )

But in true SD form, our burgers were utterly & completely pristine - don't know how you do it but we love, love, love you for it!

Staff was running around like crazy but it was a controlled chaos that equated to short wait times & satisfaction delivery - yup, this was good as it got
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Oh this location is damned delicious. I killed a super with bell peppers and cheese and a large order of garlic fries with no problem. 

The meat tastes better here versus the Marina location (probably because it's the Marina *gag* jk). Like that they have special variety burgers I haven't seen at the other spots. I CRAVE Super Duper and need to have it at least once a week. I haven't been keeping up lately but I'll give in the cravings soon enough.

Like that this location is open until 11pm every single night and it's easily accessible for me. 

Originally walked in to do take out, but the guy at the register convinced us to dine in so we said ok and opted for that but then we got our food, it was bagged up to go. When he saw our confused looks he said "You said you wanted it to go" Mehhh okay fine. Carrying that cup of soda on a motorcycle home was interesting...
author: Susy C.

description:
I'm so sorry:
Basic cheeseburger/chedder cheese with lettuce and tomato on the side.  
Regular order of fries.  
To go.

Meat was dry and gray.  Very unappetizing.  Not juicy at all.
Fries were so overcooked.  Dry and broke like twigs.  

Not returning here.
author: Jamie M.

description: Love Duper Stupor,,, er, Super Duper.  No elitist here as I like In-N-Out however while twice the price SD's meat, the flavor, is worth it!  So delicious as are their free pickles.  Grilled onions, even blue cheese.  So good!  Must also commend the staff!  Friendly plus while my  lettuce-wrapped double to go was in an aluminum bag I was thoughtfully offered a paper one as well.  Nice touch!
author: Joshua C.

description:
I have been wanting to check this place out for quite some time.

I went her for some dinner after OSL and I ordered by Mini cheeseburger with egg with a side of garlic fries.

The burger was...alright..nothing too memorable about it. it was a bit pricey I might add for that size.. it was enough for me but some of my guy friends were not too full after their burger.


The fries were pretty good though. I liked.  I do like that we can get unlimited pickles though.
author: Phuong K.

description:
Simply divine!!! A juicy, mouthwatering and OMG that hella oil burger joint. But hey, that's what makes this place bomb.com! haha

Throw in some garlic fries with different sauces and we're talkin'

Get ready to be messy as you eat their burgers though.
author: Jan R.

description: Terrible they just got my order wrong and nobody's never answering the phone to doublecheck on customers very disappointed we never never ever order there again
author: Cup And Cake C.

description:
I'm not embarrassed to say I crave super duper... A lot. I've visited many around the city and I always leave happy! I do have to say that this particular location does seem to have a little less flavor than some of the others I've been to in the city.

If you're already there, you might as well spruce up your burger! Don't forget the avocado! And the garlic fries, ohhh the garlic fries! They are my favorite garlic fries in the city!
author: L S.

description: I went here yesterday night at 10:45. I ordered a chicken burger with avocados, grilled onions, and jalapeños. I'm a fan of burgers but this place surprised me with price point and the quality.
author: Ashu D.

description:
Super Duper is where I go when I need a burger fix
without my tummy feeling like it got hit with a ton of bricks.

Fast food on the slow food movement so there's no need for grief.
Homemade pickles, free range chicken and Niman Ranch Beef.

No twenty dollar burgers here, you can get a mini combo for under ten bucks
They even have wine and beer on draft that doesn't suck.

The garlic fries are my savory and the chocolate dipped soft serve is my sweet
The mini burger is filling enough for one person to eat.

The ambiance is simple, nothing exciting
but you're here to eat burgers, just be happy you're not dieting
author: Kristi G.

description:
get a super duper burger with bacon and fried egg!.
the meat is juicy, the bun is crisp. but man when the egg explodes... you got a hot, greasy, heavenly meat mess!
quality ingredients, tasty food, for around $10 in the middle of SF is a win in my book!

gwad... i feel like a pig.

only down side, i need more napkins.
author: Jason C.

description: While their food is good when ordered at their restaurants, I recently ordered from them through Doordash. Never again. The burger was awful. I didn't ask for lettuce or onions, so they gave me a burger with cheese and nothing else. They didn't even include condiments. And the burger was dry. I usually have to use many napkins while eating at the restaurants, so i very surprised to find a dry burger. I emailed Super Duper about this experience, along with Doordash, and got radio silence on both ends. I won't be back.
author: J B.

description:
Gave this place another try late last night, and they've improved a lot. The guy at the counter was super nice. We order two super burgers, and we were going to order two cookies and cream shakes, but unfortunately they were out. However, seeing as it was hot yesterday, and they must have been slammed, I don't feel right subtracting a star. He apologized, and offered the double chocolate, but I'm not really a chocolate person, so instead we got the garlic fries. 
Tip: put the leftover garlic cheesy goodness on your burger. It's delicious.
author: Rebekah H.

description: Literally the best burgers EVER! I got the mini with cheese and my friend got the veggie burger. We also got the garlic fries and they were amazing. Super duper messy though so make sure to grab like 20 paper towels before sitting down to eat. I love the location in the Castro! Such a fun atmosphere and cool people.
author: Nikki S.

description:
BOMB!!
I got the small super duper burger w. swiss cheese and avocado on it...
SHUT UP!! AMAZING!!
also got the parmesan and garlic fries... speaks for itself 
there is a ton of garlic and cheese on these bad boys!
and to top it off I got the cookies and cream milkshake.
never had a bad experience with the food here it's so freakin good.
please go. now.
author: Cody F.

description: I was really excited to try this place since I heard some great things about it.  I like the concept, but I was a little disappointed with the burger.  It wasn't bad, but nothing special in my opinion.  The patties are pretty thin.  The meat had a lot of gristle.  May have been an off night.  The service was decent and I did like the homemade pickles. I might try it again. We'll see.
author: Tommy M.

description:
If the food is great sober, I can only imagine how amazing-balls it is DRUNK!

Missed out on a 5 star review because they ran out of pickles.  You should always be fully stocked especially if you are located one the Castro.  

Also missed a star because their alcoholic root beer shake did not have a buzz to it.  I couldn't taste the alcohol, but it was a damn taste root beer shake.  A special drink only during Pride 2015.

Cheeseburger was so juice!

The shredded Parm on the garlic fries was awesome.  I was amazed that the garlic fried had melted cheese.  Just enough garlic too.

I will be back.
author: Sunshine S.

description: Great place! Comfortable environment for visiting with friends. Kid friendly menu, fantastic food all around. I would return again:)
author: Emily B.

description:
There's a disclaimer on the menu and on the wall that, since the burgers are cooked medium, they will be messy. I'm glad that disclaimer exists because they weren't kidding. The burgers are insanely greasy and oily due to the melted cheese. Basically from the start, keep the burger wrapped in the paper, because, from an engineering standpoint, they aren't soundly constructed.

That being said, the flavor of the burger was absolutely delicious. All elements, so long as they're wrapped in wax paper and surrounded by extra napkins, come together in a perfectly tasty tapestry of meet and veg. 

What sent this place over the top though was the shake. I haven't had an authentic malted shake in a while and this one was perfect addition to this burger on a rare 90 degree San Francisco day. 

The menu is a simple process of how many patties and what you want on it. Do you want fries? How about a drink. Basically a little simpler than In and Out. 

The only reason its not a five star review is that from the first bite of the burger, discharge landed on my pants and I've not been able to get the stain out. Hopefully that's not a permanent reminder of an otherwise delicious experience.
author: James G.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had! I got the 4oz burger with cheese, avocado, red onion, lettuce, and super sauce. It was delicious. I also shared garlic fries with my brother which were great, and I had a chocolate shake on the side which was as good as any other shake. I love the fact they use sustainable to go cups and use organic ingredients. Definitely stop by here if you're craving a good burger.
author: Tayler C.

description: Their garlic fries are so full of flavor! I'll come back for those alone. I like how you can choose what you can put into your burger and it's a simple great burger. Fresh meat patties are great.
author: Ruby B.

description:
Well, it was good. I am not ever going to be a loyal follower, but it was decent. Those garlic fries everyone raves about?  Yeah, not a fan. But that is simply because   I prefer my garlic cooked. Generally speaking, garlic fries from anywhere are loaded up with nearly raw garlic, which just does not taste good to me.  But that is a personal preference. 
If you're a fan of gobs of raw garlic, these fries are for you. I got the mini (that's a single burger by any other standards) with cheese & an egg. I was hoping for a runny yolk but didn't get it, which means I could have done without it. 
The homemade pickles are ok. I prefer my pickles with more kick, so that didn't go as planned either. 
And finally, I wanted a spiked chocolate shake, but we orders to go and you can't take alcohol outside in SF. Seems odd considering half the town is walking down the street smoking pot. 
Overall - meh.  I prefer In & Out if I'm totally honest.
author: Gabrielle T.

description: A group of four of us visited this restaurant on Saturday, January 8 while on a weekend stay in San Francisco. We were all in the mood for a burger and and we resorted to yelp to find the closest most yummiest burger and it did not disappoint. This burger was AMAZING and the garlic fries too. I definitely recommend this place for a fast, delicious burger. Oh and the ice cream is delicious too!
author: Jessica R.

description: A reasonably solid burger and kinda meh fries. I had the bleu cheese concoction and it was quite juicy and even at the smaller size a reasonable meal. I only slightly regretting not getting the larger one. My garlic fries had weird clumps of parm that weren't evenly distributed in any meaningful way and made for some strange and decidedly mealy bites.
author: Misha T.

description:
I was craving for a nice burger from time immemorial and wohoo finally found a place to soothe my cravings.
They have very nice varieties of burgers and their patty is soft and juicy.

Surely recommended
author: Mimansha B.

description:
I have never had more fun having my food order completely butchered and blown. My cousin and I laughed for days afterwards. We laughed about this fuckery all the way home. 

My cousin and I were actually on our way to Orphan Andys as we were craving food and milkshakes. On our way we happened upon Super Duper, took a look, and decided to try something new. 

Ok so we both ordered 4 oz. burgers with our own specifications, then shakes, hers a child, mine NOT, and some fries to share. The order comes up and I realize there are two child shakes on our tray. I walk back to counter and let them know, they take back the child shake and make a regular sized one. Later I realize the milkshake was probably the wrong flavor, long story, but I think so too.
Then I check out my burger. *sigh* All I wanted was lettuce, tomato and pickle. What's in my burger? Mayo (bleh), onions and tomato. I decide I can pull out onions, wipe off mayo, but did want my lettuce. I ask for it, get the tiniest piece, then go start to eat. I bite into my burger and it is pink. Not medium pink, medium rare pink. My cousins was a nice pink, mine was moo'ing pink. Not to mention there was a piece of, uhhh, I don't honestly know what it was, looked like an old piece of bacon, but my cousin and I think it was an old piece of burned egg. It was stuck to the side of my burger. Gross. I decided I can't eat it, let them know, and take their offer of making a new one. The cashier and I CLEARLY AND EXPLICITLY go over my order, I say lettuce and tomato only. Why no pickles? Well I realized that they have a jar of their home made pickles next to the condiments. With all the issues that we had already, I didn't even BOTHER asking why pickles weren't on the original burger. They're on the menu as a topping option, and even if they are only at the condiment table, no one told me, not to mention they are spear shaped so they don't even go into a burger. Whatever. 

So I make my remake order simple, tomato and lettuce. He's nice, apologizes, takes order, says he'll bring it to my table. As I wait we just laugh, it's crazy how much has gone wrong with such a simple order. Even my cousins burger didn't have lettuce, which she had order, but she just let it go. Ok so my burger arrives and it smells good, has no mayo, no pieces of egg, does have it's tomato, but has no lettuce. *we laugh* Ok look I don't ask for much on my damn burger, but lettuce is one that I absolutely want on it. I go up and ask, laughing because either I laugh at this lunacy, or I am going to flip the fuck out, this food isn't cheap for them to be blowing it this much. I ask for the lettuce and learn they ARE OUT OF LETTUCE. Were they hoping I just wouldn't notice?? OOOHH and my new burger had TWO PATTIES! LOLOL was that my substitute to lettuce?? I mean wtf, I don't want a double burger, I had fries, a shake, I can't eat that. I had to take a patty out and it got thrown away. So I go sit down and just laugh and laugh and laugh because this is fucking ridiculous. WHY WOULDN'T ANYONE TELL ME!? 

I just feel like everyone dropped the ball all over the place, the kitchen as well as the FOH. Kitchen wasn't paying attention to their shit, cashiers weren't communicating to me or kitchen, it was a mess. Did I mention another customer was complaining about something right before me? I couldn't hear all of it but my cousin had the better view and said customer looked very unhappy and I heard the cashier say "refund right away" at one point. So it was a bad night for them. Unfortunately I doubt I'll come back. I mean it was just too terrible yet hilarious for me. I should have just went to Orphan Andys.
author: Reyna O.

description:
I've aways liked this place, especially because the staff is super awesome. Last night, in particular, was just a fantastic experience. My boyfriend and I went there to get some late night burgers and shakes. The guy that took our order is always awesome. I don't know his name but he's tall and wears glasses and is just about the most efficient cashier I've ever seen. 

After I ordered a shake, they told me they were out of the one I wanted and offered to give me a more expensive shake for free instead. Then, when they happened to accidentally make an extra burger, they offered it to us free of charge.

Awesome place, great food, great staff.
author: Kyle S.

description: I have been a patron and fan of SDB before they opened up locations all over the city and after years of feasting on their greasy amazingness I would like to formally request better napkins and to bring back the backs of chairs!  You just can't make us use those sh*tty brown paper towels that are in elementary school bathrooms anymore!  Our table seriously went through a stack of them so it can't be the environmental option either.  Also, what happened to the chairs?!  I mean are you seriously making us use our core to sit on a low metal stool after feasting on a super burger?  That's just mean.
author: Bernadette T.

description:
Great veggie burger with hummus (think flattened falafel). Fries are to die for as are the shakes. 
Service is always spot on and food always good!
author: Matt V.

description: Great lunch place. The menu is simple enough for our kids to enjoy but the quality of food is excellent. Save room for the home made ice cream.
author: Alan B.

description:
Quintessential SF burger spot and a definite must-try for anyone visiting San Francisco!! With so many locations throughout the city, there's really no excuse. Super Duper perfects the balance of quick service yet still maintaining somewhat of a sit-down restaurant feel. 

I can't stress how juicy and flavorful the burgers are. THEY'RE SO GOOD. The juice spills out with each bite you take, and it becomes hard to stop the juice from dripping down your arm. But at the end of the day, guess what? You don't care!!! All you can think about is the happiness and deliciousness you get from each bite. The fries here are also on point btw.

I was never really a fan of pickles until recently...but honestly, I credit Super Duper for my sudden love for pickles. The pickles here are homemade, and best of all...wait for it....THEY'RE UNLIMITED. So yes, even for you people who hate pickles. I beg you to at least try the ones here because they'll be unlike any other pickles you've had.

One last thing that I love about Super Duper? Their soft serve. Mmmmmmm. Few places have both great burgers AND great soft serve. A cone of soft serve ice cream (when dipped in chocolate, even better) is the perfect way to end a great meal.

This place lives up to its name. Cheesy? Maybe. But hey, it works for them!
author: Aaron W.

description: Melty yum goodness, that's all you need to know. Worth the walk into the Castro for super burger. They also serve dessert, beer, and garlic fries. Why haven't you been here yet??
author: Trisha C.

description: Super burger is sadly kid sized for a almost $8 burger. I had much bigger at Mc Donald for cheaper. So if you're hungry and expect big, you will be disappointed.  Otherwise, that said the quality of the food have nothing to do with McDonald. Steak taste delicious, and the fries not over cooked and dry, like it's often the case
author: Frank S.

description:
These guys are super friendly and professional. ...And they know how to grill a burger.

I had the single bacon cheeseburger with a chocolate malt. After I ordered I saw the "special" menu at the registers.  I'm still glad I had the unadulterated classic cheeseburger - simple is sometimes the best.  I'll have to return to find out.  :)
author: Jeff G.

description: Still no Gluten Free bun option. And those of you who, like me, can't handle gluten, understand that wrapping a burger in lettuce just ain't the same. Otherwise, this place is perfection - grrr!  it's 2016, get with the program guys.
author: Jordan J.

description:
1. Cookies and Cream Shake + Spiked = This just literally tasted like they took a cookies and cream shake that would have been fine on it's own and dumped in some cheap alcohol. I did not like it and I don't believe a lot of thought has gone into the alcohol/shake flavor combination.

2. The burgers were incredibly juicy and delicious, except the meat was very salty. So salty, in fact, that the meat was almost inedible. Dude, lay off the salt. It's a flavor enhancer.

3. The garlic fries were ridiculously delicious.

4. The staff was very friendly and the price point was good.
author: Tara H.

description: This place probably has the best burger I have ever had. It isn't the most inexpensive but it is worth the price.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Super Duper, that's right!
Support a fast food chain that uses fresh local ingredients!
My burger craving yesterday was satisfied and the friendly service (girl with the glasses at the counter) made it even sweeter.
The only problem I have is I never have enough room for dessert and I've been wanting to try the Strauss soft serve ice cream for ever...
author: Monkey B.

description:
Great place with great burger, one of the best burgers of my life.

I have pair around US$ 11,50 for the burger and soda.

Next time I will try the extra avocado. 

It is a very comfortable with a modern design very close of market street and apple store of San Francisco.
author: Márcio R.

description:
Never had the burgers. We passed by here after our meal at Kitchen Story.  I thought I was full but how wrong I was. My second stomach kicked into gear.

When I saw the sign for "Organic Soft Serve Ice Cream" I couldn't help myself. 

I had the kid size organic swirl (vanilla/chocolate) soft serve ice cream, I am not sure what the adult size serving of this is, but the kid size was more than enough for me. Straus organic milk is always good in any form, ice cream, frozen yogurt, etc.

A nice surprise to finish off my lunch.
author: Nette T.

description: Really reasonably priced burgers cooked to perfection. I got my burger medium rare and it was cooked to perfection. Will definitely be coming back here again soon.
author: Adam R.

description:
WHAT A JOKE!
(lets put extra grease/oil on the burgers right before serving to the customers and maybe, just maybe they'll think that these are "super juicy" and not just very greasy burgers)
All organic and or grass fed blah blah blecccc  threw up from a half eaten 13 dollar burger fries and drink.
Never Again.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
The burgers are fine - it's not McDonalds, for sure -  but its not the place for someone on a hunt for the best burger.  

They're charred,  which is great, but the burger is mostly bland tasting.  

The fries were cold but even if warm, I don't think they'd be as good as McDonalds.  

So if you're hungry, this place is fine but if you're after a burger experience, try the new order kiosks at McDona
author: Terry M.

description:
Garlic Fries: 7.9/10 Damn good fries, but a little too oily.

Super Burger w/ Cheese & Bacon: 6.5/10 Yeah it's good, there's meat and lettuce and tomatoes and everything your basic burger has. Nicely toasted bun....but wayyy too oily. 

Overall, if you like your burgers oily and oily, not to mention oily, then this is the place for you.
author: Gary W.

description:
Garlic Fries + Mini Burger with Jack and banana peppers + Drink = $11

The fries are addicting and the pickles are fantastic. I can barely finish a mini burger and don't think i've ever seen anyone get the Super Duper and fries. It's A LOT of food and pretty damn greasy but oh so good! 

The service is fast and I always get a kick out of the guys behind the register here. One of them seems to be on coke every time I see him.
author: pretty w.

description: This is based only on the ice cream. It is AMAZING and sooooo good. You need to go there and get some. The service by the staff is great. They are very nice and quick. The ice cream tasted fresh, delicious and rich. Visit them for the best ice cream around. YUM!
author: Big D.

description: THEY SHOULD CHANGE THE NAME OF THIS PLACE TO GREASY BURGERZ cuz they got the most greasy burgerz i ever tasted in my entire life...and that sh!t was hella f**cken nasty bruh..when i squeeze my burger it dripped grease like it wuz drenched in a bacon grease slushyz...dont know if they buy theyre reviews or people go here cuz they got a lot of reviews....this place is absolute trash..dont ever waste your money or sacrifice your health here..this place is worse then mc donalds...dont believe the lies...wud rather have had burger king...cuz f**ck your greazy burgerz
author: A E.

description: Super Duper is just consistently great! Juicy, beefy burgers, and delicious shakes. Everyone seems to have an opinion on the best burgers in SF, but I personally feel that they're always in my top 3!
author: Kazu O.

description:
delicious burgers and shakes. More expensive but definitely tastier than in-n-out.
Came in once and my order was lost. Was feeling upset but then my order was on the house without me even asking, so I really appreciate that. Will be returning!
author: Alec F.

description: Burgers are expensive.. add on's are expensive and the staff is kind of rude. The place is small but people get in and out quick. The burgers are pretty salty, but they are moist and do have flavor. Garlic fries were okay. Probably won't be back but was nice to try. OH, and the homemade pickles are pretty good... and I don't like pickles.
author: Tiff C.

description: Really good burgers and fries! Best part is that it's located in downtown SF
author: Michelle H.

description: Their rich and juicy super burger "with everything on it" was exactly what I needed after a long stressful day. It was really delicious and fulfilling, the staff was friendly and I was greeted with a benevolent smile. Nice place to go to have a decent meal for a reasonable price.
author: Oleg K.

description:
True confession: I've never actually had a burger here, but it's only because I can't get away from the chipotle chicken sandwich (which I consume on a near-weekly basis** -- cringe!) It is easily one of the best chicken sandwiches around -- but be sure to stock up on napkins, because it's messy. Tasty, perfectly cooked chicken, lettuce, tomato and melty jack on toasted ciabatta might be good on its own, but the chipotle aioli in which the sandwich is smothered is what really makes it stand out; it adds so much flavor, and it's the perfect balance of sweetness and spice. I also love Super Duper's fries; they're always perfectly hot and salty. 

If you still have room(!), the organic soft serve ice cream is really good, too!  

Service is always fast and polite; the seating in this location is limited and it can get pretty crowded (there seems to be more space in the the downtown locations). As if the glorious menu weren't a good enough reason to frequent Super Duper, the business is also all about local, sustainable farming, and everything you'll use to eat there -- packaging, wrappings, straws, etc. -- is compostable. A+.

It's always busy, no matter what time of day -- but of course it is; it's a testament to how delicious the menu is. 

**You know that "You...again?" face of incredulous recognition you get from clerks? (Or is it just me?) I'm fairly certain they know me by name.
author: Katie M.

description:
Meal was sort of a thrombotic terror. Had a mini burger with everything on it. It was tasty, but the level of grease was nauseating. There was a pool of melted yellow lard on the wax paper. 

The garlic fries were soggy, rather than crisp, since it was drenched in oil. Must've been cooked in oil at too low a temperature. Garlic tasted slightly raw and overly powerful. Eating fries with nonmelted cheese is not very satisfying either.
author: Tes Y.

description: These burgers are so so so so good.  The best.  Ever.  Wait I shouldn't be telling everyone this should I - well at least there's enough locations to thin those lines a bit!
author: Alexandre P.

description:
Pros: accepts credit, friendly cashiers, unlimited pickles, all wrappers compostable
Cons: overly greasy tiny burgers

You would think that a "Super Duper" burger would be larger than your average hamburger. It really wasn't. I got the super duper with everything on it and compared the the mini, there is an additional patty. After you order, you wait until they call out your name with your order. The entire burger was the size of my palm and flipping it over to open the wrapper, I could already see the sheen of grease seeping out. Towards the end of my finishing my burger the patty started to fall apart and the bread started to also. I liked the flavors that came from the burger with the addition of the jalapeño peppers, but I could not overlook having to wipe my hands after every time I picked up and put down the burger. It's not a bad deal for $7.61 (7+tax), but I just wish it were a little bigger. 

The store has ample seating inside and a few tables outside. The staff is very good at cleaning a table after it's been vacated.
author: Alex T.

description: 2.5 stars, very very average burger and fries. Patty was over cooked, barely any sauce so it was super dry and tasteless. Fries were fries, nothing special. I wouldn't go back or recommend- there are so many better burger places out there.
author: Allie S.

description:
pros: organic beef fast food, ice cream is soft serve, Service is pretty quick, lots of seating options, soda machine with free water, free pickles, self-serve condiments

cons: not the greatest organic burgers (roam is much better for the price), a bit pricey.
author: Mel L.

description:
You got to try the Super burger everything on it with extra avocado and grilled onions. Too bad, they dont ask how you want to meat cooked.

The fries are pretty good too!
author: Arnaud H.

description: If they are "busy", they just ignore the phone, it rings forever and then goes to a message that says the answering service is turned off. So then you go in person, which makes the line bigger, which makes them more "busy" and unable to answer the phone. Horrible customer service.
author: Garrett O.

description: We were walking up and down Market St looking for a place to eat, then came across this place. Staff was super friendly, food was awesome and very inexpensive, especially for its location. We're definitely coming back! :D
author: Jenn H.

description:
My GO-TO spot when I'm craving a quality and inexpensive burger!!!

The burgers are juicy and will more than satisfy your taste buds. I get the super burger while adding on bacon and an egg with a side a french fries. The special sauce along with the patties make the burger extremely flavorful. The service is quick and they usually have your order ready within minutes. And what better way to end your meal after inhaling a fatty, juicy burger by getting some ice cream. 

The only downside is that there are no drive thru! All the super duper locations in San Francisco present challenges when trying to find parking. However it's all worth it when you get your hands on one of these bad boys. Definitely recommend going here and I hope super duper rapidly grows their locations so they are more accessible.
author: Vincent C.

description: Have it your way! Savory cheeseburger on a lettuce wrap. The twins split a plain burger. Silky sweet vanilla soft serve cone and chocolate shake.  Load up on the free pickles!
author: Vanessa H.

description: Super duper burger is all about the freshness, the beef patty is charred on the outside and juicy on the inside, the tomatoes, lettuce and the sauce will be all over you but that's what super duper is all about! Don't forget the soft serve hand dipped chocolate over the vanilla and chocolate creamy cone. Yum and all over you, that's a complete meal!
author: SJ L.

description:
One of the best chicken sandwiches I've had in a long time and the bf loved his burger!

We decided to check this place out because of the rave reviews and I'm glad we did. We came in a little before the noon lunch crowd and it wasn't that packed yet, but people started to trickle in around 12:30. 

I decided on the chicken sandwich with chipotle aioli and added avocado and an organic egg for $1 each. Other toppings for $1 are: grilled peppers, roasted portobello, and cambozola blue cheese. Lettuce, tomato, red onions, super sauce, jalapeño peppers, grilled onions, and pickles are free. 

The bf settled on an 8 oz "Super Burger" with $0.50 for cheese and a $1 for bacon added. He had "Everything On It." Then we also ordered garlic fries for $2.75. He got a regular fountain soda for $2 and I had a "Super Shake" of chocolate and fresh strawberries for $5.75. Our total came to about $30. It was pretty pricey for fast food, but they obviously use organic and fresh ingredients so it's worth the price.

The chicken breast they use is "100% free range" and that's a plus. You can taste the difference. The bread was a sort of ciabatta bread and it was really good. The chipotle aioli was very tasty and the lettuce, tomato, and avocado were very fresh. The organic egg went perfect with everything even though it was messy. 

The bf thought his burger was really really good. Slightly better than a burger at Pearl's. He liked the garlic fries, but I didn't care for them. There was more parmesan cheese than fresh garlic. Also, I was disappointed with my shake. I should've just had a regular chocolate shake because the strawberries didn't really add much to it. The bf thought their homemade pickles were alright. They weren't crunchy like he thought they'd be. 

Overall, great food and a good first time experience. The ambiance is ok. But, beware of the flies hovering around. I'd suggest skipping on getting two drinks, if you don't mind sharing with your significant other to cut costs because there are free refills for the fountain sodas. The chocolate and strawberries milkshake wasn't worth it. Everything else mentioned was.
author: Fallon P.

description: What a burger should be!  I was impressed with the food, the customer service, overall it was a great and pleasant experience!  I loved that I could add unique toppings to it.  The garlic cheesy fries were unbelievable!  Its the perfect blend of garlic & Parmesan!  Jocelyn was also very helpful in helping me with my order, and making me feel like a valued customer!  She made sure it was made to my specifications.  The place was clean and comfortable.  I appreciate the attention to detail.  I will definitely go back!
author: Daisy G.

description:
Okay, I gotta say that the garlic fries are yummy. However, the portion size is not very large for the price. 

A "super duper" burger = double patty burger
A "mini" = single patty burger
The burgers are slightly larger than In-N-Out burgers, but the price is way higher.

I came here once, the staff was not friendly and kind of came off a bit rude. I did not know there was a burger size difference and was confused and the cashier seemed pretty frustrated that I needed some explaining. And the person who was calling numbers looked like he hated his job. 

I do want to come back from soft served ice cream!!
author: Jess W.

description:
I'll have to admit that this place is a bit of a guilty pleasure for me, I've been here a handful of times now and I usually get the same juicy Super Duper (8oz) with bacon and cheese, always with a side of regular fries.  They even have homemade pickles that are deliciously brined and crunchy, now if only they would monopolize on the whole artisinal sauce market. :P
