Although it is a chain, Super Duper offers much better value than other burgers located in SF that cost a premium to enjoy, especially when they are listed very bare-bones minimally on the menu (usually a patty, buns, and onions and lettuce), and all the fixings are only available as an additional request which can easily become absurd.
author: Ty T.

description: One of the best burgers in town. They will make it medium rare, unlike most other places.  Juicy and tasty.  Will come back again even though I don't live nearby.
author: Kaman T.

description:
My friend Anthony brought me here on my first night back in the Castro in a while, and it was AWESOME. Better than any burger in LA, by far. I had the jalepeno burger (super)... amazing. Came back Sunday for a Blue Cheese Burger, and it was a bit too rich and oily for me.

Fries are like McDonalds... which is to say... fantastic. Decent house white wine too.

Best burger joint in SF!
author: Sean B.

description: Came in here for a burger. The Burger is good and the french fries are good. What I did not like is that the menu is hard to understand. The menu says Burgers (4oz) and Super Burgers (8oz). I did not know what kind of burgers those were. I had to ask. I also don't like that there is no BBQ sauce here.  Lastly I did not like that there was no America cheese here. Over all this place is ok. But I rather go to Burger Mister because they already have America cheese and BBQ sauce. I would come back here if you get BBQ sauce and American cheese.
author: Isaac H.

description: Awesome tasting 'good old burgers' however cannot seem to get delivery on apps any longer :( truly I recommend trying their burgers
author: Kirk M.

description:
Some friends were visiting so I took them out to get food. They especially love burgers and we were in the area so I took them to Super Duper. 

I ordered the Philly Jalapeño burger (I saw it described on a list when I got to the register) and an order of garlic fries. Came out to be a little less than $10. Still kinda pricey butttt I liked my order. My friends got their own custom mini burgers.

I had no idea that Super Duper had their own type of burgers so I was stoked when I saw the Philly Jalapeño burger. Sometimes, you just don't want to think about what kind of combo you want, you know?

Philly Jalapeño burger (pepperjack cheese, jalapeños, roasted red peppers, other things I don't remember) was delicious. There was nothing about it that I didn't like and for this reason, I believe that it was worth the price. 

The garlic fries are delicious. I've had them before and each time I've ordered them, I've enjoyed them. Super Duper makes their fries skinny which I enjoy because they're the crispy type and not the fat mashed potato type that you get from steak fries. This works especially well with the garlic cheese topping. I usually have a good amount of control when I eat but I found myself munching on these garlic fries like my life depended on it.

My friends really enjoyed their food as well, which I am happy about. I hate to disappoint!

Yummy place!
author: Sofia R.

description: Super Duper is like an oily version of Shake Shack. Oily or not, burgers aren't a healthy diet anyways so I'm not complaining! Their garlic fries are greasy good and will have your breath scaring off any nearby vampires for hours. Like a handful of recent reviewers have noted, they'll most likely mess up your order so be sure to examine your burger before you bite into it. I asked for cheese on my mini burger. I even called it a "mini CHEESE burger" when I ordered it and asked him if I mentioned that I wanted cheese on my burger before I was done ordering to confirm. My burger was cheese-less but I didn't make a big deal since I was already half way done.
author: Trish T.

description:
Burger was good!!! got the super duper burger with bacon cheese and an egg!!
a little messy but was worth it.

only downside is its hard to find a table if there's a lot of people..

other than that everything was good!

Service was great!
author: Gerardo M.

description:
Still love my Super Duper. Just wanted to update with another food porn shot. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=gaAcG3EBx4DPG7EOmGNRuA) 

Even the laissez-faire attitude, and sometimes bitchiness, from the nonchalant  server/order-taker could not prevent me from enjoying my juicy cheeseburger. Perfect bite before afternoon drinks. Well I started with a Scrimshaw pilsner here but why not wash a good burger with some good beer?

Still heart you Super Dups!
author: Jon L.

description: Really good veggie burgers, and love their jar of endless pickles. Its a great place to grab a bite for very modest amount.
author: Shubhi T.

description: My favorite place to get veggie burgers! The shakes are really good too. Consistently great place.
author: Fifi M.

description: Zero stars. I know! Let's post our closing time as 11pm on BOTH yelp and foursquare AND on our own website. Let people make their eating choice spend money on a Lyft to get there with half an hour to spare, and be totally utterly dark and closes with no mention or sign on door. F you guys not going to come back here again. As it was I had a burger a few years ago at marina location and thought it was way way over rated but tonight was your second chance to hook me but alas you couldn't even keep the lights on or accurately state your hours.
author: alex v.

description: The burgers here are FANTASTIC and the service is SUPERB. If you're visiting San Francisco, this is a mandatory stop.
author: Thomas H.

description:
Not a bad fast food style higher end burger joint but not the best.  Free homemade pickles is different.  My burger was juicy, but on the bland side.  I went with everything plus grilled onions and jack cheese toppings.  Unfortunately the cheese was not melted on the burger so it wasn't as tasty.  Fries are good.
I way prefer The Habit's flame grilled burgers.
author: Pocket C.

description: Amazing burgers!!!! This was our first stop in San Francisco and it wasn't a disappointment. Had our first taste of garlic fries and they were to die for. Good quality food and a decent price. Recommend everyone go and try!!
author: Kimberley D.

description: It hit the spot, great burgers fast service.  Oh and you can eat home made pickles self serve.
author: Aaron R.

description:
I'm the person that goes to a specialty restaurant or fast food joint and does not get what they specialize in. 
Ordered the chicken sandwich and added bacon to it, not much to say it was cooked right and it was juicy, but that was more of the sauce than the actual chicken. Went with regular fries. 
It was not a wow factor for me, just regular food at higher than normal cost. Maybe I'll go back and try a burger.
author: Jorge P.

description: Next time I'll know how to order & will probably get a better burger. First, their menu lists all the free ingredients & add ons which is nice but nowhere does it list mayo. Yet both sides of the bun was slathered with way too much mayo. If it had been list as one of the free ingredients, I could have said no & not had to take apart my burger to fix it. Next their so called "grilled onions" we're barely cooked and since they put them on top of the cheese, they were embedded & difficult to remove so I ended up losing at least half the cheese. Next time I'll know better. Too bad I had to buy a poorly built burger to find out.
author: Rochelle M.

description:
Super Duper is truly super yummilishusniss.......

Makes True burger look like the dumps, IMHO. their shy of $7 burger does circles and pirouettes around those of its ilk.....

So very impressed as I bit into the Niman patties.... wonderfully juicy, so full of flavor. Loved the touch of homemade pickles brined with garlic, and those buns....

the density and texture of the bread to accompany that high quality beef..... just buttery crisp and grilled lightly to help absorb the juice of the patties, rendering it NON-soggy carblishnusiniss to accompany. Fresh tomato and lettuce, with dipping doodles of ketchup and mustard on the side.  A perfect burger, minus one leeeeeeetul thing:

wish they had seasoned the beef itself a bit more properly. No seasoning detected I on the actual protein. as well, a tad too greasy for me to behold.

Great bang for the buck. And I didn't even order the fries...can't imagine how much more the experience would have been elevated....sigh
author: Jana C.

description: I come here once a week and it's spectacular. Everything from the food and service. The staff is friendly and helpful, the cooks prepare the food fast (the malt shakes are amazing), and a lovely young lady (who introduced herself as the manager) checked-in with us to make sure everything was great. I usually despise public bathrooms but their's are always well maintained.
author: A A.

description:
The only complaint I have and it's a very minor one is that they cook their burgers well done, and we all know truly juicy perfect burgers should be medium. Everyone seems to be overly afraid of food poisoning though so whatevs

Other than that everything is delicious, especially the milk shake. While I was there the crowd was chill and I generally found the establishment and people to be quite accommodating.
author: Anastasia M.

description: I had the worst dinner ever here tonight. I'm from out of town and have had super duper once before at another location. Everything leaked excessively with oil, both the burgers and fries, also my hands. After a couple of bites I immediately regretted dining there. First of all, I ordered a batch of garlic fries which actually came out cold... the cheese didn't even melt through the fries. They offered to make us another order free of charge which was cool but... Like I said.. The chefs go ham on the oil here. My bf's burger was so oily it fell apart quickly. I could tell he did not like it after his first bite. He ordered a super duper burger with a sunny side up egg, we thought the egg was the culprit to his distaste but it wasn't because my burger was super oily as well. I didn't even add an egg. To sum it up, I regret eating here and wish I didn't spend my money here.
author: Kimberly P.

description: Burger is absolutely delicious. Gourmet burger at a sf business area price (~6.50). Juicy burger and careful cause it can get messy! Fries and ice cream cones are also wonderful. Taste is a given here and I highly recommend the food to anyone.
author: Nick W.

description: It was really really good,  the burger was juicy and full of flavor,  albeit smaller than I would have thought.  But I got full and I'm a big guy.  The garlic fries are very garlicky so that's something to be aware of.  I mean I know they're garlic fries but they're very very garlicky.  If u love garlic you'll be fine.  Not too expensive either.
author: Miguel N.

description: This is easily the best location of all the Super Duper Burgers. It's not quite as busy, being set away from the hustle of FIDI/Union Square. So the food is prepared fast and fresh, and importantly, the staff are generally very friendly and engaging. I've never come here and found it to be anything less than amazing. Can't put a finger on it exactly, but this location is different, and they're definitely the best of the lot!
author: Richard V.

description:
A solid burger joint. For Market street it's a moderately priced lunch spot. 

One of the many upsides is a great space with lots of seating and good beer on tap (Racer 5). 

I tried the blue cheese burger and another one with jalapenos and enjoyed both. 

Their fries were very good as well. All in all this is a pretty good place to eat. It's not the best burger place I've ever been to but considering the price you can't go wrong here if you don't want to pay $20 for a burger. I'd go here for lunch given that it is so close to my office.
author: Carlos A.

description: Simple, good.  Don't know what else you want?  Try it.  I don't like writing Yelp reviews...This may be my last, lol.
author: Brian M.

description:
I rarely write review but OMG this place is so delicious. I got the super four cheese burger. I literally said OMG after the first bite. Burger was cooked medium rare to perfection. Bread didn't sog up even tho I was a little late on the pick up. Also I got the garlic fries. I don't even really like garlic fries but these ones changed my mind.  

These burgers are life changing. Lol.
author: Daniel V.

description:
Best veggie burger in SF in my humble opinion. Toppings are fresh. Their pickled jalapeños and hummus are my faves. Their fries are always hot and crispy. They have house made pickles (all you can eat!) and, if you're feeling particularly indulgent, I recommend a soft serve swirl cone. 
They have salads I guess but really I'm not here for that. 
This is one of those order at the counter places. Their service is pretty fast. Great place for lunch. All in all two thumbs way up.
author: Rocio G.

description: This super duper location is the best of the others in town and in the Bay Area. Speedy service with great menu items. Their choice in Vege burgers is great! I love their home made shakes! The burgers taste home made.... because they are!! They are juicey, beefy, and filling. Must stop by when you are in the Castro.
author: Jackie F.

description:
The garlic Parmesan fries are amazing. With a good amount of garlic they were fried to a nice, golden crispy perfection. The burgers were nice as well. Although I had a veggie one, it was tasty which was a bit of a surprise considering I usually find other veggie patties to taste more like flavored cardboard. 

It was a chilly 50 some odd degrees that evening (I wore a parka that day) but we just couldn't say "no" to the soft serve. Needless to say, I had the heater blasting during the drive home. 

I noticed that offer a spiked milkshake. I'm gonna have to mosey on over another day and give that a try.
author: Esther A.

description: i keep trying to go vegetarian but places like this make it eXtremely difficult. i mean fuck, the burger tasted so home made that i forgot my parents split up. the fries? forget about it. EXCEPT YOU CANT CUZ THEY ARE THE BLOWJOB OF THIS PLACE. the meat is so juicy that you don't even need a fucking drink.
author: Ben M.

description: I visited here from LA. No where in la is there a good simple and fresh burger place like this one. I highly recommend for those picky eaters. Meat is not greasy, taste super fresh. Vegetarian fed beef and the fries and simple as well. Fast service as well. Go!!
author: Carolina P.

description:
No changes to my rating. Altho the food is still great, they have messed up on my order twice in the past month. Once for a phone order, I walk in and they cannot locate my order. The nice guy comp'd my burger-only order. I know it was not my mistake because I only have the number for the Castro location. Second time, I tell the nice girl I do not want cheese on my burger and ordered a chocolate/strawberry shake. My burger arrives with cheese, and I am given a chocolate ONLY shake. Argggg! After leaving the place, I realize I was charged for cheese. 

If the place was not so close to my house, and the food was not consistently good, I probably would not come back, but thankfully it is good! Don't mess up next time! :)
author: Thomas L.

description: My son got really sick last night eating at Super Duper Burgers. We immediately took him to the emergency room. We will NEVER eat nor recommend anyone to eat at this place.
author: Y T.

description: Tasty burgers with bomb fries. Nothing more to say
author: Dominic O.

description: Yes, it is a bit pricey for a burger.  BUT, they are really good burgers.  The super with everything - yum.  And the vanilla/chocolate shake - mmmm, hmmm.  Garlic fries are great, but be prepared to be garlicy for two days.  Staff is great, wait time is OK - can get very busy.  But I visit here often - two thumbs up.
author: Sean R.

description: Great veggie burger. Fry dips were pretty good, but I'd like to try garlic fries next time.  Free pickles were delicious with a nice spicy twist.
author: Heather E.

description:
PERFECTION for when you are drunk. I know there's a downtown SF location too, but the one here is just so perfectly placed. When you've been downing happy hour vodka sodas for the past several hours, nothing quite soaks up the poison like greasy carby salty fries and a salty patty of ground beef with a crunchy exterior and juicy interior. I mean, if you're going to wake up with regrets and a hangover, you may as well go all out, am I right!??!?!

USEFUL TIP: Ask for the chocolate-dipped soft serve to come in a KIDS size, if you are watching your figure but still need to indulge. It's a big enough size that you don't need anymore than that!!!!!
author: Joshua L.

description: They REALLY know know to make a burger burger! The fries here taste soooo good with garlic sauce.
author: Pingyue W.

description: Their super burger was quite oily (dripping, in fact) and much smaller than I had imagined, but it turned out to be very delicious. It does well to satisfy a burger craving.
author: Leesur S.

description:
I came here once before and it was the burgers were not super duper. It was good but it wasn't something that I would go out of my way for. If you're really hungry, a regular burger will not fill you up. 

The thing that really got me was the garlic fries. It had just the right amount of garlic mixed with chunks of cheese on top of crispy fries. It was so good! Just remember to bring mints because your breath is going to be real stanky after you eat those fries- it's worth it. 

The second time I went to get food, they ran out of meat... A burger place that runs out of meat? Not so appealing. But the fries? So worth it! 

Garlicfriesgarlicfriesgarlicfries!
author: Saewah K.

description:
Tried the chicken sandwich and it is pretty spicy due to the marinade. If you like spicy, you'l love it - very filling.

But I'm still a big fan of the burger. I'm afraid our house is already doing the burgers every other Friday. 

The test is how it tastes after it has gone a bit cold. The bun is extremely dry upon reheating which suggests that they store them frozen. Otherwise the burger is best described as an old time burger. Juicy!
author: Nan L.

description:
Hello Yelp! 

I am writing because this place is amazing. In city full of vegans, vegetarian, and such its nice to just sit down and enjoy a juicy piece of meat. It was my first time there and the ambiance was so inviting and the employees were so nice and refreshing. Kysha was the woman who helped me. Not knowing what to get she was very patient with me and helped me decide. Her advice was awesome, I got the mini burger with garlic fries and they were to die for! She also was very passionate about the soft serve so I had to get it. It was bomb! I definitely would go back, overall a quality place. 
Thanks Super Duper for being so awesome!
author: Dan H.

description:
I visited this place weeks ago and I'm still dreaming of their garlic fries! I'm not from San Francisco but I HAVE to stop by one of these chains every time I'm in town!

They have the perfect portions for all items on the menu. Not to mention, their items are healthier than the options coming from fast food places...so you don't feel AS BAD after devouring a whole meal in less than 10 minutes.

I always get the mini burger and garlic fries. I've never been disappointed and it's made the exact same way in every location. 

Don't miss out, come and try this place!
author: Bianca N.

description:
This place is *really* super duper! I got the double. It was juicy, moist and absolute perfection. The free add-ons were so choice. They even pickle their own stuff. 

Soft serve, milkshakes and beer too! How could you go wrong?! 

Highly recommended for any burger lover!
author: Christina M.

description: This is what Shake Shack will be if they ever grow up. This is "high end chain burger" done right. Very nice balance between meat and cheese. The prices are reasonable for what you get. It's definitely not the least expensive burger you'll ever eat, but it'll be one of the best.
author: Jim M.

description:
I like this location and can't find anything different.
But somehow one on Market Street has better and crunchier pickles.
I don't know why...
author: JK C.

description:
Why make reservations for a $19 Nopa Burger.. when you could destroy a couple of these gut busters?


This burger wins my SF Burger Competition in every category:

Taste: 1st place
Price Point: 1st place
Mental Drool Factor: 1st place
Pretention: Last place. (1st place?)

The burgers are sizable, the toppings generous. The meat is super juicy, they're really not kidding about that. Fries are golden and hot.  

Eat here.
author: Patrick T.

description: Favorite burger joint of all time! This specific super duper is my favorite in SF. I literally go once a week! Heaven!!
author: Shaina S.

description:
My Son and I were in the City last week to meet up for the first time with a few of his virtual buddies from Jordan. The rendezvous was well planned and had the approval of all parents involved. We had a very nice time while wandering around Chinatown and I was impressed on how well these young adults had chosen their friends. 

After we all parted ways, it was time to walk back to BART and head home. We were both a little hungry and I was also in the mood for a beer and a chance to sit and relax. As we walked down Kearny and into the Financial District, I noticed that the choices were somewhat limited as fewer places are open at the end of the workday. Those that were, didn't seem to fit well for both a Dad and his Teenage Son. Or as my Kid clearly stated as we considered one local pub, "I Don't Belong Here".  However, as we arrived on Market Street, I noticed the Super Duper sign at a distance, and knew that this place would make both of us happy. 

Super Duper also has a comfortable retro charm, a faux Midwest feel, friendly service, and uses all the right sustainable and organic buzzwords. However, Yupscale Burger places can by a tad pricey (at least by this Iowan's Standards). The Kid had a double cheeseburger, while I had a single, and we shared an order of garlic fries. After my beer and his milkshake, the bill came to about $26. That's significantly above the cost of a McDonald's value meal, but the food was really really good. I'm sure that if we're in the neighborhood again, we'll stop by.
author: Eric B.

description: Not as pretentious as many of the Achiever burger boxes in SF...but excellent ground cow on a bun with very good fixings and fries.
author: Jay V.

description: Very good burgers and decent  sized. Still a little pricey though. Burger, fries and drink ran me about 14 bucks. Value wise I'd put this place above Umami.
author: Mario W.

description:
The burges: the proposal is not overwhelming as in other places, few good options that allow you to "compose" good burgers. The meat was good, cooked well and the buns didn't taste too sweet as it happens sometimes.
About the garlic fries: I'm surprised that's the most exciting thing for many people, didn't like them at all (especially the day after).
author: Xavier R.

description:
Despite being located in the lively Castro, there are even people of all types come here to eat. One girl I saw a few days ago working at a popular North Beach bakery dining at the somewhat newest burger joint with her boyfriend. "Damn, that was disappointing to see that she has a man!"

With the World Cup tournament in progress and the nice warm weather around the city, the burger joint was obviously packed during noon time. With long lines and many people dining there in the somewhat large dining area, eating in and stuffing the burger in my face would be near impossible. 

Looking at the huge menu posted on the wall, all burgers are made from the highest quality Niman Ranch Beef. Not much of a menu, but just burgers, chicken and even a vegan option for your customized sandwiches. There are no combo deals here and every item(s) are sold separately. So I ordered the Super Burger. And for an affordable $4.75, the burger patty is made with the high-end meat and comes with melted Cheddar Cheese and the usual condiment. I also got a side of Cheesy Garlic Fries for another $3.00. And the restaurant has beer on tap with a choice of five beers, in which I took the Racer-5 IPA for $5.00 in a tall 22oz glass. The burger was very greasy but tasty and the fries were loaded with garlic.  Wanna kiss?

My meal: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=52xKjKDtc1vROImyJe5agA

Beer: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=twVLqrbHwk-x2OOY7DLT5A

Not a bad burger and meal for $12.00. I used my Mastercard for my meal. 

After I've placed my order, there was an available table after a party left. So one of hustling workers was very nice and friendly enough to clean the table I'm about to eat at. Now that's service right there for Joe Cool!
author: Matt G.

description:
I discovered this burger place because I searched in Yelp for the best burger in San Francisco and this place was on the top 3. 
Definitely, it was right! OMG! I tasted here one of the best burger in my life.
Supper juicy burgers and messy business as they say :)
They have handmade pickles! You can take as may as you want (love pickles!! :P ). An anecdote: there are also a sliced lemon box. So you can take a slice and put it in your coke. My Chinese friend thought that she should put the pickle also inside the glass LOL, so cute.
I always asked for a supper combo with cheese.
An advice, the kid size ice cream with chocolate-dipped is also a must!
I have eaten there every time that I visited San Francisco.
I particularly prefer this location than the one that is more in the centre. The service is better. There is less people there so they take more time to cook your food. They are more carefull cooking it ;)
author: Laura L.

description:
Finally got to check this place out a few weeks ago. My husband has been a few times. He  loved their burgers,and thought it was a great value.

I have to wholeheartedly agree! Had been to Roam recently as well, and this place was SO much better ,(and quite a bit cheaper.)

I opted for the grilled chicken, but did steal a few bites of my hubby's burger. Both were juicy and delicious. Grilled chicken sandwiches are often dry and bit bland, but this was fantastic. Very flavorful, very moist, completely satisfying. We shared an order of fries, which were good but not great. If i ordered them again, I would ask for them extra crispy.

I don't know how this compares to places like Five Guys or In 'N'Out, have never been to either, (nor will I.) I haven't eaten fast food in about 8 years. Super Duper certainly didn't feel like fast food, especially with the delicious grilled chicken breast.
author: Amanda G.

description:
A collective sigh of indifference is all that Jamie W. and I could muster when sinking our teeth into the burgers served here. In a foodie town like San Francisco, the burger spectrum can run the gamut from Pearl's and Mo's on the bargain end to the likes of Slow Club and Zuni Cafe on the other. In-N-Out and Nation's would be in a parallel universe covered in spandex and jug wine. Super Duper would be a lost asteroid hovering over a black hole. And when is Duper ever not Super? Perhaps Mediocre Duper would be more accurate. 

I was gobsmacked to find out that this place is owned by the same people who brought us Starbelly, Beretta and Delarosa. I don't see the family resemblance. This is a retro-modern place that's probably closest to Taylor's Refresher (or Gott's Roadside, whatever) in flavor and decor, even the same brushed aluminum trays. The service is on the pedestrian side with the young servers making their personal ennui evident to the customers around them. The menu is extremely limited with three burgers to choose from in single and double variations, chicken and veggie options, some fries, some shakes some desserts. The end. 

I went nuts and tried the $6.75 Super Duper Double. Meh. It was swaddled in butcher paper like a Taylor's burger, and the Niman beef had a strangely mealy consistency. Jamie W. was more modest and ordered the $4.75 Super Duper Single, and that's when I realized that the meat patty itself was quite flat and on the paltry side. The less-than-fresh fries were equally disappointing with the $3 Garlic Fries way too moist with the garlic mix globbed onto the already flimsy shoestring potatoes (see photos). There's also an obscure jar of pickles next to the condiments. I'd avoid them unless you like the taste of really sour pickles. Refills are free though. 

FOOD - 2 stars...decidedly mediocre burgers and fries will only satisfy those who couldn't wait for the F-Line to get to In-N-Out 
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...retro-hip fast food in need of a McDonald's happy meal 
SERVICE - 2 stars...too young to care (...I'll always remember the look of indifference on the server's face when I picked up our burgers) 
TOTAL - 2 stars...disappointing...I might as well be ignored at Slider's for the same price
author: Ed U.

description:
Hells yeah this place is every bit worth of 4 stars!  

I took my GF here because we were looking for garlic fries. Man, what a gem. I ordered the super duper burger with everything and she ordered the veggie burger. I have to admit, that veggie burger was pretty tasty. But I wouldn't trade it for all the yummy goodness of my double beef patties with some wicked delicious sauce that made the burger even more addictive. The garlic fries were pretty good too. I can't wait to go back. Oh!  Don't forget the pickles. The ones near the straws and condiments. Those were great too. Not ur normal dills that's for sure. Damn I'm hungry now.
author: Mike C.

description: Never fails. This is such a great place for a quick bite and it's good, healthy food.
author: Steven H.

description:
Solid stop in the Castro for a burger.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=2gSW4NzEbg-D8mgPkRaieg)

Ordered their double Superburger ($6.45) and sunk my teeth into two juicy and greasy but flavorful pieces of Niman ranch beef.  The unique thing about their patties is that they were smashed which gave it a sort of crispy texture. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=p54TNXTlwKkqhe81-Xv6Yw)

I can see the in-n-out comparison but In-n-Out doesn't toast their buns as nicely as Super Duper does. But I do have to give the edge to In-n-Out's animal style fries over Super D's garlic/parmesan ($3) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=F-ohOmOjODeqjA55LGVuKg)

The burger and price point is 3.5 stars but the people working here bump this bargain bite up to 4. They were just so friendly.
author: Earl G.

description:
Their slogan should be " Mhmmm Mhmm Good!"
There is nothing I don't like about this place- I love their juicy burgers, their ice cream and their garlic fries. They are moderately priced though which can be a con but I would pay it in a minute to eat one of their burgers, fries and of course their mouth watering ice cream. However caution that if you do eat all the good stuff, get a smaller size burger if you want to eat in one sitting or get the regular size to split for dinner or lunch the next day.
author: Desiree C.

description:
This place is underwhelming, while their burgers are tasty, they are pretty small, a burger is supposed to leave you satisfied, not wanting more, the fries aren't bad, but their gralic fries have a ton of cheese on top of them for some reason
The main downside of this branch is it can be run over by castro transients at times, the marina or embarcadero branches are a better experience if you insist on trying super duper
author: James z.

description: This place is delish! Came here based on a friends recommendation cuz I wanted a hearty burger. The menu is very simple. Nothing over the top which is nice. I ordered the 4oz burger (aka the mini burger) with cheese and egg. It was awesome and filling. Fries were good and fresh. Pickle jars are located at the condiment station so you can stock up. Will definitely be returning.
author: Holly D.

description:
I usually enjoy Super Duper enough that I'm willing to overlook the occasional order snafu of, for example, not getting the avocado I ordered (and was charged for) on my to-go order.

Tonight's customer service fail was beyond the pale, though.

I'd gotten a Zip car for a couple of hours to pick someone up at the airport and run a couple of errands. When I was done with the errands, I still had 25 minutes left on the reservation. I decided to take the opportunity to pick up a late dinner. When I walked walked in, and placed my order, it was 10:25pm. They close at 11:00. I was the only customer ordering at the time. At 10:45, I noticed the kitchen crew cleaning the grill for the end of the night.

This whole time, the two register staff were standing and gossiping (?) behind the counter. When I inquired about my order it was actually to cancel - I had to return the car in 12 minutes. I was asked what I ordered (seriously, I was the only person). Turns out my (now cooling) order had been ready for a while, but they were too busy talking to notice. 

I left the restaurant, followed a couple of minutes later by one of the staff, who offered to refund my money. Unfortunately, I didn't have time to go back inside. 

I think I'm done with Super Duper, for a while.
author: Ms J.

description: I'll break my own rule here (I hate it when people speak in superlatives): BEST burger I ever had. Hands down. Super juicy without being super greasy. I had the regular burger with portobello, blue cheese, jack cheese and bacon. Amazing good. Garlic fries are also to die for. Beware: you may want to forego kissing for a couple of days after eating all that garlic (on the fries).. But totally worth it. :)
author: Raphael F.

description:
THIS BURGER IS SOOO GOOD!!

First off, this place is organic and makes the most delicious burgers and soft serve ice cream out there. My friend introduced me to this place and I am so thankful. This is like a gourmet fast food burger because it is more expensive than say In n Out but cheaper than the restaurant burgers. 

WHAT I GOT
1) I got the mini burger with cheese and it is just the right size. In my opinion, the mini burger is like a regular size burger so I cant imagine how huge the super burger is. The meat is soooo tender and juicy and just tastes super delicious with the bread and cheese. My mouth is watery just thinking about it. 
2) Garlic fries!! You must get the fries. They are so crispy and oily and the garlic and cheese topped off of it makes it one of the best garlic fries I have had. Gotta have fries with your meal!
3) I got the cookies and cream shake on another occasion and it was good but I would pass on it. It tastes like an average shake and I would much rather get the soft serve.
4) I got the soft serve on another occasion and it is as good as it looks. I think next time I will get the chocolate dipped soft serve because chocolate makes everything better :)

**TIPS**
1) Get the mini burger because it is the perfect size.
2) Get the garlic fries. You will not regret it!
3) Chocolate dipped vanilla soft serve FTW!
4) ENJOYYYY!
author: Amy H.

description: I have had way better. I like the idea of this place but I think the burger could be better. Like the soft serve though ;)
author: Gwen L.

description:
You wouldn't believe how hard it is to find a decent veggie burger at an over-the-counter price. They are either bland, poorly put together, lacking complementing condiments or all of the above. Super Duper is officially my go-to place in San Francisco to get my quick veggie burger fix. 

For $6.50, I get my standard order: a veggie burger topped with cheese, jalapenos and grilled onions. The patty is delicious, flavorful and filled with real vegetables that doesn't fall apart when I pick it up or bite into it, and the Super Duper sauce really kicks it up a notch. I love pairing it with a side of garlic fries or, if I plan on dining in, the spiked double chocolate milkshake. Might try it with avocado, egg or gorgonzola on a splurge day, but for every other day, my standard order suits me just fine.
author: Auburn S.

description:
The "super duper" must refer to the burgers or at least that's what I experienced during my visit.

For such a small space there is surprisingly an abundance of seating both inside the restaurant and out.  The service could be improved, but I'm certainly not going to chastise them on that since they've only been open for one week.  I had a relatively early lunch around 2:30 PM and noticed this place is already very popular.

After a quick glance at the simple menu posted on the front door I walked in and headed straight to the cashier station where I ordered a Double Cheeseburger, a plain Fries and a fountain soda for ten bucks and change.  The burgers are cooked to order so do expect a bit of a wait.  While waiting I noticed that the restaurant uses mostly sustainable / compostable components.  For that simple fact I don't mind paying a little bit more.

If you're dining in the food is served on cool, lightweight aluminum trays lined with unbleached paper.  There is a mason jar filled with homemade pickles at the condiment / napkin station that you can help yourself to.  Metal tongs are provided so you don't have to dig your fingers into the jar.  I love pickles, and these were very good.  I didn't have anywhere to put my pickle so I put it on top of my big order of fries (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=xDGTPePW59mlBF3bAz9xaw).  The pickles were very crunchy and not very salty.  I should have had more.  

My fries weren't cooked to order.  In fact I got a mix of limp, chewy, stale fries mixed in with some fresh, crispy, meaty fries.  The fries are natural, skin-on shoestrings that definitely taste better fresh than stale.  You probably already know that however.

I loved the burger.  My Double Cheeseburger (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=h5WDOeQrDK9mnW6VF9L_aQ) was delicious.  The burgers here are fairly small in size but definitely big on taste.  The super soft bun was moistened with a bit of the Super Duper Secret Sauce which looked like mayonnaise but tasted more inspiring than just plain mayonnaise.  There's lots of cheese on top and in between the burger patties.  Lactards, bring your Lactaid!  The juicy beef patties are cooked medium and tasted like high quality beef.  The combined ingredients literally melted in my mouth.  It was that good!

I'll definitely be back!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday April 9, 2010 @ 4pm
Dining Companions:  Husband & Doggie
Scene:  Adorable Boys in Prada Shades, Fitted Tee's, Jeans & Flip-Flops w/ Small Dogs
Vibe:  Chill
Decor:  Fun & Retro.  Grey & Yellow Patterned Walls. CheckerBoard Floors.  1006 Navy Collection Chairs.  
Service:  Cute Girl & Boys
Imbibe:  Fresh Squeezed Lemonade, Shake w/ Fresh Strawberries.  Beer & Wine Available
Devour:  SuperBurger, Garlic Cheese Fries, Strauss Soft Serve Vanilla & Chocolate Ice Cream Cone
Total:  $16.75
Note:  Brought to You By The People of StarBelly, Delarosa, Beretta
author: Genevieve Y.

description: I and family ate here so many times, lost count, this is defenetly the best burger place in the Bay. We also go to the one in the Marina and also the location in Marin County. They are all great and full of taste.
author: Eleonora L.

description: The burgers are tasty, but they're not the best burgers I've ever had. I tend to get mine med-well or the burger get too runny. It's a bit annoying how the staff is robotic. I'll place my order and tell them 'no onion' and I get interrupted every time with 'cheese?'. My favorite is they have my credit card in hand and still ask me for my name.
author: Fabian M.

description:
first time trying super duper burgers--it was good. I got a super duper with cheese and bacon and all the basic fixings. good meat-to-bun ratio. I love a messy burger, and this burger was indeed messy, as promised. I would say it was a little bit too greasy for my tastes--the bun got that grease-sog to it fairly quickly. but overall, delicious. the garlic fries were also perfectly crisp and decently garlicked. service was friendly and fast.

the nice thing about this location is you can sit outside and provocatively eat your burger for the folks sweatin it up across the street at fitness sf. of course, if you sit outside, you run the risk of getting a disgusted look and head shake from some lady walking by briskly with her yoga mat in tow. NOT THAT THAT HAPPENED TO ME, RIGHT RANDOM YOGA LADY WHO APPARENTLY HATES BURGERS AND HAPPINESS?
author: Angry Eyes W.

description: Awesome burger place. Got a super sized cheese burger+garlic fries+root beer. The super sized burger was 6 oz I think and you can get all the traditional toppings (eg lettuce, tomato, grilled onions) at no charge. The garlic fries has actual diced garlic which I thought was great but you may want to rethink if you're on a date. They also have free assorted, self serve pickles.
author: Doug G.

description:
Daaaayum, that's some effing delicious ice cream! 

I walk by Super Duper's life-sized ice cream cone sign on a weekly basis and finally decided to succumb to it's swirly allure, nevermind the frigid weather. Talk about being in the right place at the right time! I marched up to the counter ready to pour my piggy bank out and claim my organic Strauss Creamery cone, but just before the lusty words could escape my mouth, the Super Duperette behind the counter looked at me with a troubled expression, holding a top-heavy vanilla cone and said..."Um...do you want an ice cream? I made one too many..."

Gawd, this was so meant to be...

Ruggy J said he wanted just one bite - and that boy has some restraint - but even Monsieur Willpower confessed to wanting more, more, more! And that cone...so crisp, so fresh, such a bittersweet sign of the end. This is one absurdly tasty treat. 

Can't speak for the hamburgers, but it's on my list. Go around 3pm when the line has dwindled to only a few confused tourists.
author: Nique F.

description: Great food and friendly staff !!! I'm in love with their chicken burger !! At course if you add avocados, jalapenos and bacon mmm and can't forget the shake . I always bring friends to this location is cozy and if I'm lucky to sit outside is always a plus .
author: Jeanette R.

description: This place is great for the location and price. I figured that being so close to Union Square that it would be highway robbery.  We ordered a mini combo with garlic fries and a jumbo combo with bacon and garlic fries for $25. The burgers are natural ground beef. I'm usually leery of organic places because they taste like crap and are expensive. I was surprised how great everything tasted. They also offer homemade pickles, which are to die for.. I ate at a lot of frou frou places while I was in SF, and it was a disappointment. The staff is also friendly. I love Super Duper Burgers!
author: Ha D.

description: Ordered lunch in for the staff and it was all so yummy.  Especially the shakes! The burgers were delicious and you are able to top it off with a fried egg.  Great selection of fries and the housemade pickles were scrumptious.  Good lunch pick for varies palletes.
author: Lan N.

description: This is my favorite burger in the city so far.
author: Sarah S.

description: Loved the chicken sandwich and veggie burgers. Crispy n tasty. Enjoyed the experience.
author: Ashish B.

description: While the pickles weren't something I was especially fond of, can I just say garlic fries..... Those were totally worth raving about. They were delicious. And I love burger joints where I feel "healthy" eating them. Delishhhh!
author: Kathlena H.

description:
I've seen multiple Super Duper locations around the city and with a name like Super Duper, it's hard not to be curious and give it a try.  My friend and I visited this location on a Thursday around 12:30 p.m. and it was not crowded at all.  There were two other groups there- one had already gotten there food and the other was waiting.  We were quickly greeted by the man behind the cashier, but we took a couple minutes to peruse the menu.  We decided on:

-Chicken sandwich ($6.50) for me: the chicken sandwich was okay.  The chicken was a thin, even piece that spanned most of the length of the bread and sandwich was doused in a chipotle aioli sauce.  The sauce was leaking out from the a hole in my bun and became quite messy.  The bread is a little bit chewy, like ciabatta, and was okay.  Overall, I'd probably order a burger instead of this, if I make another visit.

-Super burger ($6.50) with cheese ($0.50) for him: my friend devoured his burger; I'm assuming he enjoyed it.

-Garlic fries ($2.75) to share:  the fries are a bit on the crispy side and topped with a fair amount of shredded cheese.  I wish it were a little bit garlic-y-er, though.  Still, the portion size was just right to share between the two of us.  We actually had some fries left over.

-Organic iced tea ($2.25) for me:  Very average, it was fine.

-Fountain drink ($2) for him: Free refills, they have coke zero too.

-Homemade pickles (free): These can be found at the condiment/utensils station.  I don't really like pickles, but I gave them a try and they tasted fine.  My friend was really excited to try out the pickles after hearing so much about them- he said they taste like any other pickles.

Overall, the food is decent.  It's not expensive, but of course, not as cheap as some fast food places.  Everything was decent, but I think I want to come back for a milkshake or chocolate dipped cone, next time. 

Notes:
-Metered street parking in front.  Or go a block back and there's free 2 hour parking.
-Free homemade pickles.
author: Samantha L.

description: Delicious burgers! I got the Super Burger which is 8 oz of meat (2 patties) and added cheese and bacon. Came out to $9.50. Veggies included tomato, lettuce, and red onions between a sesame bun. The patties were cooked to perfection. My only complaint is that the burger was a little oily but other than that, awesome!
author: Greg T.

description:
all i gotta say is its super dee duper good! ;)

when i hear super duper, i imagine big.  its pretty small for its price.  and the price is pretty highhhh.  

burger was juicy!  juice all over the place.  juice + grease = heart attack ,but thats my kind of thing. =P

garlic fries were cool too.

they offered free pickles.  lotssssss of it in the jars near the soda fountain.
author: mong linh n.

description:
Loved the burger with the egg on top!!!!!  OMG it was so good. The garlic fries are perfectly fried too.  Plus, everything is organic.  

I had the mini burger with everything on top, plus an egg on top.  People were raving about the pickles.  I thought it was just alright.  I mean it is free and all you eat.  My roommate loves their buns, but I had to take most of it off due to the carb factor.  

Overall a great experience.  I will have to come back and try their organic dipped cone.
author: Lilly W.

description:
Just....take my money. JUST TAKE IT!

Never disappointed with these guys. I mean, that burger is just the epitome of a juicy one -- one bite and suddenly you're drowning in flavor, aroma, emotions, and amino juices all over your face. And despite all the juice, it doesn't even bother me when the bun starts marinading in it. Just more umami all up in my grill.

Garlic fries are always the right decision. Just go for it. The spiked shake, however, not what I was hoping for (aka I'm lightweight an alcoholic and I need my shakes made with hard liquor and not soju...that stuff could barely get a kitten tipsy).

So in con-clu.....in conclooshun....IN CONCLUSION, this is the only burger joint that will ever take money away from me besides In N Out. Sorry bae but it's side bae dae.
author: Matt V.

description:
My friend and I have regular, ok maybe perpetual, cravings for French fries. I yelped fries on a night out in the Castro and this little joint popped up. The menu and decor and vibe reminded me of Shake Shack, ah memories.

We got the garlic fries, hot and crispy, though not particularly garlicky. There were free pickles to snack on while we waited too, which for a pickle lover like myself... Jackpot! Would love to come try out the burgers one day.

PS they have straus ice cream and such too.
author: Vivian H.

description:
If you looking for a juicy burger with the works, it's going to be Super Duper expensive!

Building your burger -- 
Super Burger (8oz) for $6.50
or opt for the "Mini" Burger (4oz) for $4.50
- Add Cheese $.50
- Add Bacon $1.00
- Add additional toppings $1.00:
- Avocado, (1) Organic Egg, Grilled Peppers, Roasted Portabella, Point Reyes Bleu

FREE Toppings include:
- Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, "Super Sauce"
Additional FREE (must request upon order):
- Jalapenos, Grilled Onions, Pickles (at the napkin station)

Super + Mini - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=y3XjJ9KZiIZP9aLMMdlLuQ&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Okay, despite your choice of going for the 8ozer or the 4oz burger, the buns, greens, toppings, and everything else will be the exact same size. I got the 8oz and my girlfriend got the 4oz and because how identical both burgers looked, I almost devoured her Mini (found out shorty after since my burger had bacon). Seriously, these burgers are puny! My Super was just slightly bigger than the palm of my size L hand.. 

So of course, yes, the burgers ARE juicy and delicious but the bill for simply a Super with bacon + cheese, a Mini with avocado (which no actual avocado was in the burger), and a side of straw-cut Garlic Fries summed up to over $18 bucks! least to say, we still left hungry afterword.. 

Good burgers but if I'd knew I would have been nickled and dimed, I would have just settle for a DoubleDouble (or 2) with Animal Fries at In & Out for less!
author: Albert L.

description:
Words can't explain the juicy, mouth watering, finger licking burgers you can eat! Yum!! Yum!!
Can't wait to go back, this place is awesome! Why didn't I hear about it sooner!?!
author: Peanuts M.

description:
Simply put; damn good food. 

Burgers cooked medium and service is fast. 
Pickles are home made and amazing
All post consumer waste is compostable
author: Chris K.

description: First time here! Chilling in SF for the weekend and asked a friend what's a good place and she recommended Super Duper Burger. I think this is the best burger I've ever had! Not one that I would eat all the time cuz of how oily it is, but this would be my cheat meal all the time! You NEED to try this if you're in town!
author: Dorothy Rae G.

description:
one star for the bathroom it was well supplied and clean and handicap accessible.  

2nd star for their awesome fast service and recieving my burgers. 

3rd star for the layout and vibe of the restaurant reminds me of a chipotle but its serving burgers instead. 

4th star I like how they advertise the food is organic veggies and meat too. when I received my regular beef burger the size isnt too big its sort of like an innout burger size. the first thing I saw was mayo bulging out but the beef was tender and not over cook or well done. the meat was still a lil pink so if u are scared its not cooked all the way I suggest u tell them well done. overall the burger was juicy and fair in price for 5 bucks without a drink or fries. I also like how they have complimentary pickles on the condiment counter. 

overall I will go back for a quick burger if im craving for one and for hangover food.
author: Alex T.

description:
Super Duper Burger just change your name to Super Duper Delicious.

Recently went to Super Duper Burger to experience the hype. I ordered a basic Super Duper Burger (8 oz) the first time and the 4 oz a different time. The burger is 8 oz of pure flavor, juiciness and deliciousness. A burger you can't resist. I also ordered an order of fries, albeit delicious it was terrifyingly overly salted. And not just overly salted with iodized salt, these salt crystals are like ice cream salts! Super Duper, please tone down the saltz.... The vanilla milkshake was also very good.

Definitely will come back, over and over and over and over again.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Boy, Super Duper sure does a great job.  Simple menu.  Honest pricing.  Clean dinning room and bathrooms.  
I love the burgers.  A double is the perfect lunch.  Check out the yummy pickles.
author: EC N.

description:
Solid burger not mind-blowingly so but much better than most chains that litter themselves across San Francisco.

I tried the Super(?) Duper Burger which was two 4 oz patties shoveled into a seemingly plain sesame bun. I opted for the bacon and cheese addition obviously.

One complaint that I almost never make is how greasy this burger was, like I love greasy burgers but this one felt like they finished cooking it and then dipped the entire burger in grease french dip style. 

Flavor-wise I liked it it falls in line with In-n-out in terms of generally overall burger, although it goes it a completely different direction from the clean cut in-n-out burger to the sloppy I need to wear short sleeves to eat this burger. 

The fries were solid but I feel the other reviews hyped them up to be more than they are, especially in the 3 dip department which should be noted were served in tiny sub 1 oz containers.

Free pickles were "meh"

TLDR: Burger tasted like a $8 burger from a decent diner, fries tasted like well fried frozen fries (Not a bad thing), and the grease is strong here.
author: Jeff T.

description:
As a Castro local, Super Duper is definitely one of my regular food joints (I come here at least once a month). This place is sure to satisfy any burger craving!

The menu is fairly simple, so I pretty much always order the same things:

Mini Burger with Niman Ranch Beef + Cheese ($4.50 + $0.50): Don't be fooled by the name "Mini". This is actually their "normal" burger (Super comes with 2 patties). It comes with 1 4-oz patty, yummy melty cheese, and a bunch of free toppings if you desire (lettuce, tomatoes, jalapeños, super sauce, etc.). I get it simple with extra lettuce, tomatoes, and the super sauce, which is similar to the thousand-islandish sauce that In n Out uses. The burger always comes out super juicy and full of flavor. Veggies are always fresh, and the cheese is melted perfectly over all the meat.

Garlic Fries w/Parmesan Cheese ($2.75): Yum, definitely a staple for me. Fries are usually really crispy, but the amount of garlic/cheese fluctuates with every visit. More often than not though, the fries come topped with a ton of garlic and parmesan cheese. So much so that your breath ends up smelling like garlic for a full 24 hours! But who cares about bad breath when it's delicious while you're eating it!

The bf usually gets the Super Burger; like I said, the only difference being the 2 meat patties instead of 1. 

The food here is really solid and consistent. Never had a bad meal here! In my opinion, this is definitely one of the better burger places in the city in terms of taste/price, especially compared with the other local Castro/Mission ones like Burgermeister (expensive for what you get) & Urbun Burger (meat was a bit dry). They also have soft serve here for dessert! Hand-dipped cones too!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Retro charm in every detail, including the food, aluminum trays, and the printed wrappers, Super Duper is reminiscent of a more polished In N'Out. The burgers come in two sizes (mini or super) with the option to add free and premium toppings (egg, bacon, cheese, avocado). They also have shakes (malts and spiked shakes too), salads, chicken sandwiches, and veggie burgers. For dessert, you can choose from homemade pie, cookies and Straus organic soft serve ice cream cones (dipped or not). A kid's menu is available. 

Love that they make their own pickles at the condiment station. 

* Mini burger ($4.50): neatly wrapped and carefully put together, the patty was very juicy with a lovely char, the veggies (a leaf lettuce - not iceberg, yay, red onions, tomato) were fresh and bun was warm and soft. Their secret sauce, a mayo based concoction, didn't add much to the burger's flavor.
* Garlic fries: thin, lightly crispy, right amount of salt, sprinkled with parmesan cheese
* Dipped cone (Straus soft serve vanilla ice cream, chocolate shell, cake cone): wonderful, will bring back childhood memories, it's very messy and it's much bigger than DQ's version

Driving by their giant soft serve cone sign always makes me think of fro-yo.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Burger (4oz) with everything and cheddar - Tasted like a cross between Ruby's and In N Out. Which kind of makes sense because I feel this place is like a cross between Pearls and In N Out. But its WAY than Pearls. I read other reviews about the grease factor- I did notice it, but it wasn't overwhelming. The patty was also a perfect medium, and had a good flavor. It tasted more fresh than In N Out beef. 

Garlic fries- again, way better than Pearls, but In N Outs fries (plain) are still superior. I'd get garlic over regular, and they give a normal portion size, so thats a plus. 
Pickles- these were too sweet for me.
Small chocolate dipped cone- delicious! The cake cone tasted like a rice krispy treat!
UNLIMITED COKE ZERO REFILLS- I'd come back just for these alone. 

Overall, Super Duper really surprised me. Being on the quest to find the best burger in San Francisco (what Yelper isn't?) its nice when you come across a stand out. 
I'd easily pick this over Pearls and Roam, but not over Little Griddle or In N Out. But its a close third.
author: Emily D.

description:
Perfection! In my book this place has nailed it for a burger joint. 
Absolutely one of the best burgers I've ever eaten, anywhere, for only $7! in SF! Wow! Seriously good beef they grind daily from a local farm, really cool people and did I say A DAMN good burger!
Simple, but relatively diverse menu. chicken, veggie, etc

I love finding a bargain in the city, but this place goes beyond a bargain. 
Definitely give this place a shot next time you're in SF.
author: Brian O.

description: This used to be awesome. However the customer service quality has deteriorated significantly over the past couple years. You can still rely on the food quality. But I am reminded that I can make good burgers at my own house without being served by rude, self important kitchen / service staff. Rude Employees. Uncaring management. Dirty tables.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Please Note:  The menu SAYS that these are some drippy burgers!  They are organic and/or grassfed beef options cooked at Medium by default.  If you're shy of grease have them cook it longer, or you can go somewhere where only half of it is real beef and the other half takes down the calorie count. Sorry kids, ya can't have it all!

Huge points nailed by Super Duper Burgers.

# UNO.  Stellar customer service.  Have you been to food joints in San Francisco lately?  They don't have to be nice because the people come either way.  So, Super Duper Burgers, why so nice?  Why so incredibly friendly and upbeat?  If fact, if you fear grease as aforementioned, I'm sure they will do whatever they can to accommodate you.

# DOS.  The burgers are made from grass fed cows.  They are juicy and succulent and outright glorious.  Dayum SON!

# TRES.  The garlic fries are a perfect portion, a perfect price, and tongue sluttin' greatness.  DAYUM son.

# QUATRO.  They have beer.  They typically have Racer IPA.  On tap.  On tap beer and unbelievable burgers with fries.  DAYUM SON.

Compostable everything-LOVE LOVE LOVE!


Do yourself a favor and get a treat- it'll be one for the books!
author: Ashley W.

description:
Super Duper Burgers, why aren't you in Florida?

I'd give this a nod ahead of Five Guys, easily. 

The burger was cooked perfectly and the sauce added that special touch! Yum...service was friendly, and quick. Fries were great and a good size. I believe it's all organic...not that I can really tell the difference, but it was all very fresh. Wish I could make a trip again soon.
author: Chris B.

description:
Walked here on my lunch break to see what it was all about and I have to say it was worth the mile walk.

Pros:
- It's a good burger in the grand scheme of things. I got the Super Duper with added cheese and bacon (of course). I've not tried the specials or the chicken as of yet
- The portion size of the fries - sometimes at other places they will give you a handful and call it a day, not at Super Duper burger...
- The ice cream is good too - albeit very messy

Cons:
- Just not a lot of space at this particular restaurant, but where is there in SF?


It's a good spot to grab a burger. I will go back for sure.
author: Wes H.

description: Good if you love grease, but i dont. The veggie burger patty was a deep fried greasy hot mess. It was inedible.
author: Nona T.

description: The burgers are truly super duper. The service is fast. A simple burger can be dressed up to anyone's liking here. I like to 'pimp' mine out - add the avocado, bacon, jalapeño, the grilled onion, mushrooms. However .. The pickles are a def no go for my taste buds at this burger place. Tried at least 2.  I think they are trying to be gourmet but instead it comes out to be weird. It has a funny flowery after taste. I might have seen fennel seeds in the jar. Cant pin point it but i like my pickles sour.
author: Zita M.

description:
This is my favorite place to go in SF now
my fiance does not like burgers but he always wanted it when he is in town...and i am loving it too
author: TTrraaccYY H.

description:
The burger was delicious. FYI: a "mini" burger is actually the size of a normal burger and, with fries, was plenty for me. I got the garlic fries after reading reviews. They were rather disappointing. TONS of what tasted like raw garlic soaked my fries and was way too intense...too spicy. It was literally burning my mouth. It has now been over 12 hours (with 2 teeth-brushings, 2 flossings, and plenty of Listerine) and I'm STILL fighting the strong garlic taste. The aged cheddar was good, but next time I'll just get the regular fries.

I left a full drink on the table to pick up my order at the counter, and when I got back, the glass was gone. Without a receipt, I couldn't get another. That was irritating (and made the garlic fries that much more difficult to handle.)
author: J C.

description: Best burgers in the bay area.  I love this place.
author: Timothy M.

description:
Fuck this place. 

I understand the pricing of the burgers since their oily "organic." Seriously their pricing is SUPER DUPER ridiculous. 2$ for fries in a little bitch container. SERIOUSLY!!! 

Shake was okay even though it was melting within the 2 minutes we got it. It isn't thick and creamy. 

One star for being environmentally friendly.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Stopped by Super Duper for a quick pre-movie dinner.  For the most part my experience was pretty super...duper.  

I had the portobello sandwich and garlic fries.  I'd chosen the vegetarian option in a slight effort to be healthier, but turns out that the mushroom was breaded and deep-fried, rather than grilled.  Well, so much for that.  In either case, the sandwich was actually incredibly good.  

The garlic fries on the other hand, were quite disappointing...seemed as though they'd been doused with garlic powder rather than the real thing.  Or was the aged cheddar?  I'm not sure, but didn't enjoy them, especially when compared to the garlic fries at somewhere like Gott's.

In general though, my impression was positive-- very cool that they use Niman Ranch beef, free range chicken, Strauss soft serve (trying this next time!) and even have homemade pickles too.
author: Joanne G.

description: Super duper is so super duper! Great service and amazing burgers full of flavor and super duper seasonings! The burgers are both fresh and well put together. What a great spot to enjoy a tasty burger day and night.
author: Kayla W.

description:
Five stars because I left my phone here and no one took it. Right off the bat, I love the people who work here. 
The food tasted good, but we were a little put off at how much oil there was in the garlic fries. I was left wondering if the garlic is in a sauce or if they just tossed the fries straight out of the frier without shaking them out a bit.  Between the juicy burger and the fries, we felt overwhelmed with fat. We went out of our way to check it out, but in the end decided that we would not make a special trip to do it again.
author: Susan B.

description:
I'd say a 3 star burger, but the garlic fries and house made pickles are the winners. First time here and I waited a good 15 mins. Something was up... Amir, the manager at the time, told me there was a mix up in the ticketing system. He was friendly and apologetic, comped my meal and even offered me another beverage bc I had already finished my milkshake during the long wait.  

My order: spiked cookies and cream milkshake (so so), double with cheese, garlic fries (yes!), free house pickles (yass!).  Came out to be $19 incl tax.
author: William V.

description:
I remember drooling all over the windows of this place, waiting for it to open its first location on Market Street way back in the day, thinking, Sweet now I don't have to trek it to Burger Joint for a decent burger... and lucky me, this feels like a little bit of Shake Shack in SF.  This restaurant, Kasa Indian, and Starbelly were really the trifecta that jumpstarted the pulse of the Castro's gross dining scene. Let's face it, the mall in Vallejo probably had better food before these guys came to the hood. I digress.    

1.) Carefully-assembled, juicy and seasoned burgers on a delicately toasted bun.
2). Hot n' crispy fries.
3). Sexy Italian proprietor. 

I think we're done here.
author: BroSauce J.

description: Great burger, shakes, and lemonade! We drove an extra twenty minutes to come to this location for the shakes after a long day... And the milkshake machine was broken! We explained our  predicament to cashier Adam, who was nice enough to find us in the super busy diner once the machine was back up! I really want to thank Adam for saving the day!
author: Kay M.

description: First time here! My new favorite burger place. Loved everything. Fries where good, crispy outside and soft inside. Burger was delicious, I got the mini 4oz, perfect size, bun tasted good, meat was well seasoned properly cooked and still juicy. Reasonably price too! Yay!
author: Claudia B.

description: I went to Super Duper Burger for the first time yesterday and it didn't disappoint! The burger was so juicy! it had the right balance of salt and vegetables. The Red Onions on the burger were good and I don't normally like Red Onions. I don't know if they do something to them,  but they were good. The fries were also good even though I only had the regular fries. The food also came out quick! Almost as quick as a fast food place. But Burger King doesn't have anything on Super Duper Burger.
author: Thomas J.

description:
Pros: good burgers with choice of size. 
          Egg on the burger

Cons:  fries weren't good

Good burgers but I'd not wait in line to eat here.
author: Bayarea K.

description:
Wow! This is a must add to bucket list burger spot. 

After a long night of drinking, a good bacon burger sounded like a solid choice. This was the best burger I have ate in 34 years. Let me repeat that, best burger I have ever ate! Juicy, flavorful, melt in your mouth delicious! Fresh, soft, and tasty sesame bun. I ordered mine with bacon, blue cheese, lettuce, grilled onions, and the "super sauce". 

Garlic fries were delicious. They offer three extra dipping sauces which we ordered. Two were a little bland but one was delicious. I was tempted to try a specialty organic shake/malt but passed. Based on the burger, I'll certainly try it next time. 

Atmosphere was similar to Chipotle in the sense that it was a step above fast food. Casual but nice. 

Don't think twice, just do!
author: Cory W.

description: Aaliyah and Adam were awesome- and most importantly the burgers- were the best in town! We were coming from LA and this San Fran joint was delicious :)
author: Masha B.

description: I don't eat much beef, but I do enjoy a good burger. And Super Duper was definitely Super and didn't disappoint. I went in for lunch because I was in the area and I wanted something fast, cheap, and good. I ordered the mini combo (burger, fries, drink) and received my freshly made food shortly after. The "mini" was big enough for me, and they weren't skimpy on the fries. Everything seasoned just right, fresh ingredients, and good design, too! Since I was leaving town two days after, I went for lunch again the next day!
author: Jen K.

description: I loved the burger. Asked for a 4oz and it was the perfect size. I was able to finish the burger feeling satisfied and not stuffed.  The fries are good as well.
author: Yisel F.

description: I had a mini four cheese burger, garlic fries, and small vanilla shake and have nothing but good things to say about my meal. The burger was cheesy, the fries were not all that great or crisp but they were garlicky and complemented the burger well. Lastly, the vanilla shake was great and refreshing. FYI the meal cost about $14. Would not hesitate to come back here again. Cheers!
author: Carlos R.

description:
2 stars because honestly.. Meh, I've experienced better. 

Been to the other Super Duper locations and have much better service and experiences there. 

The employees here, especially the cashiers aren't exactly the most friendly, nor do they shed a smile. --and that's upon multiple visits. The only reason I've been to this location is because I do like their burgers, and because it's conveniently closer than the others, but still parking sucks. Right on Market though, so what do you expect?

I would say it's pricey for a quick, non fance-shmance burger, but only because of its quality. You can't knock that.
author: Charmaine P.

description:
DIRTY!

I watched the staff, play with their beard, pick up food off the floor, wipe down tables and trays all with the same towel!

If that is what goes on in the front of the house, what goes on in the back!

Friendly staff and decent burgers.

Pickles are awful and quality of mustard is terrible.

Avoid.
author: Max L.

description:
Honestly - I'm not that impressed.  The food tasted good, not great.  The only thing I was impressed with was the Strauss Vanilla Milkshake - a great shake.  I have heard of Super Duper being in line with the In-N-Outs of the world and even though this place is a bit more impressive than any other drive-thru fast food the food wasn't "super" impressive.

The menu was cool and in urban fashion aligned with San Francisco flair. I ordered the garlic fries and super (8oz) burger with cheese and bacon. The Garlic fries tasted like any other fries you would purchase waiting in line for a ride at Disneyland.  The burger itself was a bit gristle(y) and unpleasant.  The bacon was soggy and not the crispy taste I had hoped for.  

I will have to give Super Duper another try before I give it the big thumbs down but it's going to be awhile.  Sorry Duper.
author: Kevin J.

description:
They say you shouldn't judge a book by its cover, but in this case, super duper wears its' heart on its' sleeve and has basically everything you need to know on its wrapper!!!

all you need to know: 

first class burgers!
ninja fast!
kick ass!
yum!
dope!
in your face!
mmmmmdelish!
juicy!
tasty!
awesome!
tasty!
DAMN GOOD!

yeaaaa boy!!! I'm talkin bout: 
the SUPER DUPER SUPERBNESS that is Niman Ranch burgers, garlic parmesan fries, shakes, choc-dipped strauss creamery swirly soft serve.

*tip: though the burger is served on top of a flat wrapper and you can man-handle the crap out of your superburger with lettuce, tomato onion, jalepeno peppers, pickles, super sauce, avocado, egg and more, you'll have a much more enjoyable eating experience if you don't have said egg, special sauce and more running down your elbow and dribbling down onto your flawlessly tight top, accenting your macho mucho muscles. Gotta keep that get it right/get it tight bod while strolling down Castro ya know!??
author: Angela W.

description:
I came here looking for a good burger. At this point. I was tired of fast food burgers so i decided to give this location a try.

On the plus side:
Grass fed burgers

Negative side:
*No combo options listed on the board.
*Everything is Al LA Carte style..
*Parking and driving to area is hell.
* Seating is much more cramped than McDonalds.
 * This place is louder than a flashbang going off so get your ears checked after you leave.
*The people around you are very pompous.

End Verdict: Take the trip down to financial district for a better customer experience.
author: Eric C.

description: I thought this place was so good.  My burger and garlic fries were great.  I love having a sunny side up fried egg on my burger.  So yummy but so messy.  Service was friendly and quick.  They're cookie milk shake was amazing.  I'm still craving it.  Wish I could find a place like this in Southern Ca.
author: Kim T.

description: Great Burgers, shakes and hand dipped cones.  Fries are just meh.  There are a couple of outdoor tables so you can bring your pet which is great.
author: Dave C.

description:
Great burgers that are extremely juicy. I would describe them as "wet" tasting. Side pickles are a nice touch. 
The real gem here is the delicious soft serve they have. It has a really clean, icy dairy taste to it. Just as good as ice cream from a real dairy.  The interior and branding of this place are pretty Web 2.0.
Don't forget your napkins.
author: Zahin A.

description: The burgers here are decent. However I find the patty way too greasy, the grease even sinks through both buns and leaves hands an oily mess. Flavor wise the meat was definitely juicy and fresh tasting. Really good for satisfying junk food cravings.
author: Rosa T.

description: $10 will buy you a good but somewhat greasy Super Burger with extra jalapeño on the side. It's really tasty especially after a drinking night with friends. I still can recall how juicy the meat patty was. They also serve beer, which is awesome! However, it can be pricey, $27 for a meal for late supper for 2! The same meal at In-N-Out Burger would probably cost less than $15.
author: Tai V.

description:
Super Duper is basically a fancier In-n-out. The burgers are made with similar small patties (though a bit bigger than the In-n-out variety), but are usually cooked a little closer to medium, rather than the In-n-out well-done-ness.
The sauce is good stuff, and the burgers are very flavorful, and super juicy. You WILL make a mess. The house pickles are also quite tasty, and pretty subtle.
There are a few beers on tap, and even 2 wines, but the selection is small.
Also, the shakes are excellent, and thankfully not absurdly enormous.

This instance of the chain is really pretty small, so seating can be hard to find.
author: Don H.

description: Delicious.  The staff were friendly and recommended the chicken sandwich, which I loved.  The homemade pickles are delicious.  The Straus soft serve ice cream is wonderful.  Thanks for a great meal!
author: Christy L.

description:
Tomorrow is Super Duper day!! Not a joke, the city has proclaimed Thursday, April 28th 2011, as such. And to celebrate its 1st anniversary that day, SD will give away free burgers from 2-3pm. Yay!

I have to give props to SD for having affordable burgers (while many restaurants are pushing +$16 burgers) and because menu prices include tax. But I'm not a fan of their fries.

Note: in case u didn't know they're opening a 2nd SD, in the former Seller's Market #3 location (2 doors down from Del Taco/ across the street from Walgreens).
author: Luis C.

description:
Super duper juicy in my mouth. WOO! 

Bacon. cheese. burger. How much more simple, yet fantastically delicious can you get? Sorry mom, I know I told you your burgers were the best, but you got some competition. The burgers here just taste so fresh, every single ingredient in your burger. The fries are addictive too.
author: Anh P.

description: AWESOME Garlic Fries (1 order for 2 little asian girls = not enough!). Housemade pickles are perfectly crunchy with a hint of a spicy kick. Burgers are done right, juicy, messy and delicious in its simplicity. This location was very clean and friendly with high turnover. Will be returning when I visit the area again.
author: Tracy N.

description:
It's not often I'll give a burger place 5 stars, but Super Duper burger deserves it.

Super Duper was recommended by a friend in Washington DC familiar with San Francisco eateries.  He said great things about Super Duper, but the only true way to truly appreciate it, is going yourself.  So I did.

The burgers are delicious as are the fries and the shakes.  For one extra dollar you can spike your shake with a little booze.  What a joy.

If you're in the area bar hopping this is a perfect way to finish your night.  I'm definitely coming back.
author: Juan F.

description: These burgers are so fucking good. I'm upset with how ducking good these burgers and garlic fries are.
author: Alex I.

description:
If you like saucy and flavorful burgers such as In N Out, Zorbas (Riverside, CA), or Red Robin, prepare for some disappointing burgers.

Their super sauce should be called super-weak sauce. It's an incredibly subtle butter flavor that does nothing to enhance the burger experience. What hurt the most was that I paid for extra cheese and it was tasteless. How is that even possible?! Good thing we got garlic fries or else we would have left super hungry.
author: Hanna L.

description:
Delightful. Delicious. Da Bomb. Okay so I was struggling for that last one there, but still, I mean it.

Everyone and their mother (and her pet chihuahua) has yapped endlessly about the glorious glutton-ous gorgefest (wow I'm on a roll) that is In-N-Out, but that's just a 4-star meh experience. Yes, it's fabled, but is it really that good? Well, kinda... but Super Duper is miles better.

The bun, burger and bacon (hot damn I'm killing this) came together so harmoniously, and and every bite so satisfying that I could not imagine any burger joints at this price point beating this. EVER.

Let's also talk about those fries, please. Golden goodness (I did it again) at $2.25!? YES PLEASE. I wish I could have put away more, except I have to sacrifice some things to maintain my waif-ish figure.

When you add in the homemade pickles (briny, pucker-worthy gems) and the organic soft-serve ice cream, there's really no way this isn't your default cheat meal, if it isn't already.
author: Marcus L.

description:
So much delicious-ness!  I love their mini burgers with cheese, avocado, and bacon.  

The burgers here are so yummy.  They have both mini burgers which are 4 oz patties and a bigger burger, which i can't remember the name of right now, that has 2 patties.  They also have a good selection of add-ons for your burger.  I really love super duper burgers, they are soo yummy.  Additionally, they have good veggie burgers too!
