Other things you must try are their milk shakes, such as chocolate or chocolate strawberry, and the garlic fries.  The garlic fries are covered in garlic bits and parmesan cheese!  Can you ask for more?!  Also, the people who work at super duper are really friendly and helpful.  If you haven't tried super duper yet, you must.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Finally came in after hearing so much about Super Duper and it lived up to its reputation. Ordered the free range chicken chipotle sandwich on ciabatta bread from the helpful staff and then noshed on the free pickles (which were excellent) while waiting. Thought there would be a longer wait, but in no time the sandwich came out and was extremely flavorful. 

Atmosphere: fun, laid back, light and everyone seemed to be upbeat (customers and staff). 80s synth pop played in the background.

Food: the chicken was moist and tender, the bread was toasted to perfection and the chipotle sauce went perfectly with the grilled veggies.

Staff: friendly, attentive, on point.

Although I grew up in the California suburbs with In and Out, I would definitely choose Super Duper when looking for a fast food meal in the city.
author: Roberto d.

description:
The burgers here are slightly pricier than your average burger. If you can taste the difference between grain fed and grass fed beef, then you'll understand why the cost of your burger meat is so expensive. 

Ordered the 4oz burger, garlic fries (w/ 6 month aged white cheddar) and a coke. 


PROS: Buy a burger and fries before you hit the bars around the area. It'll help you with your alcohol absorption. I liked the fries over the burger really. Sad but true. Burger meat was delicious but a bit overcooked. The bun was semi greasy with too much sesame seeds. OMG.. Garlic Fries tasted just like the kind you get at the ballpark and the coke? Well that's typical Coca Cola. Cost of a softie is fairly affordable. 


Cons: The neighborhood has no FXXKN parking!!! Facility has some high ceilings, so it gets loud real quick. Customer service needs some work... Keep in mind that this is close to the Castro District, so the people who live and work around here are FXXKN snobby, rude or are straight up assholes. I have yet to come across someone around here who is friendly. 

Overall: Food is delicious, Customer Service is rude and I prefer the Financial District locations better.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I love their veggie burgers! One of the best ever and they make their own (not just a morningstar patty)! A usual veggie burger comes with hummus and cucumbers, which compliment the crunchiness of the veggie patty very well. I remember taking my first ever bite of this burger and entered burger heaven. Also, their bun holds up the patty and ingredients very well.. so soft and fluffy! My friends also love this place and rave about their regular burgers, which come from good quality beef. Truly delicious and tasty!! 

This is no ordinary fast food burger place, (obviously way better than a McDonald's or In-N-Out). I suggest to order their crispy, thin fries and don't forget to grab some FREE pickles from their jars. 

A great place to head to with a group of friends, maybe late at night... if you are craving just a good ol' burger with fries and want to steer away from the processed burgers that never mold.
author: Aiza B.

description: A great place doing the best "right thing" their packaging is 100% compostable, without trsh cans, all recycling and compost! Using local designers and painters as opposed to those big companies lacking any consciousness.
author: Roberto H.

description:
I came here with a couple people cause we didn't know where else to eat for lunch, and it was SO GOOD. Thanks friend who introduced us to this place, cause it's bomb. And it was in dt, so it was really convenient: park, eat, shop.

I ordered the mini burger (4oz) with everything on it, plus cheese, avocado, and roasted portabello. It was the perfect size, not overwhelming, but still filling. And the best part? It was only $7! 

The fries are pretty good as well. They come with this "super sauce", but I still prefer ketchup. For dessert I got the choco-dipped vanilla cone, but I wish I got the kid's size cause it was so big. 

Will definitely come here again! Staff is extremely friendly and pleasant (:
author: Adorable T.

description: Was in Mill Valley for 3 days (from MA) with a family of 5 (1 GF) and went here twice - we discovered it on the second day.  Fabulous!
author: Ted M.

description:
The Super Burger *Everything On It*: Two incredibly juicy homemade patties stacked between a tiny bun that doesn't quite hold its weight. ($6.50)

The Homemade Pickles: Free, Endless, Delicious

The option of getting a Spiked Milkshake: Revolutionary (+$1.5 only!)

The Straus Organic Soft-Serve CHOCO-DIPPED: Amazingness in the shape of an ENORMOUS cone. ($4)

My only complaint: My bun just couldn't hold that massive mound of meat. Com'on Super Duper, if I was on a no-carb, lo-carb diet, I wouldn't eat the bun at all.
author: Talia G.

description:
We've been back since and have had an improved experience. The burger was cooked much better, although I guess its just not a perfect match because I still think it lacked seasoning. Just a little salt or *something* would be nice. 

The pickles are still awesome!!!
author: Claudia P.

description:
I got sucked into trying Super Duper burger, ( despite the fact I had In&Out the day before) because of the design of the place. Why does this always happen to me?

I loved the wrappers, homemade pickles and mayo, the stone/brick mixed with patterned walls... the orange creme soda, and the general organic vibe. 

The burgers were pretty delicious, and the presentation helped. The buns were puffy and soft not smashed, the burger also shaped perfectly, and at 4 oz was the perfect size. The milkshakes were pretty delicious (although I felt a little overpriced).

My only caveat was that I wasn't in love with the garlic fries and the 3 dipping sauces. My boyfriend was bummed about how the parmesean was more present than the garlic (and I have to agree). Plus, they were a little too soggy for my taste.

Overall, this place is delicious. I wish it was closer to home, because i'd love to have it completely win over my in&out and 5 guys b&f cravings.
author: Kary M.

description: Good shit. Went here on a whim tonight and was not disappointed at all. Burger was simply Good Shit
author: Lawrence B.

description: Burger was cooked Medium well and was dry. Fries were ok and the three dipping sauces were odd tasting and unpleasant. Nothing Super Duper here!
author: Steven B.

description: Best burger in the hood!  Tasty burgers, the best chocolate shakes around, solidy delicious fries -- and those free homemade pickles.  Love this place.
author: J J.

description: Super Duper Burger is pretty, well, super.  The menu is straight-forward, no fuss no muss.  The burger bun is nice and fresh as well as the veggies (vibrant green lettuce, ripe tomato, crispy onion).  The burger patty is flavorful and juicy.  Their super sauce (I believed it was called) is their version of thousand island.  You can choose between a mini burger (4 oz) or a super (8 oz).  The mini was the perfect size for me.  Along with their delicious garlic fries and I was left feeling satisfied.
author: Rose A.

description: If you are looking for a quick bite to eat and are craving a burger you have come to the right spot. I ordered the bacon burger with an egg on top. You cannot go wrong with this place. The fries are delicious. I even had a soft serve cone which was a swirl of vanilla and chocolate goodness. I really enjoyed the pickles that were so conveniently located in the condiment bar. I may have consumed more than my fair share of pickles and fries during my visit. I highly recommend this place!
author: Charles B.

description: Super Duper's Right - even their veggie burgers are awesome! Like this location better than the other ones.
author: Tracey W.

description:
I have a weakness for soft serve ice cream and Super Duper is my favorite go to place for this treat. It comes in chocolate, vanilla, or both swirled together and they use organic Strauss cream to make it. You also have the option to have your cone dipped in chocolate or transformed into a full blown sundae, their toppings include cookies & cream, strawberries, chocolate chips, bacon bits, etc. 

I haven't tried their burgers (options include 100% Neiman ranch beef and veggie patties), sandwiches (free range chicken), or fries yet, but they all sound nice. They make a point to use local, organic ingredients, and bio-degradable dining ware,so you're doing the world good while you eat.
author: Cathy K.

description:
This place is amazing. This is by far the best burger that I have ever had. It's juicy and cooked to perfection. Whatever is in the super duper sauce is amazing. In fact, I am actually craving one right now. 

You don't even have to get the super duper burger to get the amazing taste, but you should get it if you're super hungry. I like cheese on mine. Don't miss out on the pickles!

If you're going to get fries, consider the garlic fries. These are so good. The garlic is fresh and the cheese is also really good. 

Any of the drinks are good, but also get a milkshake. The strawberry and chocolate smoothie is AMAZING. Honestly, I love this place. I take my friends here when they come to visit. I recommend the market location over the one in Castro, but they are still just as good. 

Enjoy!
author: Angie D.

description:
Good burgers at a great price - plus the people are cool, helpful, and friendly. 

I looked at the menu for Burgermeister and Barney's 'gourmet' on 24th in Noe and they're good not great. In fact Barney's didn't have much flava when i was there and it's a 14 dollar burger - a little too much to not be stunning.

Good fries here and delicious double chocolate chip shake.
author: Rew C.

description: I'm not sure why people like this place so much. There's absolutely nothing special about this place. The burgers are ok but nothing to write home about. If you're the type of person who likes to write home about things you shouldn't go here because you will have nothing to write about. If you want an average tasting meal you should go here. It's also really slow for some reason.
author: Wizardbunz Z.

description:
I had a poor experience and customer service originally did not get back to me. It wasn't until I posted a negative review on yelp that they reached out and made it right.

4 stars for the food
3 stars for the service. Wish it was done right the first time (5 stars), wish they would have responded to my original feedback (3-4 stars, depending on response). They eventually made it right though, it just took a while and multiple avenues of communication.
author: Daniel O.

description:
Super Duper  YUM = hamburger with cheese (greasy, juicy and tasty)

Super Duper YUM = Garlic fries and regular fries

Super YUCK = Veggie burger.  The patty was a mushy, vegetable tasting, blah of a taste.  Sadly, I'm never going to order another veggie burger again because of this one.

Tip: get there before noon, otherwise, the line is enormously long.
author: Jenny T.

description:
$8 - Super Burger (8oz - 2 patties) w/ bacon and cheese. Could be the best burger I've ever had. Super juicy, super flavorful, and cooked perfectly. Might be a bit on the oily side for some, but did not make me think twice of how delicious the burger was. I'm a huge fan of In-N-Out but if you come to this place, In-N-Out really does not compare. Super Duper is on another level. The bun that comes with the burger definitely tastes fresh and holds up nicely with the juicy patties within.

The garlic parmesan fries I would also highly recommend getting ($2.75). Thin cut fries, generously topped with a mountain of fresh garlic. Located on Market Street, this place is really easy to find, and is definitely one of the cleanest restaurants I've been to in SF.
author: Austin W.

description: I'm a big fan of Super Duper in general, but the Castro location last Friday night was FILTHY.  Cooks were just milling around the kitchen in a sea of crushed fries and other detritus.  It shows a lack of care and isn't very appetizing; especially when the situation could be easily rectified with two minutes and a broom.  Time to up your tidy game, Super Duper!
author: Kyle F.

description:
Alright Yelpers, 

Let's talk Burgers.

First off, don't ever mention "Five Guys" and "best burger" in the same sentence. 
No burger deserves the right to be called the best burger when their bun is so soft and mushy. We need buns with INTEGRITY here. 

The super burger here is pretty good. And I say that only because I don't want to over hype this burger for anyone. The grass fed beef really does make a difference and you can taste all the beefy goodness in this burger. No excessive sauce that  takes away from the burger's true identity, that is, the beef patty itself. 

There are toppings you can add on your burger but they are not needed. I went to the restroom and had my friend order a burger for me and he added jalapenos... adding Jalapenos was ok but it took away from the beef taste. 

The bun had a nice firm feel. And everything just worked well in this burger. So well that I was just happy and that's pretty much all I remembered. 

Beefy goodness...
Firm bun...
Happiness. 

Oh we ordered garlic fries and they were as good as ball parks.
And they had milkshakes that you can actually drink from a straw. 

I leave off 1 star only because there are so many other burgers I haven't tried out there.
author: Henry C.

description:
The cashier tried to tell me that this burger was going to taste better than In and Out and Five Guys, which then I immediately thought, no way.

I had never heard of this place, but it was rated high enough so I came inside and got a burger and a shake and gosh darn it, it was pretty darn awesome.

The shake was delicious, prolly a bit overpriced considering I didnt get all that much shake, but the burger was priced well and real filling so it evened out.

The lines can get long, but they keep it moving. The pickles here are also real real good. I grabbed a few, but should have taken them all.
author: Luis D.

description: Seriously favorite burger place ever. Their pickles are homemade, and the other day when we ordered they gave us free fries because they got the order wrong.
author: Carol Y.

description:
Really good food.  Very nice staff.  The line will be really long when you arrive, but don't worry-- They're so quick with bussing tables and there's lots of turnover, so you'll get a table by the time you get to order your food.

The downside is that this place is freakin' loud.  Like, I can't hear myself think.  If you get a table at the back of the restaurant, you'll get kitchen noise.  And if you get a table at th front of the restaurant, you'll get this constant traffic of people walking in, looking at the line, and saying, "OMG, the line is so long!  Should we go somewhere else?"

I found myself scarfing down my food because I couldn't wait to get out of there.  

Though... now that I think about it, maybe this is by design.  Loud restaurant = fast table turnover.  Hmmmm?
author: Needles K.

description:
I was hugely skeptical when I walked in here this week, but ultimately felt like this was one of the best burger joints I've been to in a while:
 - service - nailed it
 - 4oz burger option made the automatic gut bomb a mini-gut bomb
 - garlic fries - awesome
 - chocolate milkshake - delicious
 - option of getting chocolate milkshake spiked...more delicious

Everything burger was good, but I'll try something simpler next time.
author: Jeff F.

description:
These burgers really ARE super duper - they are not screwing with us. The mini is an awesomely filling size, I got the hamburger with everything. Here's the breakdown: the artisinal bun actually does make a difference. It has texture, it's fluffy and there's an actual flavor. The beef patty is ground to utter heaven, it falls apart when you bite into it, in the good way. I wish I'd gotten jalapenos and/or a fried egg on that bad boy. But as a simple burger, it's way better than any other burger at that price. 

The pickles they serve for you to snack on are awesome, how often do I see pickle spears? The fries are deliciously crispy and have a great flavor (I H8 In n Out's fries because they lack anything good) and the service was warm.

I also would recommend getting their organic soft serve ice cream. It's perfect for walking around SF on a sunny day. I bet the rest of their desserts are just as great.  What a yummy casual burger option in the city.
author: Tanya D.

description: These burgers are just that super and duper. I am not a huge fan of the stauss creamery soft serve, I don't know why it's a bit more icey than creamy. But everything else is on point. Best burger. Great fries and don't forget to try the house made pickles.
author: Silvio S.

description:
Every once in a while, I really crave one of these burgers. Probably one of the best quick burgers I've had in the city. 

I will say though that I usually order double cheese burgers from fast food joints, but their double cheeseburger is 8oz... that's a half a pound of meat! I've ordered it before and I can't finish it, so now I just order the smaller 4oz portion. Their special sauce is also subtle enough to actually add to the taste (I'm usually not a big fan of "special sauces")

They have really good garlic fries with shredded cheese on top, and milkshakes! (cookies and cream!!!)

And they also have beer, or you can get your milkshake "spiked", if it's one of those kinds of days.

The only downside to this location is it's directly across from my gym, so I have to sit there and feel guilty the whole time I'm eating!!! (just joking)
author: Mike C.

description: Solid burger. Everything was great about it. The garlic fries were good too, but nothing amazing. I would recommend anyone who has a big stomach to get the super (two patties) and not the mini (one patty). I would have tried the milkshakes, but we had to leave as soon as we arrived.
author: Gill S.

description: Their Veggie Burger is the KING of Veggie Burgers. The patty was moist and juicy and adding HUMMUS to their burger was just mind-blowing.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Good. Not great. Nothing "super duper" about this joint.

I am on a search for the best burger in SF. So far, I have not found it.

+1 for the service, +1 for the decor/atmosphere, +1 for their whole organic/sustainable/local deal, but I really don't have anything that stands out in my head about why I should brave the horrible parking situation to come here again.

In my opinion, the burgers lack seasoning. The bun did not hold up to the gigantic burger. The sauces that came with the fries were nothing special. $26++ for 2 burgers, 2 diet cokes, 1 fries...not really worth it to me.

There are TONS of places in SF that have burgers...and this really doesn't stand out. I just feel Meh about the entire experience.
author: Stacy S.

description: Great friendly service! The staff was so nice and helpful. Best lemonade I've ever had!!!! Tastes like lemons and not a cup of sugar! Best milkshakes! The burgers are yuuuuuuuuummy! Huge, sloppy, greasy... But fill of flavor and taste so fresh! In fact everything was incredibly fresh. Garlic fries were off the chart delish!  We had to roll ourselves out of there. Normally that would put us in a food coma but with all of the walking we've been doing it just fueled us! I personally believe this is the best SDB in the area!
author: Evie B.

description: Great family spot! Landed here after over looking Monks Kettle. Garlic fries were perfect - but not overwhelming with too much garlic. Burgers were amazingly good, with the little greased up crispy edges. Our boys had shakes and commented they were "good as In N Out shakes". Will definitely be back!
author: Justin F.

description: The fries were served at room temperature. The cheese didn't even melt! Overall very dry and definitely not fresh.
author: Thuy N.

description:
Super Duper is really Super Duper!!!  After living in the 'hood" for the past two years, we finally dropped in for a burger.  I had one with everything, I mean everything and he had the chicken - both were totally delicious!!!!!  LOVED them both and the fries were fabulous!!!  Did I mention a shake--to die for all of it just really yummmmmmmmm.

On our list to go again very soon!!!  PS  your recycling and green approach is top notch!
author: Jeff P.

description: Omg one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. Greasy and loaded with pretty much everything you can think of. And the garlic fries..get out of here. The FREE pickles are semi-sweet-/semi-sour-vinegary deliciousness. Gotta have a shake to top it off. This location is really nice and spacious, especially for downtown SF!
author: Alli H.

description: After six month in Asia this was one of the first places i visited when I returned home. The menu is simple and because of that they are excellant at making burgers and thier garlic fries and free pickles are so freakin' delisous. Dang it, now im hungry after writing this review!
author: McCray W.

description:
4.5.

Excellent fast food burger. Grilled onions, cheese, and all of the normal fixins. Came out fresh and is reasonably priced. If i lived near one id be a frequent customer.
author: J A.

description:
Great burgers, free pickles and racer 5 on tap.

Need I say more? I think not.
author: Eric Z.

description: Best milk shake ever!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This review is solely about the ice cream!

However, Super Duper won my heart.  After having brunch, someone mentioned that this place had really good ice cream.  Naturally, I then wanted some.  I'm not sure where I went wrong though.  It could have been ordering the vanilla-chocolate dipped cone or the fact that I didn't order a kid's cone, but it was a mess.  I tried to keep up, I swear!  The mess was worth it though since I haven't had ice cream that good in awhile.
author: Claudia S.

description:
Outstanding burgers...excellent craft style and toppings variations.    Scores in the top 10 of Max's Burger list (Val's still leads, with roam a close second).      Super Duper juicy.

Fries were perfectly crisp (extra crispy and crunchy the way I likes them), but they had a vague fishy takes, hence the loss of a star.  

You gotta try the "Soft Cream" (as they say in Japan) cones, choco dipped.   Brought back fond childhood memories.
author: Max K.

description:
Double Cheesburger= Juicy, moist, cheesy, & perfected
Fries= Hot, crispy, & fresh
I added avocado and bacon to my burger. I just wished the bacon was crispier. I did love the fact of self-serving yourself to homemade pickles. 
The cleanliness around the eating area can be worked on. Yet i'm fully aware it gets really busy and only so much can be handled. Overall visit "A".
author: Cee L.

description: It's been a long time since I wrote that, and they've since revised their milkshakes into a very nice example.
author: Ben W.

description:
The fries here are what McDonalds fries are when the are perfect.  Hot outta the grease.

NOTE there is a special (only at lunch) - sign by the register.  Mini burger, fries and a soda for $8.  Good deal.

Like this place a lot.
author: Amy W.

description: First time trying this place. (Market-triangle location) Delicious burger along with amazing garlic fries!
author: Amanda M.

description:
First and foremost 5 stars for the food! 

My friend took me to the one in union square and it was amaaaazing! The juiciest burger I've ever tasted. The garlic fries are a must! The burgers and garlic fries were just as good at this location however the cashier was kind of an a-hole.. I ordered a beer and I receive the dirtiest look ever and it kind of offended me. I'm sorry that I look young but why you gotta mad dog!? Oh well, my racer 5 paired perfectly with the food and all in all it was great and ill definitely be back to another super duper!
author: Serennah R.

description:
Freakin delicious! This is by far the best fast food burger I have had. The employees were very friendly. I was very satisfied with my visit

Don't be fooled by there interpretation of "mini". I had the combo and was full afterwards!
author: Jonathan M.

description: Greasy garlic fries overpriced.   Iced tea tastes real bad.   Hamburger had bone fragments in it. Otherwise ok but not very good.  We won't return
author: Mike N.

description: Had a wait between shows at SF Sketchfest, so we strolled up from the Castro theater. Very impressed! The garlic fries were delicious, and our burgers (he got a mini, I got a 4-cheese mini) were also very good. The bun was fresh and had a great texture. The prices were very reasonable, and the staff was helpful and friendly.
author: Robin B.

description: Super Duper makes a good, juicy burger. My gripe with the pickles. I like pickles on my burger, but the pickles provided are cut in wedges, which makes for a messy sandwich with pickles that slide out of the sandwich. The pickles are also too vinegary for my taste, either to eat alongside the burger or eaten as part of the sandwich. I'd much prefer sweeter bread and butter style pickle chips. Even a garlicky style pickle chip would be better. I have to say that Super Duper would have a tough time standing up to In-N-Out or Shake Shack in a side by side taste test.
author: John R.

description: Delicious burgers and fries and tasty shakes. Although this may seem like fast food, def not fast food prices. It is expensive for what it is. Great customer service though- the cooks messed up my order three times... the last time, i just ate it cuz my husband had already finished his meal. But the manager saw that it was messed up again and refunded us for the whole meal. Which was like $40 so made it worth it.
author: Kelly H.

description: Man that burger was good. Medium rare patty, boom! Whole leaf of lettuce, boom! Will definitely be trying other items on the menu.
author: R H.

description: I like this location. It's unassuming and maybe even easy to miss, but you know you're in the right place as soon as their brand hits you in the face. The Straus ice cream is somehow creamier at Super Duper, not as icy, but actually soft. I like the lemonade so much that I make a version at home that is inspired by it. The burgers are solid. The pickles are unlimited. The shakes are thick. There isn't much more you can ask for.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Second time eating here, first time at this location and it did not disappoint. Even better than the first time! One hell of a burger with out all that fancy extra stuff. Come to Sacramento please!
author: Ryan Y.

description:
For a non-beef eater, we have two options: Chicken sandwich and Veggie burger with hummus. I decided to try chicken sandwich today. The grilled chicken breast was tender, juicy and not dry. It's served with ciabatta bread. You can choose the same toppings as those you can get from regular burgers. I love their Super Sauce (spicy). They usually give you a generous amount of sauce on the bun, so if you don't like your bun wet, you should tell them.

Straus soft serve is so irresistible, so I rewarded myself a cone of swirl before I went home. Perfect Sunday night meal!
author: Saran R.

description:
I don't know what they put in their burgers, but these are pretty much the best burgers EVER! The burger patties are seasoned and cooked just perfectly, the bun is always soft and fresh. Whether you're picking up a quick lunch to-go or stopping in after happy hour, this place seriously never disappoints and the burgers always hit the spot! 

My ranking is in this order: 
1. Super Duper
2. Five Guys
3. In-n-Out
author: Angelina B.

description: Oh My Word  -  such a simple creation executed with perfection -  the burger...  No..  The SUPER BURGER.  my husband,  daughter and I were looking for a burger joint in the city while visiting my mom and found ourselves in the Castro/Market  Street Super Burger location.  It is almost always packed with enthusiastic,  wonderful,  and colorful patrons but the long waits are definitely worth it.  The burgers are oozing with greasy goodness (can't ever go wrong with grass fed beef)  and the artisan buns they use are just a perfect marriage. SUPER burger definitely has perfected what a quality burger should be and will definitely find ourselves eating here more often (we took home a menu and apparently they are located all over SF, so we might go to those locations too since parking is near impossible at the Castro / Market St location).
author: April B.

description: Modern interior, very friendly service, good deals. I got a breakfast mini burger which in fact wasn't that small. Great location. Definetely a place worth visiting.
author: Maciej M.

description:
My Order...


--8 oz "superburger"--

w/cheese
w/bacon

--Regular Toppings--

lettuce 
tomato
red onion
super sauce

--Extra Toppings--

avocado
organic egg 

--Fries or Garlic Fries--

garlic

--Extra Points--

They have tax included to the menu to make life easy!
Doesn't say it but garlic fries come with parmesan!
Not a fried egg but sunnyside with runny yolk!
Complementary housemade pickles!
Giving me a pint glass for water and not those wimpy dixie cups!
They have beer and wine!


...Super Duper tastes way better than any fast food joint (let's not forget about the booze!) and is quicker, cheaper, and more casual than a restaurant... You truly get the best of both worlds. Super Duper is another solid burger joint to add to my list. Hands down BEST FAST FOOD BURGER in the city. I will definitely be back!!!
author: Brian L.

description:
I think this is some of the best simple-burgers I have ever had.  Incredibly tasty for such a simple burger.

The only issue I had was that they asked "do you want regular or curly fries' or something like that... So I thought it was included in the price.  It wasn't.  That as a little sneaky.
author: R G.

description: there was a long line when we first walked in, but the service was surprisingly fast and we were ordering in about 5 minutes. my only complaint would be the size of the fries, not that big. the veggie burger was fantastic and I highly recommend. also be sure to order a milkshake, they come in a really cool tall glass, I recommend the vanilla with malt. overall a great experience
author: Kate K.

description:
Too bad they have chosen to add $$ (a hidden cost until you pay) to every receipt for Healthy San Francisco. Either they don't believe in providing health care to their employees or just want to make additional money for themselves. I do not support this practice and I don't think others should either. 
Super Duper, please stop this practice so I can come back and enjoy your food again, I don't care if the burger is .20 cents more on the menu.
author: Bill B.

description: Good burger and fries. Fast Service and friendly. Super Duper Burgers has been a staple in the Castro for almost four years and it's because of the quality and service that keeps them going.
author: joe f.

description: When you get a super duper burger, the two patties and cheese have a different chemistry to just a normal (mini) burger. Do the right thing. Get the super duper burger. Also, I want to bathe in the fry sauce.
author: Lara O.

description: Free pickles! I mean come on! Super Duper Burgers are super duper. Fresh, authentic ingredients make a better burger. You start with one patty or two and then you can add any number of basic toppings. (lettuce, tomatoes, mustard, etc.) Cheese and bacon are extra. My brother added an egg to his. I also highly recommend the garlic fries. Fantastic! FYI, the pickles are on the side next to the ketchup, mustard, napkins, etc.
author: Ian G.

description: Burger a bit too greasy, but delicious any ways!
author: R G.

description: Great place! The burgers are delicious and the garlic fries are bomb.com!!! I love that they make thier own pickles. Overall its a great place to get a delicious burger
author: Brent D.

description:
Pretty good burger.  However, paying $10 after tax, for just a burger, no fries, no drink, fast food atmosphere feels steep.

Not sure while yelp gives this one $.  What is  two $$ for lunch, $20 and a waiter?
author: Anon A.

description:
I used to be a huge fan , especially of the financial district market st. location.
in the last 2 weeks I have been to both. (Financial dist. location being the better of the two) 
Basically, my burger kinda grossed me out and i ate just half of it. way greasy, barely any lettuce and old mushy tomatoes. My garlic fries barely tasted garlicky and its obvious that they use frozen overly salty fries.

I hate to write negative reviews because I am aware that they greatly impact buisness....but how do you think i feel having spent $12 on half a cheeseburger that I didnt even enjoy. Superduper was amazing......2 years ago....not today.
author: L V.

description: I still I love everything on their menu! The menu isn't large they just do everything so well. Best burger and fries in SF. The soft serve ice cream is amazing. After 4 years I'm still going to this place and it's great every time.
author: Art L.

description: Space at the restaurant was a bit packed, but that's jsut a testament to how good the burgers itself are. It was amazing. I had a Burger (no cheese with everything on it with an egg on top) and jee wiz it was awesome. Meat was an awesome medium, and the bread was also soft, the egg was just cooked perfectly to compliment the flavors of the burger, and the secret sauce is awesome. Vanilla malt milk shake was also amazing. I recommend this to anybody looking for high quality burgers for cheaper.
author: Peter M.

description:
If In N Out Burgers had a rich step brother it would be Super Duper. 

The ambience of eating here reminds me of a really trending looking In N Burger. It does cost about twice as much as a meal at in n out. Their burgers are pretty basic in terms of originality but execution is down really well. Meat is pretty taste, although sometimes they serve their meat really oil, probably cause their patties are high in fat. 

There are so many places that try to be different when they can't even get a normal burger to fly. This place doesn't offer fancy up options, but it a good tasting burger.
author: Ryan R.

description: On point!! When I'm in the mood for a quality american classic, doesn't get much better .... Simplified yet savvy menu, taste first attitude -- great atmosphere, always leave satisfied
author: John O.

description:
Super Duper keeps being compared to In-N-Out, which I hate, so that does nothing in terms of appealing to me. But, I found out they serve a Veggie Burger made with a fried portobello mushroom cap & I had to try it. The verdict: it was awesome. A flavorful, lightly breaded portobello cap, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, special sauce & two pieces of extra crispy bacon ($1.50 extra) between a hamburger bun. (I know, it's hypocritical to get bacon on a veggie burger, but I have nothing against bacon...it's the ground beef I have issues with...)

Unfortunately the Veggie Burger was the only good thing about Super Duper. My dining partner & I ordered:
* [garlic fries] mushy, limp, zero garlic flavor, not worth the calories
* [2 brown sugar lemonades] sounded good on paper, but was watered down, super tart & pretty gross
* [double cheeseburger for my friend] i felt so bad that he didn't like his burger b/c I dragged him here! He said it was super greasy & just not very good.
* [chocolate dipped cone for me] $4. I prefer McDonald's soft serve cone.
* Total: $28

I'm giving Super Duper an "A-OK" because I think they've got potential. They were able to execute that Veggie Burger wonderfully; I just don't know how they messed up the rest of their menu. They obviously have a lot of improving to do, but in the interim, I'll be back for their Veggie Burger & nothing else. 

And isn't it ironic that Super Duper is located right across the street from Gold's Gym?! Eat here & you're doomed to spend an extra hour on the treadmill!
author: Fancypants X.

description: This was an embarrassment and I'm done with Super Duper. I have tried them 2 times over 3 years and am absolutely done with them. The first episode in 2013 (at a different location than tonight's fiasco- 4th and Market) was a big piece of gristle in my burger that just about cracked a tooth. Tonight's episode was even worse (Upper Market location.)  When my burger arrived the wrapper was just covered in grease. I picked it up to take a bite and grease just POURED down my hands. I held it out over the tray and just watched as grease trailed down off the burger and puddled on to the tray. I tried one very tiny bite and immediately pushed the tray away and said "no way." My friend had ordered garlic fries and there was grease puddled at the bottom of the little paper tray they serve in, and his burger had the same issues mine had with the grease. I have never just pushed an entire meal aside like that, but I knew I couldn't do that to my body! I appreciate a good burger with some juice, but this was DISGUSTING. I do not understand how this chain remains in business. Their product is downright awful. I've tried two of their locations and had bad experiences both times. NEVER AGAIN ( not even for coupons or free meals.) They just don't know what they are doing. This was an epic fail, and twice! (I know, shame on me for returning a second time.)
author: Michael M.

description:
This place is great!  4 stars means 'Yay! I'm a fan'
....
I really adore this place.  The whole concept is brilliant.  Hat's off to the owners.  

The staff are great!  Very attentive and they keep the restaurant looking great.

Tasty, Tasty, Tasty.  That's what I have to say about their burgers.  The fries are awesome and even have their own made pickles which are incredible. 

They have beer and wine on tap and I love that concept.

Do check out this place next time you are downtown in SF.
author: Don J.

description: This place has gone down hill.  Aweful place to get a pick up order.  They don't only mix your order, they give you an old order when you order to pick up.  Horrible.  I ordered a super burger "$7.75" and french fried.  the fries were not only soaky but been sitting there for quite sometimes.  The burger was not even a super, it must have been someone's order that was sitting for long time and became a mash of ground beef.  Avoid .. just an aweful way of running a business.
author: Kamal H.

description: Yum yum yum! I went here while visiting San Francisco and was so happy. Chicago needs one of these! Ordered a cheeseburger with a bunch of random toppings, with garlic fries, all under $10  I seriously can't complain when food is that cheap and still pretty delish. The place has a five guys type of feel (minus the amazing Cajun fries) but same concept of build-your-own burger.
author: Genie B.

description:
This is by far one of favorite hamburger joints ever.  Every single item I've ever had there has been delicious.  The chicken and hamburgers are totally yummy with a lovely bun.  Their salads are fresh, nutritious with excellent dressings.  The chicken is flavorful and tender.  Love the fries and shakes.

Also, the price is right.  Very inexpensive for quality healthy food!!!

Best of all is that how environmentally conscience they are.  95% of everything is compostable.   The environment is clean and inviting.

I go to the one near Steuart Street.
author: Dina L.

description:
Yet another foray into the hamburger wilderness of SF. 

The signage of this hamburger shop has a certain retro-sensibility to it. Like I could imagine it on one of those old faded ringer-tees. 

The super hamburgers have a nice simplicity to them as well. Although you can dress your burger up in all kinds of things like portobella mushrooms and grilled onions, it's the beef that really stands out in these burgers. It's not often that I can sit there and really enjoy the taste of the beef in a burger, but that was the case when I bit into one of the super burgers here. A juicy medium-rare, with a solid slightly charred crust on the outside. Topped with fresh lettuce, tomatoes, sliced red onions, and cheese, it was an extremely satisfying burger. It's size doesn't quite match up to some of the other burger joints around, but the taste definitely does. I could do worse for $7. Extra for some of the special additions. There's a smaller slider-sized burger, which is essentially the same thing. I think that would be plenty for me next time. 

The fries here were decent. Nothing that special. One of my friends was disappointed that they use garlic powder instead of real roasted garlic on the garlic fries. The dipping sauces for the fries are pretty good, though. Mayo, chipotle, and super sauce. Not sure what the super sauce is, although I'm thinking that it's some thousand island knock-off. A big bonus is the homemade pickles. They are delicious. And I'm not regularly a pickle person, but the pickles they make here are snap-crispy and have a tangy/zesty brine to them. 

I wish i'd had room for some of their soft-serve cones. I saw a ton of people eating them and I so wanted one. Next time. They also had a cookie and cream shake that I would be interested in trying. A little pricey, so we'll have to see if it's worth it. 

Even though the place is not that big, it was surprisingly easy to find a table. Traffic seems to flow through pretty quickly, and the service is pretty speedy.
author: Saunders C.

description: hands down, this is the best burger I have ever had!  I frequent this place often, it is awesome!  The garlic fries are also amazing, as are their housemade pickles.  I had out of town friends staying with me and they ate here like everyday.  I just visited them in Baltimore and they were ashamed to take me out for burgers because they knew nothing could compare to super duper!  I will add that this location in particular has excellent burgers.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Burgers were greasy ... but in a good, juicy and flavorful way. The meat was showing some redness, which I also liked because really, cows taste better when they're not well-done. Decently priced. Fries were good. Very simple menu. Overall, a good alternative to In-N-Out.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Salty, juicy burger with gooey cheese, crisp, fresh lettuce and ripe tomato, all jammed up inside a soft, slightly sweet bun. Melts in my mouth.

I like the fries- hot n salty, with a good mix of crispy ones and soft ones. And the shakes are creamy and flavorful (the chocolate especially).

Bonus: Organic and not expensive.

I wish they delivered because then I could lie in the bathtub and eat burgers all day like a lazy Rubenesque goddess.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Went to Super Duper for lunch a few weeks ago. Standard fare -- cheeseburger, garlic cheese fries, and a soda pop. Under $10 for everything. So far, so good.

The burger was very flavorful, but it was a bit on the small side. Will probably go with a double for the next visit.

The fries were great. Often garlic fries can be overpowering with garlic (Gordon Biersch, for example). This had just the right amount -- present enough to remind you you were eating garlic fries, but not so much that you have no chance of some make out time post Big Red chew. The parmesan cheese was a nice touch, though they could've added a bit more.

The soda - well, c'mon now, that's pretty standard.

Overall, a good meal, and a nice alternative to some of the other fast food joints around. The In-N-Out comparison for burgers is valid, though these are a bit smaller. 

I'd go back, for sure.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
For me, a 4 star review means there wasn't anything terribly wrong with the food, but it also wasn't particularly spectacular, nor did it have that first bite wow factor that causes you to dream about it. And this seems to be the general sentiment amongst the early reviews for Super Duper.

The place was probably 50% full at 2pm for lunch. It was obviously still under construction when I got there, with plywood lining one of the walls. There were a few tables outside on Market St. Inside you had about a dozen tables including 1 large communal bar/table.

I ordered a Superburger (4.75), garlic cheese fries (3), and a strawberry shake (3.5).

The shake was excellent, with plenty of fresh strawberries you could taste. The consistency was definitely more 'milk' than 'shake', but not a bad thing if you want a shake you can drink instead of scooping out with a straw. 

While I was waiting for my burger, another person ordered a choco-dipped cone (4) and disappeared so the worker asked if I'd like to have it. Normally I wouldn't want to ruin my appetite with dessert first, but I couldn't pass up the opportunity to try another item on the menu, especially since the milkshake was so good. And good thing for greediness because the cone was absolutely delicious. It had vanilla & chocolate swirled frozen soft serve inside of a chocolate shell so there was chocolate everywhere.

The burger took about 10 mins to come out. The bun was soft, the meat was fresh, albeit a tad small (slightly larger than your typical In&Out patty?). The extra $.50 to get lettuce and tomatoes was a little annoying but not a deal breaker. I didn't taste any of the 'super sauce' so maybe that's why I didn't think it was anything special. The first time I ate at Trueburger in Oakland, I bit into a burger, got a mouthful of their garlic aioli sauce and thought 'WOW,' but nothing like that here at Super Duper. The fries were your typical shoestrings, tossed with invisible garlic and dusted with parmesan. The fries were pretty good and large enough to share with 2-3 people.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
1) five guys
2) super duper
3) in and out 

I did not put ketchup on this Super Duper Burger. That, is a first. 
That is a Tasty burger.
author: Eva B.

description: Burgers and fries. That's it. Done very well. Oh, and ice cream cones dipped in chocolate. Eat here.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Went here with the bf a couple months ago so can't really remember what I ordered. However, I think it was the chicken sandwich and he got the vegetarian burger. His burger was the size of my hand, which isn't that big, thankfully I thought to myself I got the chicken sandwich because it was as big as his hands, which are big. 

I remember my sandwich good but I'm not really sure about my bf's food, he didn't seem too pleased. It's expensive for what you get, I mean I understand they try and use organic stuff and buy local cage free chicken and free range cow meat but at least give me a little more food. I love to eat, lots of food. And you have to order fries seperately??? NO. I want my fries to come with the burger, but alas I had to order the fries otherwise I'm sure I would have left with an empty stomach. 

Don't get me wrong my sandwich was yummy but not enough for me to go back. If you want a good burger place to go eat at try BurgerMeister which is walking distance from Super Duper. In fact I'm going to go write a review for BurgerMeister right now! 

OH! the milkshakes are pretty good here too.
author: Jonathan R.

description: I've tried their super duper burgers 4 times hoping that it'll decrease in satisfaction. I was wrong, the burgers are amazing each and every time.
author: John N.

description:
3.5 stars so far because I love the geniuses behind Starbelly. I love the simple menu (though I still think they need to cater to Castro clientele a bit more and offer a whole wheat bun/lettuce wrap option and ketchup without high fructose corn syrup!).

The burger itself was decent. A bit on the greasy side, but we were there for hangover fare and it seemed reasonable. By far the best possible burger option for the hood when you factor in taste and affordability. I really like the fries since they were very basic and in-n-out-esque. Also the giant pickle jar where I can select my own pickle...love that!

Bonus points for some outside seating, a super friendly staff, and some old skool jams on the radio.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Good Ol Greasy American Food!  I give their burgers a perfect 10 but their fries more like a dismal 5, which is why I think they have a fancy fries sauce selection - the fries simply cannot stand alone.  *Quick Tip - to remedy the bland fries just stuff them in your burger.  Trust me, it can't get any better than that! 

My order is the Super Burger with Bacon, Cheese, Avocado with Jalapenos Peppers on the side and an order of fries.  Stuff your burger with fries and take a bite of the peppers after taking a big bite of the burger.  It's greasy fat, greasy fat , fat and even more fat and then hot, hot, hot,...damn is it good!
author: Emmanuel F.

description:
Super Duper is a nice blend of nostalgia and foodieism, and a good place to quell an In-N-Out craving.  

We started with a basketfull of the complimentary house-made pickles. I opted for an off-the-menu grilled cheese--basically the Super Duper without the meat, which totally hit the spot.  My buddy got the Super Duper and didn't speak until the burger was gone.  The garlic fries are stupendous and big enough to split, which we did. 

If you aren't in a full-on food coma after downing a burger and fries, the Strauss creamery soft serve is out of this world.  You can even get it as a chocolate dip ice cream cone.  Unreal.  

The folks who run the place are really nice, and they get bonus points for making everything compostable.  Seriously, there are no trash cans here, because everything--even the straws--is compostable.  They're also participating in the ibikesf program, so if you bike there, they'll give you a free soda.
author: Dana S.

description:
I'm super! Thanks for asking!

Not a bad place. Their burgers are high quality and priced well. This isn't going to be battling Spruce for the best burger in the city, but it also costs half as much. 

I was disappointed in our fries with the three dipping sauces. I felt that they were all pretty bland and somewhat tasted the same.

When it's all said and done though, I'd be happy to come back here for another super duper burger!
author: Kevin H.

description:
I've had:

The portabello sandwich with cheese, avocado, everything else, supersauce & fries.
For some reason it's called a sandwich, but burger buns are used. ~ $10

The Super Duper combo + avocado & garlic fries ~ $10

Supersmashed my face into both these burgers, and am happy to report that Super Duper lives up to the hype. Juicy juicy juicy and not a heavy burger that leaves you with regrets.

The fries were oh, oh *french kiss* MUAH! The free homemade pickles were delightfully crunchy. 

If I had any criticism at all, it would be that for Super Duper to be more generous with the avocado. But it should be noted that I'm an avocado fiend and always think "there could be more avocado" for any plate involving avocado.

A great alternative to Gott's Roadside, which is too greasy for me sometimes.
author: Jenny M.

description:
I like the malts and burgers--they are really quite enjoyable. The prices are reasonable and all the packaging is compostable (I appreciate this cool feature)

Unfortunately, the burgers are a bit greasy but I love them enough to keep coming back. 

The staff is helpful and very kind...I recommend this place.
author: Mr. Bill S.

description: So delicious! Burgers were so juicy and delicious! House made pickles are freaking awesome! Garlic fries are amazing! Love it!
author: Leann M.

description:
we heard about this chain from yelp, and seeked it out to experience the hype. we ordered

burger - ok, a little thicker than in & out
strawberry shake - with big pieces of strawberries!
garlic fries - disappointing & oily

would come back for shake!
author: Char Y.

description: A friend of mine described this place as high end fast food, and he could not have been more right. The only difference is, to feed two people at a fast food burger joint, the price could near $15. Here, IMO one $8.50 burger meal with everything plus garlic fries and shake (At this point it stopped being $8.50) could feed two people.
author: renje g.

description:
This is exactly what the Castro has needed for far too long and by filling this niche they will be highly profitable. They strive to be as green as possible with, as far as I can tell, no waste cans and only compost cans available, bonus to all the green geeks among us.  When I stumbled in on a lazy Sunday afternoon around 6PM this place was pack and I was lucky to get a table outside.

I had the Super Burger, fries and a coke. Total $9. The fries are remarkably wonderful and next time will try a large. I was bothered a great deal by the size of the ketchup portion cups because they are hardly 1/4 the size of a standard cup causing more waste as I needed 4 cups instead of two. The burger was great. It was cooked maybe a little more than I prefer and don't remember being asked how well I wanted it done.

The burger was full flavored and not too dry and tinny small and not juicy. This will not come close to filling you up, it's more like a mid-afternoon $10 snack. This joint is not on par with the likes of Pearls or Urban but it's OK and I will be back.
author: Justin S.

description:
Great burgers here. Get the triple patty if you're feeling hungry.

The service is always quick and friendly.
author: Anthony Y.

description: This place is okay.. I've honestly had better burgers. In addition, the staff wasn't that welcoming/friendly. Maybe they were just having a bad day though.
author: Avril-Keyehra M.

description:
This review applies to all Super Dupers and is written for anybody trying to follow a paleo/primal or anti-inflammatory diet.

As readers of J. Safran Foer's "Eating Animals" know, Bill Niman was forced off the board of the Niman Ranch corporation because the shareholders wanted the company to head "in a more profitable direction." So Niman ranch, while never a grass farm, has become an industrial factory farm CAFO. Antibiotics, insane levels of Omega 6, that salty corn fat smell, the works.

They fry up everything else in high-omega-6, easily rancidizing canola (rapeseed) oil. No self-respecting paleo can go in there for more than a salad now.

So Super Duper isn't useful, delicious as it is, if you're trying to decrease, rather than increase, bodily inflammation. You can do better and healthier at home. Or at Dr. Teeth in the Mission (Marin Sun beef) or Prather in the Ferry Building.
author: Matt L.

description:
Oh My Yummy Goodness!
Heard about this place from a random burger loving guy we met at Smashburger a week ago.  Thanks random guy it was a great tip.  We loved the burgers and the fries!  Service and cleanliness were right on!  

Thanks for a great first experience guys we look forward to many happy returns. Parking wasn't bad on a Saturday afternoon, perhaps we just got lucky.

Bonus points for the dog friendly tables out front!!
author: Victoria S.

description: Most delicious juicy cheeseburger I have ever had!! I love this place! Fries were delicious too and the chocolate shake with chocolate chips was perfect! Must have
author: Melissa A.

description:
I love Super Duper, and the burgers at this location were as good as any other S.D.
BUT... we watched an employee use a rag to wipe crumbs off the floor, then use the SAME rag to clean a tabletop, and THEN drop the rag on the counter next to the milkshake machine!  And this was the guy who gave us our food earlier.  We told the manager on our way out.
I'm sure I will eat at Super Duper again, but NEVER at this location!
author: j l.

description:
Yes Please!  Consistently inconsistant, but most often delicious.  

Weekly visitor.  I had to stop myself from licking grease from between my fingers because I worried the staff would think I was making inappropriate gestures.

Sometimes the burgers, as a whole, are dry (A problem I've never had).  And I can't always taste their Super Sauce (A problem she's never had).  But, still I'm a devoted fan.  Thanks Super Duper for bringing me MEAT.

Good Burger
Great Garlic Fries
Great Pickles (Still wish you had small ones to put on the burger)
Bangin' Shakes
Lick-a-licious Soft Serve

Note:  The taste has dwindled over the past 2 years, but its well sourced and a fair price.
author: Princess T.

description:
One of the best tasting burgers I've had! And, their fries complete the meal. 

When their register was going through issues, the cashier lady was awesome enough to give us a soda on the house when we didn't have cash on us, and had to run a few blocks to the atm. :)
author: Iris H.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening to try the burger after looking at the yelp pics.

I ordered a plain burger with cheese ,avocado and egg, I forgot to add bacon.
and the garlic fries my friend loved it
My patty was kinda overlooked and was crispy.

There isn't an option on how we can get our patty, they cook all there patties medium.

This place reminds me of chipotle, I think they support local farms and use free range animals.  To me these two restaurants were kinda bland.

I would rather go to moes burger further in Metreon
author: DOM d.

description:
Like In-N-Out if it sold beer and wine!  The menu is sparse.  There are upgrade options from single to double patties.  No scripture references on the wrappers though.  Solid fast food for any neighborhood.  An amazing addition to the culinary deprived Castro.  Needs to stay open later to really drum up the business since it's way better than crappy pizza.

Super Duper Burger: They didn't ask me how I wanted my burger, but it was exactly how I liked it: medium with a slight leaning towards medium rare.  Apparently this is the default which is a definite leg up on In-N-Out.  The meat was awesome.  Fresh (not frozen) from Niman Ranch from those happy, healthy, organic cows.  I didn't taste much of the secret sauce, they probably need to add more.  The lettuce and tomato were fresh, but the boring iceberg lettuce and slicing tomato variety.  Really liked the bun, just like the one at In-N-Out!

Garlic Cheese Fries: I was worried I'd get some bastardized concoction of nacho cheese and garlic.  Thankfully the cheese was a sprinkling of parmesan on top of lightly garlicked fries.  Didn't see any sautéed garlic so it must have been a drizzle or dusting of garlic.  Was yummy though.  Reminded me of truffle fries, except without the truffle and at a fraction of the price. 

Pickles: Made in-house and free for the taking.  Fresh tasting like a dill spear, but could use some more distinctive pickling spices and herbs.  Way better than the jar stuff.

Vanilla Milkshake: Bland.  Could be thicker.  Not a stand alone reason to come here.
author: Adam B.

description:
CUTE CASHIER! Be on the down low when you see him though, he's a pretty chill guy.

Yummy burgers, good fries, rocking milkshakes. I like the setting. Ooh, pickles.
Good stuff. Possibly best Super Duper in SF.
author: Sophia W.

description:
SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO   D I S A P P O I N T I N G!!!!!!!!!!
I AM DISSING SUPER DUPER, No truth in ADVERTISING

SUPER DUPER was highly recommended by lovely ladies at Aerosoles.  I was going to go to S.F. Center for a Bistro Burger and they touted S.D. that I went.

I was really jones-ing for a great burger.  the place was jammed as it WAS LUNCH
TIME.  The burgers did look really fantastic, fresh and truly like tummy pleasers.

It was all SHOW and NO TELL.  The burgers are really not thick and juicy.
THEY ARE THIN and GREASY!   Yes, everything is fresh and very much a selling point, GOOD EYE CANDY.

The FIRST BITE was an explosion of grease when I chomped down and discovered 
the truly ANOREXIC PATTIES. Yes you get two patties just like a "DOUBLE" at one of the Cheapo-Chains.  These have been dieting far too long. I don't believe there really is 8 Ounces of beef.  Why not make A REAL BURGER with a THICK and meaty
burger.

I would have liked to have tried the garlic fries but they are off limits, once in awhile they seduce me, not often. Maybe they would have been the bomb.

ESSENTIALLY,  THE   B U R G E R S   B O M B ED.
author: ELINOR H.

description: These burgers were delicious! I really appreciate the fact that they have a smaller sized burger. Their garlic fries and pickles were also fantastic! Their seating area is small and can get packed but the table turnover is quick. They had great prices and excellent service.
author: Jessie L.

description:
I came here because my favorite burger place had an unacceptable hour wait and I was hungry. Tells you a lot if a 1 star review comes from someone as hungry as I was when I walked in.
First off, the guy who took our order as an absolute snout. He rolled his eyes at us at least 3 times and threw such an attitude that I was practically stunned and unable to continue speaking my order. I felt like I was being the rudest person alive by daring to bother him at his place of work, asking him to do his job by taking my order.
The garlic fries were greasy beyond belief and utterly lacking in garlic. The ketchup was tasteless - how do get tasteless ketchup?
Then there is the burger. I got the small version with everything and the only redeeming quality was the sauce. It had a great flavor and texture and did a fantastic job of masking everything else.
Next time, I'll fast.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Imagine a burger where you fill up on the burger and toppings instead of the bun! Add a tasty dessert (or two) and you have a great casual dining experience.
author: Brad D.

description:
Super Duper with bacon and avocado, garlic fries, chocolate shake with fresh strawberries.... totally food coma after :) The patties were tenderly juicy, meatily flavorful and pink in the center.... 
If you must compare, more like a burger from Taylor's Refresher than anything froma fastfood joint.
author: Denny C.

description:
Ah, Super Duper...

I have a love-hate relationship with this place. The food is ah-mazing. A super burger with avocado, slathered in super sauce with a side of fries is my default go to option. The spiked cookies and cream shake is not bad also.

The only thing holding me back from coming in here more often are the employees. They seem a little detached, sometimes borderline rude. I get this weird pretentious vibe. (WTH? you guys are a burger joint!) I mean I don't come here for conversation but that super hostile attitude, something about it makes my meal go :(. Oh well, I order take out anyways.
author: Anna F.

description: Good veggie burgers, but this is not about that. This is about how one of their employees (handsome dude, didn't get his name) chased me down when I left without my purse. So. Rad.
author: Annelise D.

description:
you cant find a better burger if you tried.  but why bother trying when the best is right here!  so juicy, so good.
and the garlic fries are insane!!  they leave your breath insane too.. hahah
the people that work here are very friendly and by now they even know my friend and me by name.
i highly recommend this place if youre searching for the perfect burger.
author: beth m.

description:
I gave this place another shot. When I ordered, I leaned forward and really emphasized that I wanted my burger cooked MEDIUM and I didn't want my egg overcooked, I wanted it runny. 

This time, everything came out fine. Actually, more than: just as good as the other Super Duper's in the city. Thanks. You've restored my faith.

Will I have to ask again, next time? I definitely do not want to be "that guy" who goes out of his way to ask the staff to cook his stupid burger to spec.

There's a sign nearby says all burgers are cooked medium, so I shouldn't have to ask them to do their job.  Then again, I don't want to send my food back. Most of all, I don't want to give any grief to people in food service: it's a tough job and the wages are low. 

Quandary!
author: Tim W.

description:
Do I care that the employees can't seem to call my VERY easy name out correctly?  No.   
Do I care that they seem to not give a damn that they have customers?
No. 
Do I care that never get my correct order.  Yes.  When I finally break down and get a damn burger...I shouldn't get a Portobello Mushroom sandwich instead.   
4 stars for a decent burger (when i can get them)
-2 stars for possibly the most solipsistic service in town.   I guess I do care about the first two things after all.
author: Kristian C.

description: Great place !! Really nice veggie burgers service was fast in less than 5 mins my plate was in front of me and I was chowing it down like crazy it was absolutely delicious I used to go to slider bar across the street for my lunches but I am gonna start coming here it was that good !!! A fabulous place
author: Prerna V.

description:
I have Super Duper a few times per week for lunch.  I always get the chicken burger, so this is a chicken burger-only review.  (I feel countless eyes skipping to the next review.)

It's quite delicious, and I'm almost always really satisfied with the meal, but for 2 small issues:

- 1 out of 20 times the chicken is so tough that I would have to chew it for 10 minutes in order to get the signal from my brain to swallow.  These are unfortunate days when I have to throw out my chicken burger.

- There is quite a lot of bread involved in the whole shebang.  The bun isn't an air-filled fluffy one, it's a hard ciabatta bread, so I feel kind of like I'm having a helping of bread with my lunch, as opposed to a burger involving a bun.  Hope that makes sense.

Overall you'll probably be happy you came.  Oh, and the soft-served ice cream is good.
author: Evan B.

description:
These guys serve 8-oz burgers for half the price charged by fancier places like Umami Burger (http://www.yelp.com/biz/umami-burger-san-francisco#hrid:Ruw1p1pogHPgqcUVSv9zYA), Marlowe (http://www.yelp.com/biz/marlowe-san-francisco-2#hrid:w8g9QwFaVxhEgYt7u5CjHw), Godfather (http://www.yelp.com/biz/godfathers-burger-lounge-belmont#hrid:4pxAjONJ00wUTN0a8Xz4Cw) or *sigh* Burger Bar (http://www.yelp.com/biz/burger-bar-san-francisco#hrid:oNne1fPu651q_EE88mOyZw).  Simply put - it's a Marlowe burger with Wendy's price - something that is seemingly impossible but, I guess not!  

The ingredients are super high quality - toasted bun, fresh ground beef patty (two if you order a Superburger), tons of free toppings to choose from (lettuce / tomato / red onion / grilled onion) and even more additional toppings (bacon / cheese / fried egg / others).  The fries are the kind that I like - extremely crispy shoestring fries, great with ketchup and mustard.

I'm experiencing a Pavlovian reaction as I'm writing this - mouth starts to water and stomach starts to grumble.  I'd better cut this review short and go get myself some food.  

Later!
author: Ange L.

description:
They got some pretty good burgers here. I always get one with the egg.

The only thing I hate is looking for parking.
author: Bobby L.

description:
I've read most of the reviews on this place, and for the most part I find that they're pretty accurate.  Note:  If you're here, there's a likely reason for it and that reason probably involves alcohol.  That's okay though!  My friends and I have come here many a night after Happy Hour at Badlands or the like.  A burger from this place is not small --  so it gets the job done. Also note that this place is one of those Hangover cure places.  I attribute this to the fact that... well... you're eating beef wrapped in grease.

Ambiance:  What can I say about Super Duper?  It's a burger joint, but with an oversized menu and a pleasurable color scheme.  The menu is pretty extensive. What happens upon entry is that you get to choose between a small or larger sized burger.  You then pick individual ingredients to add to your burger, such as bacon, avocado, etc.  It's not unlike The Counter a la Santana Row and other locations. There is also a self-serve soda machine and the bathrooms are relatively clean for a fast food restaurant.  I found it enjoyable.  

Service:  Like many a fast food restaurants, this place has you order at the front from the oversized menu overhead.  You'll then have your name called and they'll hand you your tray when you come up to get it.  Beyond that, don't expect much service.

Food:  The burgers here are probably nicer in presentation than anything you'll get at Burger King or McDonalds.  I enjoy coming here over either of those places, but it still doesn't really stack up to In n Out in my mind.  That being said, such a comparison is based on TASTE.  If we're going for simple size, I dare say that Super Duper burgers are bigger.

TIP:  This place can fill up, so if you're with a friend, have them sit down while you order.

TIP:  Both the garlic fries AND the sweet potato fries are worth trying.  Try the three-types of dipping sauce too.

TIP:  If you're really watching the calories, the chicken option is worth exploring.  They ALSO have a Vegetarian option, just in case your or one of your friends doesn't eat things that used to have heartbeats.  

TIP:  A link to the current menu! http://www.superdupersf.com/pdfs/SUP-Menu-1011.pdf
author: Bryan H.

description: I know a lot of folks geek out on their juicy, almost-as-good-as-In-N-Out burgers, but really... If you're a fan of milkshakes, you gotta get in here ASAP. If you've yet to try the cookies and cream varietal, you haven't lived!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Super Duper Burger truly lives up to it's name. The burgers are super with a side of duper. You love duper. You crave it. You wake up in the middle of the night calling out..."DUPER!"

All the food here is excellent. Get a Super Duper with everything. Get a veggie burger. Get some garlic fries. Block the ketchup while you fill up in the pickles. Drink tea, drink Coke Zero. It's all good. 

Eat your burger and watch everyone pump away at Gold's Gym. 

Best burger for the dollars and cents that you work for everyday.

Treat yourself, you're super and you love some duper.
author: Jason L.

description:
Burger was greasy and slightly overcooked, 2 stars. Fries were hot and fresh, 4 stars. Milkshake was satisfying but a bit oversweet, 3 stars.

Average of these: 3 stars.
author: David C.

description:
I've eaten at Super Duper for three days STRAIGHT and quite possibly going onto a fourth time later today. I don't think I've done that at any place in the world besides my own house! As much as I love Sushi Zone, the wait is way too long for even twice in the same week. Txoko is my new favorite "formal" sit down restaurant but it's pricey and parking is horrible. Super Duper is cheap, right in my neighborhood and is the best burger I've ever EVER had.

Sorry to In-N-Out, Burger Bar, Umami, Bradley Ogden, McDonald's, Pearl's Deluxe, Hall of Flame, Burger King, Jenny's, White Castle, Shake Shack, etc. you guys just don't compare. Yes, I've eaten a lot of burgers and those are just to name a few.

I was actually not impressed the first time I ate at Super Duper but this was when they first opened. Since then, they've redone the recipe for the hamburgers and bless them for it because it is now not only SUPER DUPER juicy, but has just enough grease to make the delicious beef flavor linger in your mouth. It's a hot mess with special sauce AND melted cheddar cheese dripping down. The toasted bun and accompanying lettuce, grilled onions and tomatoes are fresh and play wonderful supporting roles. You never think wtf there's too much lettuce, I can't taste the meat! 

Fries are amazing too and I'm not just saying that because I love their burgers so much. They're thin cut with the skins left on and always hot and fresh. You need to get an organic soft serve Straus vanilla cone after your meal. Coming from an "ice cream over soft serve" kinda gal, this says a lot. They're also open until 11PM EVERYDAY. And if all that wasn't enough, everything they serve the food with is COMPOSTABLE! YAY for being good to the costumers AND to mother earth. 

I LOVE YOU SUPER DUPER! You know this is for real because I haven't used this many caps in a long time.
author: Julia T.

description: Best burger joint I've ever been to! If you haven't been, you should go! You might spend a few more dollars then you would on a McDonald's meal but it is totally worth it. Their fries are killer! BANGIN fries...
author: Michael R.

description: I love this place. Zamir and Jed are the bomb. They actually remember my order and remember my name. That's real quality service that's hard to find from a burger joint that feeds thousands a day. Easily in my top five burgers in SF.
author: Matt G.

description: I love this place! House-made pickles are the best. Only issue was my friend from out of town got super duper indigestion!
author: Katelyn C.

description: I reluctantly went to the Castro Super Duper with my meat eating friends thinking I would be stuck with a dry veggie burger or worse.  To my utter pleasure and surprise the veggie burger option is fantastically flavorful.  The fries are good.  And if you're lucky to go on a night when the tall handsome guy is behind the counter you'll see what excellent service is.  I will definitely go back.
author: C. J.

description: Besides Pearl's, this is my other favorite burger place! Their burgers are quite flavorful and prepare to have napkins on hand, because it drips! I totally recommend the garlic fries and milkshake!! It can get quite packed, so waiting is normal, however worth the wait! The atmosphere is pretty open, and if it's really busy, seating can be hard to get. But it's cool, cause it's SUPER DUPER yummy. Yeah, I just did that.
author: K N.

description: Delicious organic ice cream! Great fries and burger. A perfect place with kids and/or friends. The staff is very nice. I've been there over and over and it has always been the same great experience.
author: Frances G.

description:
Over rated place.
Garlic fries: 4 stars
Burgers: 2.5 stars.
Not that good, can't compare to shake shack.
author: Casey H.

description:
Best. Burger. Ever.

Hands-down, full stop. 

And Willie Brown concurs. When I had the pleasure of having lunch with him, the topic of burgers came up, and he said it was the best HE'D ever had, and he goes there 2-3x a week. The man is much older, wiser, and worldly than I, so I take it that he knows what he's talking about.

Seriously, I had to go a revise one of my Yelp lists for this place, haven't been compelled to do that for any other list.

Out-of-towners clamoring for me to take them to In-N-Out now get diverted here.
author: Ches W.

description:
I stopped in for a quick take out yesterday during the pouring rain. 

The staff was really sweet and the veggie burger so SOOOO good! I added Blue chees. I got the fries with the 3 sauces but when I got back to work I realize they forgot the sauces....I wanted to cry. But the rest of the food was amazing.

Make sure and grab some of the home made pickels! 

I will have to come back to try the cookies and cream, shake! Looks to good not try!
author: Alicia K.

description: Seriously! I honestly do not think it's too much to say that these are the BEST burgers I've ever had in my life! Clean tasting and juicy meat like whoa! I can't wait to go back!!!
author: Amber D.

description:
We decided to stop in for a quick bite.

I got a mini burger with cheese, "everything on it", jalapeño pepper, grilled onions and pickles, added an egg. The burger was decent everything was cooked nicely. 
Their housemate pickles were okay. 
Garlic fries were good. 

Overall, good stop for a burger fix.
author: Annie D.

description:
My wife treated me to a cheeseburger at this place for my birthday.

That's all I wanted, really. No fancy restaurant for me. Their burgers, fries and soft-serve are made with all natural ingredients and no junk like MSG or high-fructose corn syrup.

There are a few tables out front on the sidewalk and it was a nice evening so we took our meal out there. That's when the doped-up dude came along and showed us Mr. Wang.

He stared at me first and smiled, seemingly mesmerized by my good looks or something. Then he stumbled toward us and all I could think was, "No dude, please go away.. don't talk to us, we're having such a good time and you're just going to frack it up.."

He was about 25 and dirty, with a closely shaved head and clad all in black-leather except for a pair of loose-fitting jeans that found their way down to around his ankles as he walked up. He didn't seem to be aware of it at first and smiled like a little kid as he approached and waved at me. "HI!" he said.

It was disconcerting to have this guy's dick within about two feet of my wife's cheeseburger. I don't really think that's happened in our twenty-two years of marriage and it's a stretch even for San Francisco. Hell, even for The Castro District. Usually the standard naked guys don't walk up and wave their wangs at people having a meal outside, but as I said, this guy didn't seem to be aware that his pants had fallen down.

He must have seen the expression on my face, which probably looked like I was about to remove his appendage with my knife if he didn't do something about it right quick, so he glanced down and then yanked his jeans up while apologizing. Then he sat opposite us and stared at my wife.

"Please don't join us," she said. "You weren't invited."

"Oh I'm sorry, I was just waiting for a friend!" His eyes grew big as if he'd just been scolded by his grandmother, then he looked at me and smiled again.

"I'm really, really sorry.." he stammered. "But you look like Jesus." Then he turned back to her. "So you must be.. MRS JESUS!"

Just then a door opened next to our little sidewalk table and a guy came out. "There you are!" he said to our guest. Come on up.."

They went through the door and headed upstairs, with Mr. black-leather dude glancing back a couple of times while continuing to smile as he tried to convince his friend that Mr and Mrs Jesus were sitting there eating cheeseburgers right by the front door.

In LA we once had a homeless guy come up and act like a dog. He begged for a bite of my burrito and then lifted his leg and peed on the bush beside me. In San Diego I once had a bum give me change, saying that I looked like I needed it more than him. 

At Disney World, my wife was stalked by an autograph hound who thought she was Shelley Duval, and while in a restaurant in Medford Oregon one evening, someone sent a bottle of wine to our table because they thought she was Alanis Morrisette.

But only in San Francisco have we been flashed and then mistaken for Mr and Mrs Jesus. God, we love this city.

Four stars because the burgers and fries were pretty good and the floor-show was quite entertaining. But the soft-serve was kind of runny that day. Perhaps the dude melted it?
author: DW R.

description:
My stomach was feeling The Hunger grumble grumbling and right in front of my face my eyes see super duper burgers.  

With a very easy to build your own burger menu it was very quick and easy to create one of the most delicious burgers I have ever eaten in San Francisco.  Although they did not ask me how I wanted it to be cooked ,  the burger turned out to be mouth watering in every bite, and that's with only the Secret Sauce.
