The bonus treat treat that gave it its 5 stars was the HOMEMADREPICKLES..  a defenite yummy in my tummy!!
author: Erik D.

description: This is a very good burger joint.  The buns (one of the most important elements to any sandwich) are delicious and hold nicely.  The meat is hand patties of quality beef.  Nice house made mayo and sauces.  Easily my favorite sub-$6 burger in SF.  Oh, and the fries are fresh and tasty too.  The house pickles are great too.  If you are looking for a high quality and not too expensive burger this is the place.
author: Eric S.

description:
Just your average hamburger joint.

Burger- Salty, not too exciting
Fries- good
Vanilla Shake- Icy, not creamy or natural tasting
Pickles- Good
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
More like super duper greasy burger. 

Okay, they have pretty awesome salty fries, which I like, I like my fries salty. However, their burgers are greasy. The milkshake was okay. Nothing special. 

Love the concept. Its like chipotle but super duper. Minimal and simple menu is great, especially for those who cannot stand reading a menu with an empty stomach. But this burger joint just didn't do it for me. 

I would like to try their soft serve ice cream next time.
author: J C.

description: I took my little cousin here while we were in San Francisco for Carnival. The burger I ordered was small yet perfect. I also ordered fries. I did get full and I was happy that my party was so fresh and not greasy. Its a nice fast food restaurant with really great customer service.
author: Ka'Desh C.

description:
Found this place on yelp while walking around the area. Sometimes I like to eat vegetarian when I feel like I've been too carnivorous so I went with the portobello burger. I was a little disappointed when I got it and discovered the portobello was fried. There goes being healthy. But wow- best portobello burger I have ever had.  It was just as fulfilling as a real burger. But maybe that's just me. 

Also, the pickles come with your meal. I was confused because other reviews made it sound like you had to order it. So I was looking real hard at the menu. For a while. Haha.
author: Susan C.

description:
Juciest, most delicious burger I've ever had. Regret not getting the egg on top of it. 
Afterwards, saw a nude man strolling right outside in the middle of December, but the burger was that good I only realized after he passed by I just saw a penis. Can i say that on yelp?
author: Joe H.

description:
BEEF IS NOT GRASS FED. That having been said, Niman Ranch is okay, if you want grain-fed beef, although they will allow GMO ingredients in the feed. A better option than McDonalds, but don't think you're doing your body any big favors by eating here.

My rating is not a commentary on the taste - the burgers are definitely good. I just hope to clarify a misunderstanding about what you're actually consuming when you eat here.
author: David B.

description:
5 Stars for the Veggie burger. It had a fantastic texture where the outer layer was crispy and the innards were very veggie. Not only was the texture great, but the taste was really awesome for a veggie burger. 

I was really happy with the fact that they server organic food, and that they are REALLY green with their compostable packaging. 

I really wish that they had the cookie-pecan pies. There was a painting on the wall that showed cookie-pecan pies. But maybe that's better for it not to be there since it's swimsuit season anyway.
author: Rosie M.

description: The burgers here are so juicy and delicious. So fresh and flavorful. I really enjoy the chicken sandwich as well.
author: Cat T.

description:
I love this place but I have to admit I've never even had one of their burgers. They have a chicken sandwich that I tried the first time I ate here, and I liked it so much I haven't been able to order anything else on subsequent trips to Super Duper Burger.

I love going somewhere that is busy/bustling, it somehow always makes you feel like you are doing something right since there are other people there doing the same thing.

This place is always pretty busy, but the waits aren't usually anything unbearable.

I plan on trying one of the burgers very soon, since I go here (probably) more often than I should.
author: Gary M.

description:
Went to the city to visit a friend and we decided to yelp and find somewhere to eat. Super Duper Burgers showed up on my results due to having pretty good ratings. We walked down market for a while until we realized that we had long passed it. The store sign is white and not very vivid.
Once inside, we were greeted by smiling staff. They were very warm and helpful in helping us decide what to get, because it was all of our first times at SDB. I enjoyed the friendliness and helpfulness we received.
When we got our food, I was uncertain about whether I would get full off my 6 oz. burger. The guys all got 8oz burgers and for a moment I regret not doing the same. However, more than halfway through we all felt very full. The little burger was so dense and compact that it was more than a meal itself.
More onto the quality. The patty was very juicy indeed. They usually cook their burgers medium rare but I asked for medium well. The cheese is additional (typical at most burger places but I never understood why). And I also added avocado for $1 which is reasonable. The overall taste was great. The aoili complimented the flavor of the burger very well, as well as my pint of Great White (my favorite!) The only thing we did not entirely enjoy was that our burgers was a little too greasy... Too greasy that my brother had a few drops that stained his pants after it leaked off his food. :/ (And yes, it was the grease because I saw it with my own eyes.)
author: Vicky H.

description:
Burgers are a basic necessity and a good burger is so easy it can earn a fan in a heartbeat.  

I have been going to Super Duper since it opened. Its a welcome change to the neighborhood, and while I worried with Slider Bar opened, clearly they have nothing to worry about.

The burgers and chicken sandwiches are always tasty and fresh. There was a short period where the burger seemed a little greasy but that seems to be resolved.

I love the slowly evolving menu. The newest editions of shakes and malts with fruit makes for a nice sweet addition to any food time.

Service is easy, seeing as it is all self serve and the kitchen is pretty fast.

I wish they had an on-line ordering option so I could order in advance and swing in and pick it up or eat in, without having to wait at all, but that is just the way I like a fast paced world.
author: Jim H.

description: Garlic fries are Delish!!! It is a must have here. The service was wonderful and the atmosphere was nice.
author: Sothary C.

description:
It doesn't get any more organic than this and love the sustainability emphasis. Grass...what cows are supposed to eat!

We go here at least once every couple of weeks. Superb!
author: Candy T.

description:
Heaven on Earth for a burger fiend like myself.

I loved all of the add-ons, despite the fact that they were a little pricey per individual ingredient. Also, that trio of dipping sauces for the fries wasn't too bad either (Super sauce, Chipotle & Homemade Mayo).
PLUS, this place has some unique shit going on that I enjoyed:

+Extensive sundae options! You can add CRISPY BACON to your sundae...go ahead and try to tell me that ain't awesome.

+Not only do they have bomb milkshakes, but you can get them SPIKED. I want to say Super Duper gets the 5th star just for that.


Will I be back? You bet your sweet ass I will.
author: Bree P.

description:
Good, but pricey

I was out shopping in the area randomly, so I asked my sister [local] where a good burger place was, so she suggested this to me. Decided to give it a try. It's right next to the mall, so it's not a big journey after a shopping trip.

First off, the decor is pretty cool and modern, similar to the feel of a chipotle (purely on decorations). So it feels very inviting to crowds today. The flow of traffic is a little confusing for new customers, and I mean a little, not impossible, but I was a little confused in getting my food at first.

The menu is pretty simple, but because it is labeled "Organic" it is pretty pricey, making it lean toward medium priced food. Certainly similar to what you'd pay for at chipotle [purely on price]. When I try new places, I always try to get the most popular menu item at its most "Vanilla" state, so I got a regular super burger with cheese. It didn't take too long to be ready (wasn't too crowded when I got there).

The burger was pretty good, definitely comparable to other burgers in the same price range. I can compare it to Habit and Smashburger in taste and quality. Oddly enough, they're all pretty evenly greasy. What set this apart from the other two is the "Special Sauce", no idea what's in it, but it's good.

My friend got the ice cream cone, once again, pretty expensive because of the "Organic"-ness of it. Strictly his opinion, it was alright, nothing special. I haven't tried it because I couldn't really afford to buy it.

In conclusion, if you haven't tried Super Duper yet, it's definitely a good burger joint, but it's definitely something that I would get from time to time, purely because it's a little expensive for my pocket. Check it out!
author: Robert O.

description:
CAN I JUST SAY
HOLY MOLY!?!
Huge burgers that will definitely fill you up and are quite delicious.
Rating a 4/5 because burgers are a little salty for my taste.
Otherwise, yummy & organic everything!
author: Analleli G.

description:
I'm not gonna lie, I am a burger fan! I've tried The Habit Burger, Five Guys, and just all burger joints but this place brings me at home! From the sesame bun to the cheese to the meat/beef! Oh my gosh it just taste Super good haha.

Simple and fresh ingredients are key to a good burger and this one is worth trying! I always get the meal deal which is around ten bucks which comes with a burger, drink, and fries. Try the garlic fries! The special cheeses and toppings really compliment the food! And did I mention the unlimited free pickles? Haha yes its delicious!
author: Melissa U.

description:
Visiting SF with friends and in the mood for a good burger.  Thanku again YELP community!  While there, I saw two other customers had ordered the fried egg on their burger.  Looked yummy and I was feeling adventurous.
 
Got the regular burger (the Super is 2 patties) with cheese, grilled onions, fried eggs and the special sauce.  WOW!  The egg is prepared over easy, so OK, think breakfast steak and eggs.  I enjoyed every single morsel. High quality meat; seasoned well; cooked to perfection.  1derful!
(I only gave a 4 because everyone in our party of 3 agreed the fries were pitiful and didn't deserve to be served with the amazing burger.)
author: Planted S.

description: Another of this smallish chain.  I had the chicken sandwich this time, which was pretty tasty.  The Castro location is pretty small, but seats a decent number.  They have the standard Super Duper menu: burgers, fries, shakes, ice cream, chicken sangwiches, etc.
author: Brian B.

description: I don't like fast food much, however, supper dupper is the only fast food restaurant that I like the most.... The garlic frieds are supper delicious. ;)
author: Chiem E.

description: Great place for a AWESOME burger. You walk in and it was very busy, which usually means a great place to eat. I loved the glass for your drink. I fries were great and the burger was juicy, great garlic flavor, a little too grease but if it is not messy it is not good; right?! The only down fall was the floor was dirty but I blame that on being so busy... Highly recommend if you are in the area!
author: Erica T.

description:
Went here for lunch today while touring Castro and had a great, quick and cheap meal. Three things I like!

I had the Super burger with fries and a drink and the entire meal (with tax) came to $9. Not bad and the portions were solid without feeling too overstuffed. The restaurant is small but counter service helps turn people over quickly and there is a mix of individual and communal seating. My burger was perfectly cooked medium rare and all of the ingredients played well together so I didn't feel like I was having too much of one thing with each bite. 

I got to try have a bit of the Pilsner on tap too and it was good, but didn't try the Amber or the soft serve, but I would definitely go back to try it.

I also love the simple modern meets vintage feel of the place too. It was colorful without being cold.

I would definitely go back and get ice cream next time :)
author: Jessica B.

description: Ate here for lunch today for the first time, wasn't impressed. Burgers have a good taste but wayyyy too greasey. And I like greasey. Trust me this is crazy greasey. Like grease everywhere. Fries are good though.
author: Ryan S.

description: We went to the wrong chain because my google map wasn't working well. Still it was good too. It would be better if it's bit saltier.
author: Ilhoon J.

description: the garlic fries are amazing. heads up, you'll smell of garlic the entire day :)
author: Robert N.

description:
Yes, super duper! I think I could've eaten two of these. Great mix of juiciness, flavor, seasoning and condiments/adds to the burger....everything except the onions and jalapenos, adding cheese, bacon and avocado. Definitely a rookie move to not add the egg though!

I got takeout a few hours last Sunday night, a few hours before heading on a redeye to NY. Sure the decision might seem strange to you, but my thinking was to fill up and sleep more quickly on the plane. Did it help? No. Would I do it again anyway? Heck yeah. Next time I'll have a shake and/or drink for sure. 

At least I ate the french fries, which were excellent. And while I'm on the subject, folks, please consider this tip from a lifelong lover of burgers and fries: let the burger drip on your fries. We know that fries cooked in certain oils (duck fat) taste even better. If you like the juice from your burger, then why not on your fries too? Just something to consider.

One more note...every employee at Super Duper who talked to me was very nice. If I have to wait, and why wouldn't I wait at a great burger place in an incredibly convenient location, then please provide a nice experience at the counter and in the restaurant. And thanks to all those who did! Definitely will be back, and I'll bring newbies with me.
author: Mike H.

description:
If you want a burger, this is the place. It's the best burger I've had in San Francisco - and the price is fantastic! I've paid more for worse burgers (e.g. Burgermeister). The meat is really juicy and yummy, and the cheese is melty and delicious - all around, great quality ingredients, prepared beautifully. The only thing I didn't like was the bacon ice cream sundae, but I told them I didn't like it, and they gave me a new flavor sundae, no questions, no extra cost.

I like that they don't have a million options - pick one or two things and do it right. And how!
author: Amanda F.

description: Good burgers. Recommend the mini unless you're really hungry. The soft-serve ice cream is delicious. The milk shakes were a bit disappointing.
author: Heather R.

description:
Super duper indeed! The portabello sandwich ($5.50)? THE MUSHROOM WAS DEEP-FRIED! Feel free to take a moment to take that in. Boy was that thing delicious. All the ingredients were so simple and fresh - absolutely wonderful.

The garlic fries ($2.75) were super garlicky and delicious. Some fries were better-looking (read: crispier) than others, but the flavor was solid all around.

Just a great joint for the slow-fast-food craving. I'll be sure to grab some dessert next time, too.

Oh, and yes, the sandwich was a little bit on the wee/smallish side. Don't get me wrong - it's PERFECT for me in terms of portion. But it's dawned on me that I'm on the wee/smallish side so someone normal or non-wee in size/stature/appetite may find it a little, well, little.

Bonus 50-stars for having everything compostable!
author: Chung N.

description:
Not the greatest burger I've ever had, but then it's pretty reasonably priced. I got a super burger with the super sauce. Couldn't really taste the super sauce so I can't comment on that. 
It's nice that you can get free grilled onions even at a fast food place. I know some full service restaurants that try and charge for these.
The fries were okay.
Points for having Racer 5!!
author: Steve P.

description:
I've gotta remove a star since they removed the best sundae ever. You could get Strauss soft serve with every one of the topping choices - chocolate syrup, brownies, cookies, pecan pie, and bacon bits. The candied bacon was so good with all of the chocolate (the best sweet bacon of all of the trendy bacony desserts). When the new Super Duper opened on Market I noticed they didn't offer the sundae so was thankful the original location still served it... but no more.

Also removing the star cuz the restaurant is starting to look more run down, women's bathroom not clean. But I hadn't had the burger in a while but took a bite tonight - juicy, flavorful, beefy as ever!
author: Mimi L.

description:
Nom nom nom nom! I love Super Duper. Here's why:

-fast and friendly service
-lots of topping options
-GARLIC FRIES
-housemade lemonade
-homemade pickles (YUM)
-casual and friendly atmosphere

You should definitely try Super Duper! I've also been to their location on Haight Street, which was an equally good experience.
author: Larissa A.

description:
I loooovvveee this place!  There are tons of good burger joints in SF but this one takes the cake.   

 Everything is delish! I love that they offer a mini burger as this is plenty for me with fries as a meal.  

Excellent quality of ingredients

The price can't be beat. You can get an entire meal for under $10!  Other burger joints are $10 just for a burger.  

Thank you Super Duper your the best!
author: Serena T.

description:
So much can be said about this really wonderful burger haus, and for starters let me say that the owners did some real homework on this perfectly executed burger joint.  Kind of a grown up version of In 'n Out with more meat and some unique twists and flourishes.  A simple menu with great touches that will keep 'e coming back starts with their standard burger offering which is a tightly wrapped package with a great special sauce spread, toasted bun holding two patties each with a slice of melted cheese, some onion, tomato and lettuce put together in a way that is making my mouth water many miles away.  This meal comes with some mighty fine thin, crisp fries in a little basket.  I usually order their housemade ginger lemonade which is so good, and they keep large jars of house made pickles that are delicious for the taking.  

They make some fine milk shakes and floats as well as offer smoothie type ice cream and home made cookies and desserts.  The staff is always friendly, helpful and attentive, the place is kept clean and stocked with all that is needed to make the best impression on their customer and they have well thought out indoor and outdoor seating that can make for some nice people watching along Market Street across from Gold's Gym Castro location.  This is truly a great burger, do yourself a favor and make a bee line over there and try this heavenly burger.
author: Stu S.

description:
I am craving a mini burger right about now!

The garlic fries was also delicious - the burger was so juicy...! My friend ordered garlic fries and they were done perfectly - I do hope to head back soon!
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Came here for dinner with my boyfriend's mom and my boyfriend before we went to the 49ers game. My boyfriend's mom was curious how the food was and we knew theres one next to the new Metreon/City Target. 

We ordered the mini burgers (my boyfriend's mom and I had no cheese, while my boyfriend ordered the one with cheese), garlic fries (for them - dont like garlic), and a cups of water for us. 

Decent place. Theres an upstairs space for extra space to eat. I heard the place is popular and this place is the new one (Chesnut is always busy). when we got our burgers, and the fries; they were hella good. The juice from the meat wasnt dry at all -super juicy. I ate my burger quietly - usually If I dont talk when I eat, means I love/like it (according to my boyfriend). I finished the burger first. And craved for something else. So I got a swirl soft serve ice cream cone - kids size (just incase I can't finish it). 

We probably would come back again when were near by.
author: Gen M.

description: I love this place! You can't get better than this with 7 bucks in ur pocket. The burgers are amazing. I think the super duper is a bit too heavy for me, since it's a double patty cheese burger. I always ask for one veggie patty and one regular beef on my super duper burger. I'm a meat lover but their veggie patty is some of the best I've had! Awesome joint! Along with some garlic fries and homemade pickles, I'm happy camper!
author: Bonnie L.

description: I am very disappointed with the service I have received. I ordered a plain chicken burger with only bacon and cheese. We waited about 20 minutes. Our food came out and of course my plain burger had EVERYTHING  on it. FULLY loaded. I then went back and told them that I requested it to be plain and they refused to fix it. Extremely poor customer service. Will not be returning.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Pricey burgers, but it was still good. 

I love their homemade pickels. 

Tried their malt chocolate shake. It was really good, but i had chunks of malt powder in mine that was not too pleasing. 

I come here after work with my bf when we are craving burgers and fries and are too hungry to wait to get back to daly city.
author: Erica L.

description: Just got delivery from here via Postmates.  Awesome burgers, and great garlic fries.  Score would be higher, but they didn't include the regular fries with the combo meal that we paid for (they were on the receipt so this is on Super Duper, not Postmates).  Even with the screw up though, we'll be customers again.  Great food.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Had chicken sandwich. All the components were good, fresh. They don't do much to it to elevate it. Fries are really good. Simple menu and the price is half that of Burgermeister, which is a refreshing change for the neighborhood. Only charge .50 more for cheeseburger. 

Want them to do more with the ingredients but at this price-point you can't expect too much.  I'll keep this place in mind for my list of standards during the week but it's not a place I'd take out of town guests.
author: Adam P.

description:
I came here for dinner the other night with the boyfriend.  I ordered the mini burger and he got the chicken sandwich and we shared some fries and a choco-dipped vanilla soft serve cone.  Both were fantastic!  The burger was super juicy, perfectly cooked and delicious.  The chicken sandwich was phenomenal.  I usually don't care for chicken sandwiches because they're all dry and blah, but this was still juicy too!  I didn't quite care for the soft serve though.  I wish it was a smidgen sweeter.

Overall though, it's one of the better burgers I've had in a while.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: I am a burger enthusiast and my first time at Super Duper was SUPER DUPER. I ordered the Super Burger combo with 3 Dips and I enjoyed every bite of it !  The burger was super juicy and the 3 dips were all tasty. With each different dip, the fries tasted even better! And let me say, the fries were perfectly cooked and seasoned. The home made pickles are superb. FYI, the chain is consistent with the outcome of the food. The Market Street location food was equally great to the Castro location. The only difference was the slightly better customer service at the Castro location because the food was brought out to my table.
author: Leonora S.

description:
I've had Super Duper on my radar for the past few months and finally made it here on my lunch break today.  I love the fact that it's super fast service.  100% Niman Ranch all natural beefParking can be tough in the area, but I lucked out today.  Next time I'll just hop on muni.

There's the 8oz super burger & the 4 oz mini burger which is similiar to a single or double burger.  I almost got the super burger, but sure am glad that I did the mini.  It was nice to be able to finish an entire burger without leaving left overs.  

Mini Burger $4.50
Cheese $0.50
Organice Egg $1.00
Lettuce, Super Sauce & Spicy Pickles
author: Stacey L.

description: Came here because my boyfriend LOVES burgers. I'm not a big fan of them but this place was pretty good. I enjoyed the organic strawberry milkshake & the garlic fries as well. Will come back!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Amazing juicy burger, fresh toppings, delicious homemade pickles, and awesome garlic fries. I like pride myself on knowing a good burger and Super Duper is easily the best I've had in San Francisco
author: BP R.

description:
I'm little late to jump on the gourmet burger chain bandwagon but I'm glad I got on at Super Duper. The burger was tasty without being fussy and everything was supersized. A huge leap up from fast food without the pretentious of a fine dining burger. 

Good things about Super Duper
+ 2 sizes of burgers 4 and 8oz. Having the "mini" size is great especially if you want to order fries and a shake and not be filled up. I found the price to be consistence with the quality and size but neither I nor the French Spouse eat the huge portions lots of Americans expect.

+tasty veggie burgers. The French Spouse liked her's a lot and being veggie for almost decade, she's eaten a ton of them.

+late hours, in a city where most places close the kitchen at 10 they serve until 11pm. Wish it was even later......

+shakes and soft serve ice cream made with local organic strauss milk. Usually I don't give a crap about organic but when it comes to milk it really does seem to make a taste difference and strauss has some real tasty milk.

+causal clean decor that wasn't overdesigned or fancy but still clean and modern.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
My coworker is a big fan here, so we all decided to give it a try.

Mini burger: My coworker said it's just OK.
Veggie Burger: It's a bit dry.  The patty looked burned.
Chicken Sandwich: It was tasty and juicy.
Milk Shakes: Good
Garlic Fries: Good
author: J L.

description:
IF YOU'RE VEGAN, BE MINDFUL THEIR BUNS ARE NOT.
I find veggie burgers to be probably the least appealing menu item out there, but since this IS a burger joint and I had heard good things about theirs, we gave them a shot. After calling and confirming their veggie patty was indeed vegan (many have egg) we headed over. I asked the girl at the counter again, just to make sure and she assured me it was vegan and after trying it, I was pleasantly surprised! Really good!! I also liked the free pickles and the fries were crispy and yummy too! 
Fast forward two months to our next visit (I told you, I don't do veggie burgers often), we walk up to the counter and just because I'm a freak, I asked about the burger again, just checking. The server said it was, but he informed me the bun is not...it has egg in it. I said no one told me that last time I ate here when I specifically asked and he just said, "yeah?" 
Whether the person who helped us the first time didn't know or just failed to mention the egg in the bun doesn't really matter. I won't be going back unless I feel like eating a veggie burger wrapped in lettuce. Yeah...no.
author: Susie D.

description:
Drooooool... my mouth is watering just thinking about the burger I had here last weekend!

I popped in for lunch and got a Mini Burger (4 oz) with grilled onions, point reyes bleu cheese (costs extra, but worth it), and their signature sauce.  The burger, plus a drink, plus tip came to just shy of $10, which I felt was fair.  I used to eat at Burgermeister quite often and a comparable order was usually between 12 and 13 bucks.

Overall, I was very satisfied with my meal.  My burger was juicy and tender, and the toppings were great.  I also grabbed some of their awesome complimentary homemade pickles to chomp on between burger bites.

So yeah, the burger is greasy, but if you order a mini, you have a little extra wiggle room for unhealthiness... right?

Right???
author: Katelyn M.

description:
I've been on a burger kick, there goes my cholesterol!  I was dying to try this place especially since I was in the area.  Also there aren't many restaurant options near shopping and open on the weekend.  Prices are semi reasonable.  

Mini burger w/ cheese.
I realize it's not brain surgery but only until after I ordered I figured out the 2 lists: Free and Extra Charge.  If you want everything - then it's only the underlined items under free...see it's confusing right?  Well basically I didn't order what I intended - jalapenos & grilled onions.  The burger was bland.  The special sauce - didn't even know it was on there.  The bun was just ok.  Since I've been on a burger kick this place didn't meet my expectations.  If I do visit again I would add a fried egg, and potentially the gorgonzola.  

The fries were nothing worth mentioning.  The dipping sauces sounded  ok, but not interesting, so we didn't order.  

However, the shake was SOLID!  I ordered the chocolate w/ fresh strawberries - WOW!  My gf who recommended this place loves the cookies n' cream because it has real bites of chocolate chip cookies.  *Note the shakes are made w/ soft serve.*  YUM
author: Meredith K.

description:
Holy hamburgers Batman! Finally, a burger joint that delivers delicious burgers at a cheap price. There's so many places in the city where you get a dried out burger at an inflated price -- and it's still pretty good because it's a freaking burger. However, Super Duper does it right. The meat is flavorful and juicy, tons of good cheese options and other toppings, friendly staff and epic-looking milkshakes (I haven't tried one yet). 

Super Duper bucks the trend of bad Castro food. Get over here post-haste if you want to get filled up with tasty meat (and don't want to pay the $3 cover at Badlands).
author: Aaron V.

description:
Good fast food burgers right on Castro. Had to try this place out and I wasnt disappointed at all. The burgers are nice and juicy and their chicken burgers arent bad either. 

If youre in the area and want good comfort or fatty food then this is the spot.
author: Tim M.

description:
OK, the menu has been changed.
The new menu is,
4oz hamburger
and
8oz hamburger.
That's it.
But still got me confused.
I said to my self, "Hey, wait a minute, I want a double cheese burger, Is the 8oz double?"
Yes, it is.
But I found a small paper menu by the casher said "the combo menu"!!! 

If you are like me, fatass guy who thinks all hamburger should be a double patty, this 8oz Hamburger Combo with Cheese $10.50 is a good deal.
It comes with fries and soda.
I like the hot burger with nice meltin' cheese and crispy bun.
I like the skin-on- fries too. it seems healthy, I basically don't care healthy or not, but I like skin, any skins, sliced-pig ear-skin is good, I like fried chicken w/ skins, I like bbq-salmon skin.
I've never even got circumcised.

I like the pickles too, it nice and crunchy.

I like the small cup for soda.
I always think why all fast food place are giving such a large size cup for soda?
I think drinking soda that much will kill you.

This is great place for a quick meal.
It is a fast-food joint but it isn't like in-and-out burger, BK and Mac kind.

I like the place because the burger is GOOD.
VERY GOOD!!!
author: Nobu K.

description:
My first visit, af the Castro location, was a firm "meh." My second visit, at the downtown/Market St. location, was markedly better.

I had the "special," a two-patty burger with fries and a drink. And the burger shot up the scale of one of the better burgers I've had. Nice and juicy, it had a nice char on the outside and tasted quite good,not at all being overwhelmed by condiments. It was served nice and hot. The bun held the burger well. 

The fries were just average. And while it's nice to provide real glass glasses for the drinks instead of disposable ones, the selection of drinks on tap is too paltry. Specifically not having any non-carbonated options is just wrong.

Like Jeffrey's, Super Duper offers free pickle wedges as add-ons. But these I found far too spicy, the spice overwhelming the dill taste.

The "special" was 50 cents off ordering the items separately, making a burger, fries, and a soda just over $10. Not at all bad for downtown. Yes, there is a bit of a wait. But there's plenty of space. And I got lucky with my view on my visit; it was the beginning of Fleet Week and I sat next to a table of Japanese sailors. In fact, it looked like Super Duper was quite the Fleet Week hotspot. 

This is definitely a burger I'll go back for.
author: Chuck M.

description:
Super Duper... but for what, exactly?


The burgers were juicy but the flavors were collectively bland.

The garlic fries... (which were on the brink of greatness) fell short because they were served cold *wink wink

The free in-house-pickled pickles were charming.  The menu was extensive too (i.e. shakes, chicken sandwiches) but if the basic burger and fries killed the first impression then I'm not interested in a second date.  Next please.
author: Diane N.

description:
Good food,  but soooooo slow.  It's "fast food" with fresh ingredients made at a very,  very slow pace.  Just don't order the veggie burger as it is very, very small and the veggies are ground beyond recognition.   

I never order in person - order over the phone and swing by 15 minutes later when it's ready.   

My go to order is: chicken burger (nice piece of grilled chicken) with grilled onions, portobello mushrooms and avocado...it's delicious but I just can't give any more than 3 stars to a fast food place that's actually slow!
author: Jeffrey E.

description:
I had: Mini burger with Avo. & Garlic fries with sauce.

Burger was delicious! I think the ratio between the buns, topping and patties were perfect. Buns were just firm enough and not floppy, patty wasn't too greasy, Just perfect! That's all I can say :)

You can never fail ordering garlic fries, but with Super Duper garlic fries with 3 additional sauce, you won't be bummed. The 3 sauces are homemade mayo, chipotle, and super duper sauce. Get them!
author: Yuki A.

description:
My favorite burger place EVER! My recommendation: Veggie burger with hummus, "Everything on it" except for the Super Sauce (not vegan btw), add avocado, then add mustard on it (yourself)! OMG!

For the vegans: the portobello sandwich is not vegan. But don't worry! Try their veggie burger! It's amazing!
author: Philip R.

description: There isn't special about this burger. HOLD ON before shooting me! The burger is exactly what you expect from a burger..juices running from the meat with just the perfect tinge of pink and grease soaked up by the sesame bun. The burgers here are your classic burgers made with super duper quality ingredients. I guess the only thing that is different is the sauce but other than that, it's the burger you grew eating. Your mouth and tummy will thank you. It's familiarity made with quality ingredients. Don't be deceived by the mini burger, it isn't so mini. You also don't have to break the bank for a meal here. Your clothes might not like you too much if you become a frequent visitor...but it just means new clothes.
author: Eve C.

description:
While most people on Yelp are foodies who have learned to write about what they eat, I'm the opposite: I'm a writer who's learned to eat so he can Yelp. 

Don't get me wrong. I love eating new and fancy foods. I will try anything once. But if you said, "Hey Jared, you have two choices for dinner tonight: mussels marinated in a savory white wine sauce coupled with sautéed spinach and grilled thyme-flavored Clavela Blanca potatoes... or a fat ass burger and fries," I'm going to choose the FAT ASS BURGER.

                             \
Burger + Fries    \    anything else
                              /
                            /

I've been to Super Duper twice and both times I've left thinking "man, this is a GREAT find. I need to eat here more!"

I'd even be willing to argue that this is hands down the best burger north of 17th... and east of Castro, west of Sanchez, and south of 15th.

It's easy to miss as you walk past it in the Castro with a small sign and dwarfed by all the boom.boom.boom clubs around, but seek it out you must. With an interior Jetsons' feel, it feels classier than a diner. But not pretentious. They just serve burgers and fries and milkshakes and they do it well. And as a bonus, everything is recyclable/compostable.

You pick your burger and then select your toppings that come in two categories: free and even-more-delicious things you have to pay for. Most recently I got the Super Duper with lettuce, grilled onions and grilled peppers. I was a little disappointed that they put mayo on as a default, so make sure to say "NO MAYO" if you don't want it (ketchup & mustard is waiting for you in pumps near the fountain drinks).  

The burger was hearty and juicy, the bun was grilled Goldilocks style and the fries were surprisingly good. Somewhere between In-N-Out and regular fries. 

Similar to Ron Burgundy's feelings about his team, I give my hats off to this place. You truly are "super-duper! Way to go! Neat-o, gang."
author: Jared S.

description:
Why would anyone give them 4 stars? They're amazing! The burgers are so fresh and juicy and perfectly huge. Mmmmm... burgers... I had avocado and cheese on mine. The fries were great too, I'm glad I ordered my own. 
Next time I'm really excited to try the shakes & chocolate dipped soft serve cone! I can't believe there is somewhere in the city that has them! Now we don't have to go to the Boardwalk when the urge to sink my teeth into that waxy chocolate which is bound to chip and slide off the towering cone of ice cream, waiting to be devoured. 
Excellent, quick, delicious.
Also,  has anyone else noticed that Crispy Bacon is an option for an Ice Cream Topping?!
author: Mary Ella D.

description: Unfortunately we didn't have a good experience. They were out of their homemade lemonade and my burger turned out way too rare for me.  Maybe next time things will be better
author: Win K.

description:
It was love at first bite for me with this place. Husband and I stopped in here for a quick dinner after walking n shopping for hours at Union Square. We wanted to try the mexican place in macy's but it was shut and we were too tired to look for another place - so Super Duper it was.

We both ordered the veggie burger - mine wrapped in lettuce and husband's in their bun - and we both loved it. The patty was greenish inside and was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. It reminded me of the burgers we get back home in Mumbai. The veggies were fresh too though I would have liked some more on mine since I was just having the burger in lettuce. It was also kinda smallish in size but given the yumminess of it I can forgive them for that. The burger came out piping hot which added to the taste.

We also had the fries which were just about ok - I prefer my fries thick and these were super skinny.

Overall, it was $15 worth spent and cant wait to be back. I wish there was a super duper in San Jose where I live.
author: Bindi S.

description:
Unimpressed.  The quality of the beef was clearly high up there, but I didn't like the way they seasoned it.  Admittedly, this is a personal preference thing, so you may love it.  The fries were great, and I have previously had their soft-serve ice cream- fantastic.  Aside from my underwhelming burger, I was not impressed with the service today (but, on my previous visit for soft-serve it was great).

I'll come back for ice cream, and will maybe try some of their non-burger items.  I think this will end better for me.
author: Nora S.

description: We ate at the Castro store.  I had the grilled chicken breast sandwich.  My friend had the burger and fries.  Both were excellent.  I just couldn't get over the cost - $10 for a burger.  It  just seemed like a lot of money for a burger.  I guess I'm still not over it.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Bacon topping on
A super duper sundae?
Two greasy thumbs up.
author: Austin M.

description: I give this place 3.5 stars. It was our first visit here and the burgers were pretty tasty. I like that you can customize the burgers and I don't eat very big portions so I liked that they had a mini option. The only downside to the burger was that the bun was really small?  My boyfriend got the super super burger and added an egg which he said was really tasty but the bun didn't even cover the meat. Everything was spilling out of the burger? Loved the garlic fries so I think I'd come back to try other things on the menu.
author: RN R.

description: Mini burger is homemade-like perfection; it makes me feel like my abuelita just fired me up some red meat heaven in one of it's most outstanding forms. Yesssss. No one likes creepy cookie cutter looking beef patties - right?! El chocolate milkshake is seriously seriously muy seriously the best thing I've had since my lesbian moment a couple weekends ago. Fries are thin but delicioso, and I love pickles but don't love theirs so much. Mini bummer but I can get past it for the sake of that good chocolate lovin'. Anyway, so glad I live only a couple blocks or so away. Indulgence at it's effin best. That's what's up, mijo.
author: Natasha P.

description:
Have been to Super Duper burgers a few times in the last couple months. Is a good reliable, no frills hamburger fries place with a spare simple ambience.
My 1/2 lb Niman ranch meat burger was juicy with all the 'fixins' (lettuce tomatoes, onions, pickles, sauce etc.). The fries were crispy and there are unlimited refills of fountain drinks. The cost is what you would expect in a place like this. Mine came to about $11.50 including tax. Not quite as generous portion as BurgerMeister close by on Church but BurgerMeister will run you about a dollar more for the same thing.
author: Armando H.

description:
Decent burger at a very reasonable price.  I was in between a 3 and 4 star on this place but settled at 4 due to the service and reasonable prices. 

Standard ridiculous line due to the hype of being a new place.  The burger is very greasy.  Very greasy.  The fries are okay but nothing great.

 I've been there 3 times due to the proximity (I work 2 doors down) and I would recommend getting there before 11:45 if you don't want to wait 20 minutes to order and another 15 to get your food.

Make sure you get some of their homemade pickles that they have near the drinks.  

I plan on getting the veggie burger next time hopefully it's not greasy!
author: Andy O.

description:
Super Duper is definitely both super and duper, but it's not quite perfect. 

Because I consider each part of a good burger to be equally important, I'm going to break down my Super Burger w/ cheese by ingredient: 

Super Duper Burger ($8.00)

Bun - Soft and grilled, so it was a tiny bit crispy.  Not overcooked.  Not tough.  Not the most flavorful bun I've ever eaten, but it wasn't unpleasant or distracting in any way. 

Spread - I guess it was some kind of special spread.  It was actually really delicious.  Tasty, but not overpowering.  I couldn't put my finger on what exactly it was, although it was definitely mayo-based.

Lettuce - A leaf of butter lettuce, not too big.  I hate when places put the thickest, worst tasting leaves of iceberg they can find on sandwiches.  This was not that.  

Onion - Not a fan of uncooked red onion on burgers, so I took them off.  I can say they were thinly sliced, which I appreciate. 

Tomato - A nice slice of a good tomato, cool but not cold.  Soft, but not falling apart or hard. 

Cheese - A pre-sliced cheddar.  Nothing spectacular.  Melted well, not to the point of liquidation but thoroughly melted through.

Beef - Very good.  They advertise the quality of their meat pretty frequently, and it's true.  Their beef is good.  They cook and season it well, although it might have been a tad salty.  Not sure if it was the meat or the spread.  Either way, it was a quality burger. 

The most interesting thing about the burger was that it was a "smashed" burger, which means they put a ball of beef on the grill and smash it down as it cooks.  I love burgers like this, because you know it's not a frozen patty, and the cheese melts into all the little nooks and crannies in the meat. 

Bun - See bun.

Verdict - One of the best "fast food" style burgers I've ever tasted.  It's also a "smashed" burger, which really is great.  I think those are awesome.  It's on the small side for a burger that costs $8-10, but there's a lot of meat on the super burger and it doesn't need to be any bigger.  I was pretty full after the burger, half of my fries, the cone, and some lemonade from my house. The quality of the meat really comes through in the taste.  One bite and I was going, "Oh, yeah.  Yay.  Yes."  

Fries - The best way I can describe the fries are if In & Out and McDonald's had a fry baby.  They're AWESOME.  They're the same quality potato as In & Out, with the skins attached, but they're a little bit greasier and saltier, like McDonald's but not as gross.  Definitely recommended. 

Vanilla chocolate-dipped cone - It's good for soft serve, but it's still not real ice cream.  Pretty standard for a dipped cone.

Overall verdict - If you like no frills fast-food style burgers, this is likely going to be one of the best ones you'll eat.  Their fries are great.  Prices are reasonable, but not bragworthy.  I saw a LOT of people drinking the shakes when I was there and almost all the reviews mention them, so I imagine they're good.  Worth visiting.
author: Jace P.

description:
Everything about this place is...well...super duper. 

When I found myself with a day to play in SF, I turned to my trusty Yelp to help find some amazing places. And when I was pointed to Super Duper, Yelp proved - once again - not to disappoint!

There are so many things that I loved about SD - let me outline them.

Decor:
Oh. Em. Gee. This place is adorable! The colors were very modern, and everything was very comfortable and clean. 

The people:
These are some of the nicest folks. Ever. Period. Everyone was genuinely nice and helpful, and they made some great suggestions.

The food:
Everything here is local and organic, and they just get it right. I had a burger, fries, and a glass of wine (from tap!), and everything was fantastic!

The price:
Ummm....all that food for less than $15? Whoa. 

If I were to open a restaurant, it was be exactly like Super Duper, and I think that's the best compliment I can pay.
author: Bryant M.

description:
If I may quote from Samuel L. Jackson: "This IS a tasty burger!"  
Damn, this place is good.  The price is right, the quality is top notch.  I mean, I can't think of any place - high end or low brow - that serves a burger AS HOT as this.  I don't mean spicy hot, I mean fresh off the mother-f**kin' grill HOT, like TEMPERATE, like wow that s**t is HOT.

First off, big bonus points for ANY burger joint that allows adding a Fried Egg as an option.  I'm a big fan of this, big proponent of the marriage of egg and burger.  

[side note: in France, they call a hamburger with an egg on top Steak Hache (like hash steak) avec (with) Oeufs (eggs) a Cheval (literally on a horse.)  No, it's not horsemeat you loud American.  The egg is "riding" on the hamburger, like a jockey on a horse, capische?]

Love the fries, love the secret sauce, like the option of grilled onions or raw onions and really love the buns (an oft-overlooked aspect of fine burgerlery.)  

My only complaint - and I'm not usually one of these guys who cares at all about atmosphere - but it is F**king LOUD in there!  I mean, Kee-Ryst it's noisy.  As if it was DESIGNED to be echo-y.  I cannot imagine someone walking in there with a bunch of kids, forget it.  Maybe if it wasn't all metal and concrete the noise level could be more livable?  Maybe it was a conscious decision on the part of the owners to get people in and out quickly?  'Cause I guarantee you, when I'm done eating, I am getting the HELL out of there just so I can hear myself think.  

The pickles?  Love that they're free, but they are too sweet, too sugary for my taste.  I prefer a more traditional (German / Jewish) salty or vinegar-y pickle.  Their pickles have that sort of classic Vlassic flavor, which I'm sure appeals to Southern Baptists and the like, but it ain't floating my boat.  But, hey, they're FREE, right, so I mean, quit complaining already.

Should you go?  You should go.  You should eat.  You're looking a little thin.
author: Invisible J.

description:
Super Duper's menu is simple, just the way I like it for a burger joint.  I don't need any fancy schmancy burger menu with things in French or words that I need to Google in order for me understand what it means.  I just want the basic components that make up a delicious burger.

The Super Burger (8 oz) is comprised of 2 patties.  I added cheese and bacon which cost a bit extra.  This burger is really juicy and moist which made it delicious.  At the same time, it's greasy as hell.  I'm assuming that they're using 80/20 ground beef (80% meat, 20% fat) which would explain why it's so juicy & greasy.  The patties were cooked perfectly, not too pink and not over done.  Overall, a good burger.  The fries were fries, nothing to comment about.

If you look at their menu, it says "Our burgers are cooked medium and are very juicy . . . . could be messy business !!"  They are on point with this statement and I 100% agree.
author: Suzi K.

description:
Super Duper is in fact...well...Super Duper...yesssssssss.

I had been intrigued by the restaurant that was behind the cheesy klassic plastic ice cream cone on Market street for the longest time. It always caught my eye just cuz it stands out just like a pink umbrella in a sea lion park. As I hauled my drunk ass past that ice cream cone of craziness night after liver killing night, I realized that I just *needed* to figure out what was up with that restaurant behind the sign.

I also need to say that I'm not the biggest burger-at-a-restaurant guy. The biggest reason why is because I can make some impressive panty dropping patties on a grill if I find myself behind one. So, burgs at 'straunts have a pretty high bar to jump over. However, just like a spandex clad olympic gymnast made out of silicone, the super duper burger slides right over the competition and into first place.

Its hard to describe what made the burger so awesome, but it was really just a perfect blend of flavors. Nothing stood out, nothing was silent. It was one harmonious meat chorus playing at my lips and down into my stomach. The bun was a perfect pairing - not too boring, not too crunchy. In a word, LOVE. Probably the best burger I've ever had in SF (yes, even beating out my own).

Maybe it also had to do with the infinite homemade pickles (win!). Or maybe it even had something to do with the fact that I walked out of this place for under $15 for an epic meal (burger, fries, and beer). I wasn't a giant fan of the cafeteria feel, but that's really a minor gripe for an otherwise sweet eats place. I'll definitely be back!
author: Sean C.

description:
This location was really empty on a rainy weekend. It was still hard to find parking, but luckily we got parking on a nearby residential street.

The burgers were good with good meat and fresh veggies. This place reminds me of Trueburger in Oakland, but not quite as good. It is still one of the better burgers I've had around the city. 

I wanted to try the shakes, but they are really, really expensive!
author: Annaliese D.

description:
The portobello burger here is so effin' good. It's lightly breaded, giving it a delightful play in texture. I recommend it with "everything on it" and swiss cheese. Don't forget the garlic parmesan fries. YUM-O.

Well-designed, affordable and delicious? That's all I want in a dining establishment.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Children's mustard. 
They only have children's mustard.
That acrid, bright yellow, finger paint-lookin' stuff.

Why is it brighter than the sun anyway? 
Hint: if it wer'e yellow because of the mustard seeds, then other mustards would be the same color.

Don't get me wrong, I love tumeric-tinged yellow curries, but this stuff? Ugh.

Even ball parks have always had the next step up, Gulden's or a generic "brown" mustard. And I'm guessing they have a dijon these days. But this yellow kids' stuff? In this day and age? In this city? In this neighborhood? There are more chihuahuas here than kids. (Yes, we brought our kid, but she's not into mustard at all yet. Or food that requires teeth.)

If you were selling boiled-water hot dogs to kids at the zoo, maybe there's an argument, but high-end Pollan-approved meats and beer on tap? Don't try to tell me you're a kids-only place.

And don't gimme the "one ketchup, so one mustard" argument. 

You're doing just about everything else right. I'm not asking to get rid of the yellow stuff, just give people with grown-up palates a choice.

If you say, "no one else complains," well that's not a real high bar you're setting, nor does it tell what they're thinking, and wishing. Put out some real mustard and see which moves faster. 

You're Duper but not yet Super.
author: Brian C.

description:
Is this the best Burger ever? NO.
Is this a DECENT Burger place? yes. 
 
I don't mind to come back at all. It's a fun concept burger place to dine in. 

But I do not know why.... (from my experience with this place) I feel like the cashier at typical fast food restaurants are a bit nicer than this ?
author: Dom G.

description: Super Duper won me back. Order the burger medium well and go for the ones with the sauces like the Philly cheeseburger or the jalapeño. Nice!
author: Jim S.

description:
This place has really yummy homemade pickles! I think I was more excited about that than the actual burger....but the burger was good too. 

I got the mini burger and I think that's a good portion for a great price. The meat was nice and juicy and I added alot of stuff in it that was delicious too like all the free veggies. The fries where nice and crispy and hubby and I were both well fed for less than $25 (he got the super burger). 

I was really full so I couldn't try their milkshakes even though I really wanted to get the spiked one! So I must come back for that soon. Overall, this place DOES live up to the hype. I'm glad I live across the bay cuz otherwise I'd probably be eating here an unhealthy number of times.
author: Ireri L.

description:
If I'm gonna get heart disease from eating red meat than this is the spot that I will do it at! SUPER DUPER = BOMB ASS BURGERS! They could actually change their name to this but that would probably screw up there yelp reviews. 

Anyways, great grass fed beef, cheap, fast and delicious! I got a double (1 lb) bacon cheese with avocado and an egg and fries. Total was 13.50, not bad for all the fixing I added. I shall be returning! Count on it!
author: Ethan S.

description:
*ice cream review only*

Marvelous ice cream- vanilla and chocolate. So creamy and does not have a lot of ice in it, doesn't melt right away. You can get a chocolate dipped one too. But I heard it's hard to eat.
author: Ally W.

description:
Things to note:
-Great tasting burgers
-Unlimited free pickles
-crunchy fresh fries
-Fountain soda
-Soft Serve
-Generally quick service
-Outdoor seating
-Good prices
author: Julia D.

description:
After hearing much about the famous burgers and soft serve from Super Duper I decided to finally try this place out. Walk in to notice that there wasn't many open spots available so we sat awkwardly close to some other people. Not knowing what to order I took the cashier's suggestion for a regular Super Duper Burger. In my opinion the burger was over priced and sadly made me disappointed. The one plus was the fresh pickled pickles! Those were delicious. I came back up to get some soft serve which was okay. I think that the hype about this place is a lot more than the place is worth. I would rather grab a burger at Harvey's or similar places. 

Not saying that the food was terrible but there were other choices that would have been better.
author: Ezequiel R.

description: Super duper greasy.  Over priced burgers and shakes. This experience actually made me sick and I ended up feeding my dogs with the burger because it was so greasy and gross.  It was cool that they had garlic fries but a far cry from the ones you get at the ball park.  Overall the place was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful.  The food left a lot to be desired.
author: Roman R.

description: Just awesome. Fresh, tasty, juicy. Great beers on tap and friendly folks. Always come here when staying in town , the line moves fast and they keep the place very clean.
author: Karl S.

description:
My bf and I thought this place was going to be off the hook..the best I can say is that it's alright.

It's got a nice atmosphere going on. The wait to get our food was pretty short. The staff were friendly enough. My chicken sandwich was okay at best. The garlic fries were extremely potent! We got a free soft-serve cone with our meal which was pretty nice. Their organic soft-serve is quite delish. 

Would I go back? Lets just say that I wouldn't make my way out there just to get it.
author: Jaimie S.

description: This burger was just o.k. Not sure what all the big buzz is about here ?! Yes the burger was very juicy but lacked in flavor. Sesame seed buns should only be at micky d's and the cheese was'nt dripping like I like it. Worst of all the garlic fries were soggy and not very garlic'y. Really people ? This place is the bomb to you ?! Not
author: Carlos G.

description:
Fast food set-up, but high-quality food. 

The menu offerings are simple: burgers, fries, salads, ice cream. Vegetarian and non-beef alternatives. Local, sustainable, routinely tickled animals. Burgers cooked to order. Low prices. Quick service.

Definitely coming back here.
author: Mandy H.

description: Burgers that melt in your mouth! So good! Their special sauce, soft serve, and fries are also to die for. Best burger joint in SF
author: heather m.

description: I went here and got a chocolate cone and it was delicious!  Zac was my cashier and he's awesome.  Thumbs up!
author: Cynthia B.

description: Nothing so super about these burgers.  People raved about this place, so I finally got an opportunity to try it out for a combo post-mommy day/late hubby bday dinner.  This space is small, but the turnover rate for seating is decent.  When you walk in and wait in line, all the seats are taken.  However, by the time you get your order, you'll get a seat. I ordered the mini burger with cheese and garlic fries with three sauce.  The garlic fries were good, but the sauces weren't great...The burger was blah...i couldn't taste the special sauce...nothing special about it.  I guess it's a little healthier than your mcdonalds because it's not too greasy, but it's nothing to rave about.
author: Lisa W.

description:
We each ordered the super burger (2 4oz patties), which at $6.50 is a real bargain.  It actually seemed much bigger than 8oz.  Added bacon and cheddar for another $1.50- go big or go home less full.  The meat is über-juicy, cooked perfectly and bursting with beefy flavor, so much so that it overpowered the other ingredients.  Come to think of it, despite ordering the burger "with everything on it" (lettuce, tomato, super sauce, grilled onions, red onions, jalapeño peppers and pickles) it felt like what I ate was 2 patties, bacon and cheese on a bun, not that that's a bad thing.  It's a darn good burger, like eating fresh cow.

We tried the garlic fries and the fries and the 3 dips for $1. The dip portions were a little on the light side, but I really dug the chipotle mayo. Garlic fries were good, like what you'd get at the ballpark but like, better. And cheaper. And crispier. So actually they're nothing like what you get at the ballpark.

Finished off the fatty-fest with a sundae. Not worth the $5.

Yes parking is a pain, but it's the Castro
author: Alex R.

description:
McDonald's meets In-N-Out meets Pearl's.
This place serves up some great tasting burgers, all free-range, grass fed beef with a slice of cheddar cheese, fresh veggies, super sauce (almost like a ketchup-aoli - creamy but not too rich), and those INCREDIBLE artisan hamburger buns! Perfectly spongy, almost borderline slightly crusty on the outside, golden brown, with that yeasty scent and buttery flavor!

Also, I really loved the lemonade. I don't know about the brown sugar - but it was perfectly diluted and sweetened. Not to mention the french fries were bomb diggity - it was the artisan version of McDonald's fries - crispy, creamy, thin, salty but without artificial flavoring.

BTW, I tried the famous soft-serve ice cream. I thought it was pretty good, but not worth $3.25. And the adult sized cones are too much ice cream.

The decor is charming, the people are friendly, and the restaurant is like a litle neighborhood. I will definitely be coming back here again, now that I know where this place finally is. I have been hearing of it for ages and never remembered to come in. This is definitely a great find!

I just wished they had American Cheese to put on my burgers!
author: Y K.

description: If you haven't had a super duper burger, you haven't had a super burger. The menu is clasic, get your burger, and pair it with fries and a beer and you've sold me on your lunch!
author: Steve L.

description: I've been hearing about how great this place was and decided to give it a try. It is a cute place and the service was pretty nice. We ordered the minis and side of fries. As we waited for our food, we scouted for a table. The place is quite small but tables moved quickly. The burgers lived up to the hype! The meat was really tasteful and savory, almost melts in your mouth. Downside of it, it was a bit too small, defintely will get the other one next time. The fries are one of the best Ive ever had. They were a perfect crsip and had just enough seasoning. all in all a good burger place!
author: Rene L.

description: We're still going back to Super Duper Burger and I can say I'm a fan.  Reliable burger, good fries and lots of options like special condiments for dipping your fries. Compostable, responsibly packaged to go orders too.
author: Cynthia A.

description:
I was craving a burger on a Friday night, so we decided to walk a few extra blocks to try this place. I'm impressed by the all the different choices on the menu that SF seems to demand (vegetarian, turkey burger, portobello, whatever) but when it came down to the classic beef burger I had, it just didn't do it for me. This thing was literally dripping fat.. I put an extra napkin on the table and by the time we were done the whole thing was soaked in the oil dripping off the burger. 

I don't want to kick this place to the one-starred curb yet. I think a differently patty may be better here. Also, their milkshakes are malted. If nothing else, I'll be back for one of those, and the fries with dipping sauces.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I went here with my bestie from SF and boi did i LOVE it. Like can you picture this:

BIG JUICY MEAT BETWEEN TWO WARM BUNS SO MOUTHWATERING YOU GET WET?

It was that good. This was not your ordinary burger. No. It was hot right off the grill and jumped head first into my mouth. The slight oils accentuated the taste and the meat was just so moist and juicy. We ordered fries as well and that was yumz. Firm, but yielding. The fries was a natural and obvious compliment to the meal. Pickles here are (maybe were?) free here (it's not at the counter though). It has a nice bite to it. Man do i love my pickles!

After this meal, I also had a chocolate dipped cone. OhMaiGahd it was so creamy. I devoured the slowly melting shaft and lapped up the remaining drops. 

I really like the vibe of this place and everything is spot on. Worth the trip!
author: Vincent L.

description:
My friends who were new to town actually stumbled upon this place while visiting the city. They took me when we went back together and I can now understand why they loved it so much. The menu is pretty straight forward, which is nice. The girl who took my order was very friendly and we had a nice conversation while she rung up my order. 

Just a forewarning: the Super Burger means two patties, the Mini Burger means one. Though the Mini sounds small, it is just a regular sized burger. 

I recommend the shakes and the homemade pickles they make on the premises. Overall, my meal was delicious and everyone in my party enjoyed it.
author: Elise M.

description: Niman Burger anyone?  The location is great for just a good priced burger, thin French Fries (reminds me of McDonalds), "help yourself" pickles.  I just like that they have a Mini Burger, just the right size.  Would have loved to get an "Organic" soft serve, but just got too full with a side of Garlic Fries.  The place is loud and crowded, but a good spot to stop after all the shopping and running around.  They have a combo Mini, fries, and drinks for $8.  I like the bun.  It doesn't disintegrate into a overly wet blob.
author: Helen L.

description:
Pretty great burger, you can even ad an egg to it.

Garlic fries were great, burgers were juicy and amazing. If you want a great burger, for sure go here.

Milkshakes aren't too bad either.
author: Apricot N.

description:
BEST BURGER IN TOWN without a doubt!
I have had burgers all over SF from the most well reviewed locations and from word of mouth, but Super Duper is the tastiest.
author: Mario M.

description: My family and I stopped here before heading back home to SoCal. We had made it just in time before the lunch time rush. The burger isn't anything too crazy. I had a mini with everything on it plus added bacon, grilled onions, and jalapeños. But the garlic fries, man! They were extremely delicious. Slightly disappointed because the garlic fries came in small portions so my boyfriend had to go up and order 3 more orders because there were 7 of us. The man that took our order was polite. The place is very cleaning and I like that they're a green establishment. I also loved the location.
author: Alexis Aubrey P.

description:
FREEEEEE PIIICCCKKLLEESSS.. you get one, you get one, we all get spicy homemade pickles!!!

Ohh yeah the hamburgers are pretty darn good too. All the fixin's in a casual setting. Plus the fries are nice and crunchy. 

I know they consider In-N'-Out competitors but there's something more homey and low-key about a dine-in place that allows doggys to sit inside and outside. 

I'll be back next time i'm craving a burger in the gay-berhood!
author: Jade W.

description:
Best $4.50 burger you'll ever taste + $1 for the must have bacon.

This place should be on everyone's bucket list..

Oh yeah, their sundae with all the fixinz' including bacon is pretty awesome too
author: Jack R.

description:
If I'm in the Castro and want a burger, this is the go-to place.

A small amount of sidewalk seating is a nice plus. Until the wind kicks up and/or you get visited by one of this neighborhood's many aggressive panhandlers.
author: Boogee Z.

description:
Burgers here are fantastic, just the right size and you can gourmet it up however you like: fried egg, avocado, cheese whatever tickles your fancy. I like mine simple so its just the mini burger with cheese for me  and occasionally with bacon- oh yeah!

The fries are so -so, kinda pricey for what you get which is nothing particularly special.

Shakes are much better than the soft serve, but they are all organic so no biggie

The servers are pretty friendly so that's an added bonus

Now to the part I don't like:

I have seen an employee serving food in the kitchen actually blow her nose, then return to work - NO WASHING OF HANDS!

I love eating here, but please ensure that employees are gloved when handling food! Or at the very least wash their hands frequently
author: Bee O.

description:
Super Duper is one of my favorite places to grab a burger in the city. Burgermeister in Daly City is technically closer, but I like to avoid the parking wars at West Gate. 

Lets start with the burger. Two different sizes for your liking; I personally opt for the smaller size as the double pattys make me feel obese. Then comes the garlic fries and the chocolate shake. Everything tastes fresh, everything tastes delicious, there is nothing like it!

The only thing i DONT like is how greasy everything gets. In-N-Out seems to use similar fresh materials and I am not bathed in grease afterwards. Then again its a burger, you can't win every time!

I go a few times a month and plan on it for a while. My arteries hate me.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Ok -so I kind of feel guilty about only giving this place 2 starts - HOWEVER - based on the one experience I had, I think it is warranted.

So - I happen to be a pescaterian - so you wonder - why in the hell are you going to a burger joint?  Well, it wasn't my first choice but when you are with a group, sometimes you must go with the majority.  But most if not all burger places have a veggie option, so I knew I would be ok.

I will say the place is cute - and as some others have commented, the simplicity of the menu is very much like a higher end in -n - out.  Plus, they have organic soft serve, which I am a huge fan of (even though I didn't have it this time....)

so, my friends order their beef burgers and a friend and I each order the only veggie option, which is a deep fried portobello mushroom burger - not the most healthy option, but I AM in a burger joint so I just give a little slack.

So - when I am ordering I ask the person taking my order if there is a side salad, or a different side option than fries.  I was happy to hear they did have a side salad so ordered it along with my veggie burger.  The person then told me they had a chicken caesar, but then even commented - oh, you don't want meat ,right?  To which I answered - yes, veggies only please.

So - nice self serve soda section, quaint seating area.  Then the food comes out - my mushroom burger was good - crisp but not oily and certainly was a nice change from the normal veggie or boca burger you find elsewhere.  

But here is my issue - the salad.  I am eating my salad and after a few bites, something tastes weird...I cannot figure it out, but not right.  I take a few more bites, and start to literally pick the salad apart trying to figure out what was wrong and what do I find in my supposed veggie salad - BACON!  WTF!!!  

Now - I am not the type of veggie eater that does it for humanitarian reasons or anything, I am doing it purely for health reasons (I know the mushroom was deep fried, but really was my only option - hence why i skipped the fries!).  But COME ON - when one orders a veggie burger, and a side salad and even COMMENTS that I do not want meat - don't you think you should MENTION there is BACON in the salad.

Sigh - in hindsight I should have said something at the time - but I didn't want to look like a complaining bitch and we were in a hurry to make a movie.  

So - recommendation - please mention there is bacon in your salad - because it may be a surprise to those who do not want to be consuming meat product with their supposed veggie side option!

Jen
author: Jen R.

description:
This place was awesome.

When you walk in, the place is clean, and you are greeted in a very friendly manner.  The menu is very straight forward, with a good selection of options.  If you are a first timer, you need to get a super duper burger with everything on it, especially the jalapeños and grilled onions.

The service was nice and fast.  When the food arrived, it was presented well.  The fries were good, but average.  Nothing to unique.  They were warm, and appeared fresh cut.  I liked them.

The burger was very flavorful.  It was dressed well, and put together neatly.  It was cooked on a flat iron, but still had a ton a flavor.  The only complaint I had was the bun was very greasy.

I never give 5 stars, except in very special and unique situations.  I give it 3 stars because of the average fries and the greasy buns.

I would go back again, and recommend it to others.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Tasty, but Super Duper is super GREASY!

All the staff were efficient, which is a good thing since they are slammed busy.  We were lucky to get a table before the lunch rush began because there was no seating in minutes.

The burger had good flavors and toppings, but it squirted grease on the first bit.  The garlic fries also had good intense garlic/cheese flavor, but were undercooked and greasy.  The portobello mushroom sandwich was fried, which we did NOT see on the menu.  Again, it was greasy.

But they time we were done, all three of our paper plates had pools of grease at the bottom.

FYI - The sauces were good, especially the chipotle, but given the rest of the grease, they were too heavy.

Sorry to say, Super Duper was good, but I really like In-N-Out Burger better.
author: Tony S.

description:
This place is good!

Parking is relatively easy on a Thursday afternoon at around 4pm. I came here with my boyfriend because we both wanted to try this place out. It wasn't too crowded and the huge menu was simple and straightforward. The decor is also nice and the whole restaurant was clean.

This restaurant gets 5 stars alone for the amazing service; the worker was sweet, helpful, and knowledgeable about the products. I ordered the mini burger with cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomatoes, and their super sauce which is a mayo based thousand island dressing sauce. I also order the fries with the 3 dips - chipotle, homemade mayo, and super sauce and a vanilla milkshake. My boyfriend and I waited for about 10 minutes before receiving our food which the worker brought out to us (unnecessary, but thank you!)

The grass fed vegetarian patty was cooked medium rare and was surprisingly very good! I usually like everything well done, but this wasn't too bad. I couldn't really taste the super sauce they said that they put in the burger and the bacon wasn't as crispy as I thought it would be, but the burger as a whole tasted good. The fries are just regular shoestring potato fries. The sauces, however, are nowhere near regular. The chipotle was nice and spicy and was very flavorful. The super sauce was also very flavorful and, when added, complemented the burger. The homemade mayo was my favorite! My boyfriend looked in disgust as I dipped my french fries in this wonderful creation. It was a little on the thick eggy side though, but I thought it was delicious! The milkshake was also good, but at $4 something, I expected it to be a little bigger. My total came about to be $13 and some change.

They also have soft serve ice cream!
author: Joyce E.

description:
I just love this little place.

Good basic burgers like you-know-where, but done the right way.  Quality ingredients, local and fresh, friendly to the community, etc.

I even like the limited menu and the decor, which I think of as Post-Apartment Therapy. The atmosphere is bright and clean but still relaxed, and the tables out front are great when the weather is warm, like it was this past summer.

As has been noted, the shakes are amazing, and the various little desserts are always worth trying. Not too crazy about the garlic fries, but I have yet to witness those done any way but damp and flabby: someday my mind will accept this and I'll move on.  The regular fries are fine, just ordinary fries.

The staff is always friendly, and the boss guy seems like a sweetheart, I don't think I've ever been when he wasn't there, making sure everyone was having a good experience.

I really hope Super Duper thrives; as it is I'm tempted to go there more often than my buttocks can realistically  endure, just to support them as a business!
author: Michael W.

description: I love how when I'm done with one of my Super Duper Burgers it's almost like I have a small salad of the extras I added to the burger that slid out onto the plate from between the buns.
author: Javier S.

description: Delicious burgers and great customer service!  We are visiting the City and were looking for a good burger.  We found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  Saturday late afternoon the place was packed with a line almost out the door.  The guy at the cash register was pleasant, patient and helpful with our special request:  cook burgers to medium well.  A few minutes later our to-go order was ready:  two mini burgers with cheese, fries and mini chocolate malt.  We were starving and these were some of the best burgers we've ever eaten!  Before our vacation is up, we'll definitely stop by for another burger.  Well-done, Super Duper Burgers!!
author: Susi M.

description:
Great: 
Fries with three sauces
Pickles

Fine: 
Chicken Sandwich

Nothing spectacular. Overpriced: Great food compared to in-n-out, but 2-3x as expensive. Not as good as a sit-down bistro (Bistro SF grill), but about the same price.
author: Alex L.

description:
Super Duper provided a mixed bag of experiences.

When I was certain that a couple of our orders had been skipped over, and asked the cashier if he could check their statuses, he deliberately stared past me without answering.  (It was not possible that he did not hear me, since we were facing each other and one foot apart).  The manager finally was able to rectify the situation, and ask the cooks to start on our skipped orders.  This inconvenience caused the rest of our party to wait an extra half hour with their received food becoming cold. 

Despite the undesirable lack of service, the Super Burger with cheese, mushrooms, and a fried egg was one of the juiciest and flavorful burgers I've encountered in a long time.  The egg leaked throughout the burger, rewarding each bite with its infusion.  The bun quickly became soggy and began falling to pieces, unable to contain the fullness of the burger.

The fries were an enjoyable, crispy complement to the burger.  The thinness of the fries made it incapable of soaking up too much artery-clogging oil, and as a result, tasted light and appropriately salted.  

Super Duper's fare was definitely tasty, but the cost of the meal, necessity to shout over the rest of the restaurant to have any conversation, and questionable service prevent it from being a reliable option.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I've been here four times already because I do love their burgers. When I first came, I had one of the specialty mini-burgers with blue cheese and mushrooms in it. I wish I ordered the regular-sized burger.

The second time I came around, I ordered the regular-sized burger, but found it to be a bit too much for me!

These burgers are so good because they are juicy and flavorful. Yeah, if you're a health freak, then maybe you might not like the fact that your burger is oozing all over the tray.

I had to give it four stars only because my last visit there, I was getting my simple regular mini-sized burger to go, and it took FOREVER.
