The older lady with the glasses kept handing out similar to-go orders for people who came AFTER ME. I'm talking about as far back as 6 people after me. Really ticked me off because I was happy about coming in when there was no line.
author: Melissa D.

description:
If you're a big carnivorous eater, this is not the place for you. Yes you would think a burger joint named Super Duper be but it is not. It is however greasy, but lets just assume that you have not come to a burger place with the intention of sticking to your diet.

The best things are as follows: 
homemade pickles - size of a bit or two and a little tangy... and FREE
mini burger - 4 oz of quality beef, nicely toasted bun, and with fresh toppings
Strauss family soft serve cones with chocolate dip - childhood heaven
Racer 5 - On tap and the best beer for a burger... you must like IPAs otherwise this is completely moot point (they also have Scrimshaw if you're into that)

Over-rated:
milkshakes - you would think with the cones being so awesome the shakes are a naturally wonderful extension. It is not, too watery
fries - really nothing special

Things I've heard are good:
mushroom burger - I would try it... but I was a vegetarian for a year and decided it was best for my sanity and health to be part of the food chain

And from left-field:
MAS wine - wine from a keg... If you live a dichotomous existence like I do... you enjoy 3-star Michelin rated restaurants and Taco Bell's mexi-melts... then you should try the wine. Some notes: good with the food, served in abundance, and sustainable concept
author: Joanna L.

description:
There are many burger places in town, probably second to Taquerias.
 
This place started off simple with decent burgers and reasonable prices. However I never likes their French fries.

I stopped in for a burger the other day and BAM!  Somehow a shrinking ray must have hit the burgers,  My burger was slightly larger than a slider.  What gives?  The place seems to have a lot of traffic and they start giving less.  When people start going down the street to Sliders and getting more for their money maybe Super Duper will rethink their decision to short change people.  Also, the last few burgers that we got here were extra super greasy and somehow they can't seem to manage to cook my eggs white completely.

Staff remain friendly and positive.
author: Scott A.

description:
First time at this place last night. The food was delicious and garlic fries were AMAZIng! 

Service at the register was horrible! The place was little loud, which was fine but the  server was very impatient; no room for questions or recommendations. She placed an order for "Jose" just bc my boyfriend looked Latino. The other server (which I wish would have served us) even called her racist which was well deserved. Next time take a break before helping first timers.
author: Jax G.

description:
Okay I admit I came here with high expectations, and well, it was alright.
I would come here again if I'm in the area, but I don't think I would especially make a trip for this. 

I ordered the Super burger with eggs, and avacado + garlic fries + chocolate shake. So it HAD to be good right!? ,,,,RIGHT!?? well it was pretty good, but I wouldn't say its SUPER. It was a normal burger..an egg...and they were normal fries...with garlic. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't super duper. 

Service was good, food is good. Overall this place is good.
author: Legendary W.

description:
Yummy in my tummy and PERFECTLY priced.

Reminds me of Shake Shack in NY, though SS wins. I'll take Super Duper as a close second though.

The meat is tender and juicy, the toppings are fresh, the fries are thin and delicious and they have endless gourmet pickles! 

The people that work there are complete moron-idiots. Moridiots? One of them took 6 (I counted, 6) minutes to take one person's order. When I got up and asked what took so long, she looked at me with a vacant expression and asked, "It took a long time?" Another time, the guy asked me what my name was like 4 times before he typed down Zake. 

... Words fail me.

The bread is a little too dense for me and the fries could be crispier, but hell, it's 5 stars for the food - just go!
author: Zach S.

description:
The portobello sandwich here is delicious. The portobello is breaded, so it has a great texture and bite. When they asked me if I wanted it with cheese, I was skeptical because the way portobello sandwiches are normally, it seemed like cheese would be gross. But it was great and made the sandwich more like a cheeseburger. 

Garlic fries come with a little cheese on top and are the perfect single serving. If you are one of those people who hopes your friends will order fries so you don't have to, because you'll just eat theirs, don't do that here. They're made for one person so get your own!!

Shakes, awesome. I got a chocolate shake even though I am lactose intolerant. Totally worth the subsequent stomachache.

Bonus: as many homemade pickles you want!
author: Joanna L.

description:
First off, I'll say this I will be going back to this joint HOWEVER allow me to say this, the burgers were just MEH. Uneventful. Not exciting. The meat seemed a tad on the flavorless side and the regular hamburger bun was dry and would crumble. I had the basic fries with the 3 sauces and the fries were just eh, the sauces were ok. I'll have to try a few other items and a few other variations to find my thing here, but all in all it ain't bad. I will give them this, their shakes ROCK!!!! 
It's a cool spot, convenient, clean and fun.
author: Rob L.

description: I liked the downtown version better. This place is a little small and cramped. But the burgers are good for fast food. The garlic fries are better than the not-garlic fries.
author: Andrew K.

description: Until I had a Super Duper Burger, I'd never really eaten a burger before.  Or beef.  Or garlic fries.  That's how it felt.  That's what Madonna meant by "Like a Virgin."  Maybe all reviews should have a Madonna reference.  Maybe they already do.
author: Philip P.

description:
Super duper good!  Was craving for a burger and came here for lunch today with some coworkers and it was well worth it!

The place is trendy and cute, with a little charm to it, plus they served spiked milkshakes!! Didn't try it though since it sounded a little off to me, but I would like to try it next time I'm not working. 

Us girls ordered the mini, which is only a patty, where the super is 2 patties.  I got mine with cheese and everything on it.  The guys ordered the super with cheese and bacon, of course.  Orders came quick and it all tasted really good.  

You can tell the quality of the meat was fresh and well seasoned.  You can see them prepare each patty fresh on the grill, which makes you feel a little better for eating greasy food.  

We also ordered the garlic cheese fries...tasted like regular, thin fries, but it was only $3, so definitely should try as a compliment to the burger.  

Price was cheaper than expected, so was the size of the burger.  Mini was $4.50 ($.050 for cheese and $1 for bacon) and $6.50 for Super.  Not bad at all.  The burgers came out smaller than I expected, but still a very good size.  I'd say a guy can easily finish 2 of these.  

I noticed there were chicken sandwiches on the menu as well, but what's the point of coming here if you weren't looking into grubbing a burger, right?!

My brother told me he got the burger with the egg last time ($1 extra), but I wanted to try the simple, classic burger first....so will go back and try it with the egg next time.
author: Nancy S.

description: This place is on point with their flavors and concept. Great location and great food. The amount of people that are in line is a little daunting but it moves quick. Just make sure to stay on them if you notice that your food is taking a while because someone can come by and swipe our food. Great place... Will come back
author: Jess B.

description:
I probably eat at Super Duper at least once a week. No joke.

What I Get: Mini Burger w/ everything, pickles and jalapenos. Fries on the side and of course a beer to top things off.

Why I Really Go: Okay, so the burgers are definitely amazing. There is no doubt about that. But I really go for the house-made pickles. I'll typically get a side of pickles to eat while my burger is being cooked, and then a side of pickles to eat with my burger. I'm a bit of a pickle enthusiast, so trust me when I say these pickles are definitely to be had!

Other Great Menu Items: Soft-serve ice cream (which they run out of on warm days in SF), brown-sugar lemonade, and the pecan pie.

The staff is always pleasant, you can always find a spot to sit and the food is consistently good.
author: Justin G.

description: OMG. The mini burger even tho' it's a 1/4 pounder, and the garlic fries are so dericious. Nom nom effin' nom!
author: Pickle R.

description:
Simplicity at it's finest. 
   I enjoy a burger about once a month.  I think that rate is about to increase.  Compared to SF's other famous burgers this new addition is going to have them trying to step their game up if word gets out.  

Yelping is sometimes a double edged sword for me; I want places to do well and spread the word, but in some cases I'd rather keep it a bit of a secret if the place is already crowded.  
As for Super Duper, I think that they should be packed all the time.  It seems like people aren't that intrigued by yet another burger.  I'm sure though that once enough people try S.D., it may possibly go on to be a institution here in the city.
author: John W.

description: I ordered a super burger with bacon. Contemplated getting an egg as well, for full artery destruction, but I decided not to because it was $1.50 for one organic egg. (c'mon...). The burger itself was tasty. Very juicy and greasy. Cooked medium... I'll ask for medium rare next time. Did I mention very greasy? There was a puddle of grease on the bottom of my wrapper which, naturally, I dipped my burger into.
author: Alton Z.

description: Delicious. Chicken Sandwich is straight up delicious. Anyone got the nutrition information on that bad boy?
author: Spencer S.

description:
I love going to this place for burgers. The burgers are made to order with a bunch of stuff that you can put on it. They are juicy and tender and it's just great. 

The burgers are actually kind of small for the price they charge. They're about the size of a burger that you would get on a food truck. However, the phrase "quality over quantity" definitely applies here, so I'm always satisfied no matter what. I'd actually prefer this over In n Out.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Love it. For me, Super Duper is one of the highlights of living in San Francisco.

It's difficult to give 5 stars to a fast food burger place and I'd hate to give someone the expectation that eating here is going to change their life. It's a burger, it's a great burger, but you're not going to have a When Harry Met Sally moment here. It's also one of the most expensive fast food burgers you can get, though you can still get in and out (no, not that one) with a drink, fries and a cheese and bacon mini burger for $15 or so.

I usually manage to get a seat without any waiting around which is a great attraction, and service is always fast and pleasant. On the rare occasion that an order has been wrong, they have no issue making it right.

The burgers themselves are visibly good; the burger looks perfectly engineered to fit the toppings, the bun and the paper it's wrapped in which also keeps the abundant moisture in; these burgers are dripping with just the right amount of fat that they taste fantastic but don't make you regret eating them, and let the bun stay intact.

The garlic fries are insane. These things have a really intense garlic flavor, and are not for someone who doesn't really like garlic. Shakes are also top quality, and I'm often disappointed when ordering a shake elsewhere because SD has ruined them for me. The ability to add a shot of Soju to your shake is a great touch.

If I have to fault it, the selection of dips you can pay a few more dollars for are forgettable. While pleasant, I wouldn't pay the extra money for them after the first time.

Every time I think to myself "Where shall I go for dinner?", I have to start by ruling out going to SD again. If I can't think of a good reason, it's another burger for me.
author: Rob C.

description:
Hello kids - Joan here!

I stumbled along this place, literally, walking home from a gentlemen friend's home. I had heels in hand and my scarf covering my face, not wanting to be seen doing the walk of shame at 3pm. I had a craving for more meat, so I saw this very cute little burger joint called Super Duper. I looked around to make sure none of my fans were around to see what I was about to indulge in; a greasy burger.

I had the burger with the works and oh was it ever so delicious! My taste buds were a little off from last nights festivities, but I managed to swallow down that burger in less than 10 bites!

On top of the delicious burger, I gorged on the free homemade pickles! I love pickles, all shapes and sizes and these pickles sent me into orbit ( I snuck some of the pickles in my clutch page for Christina tonight for dinner!)

Bless you Super Duper burger!
Joan Crawford
author: Joan C.

description:
I have been here 3 times and experienced:

-Great Service
-Great Food
-Spotless, well ventilated atmosphere
-Homemade pickles

It's a BURGER JOINT, COME ON PEOPLE.  Jeeeeeez.  I don't know how much better a burger and fries can get.  Don't listen to the haters, this place is awesome.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Pretty good burgers! I'm a midwest girl so I have high standards for meat-dishes and have been looking for a good burger joint in SF for awhile... 

I came here after running a marathon so you can bet I ordered about everything I possibly could...

The burgers - pretty good stuff, I recommend eating it in the restaurant rather than taking it home (which I did) because it did dry out pretty quickly.  There are a lot of good topping options you can pick from too. The 4oz burger was PLENTY - so even if you're starving (I was) don't feel like you neeeeeeeed the 8oz burger.

The garlic fries - super good. Tons of parmesan cheese on top and pretty greasy. Probably not the healthiest thing in the world, but I can dig it.

Milkshakes - MMMM, I got the cookies-n-cream milkshake thinking it would be basically an oreo milkshake.... it's not, it's actually their vanilla shake with their own homemade cookie mixed in.... not what I expected, but I did enjoy it.  Looks like there are some pretty bomb sundaes to choose from too if you've got a sweet tooth.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
The veggie "burger" is not good.  A portobello mushroom with lettuce, tomato, onion and secret sauce on a bun.   I was still hungry afterwards.  

I don't understand why so many restaurants think a mushroom cap is an acceptable meat replacement, but its just not.  Just because we're vegetarians doesn't mean we're on a DIET.  Give us some substance!  

Other than that, the fries were good and my chocolate dipped soft serve cone was the the best part of the meal.
author: SFnativeGal ..

description: We usually get takeout... The burgers are super yummy and I really like the fact that you can add-on various options (avo, mushrooms, egg, bacon, etc.), but it's not too complicated or obscure so that you don't forget you're eating a good old-fashioned burger. They also have yummy house-made pickles, great quality soft serve and the staff are friendly. This place is our go-to when we get a burger craving!
author: Angela C.

description:
Dear Owner or Manager of Super Duper:

Yesterday 3 friends and I ate lunch at your restaurant. I paid using my credit/debit card. The bill was $14.00. However, my checking account shows a pending charge of $16.80 (which is the bill of $14.00 + a 20% tip of $2.80. I did NOT add a tip to my credit card slip, and I don't appreciate a tip (20% at that) being added automatically for a counter-service burger joint. I am not sure if this is something your computers do automatically, or if it was the employee serving me, but either way it is DISHONEST and I won't EVER be eating at your restaurant again. My friend who had lunch with me also had the same thing happen to him. 

I have written to the owner/manager at the email address listed on their website this morning and am waiting for a response. I have tried to call Super Duper, but their answering machine won't accept messages.  Since I love reading reviews on Yelp (and often do so before trying out new places) I figured I'd repay the favor by warning people about this.

I'ts too bad...the burger was good...but I won't be going back.

*****Edited on 6/10/10: I received a response from a representative of the restaurant who explained that in the restaurant environment, the cc merchant processor authorizes transactions for 20% more than bill (for tip purposes) and based on our conversation I am editing my comment, although I have never had this happen to me before (and I always use my debit/ccard) so I am questioning why is that? Wouldn't it happen EVERY time I used my card at a restaurant? Actually, I should clarify, the only time this has happened to me before was when a server fraudulently added a tip to my bill (and was subsequently fired as there was proof of this). So you can understand my concern over the "extra" 20% showing up as a pending charge. It just rubs me the wrong way that a presumption is made that a tip will be added to a bill at a fast food joint, especially when there is a tip jar on the counter.
author: Elle F.

description:
Holy In & Out Burger. Is this place for real? I think In & Out Burgers has finally met its match. Super Duper has some serious yummy action going on, with its tasty melt-in-your-mouth burgers and a medley of crispy and soggy fries this is a sure hit.

The burgers are very affordable, or in short, the prices are comparable to In&Out, and if you're not familiar, it's about  4-5 dollas! The hamburger patties are delicious and will literally melt upon contact with saliva. In terms of size, it's definitely not a 6 dollar burger from carls jr. but the high quality of super duper is what sets them apart from those nast fast food chains. 

Accommodations aren't huge but it can fit a fair sized crowd of burger fiends. The white walls, floors, counters, and high ceiling simulate a really clean and modern look. My recommendations are to get your meals to go and enjoy at a near by park, but be sure to grab a beer at a local liquor store for all you older kids for a well rounded grub experience!

Definitely will be back, and high recommended by yours truly.  

ps. delicious friesssssssssss!
author: Alex C.

description:
Super friendly staff, cute decor and convenient location, and...

THEY'VE ADDED NEW VEGETARIAN OPTIONS! They have veggie burgers now.

Their ice cream soft serve is traditional and yummy.
author: Villager E.

description:
Bacon, bacon, bacon. As I've been saying more than ever as of late; everything tastes better with meat candy. 

My super burger was no exception. The Niman Ranch burger topped with what I was told was local bacon, was grilled just right, juicy and tasty. 

I also appreciate that the housemade lemonade was delightfully tart.
author: Lee H.

description:
I dunno what came first, Super Duper or Trueburger, but Shake Shack came before all these fools.  Other than the trays though, Sup Dup does its own thing.

It's not bad.  I would come back.  I wasn't blown away but they're such a charming little shop and my meat was a perfect pink.

Garlic fries FTW!
author: Erika C.

description:
I love this place - it feels like the healthiest way to enjoy a burger. 

However, it is worth nothing that when they revamped their menu they swapped out the organic Niman Ranch burgers for "grass fed, daily ground" burgers.  Ie, not organic and not Niman Ranch any more.

I'm still happy - it feels like In-N-Out but with better quality ingredients and no religious crap-trap hidden in the packaging.  Best tasting sub-$15 burger in town.
author: Ben M.

description: Delicious food, good service, highly recommend for a decent price meal in Castro area!
author: Joshua G.

description:
Awesome burger, great fries, still need to try their shakes but they can give you more soft serve ice cream for the price they charge. 

Just saying....

Small inside, no place to really sit but knowing where this is located, it's expected. 

Good food.
author: Jay C.

description: I know this is a chain, but I had the best burger since moving to San Francisco while eating here. Perfectly cooked to juicy perfection! The staff was super friendly even though we were a little tipsy, and I loved the french fries. This is coming from someone that isn't a big fry fan! I've definitely found my Castro burger spot!
author: Bradley V.

description:
It was great taste, looks and concept.... I was a little turned off by all of the grease soaking into the bun, and believe me when I say that I'm ok with some grease... but this was just a bit much.

Good luck, 100 times better than Sliders. I'd love to see some crinkle cut fries in there, but I'll be back.
author: Nick R.

description:
My mouth starts to water as I begin to write about this place. I love it! Best burgers no doubt. TRUST ME! i love burgers and I love the Castro, so put those together and your going to have a great party! Well, you cna def. do some add on's ;) Ok, back to the review: Fabulous burgers! I've been here at least 5 times and will be back at least 5 times more. The meat is juicy, the buns are plump, the sides are fresh (fresh lettuce and freshly made pickles) and delicious cheese options . The menu also includes garlic french fries and vodka infused milkshakes! I think I've said enough. 

Even though I miss pasta pomodoro (previous restaurant at this location) I thank the universe for this divine restaurant!
author: Janette A.

description:
Came here through word of mouth. People kept talking about how good the burgers are here. I have to agree. The BF and I came here one afternoon and we were ready to splurge. I got the 4oz cheeseburger and garlic fries! LOVE! Not the place to go if you are seriously trying to lose weight but who cares really. The staff was incredibly friendly. They accidentally forgot to put my BF's order of fries in and the owner (who was there that day) gave him the fries for free. That was really cool. 

The strawberry milkshake tasted fresh and yummy. And after all that food, I still managed to scarf down a vanilla choco dipped cone. Yes, I did. And Yes, I ate it all. I was full but I was happy. I will definitely go back to try the other things on the menu.
author: Mel P.

description: I come here almost every other day. The cool staff of dudes ( + two hip chicks) are incredibly cool. I'm sort of turning into a regular( like Norm from CHEERS or something...)Cheeseburgers always great. Wish the beer selection was broader than two choices. Once in a great while, you'd think a Chuck E. Cheese animatronic mouse was on the wall with the crush of parents and kids. I guess they gotta eat too, but normally,  quiet and just a fantastic experience.
author: Liam O.

description:
We just got back from Super Duper actually. It was not loud like everyone said it was and it was super chill. Ordering was a breeze and the wait time was nothing! 

While we were waiting for our food, one of the cashiers accidentally made a soft serve cone. When he realized that the guy who was in line did not order the cone, he came right up to my friend and I saying, " I saw the look on your face when I made this a figured since this was not actually ordered, I would give it to you, free of charge on the house." I could not have been happier because I was craving ice cream. It was amazing. 

The burgers are so-so. Juicy but lacking in flavor.  I prefer Roam's burgers because they have flavor and juice. 

The fries were good too, but the hubs and I were too full to eat them. 

Two stars for food and +1 star for the free ice cream

Fast service and good food. OK in my book :)
author: Antoinette C.

description:
GREAT burger.

it's like a slower version of in 'n out without the shame that comes with knowing your meat is not locally sourced. (jokes)

the staff could not be friendlier. the scene is not a scene at all.

try this place. it's a great burger. plain and simple.
author: Kyle L.

description:
I have to say, one of the best lunch spots to go with friends on Market Street. We all got the combo (burger, fries and drink or beer). 
1- Burger - Taste and flavor to die for, super juicy. No after taste but I have to take one star off since it was on the greasy side.
2- Fries - How fries should be!!
3- Drink - Beer (IPA)
author: Saudat N.

description:
Disclaimer, I am a vegetarian.  Therefore, I know nothing of the meat served at this locale.  However, my vegetarian burger was crunchy and delicious!  It reminded me of falafel somehow.  Next time I go, I will be much hungrier and make sure that I also get the chocolate milkshake and the DIPPED CONES!!!  I SUPER DUPER HEART dipped cones and I cannot believe I didn't get one.   The business purports to serve high quality, "vegetarian" cows with meat that is freshly ground, so one can assume they care about where they source their meat (although who can say for sure except the staff).

I must say the the fries were OK but the DIPPING SAUCES (especially the "super sauce" was like CRACK!  I could not stop eating it.  I hope it did not have meat in it...  Also, an old coworker of mine who was there got a sundae with pecan pie or something in it and she said it was to die for.  I would highly recommend this place if you are in the Castro and want something kind of quick and pretty tasty.  I hope more places like this pop up in the city and also have a "Vegetarian" section on their menu like Super Duper does.
author: Kyle T.

description: The name of the place pretty much says it. Super duper good! Fresh and juicy burgers are worth the $7 price tag. Definitely upgrade to garlic fries, who knew cheese would make garlic fries so much be better!
author: Annie S.

description:
I really, really wanted to love this place. Really, I did. But all I can say about Super Duper is that it was super duper heavy and super duper disappointing. 

Not only was it exceptionally greasy, even for a double cheeseburger, but quite bland. Salt your meat, people! Wait a minute...that sounded wrong. All I know is that it looked great, but in the end you bite into a couple of flavorless slabs of meat. Wait a minute...that also sounded wrong. The point is that this greasebomb of a burger just wasn't worth the caloric intake. 

Possible saving grace: I did really like their garlic fries! And yes, there was plenty of salt on those....
author: Sebastian L.

description:
Love the SHAKES with a lill Brown Sugar. 
Best New food For Castro.
author: Timothy C.

description:
So, yesterday I finished posting my review and a couple of hours later I got hungry for Super Duper (writing about good food does tend to make a man hungry for said good food, after all). To my surprise, when I gave her my name, the gal at the counter recognized me from the review I had just posted (they had already read it... Holy Being-On-Top-Of-Feedback, Batman!). 

I went to my table with my order, relishing that oh so tender burger and the crispy shoestring fries, and a few minutes later Luis (the manager) stopped by with a chocolate shake, asking me to try a variation for feedback (since I had mentioned it was too chocolatey for me, and that was the one weak spot I had noted). We compared some notes, and he made some more adjustments to it until it was perfectly delicious (hint: ask them to make it with the chocolate / vanilla swirl for a creamier shake that still packs plenty of chocolate).

So - how cool is that? How often do you see a restaurant staff so on top of things? Gotta give them all kudos for awesome customer service and for being open to tweak things and asking for feedback. If anything, i am more of a fan now than before!
author: Marcelo T.

description:
Love it! One of my favorite things in the whole world is french fries with chipotle mayo. They have fries with three dipping sauces, and they're all pretty great. If you follow my reviews at all you know I'm allergic to lots of things and tend to avoid desserts due to a variety of perils. I haven't had a milkshake in many many years. I had some of my fiancé's vanilla shake and my tongue didn't swell up, and it was delicious. 

Chipotle sauce w/fries and dessert that won't kill me = all the stars.
author: Christy S.

description:
Super Duper adapts the In-N-Out formula to the Castro.  That means a number of things:

1) Niman Ranch meat
2) Larger patties (about 1/4lb)
3) Bacon and other customizations beyond those that In-N-Out features
4) Non-beef sandwiches.
5) Fries that don't need to be ordered extra crispy in order to taste good.
6) Overall wholesomeness of ingredients
7) A beer/wine license.

So the Super Burger was good: beefy beef, slightly crumbly, and cooked to about medium with "Super Sauce" which is Thousand Island, lettuce, red onion, tomato and cheese.  The toppings and bun measured up to the beef.  The golden-colored fries were great as well, if you like thin and crispy fries.

But it does add up: no discounts are available.  My Super Burger, fries and an iced tea totaled $9.50.

What I found weird was that a portobello mushroom sandwich was the way more expensive than a single hamburger.  Also, the forced cheeriness of In-N-Out is absent, but the service is perfunctory.

I'd go back if I'm in the area.
author: Suo L.

description:
they've revamped the menu, (they didn't have to) and now the french fry portions have dramatically decreased. Lame!

still a good burger and nice service. just lame about decreasing portions after they've gotten more popular.
author: S B.

description:
I went here with Thomass during my vacation back home and I was pretty stoked to check it out...Burger was pretty damn good I must say. I had the bacon burger (duh) and thought it was really good quality at a pretty affordable price. The fries were alright. But here's what I was all about...the super sundae; for $5.25 or something like that you can get all the toppings listed or any of the custom ones of your choice. So in my super sundae I got: chocolate and vanilla swirl frozen yogurt, chocolate sauce, caramel sauce, chocolate chips, and bacon. 

Yeah, check it.
author: Lauren S.

description:
The epitome of a perfect burger to me is In-n-Out. (No, I haven't had Shake Shack yet)  I'm a basic hamburger kind of girl. I do not like fancy burgers. I do not like cheese on my burgers. I like a firm, yet fluffy bun, well-seasoned meat patty, onions (raw and alot of it), lettuce and tomatoes.  

Alas, In-n-Out is a rare treat for me in SF and Super Duper has become my go-to spot when I'm craving a solid burger.  

When I'm vetting a burger joint, I get the holy trifecta: burger, fries, and vanilla milk shake.  Here, at Super Duper, I ordered a Super Burger (8oz) with extra onions, french fries with 3 dipping sauces (super sauce/homemade mayo/chipotle, and my standard vanilla milkshake. The Super Burger was....well, super! My biggest gripe about a burger is when the meat is underseasoned. I really enjoyed the juiciness and perfect texture/seasoning of the ground daily, all natural Niman Ranch patty. It had an organic shape to it, as if it was made by hand and shaped right before they slapped it on the grill.  8oz was alot for me to take down, in combination with the fries and shake. I'll likely order a 4oz next time. 

The fries were outstanding! Perfectly crisp and salty. I could do without the dipping sauces next time. They were forgettable and unimaginative.

The shake was the perfect compliment to the burger and fries. It was not too sweet and tasted freshly made. 

Until they open up an In-n-Out in the heart of the city, Super Duper it is!
author: Monelle A.

description: Excellent juicy burger cooked the way you like it.  Great fries.
author: Yella W.

description:
I love burgers.  A mouthful of meat is basically the best thing ever.

Super Duper was pretty lackluster though.  I ordered a double cheeseburger and a side of fries.

The burger was a grease bomb.  Seriously - it might have been the greasiest burger I've ever eaten.  And I'm not some health freak (unfortunately) but this was really unappealing.  And on top of that it wasn't even that good.  It was certainly no In N' Out and honestly I'd rather go to Sliders for a quick to-go burger.  At least there they have a few different options and an awesome salad bar thing to customize your burger.

The fries were fairly standard but weren't seasoned at all.  I had to salt those babies up before I could go to town.

Service was friendly though - always a plus.

This place has potential and I'll give it another try at some point but I really hope they improve the taste and quality.
author: Evan L.

description: waited 40 minutes after order to discover they had my food sitting for 20 minutes under a heat lamp. 20 bucks for two burgers and one fry, which is fine if its fresh but to get it soggy and cold. I could of gone to McDonalds for a better meal for 5 bucks. Going to have VISA reverse.
author: Ron J.

description:
I made the mistake of ordering the chicken sandwich at Super Duper, which is sort of like ordering salmon at the House of Prime Rib (WHO DOES THAT?!).

Go for the SUPER BURGER WITH CHEESE. It's really messy to eat because of all of the juices, but it's worth every drippity drop! :) Be sure to snag some napkins before you ruin your clothes. 

Definitely want to try it with the fresh farmed egg next time.
author: Denise L.

description:
I've had the small burger (4 oz. single patty) and the large (8oz. double patty) and they are really good burgers. But I have had better. For the fact that this place is just down the street from my work, it gets a slightly higher overall rating.

The fries are underwhelming and the portioning can be disappointing. I don't want a huge pile of fries but it's a small, little paper tray that barely has a mound in it. Because the regular fries were not that great I didn't venture to try the garlic fries.

Haven't had a chance to try the milk shakes or the soft serve. I'm a sucker for soft serves so maybe that's a foregone conclusion there. Especially since it's Strauss Creamery soft serve.

The line can get crazy long. The wait area is chaotic because so many people are waiting for their orders and sometimes the person calling out names on the orders can be really hard to hear above all the noise of the  open kitchen and open floor plan.
author: cyndi L.

description:
The most spectacular unspectacular burger ever.

Food was just alright. Had that grease bomb taste of In-N-Out, which isn't a bad thing, just not really my thing. Prices are very reasonable, so even if you aren't raving, you won't feel like you were ripped off.

Everything else beyond the burger was awesome. Milkshakes were da bomb, and after deciding on chocolate, the friendly guy working the register gave me a hefty taste of the vanilla froyo so I could sample both. And the green efforts are applause worthy. There is not a regular trash can in the joint. Everything is compostable, even the straws. Well done.

Open jar of pickles was good (endless pickles!) and bad (open jars are usually not a good thing).

And props to the guy wearing the "It's not easy being easy" shirt. Go Castro.
author: Jason B.

description:
Possibly my favorite place to grab some quick eats in SF right now.  Their burgers are delicious, and their pickles (which are a help yourself perk, near the condiments area) are to die-for.  You can get your burger sans-bun, wrapped in lettuce which is delish.    

Their spiked milkshakes are a pleasant surprise.  

They have Stauss fro-yo which alone makes a trip to Super Duper worth every step.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description:
I like it! I don't love it, but i definitely definitely like it. The burgers are tasty, but a little too juicy (and therefore drippy). The garlic fries are delicious. I am really happy for the Racer 5 beer and for the homemade pickles (sweet and spicy).

Note: an 8 ouncer is just two 4 ounce patties stacked on top of each other. Not that there's anything wrong with that. It gets busy as the evening wears on, but if you get there before 7, you should be able to find a seat easily.

Still to try: milkshakes and desserts at the counter. I'm betting this will be my regular pre-Churchill stop.
author: Phuong M.

description:
Fast food with sustainable, local food values... THIS PLACE WON MY HEART AND TASTE BUDS!

LOVE:  Veggie Burger with hummus

1.  I am a meat eating girl, who was lured by this Veggie burger with hummus and was sooo not disappointed.  It was fresh, crisp around the patty edges, and full of yummy things!  DELISH!
2.  Friendly staff and free pickles.
3.  All of your waste goes into the compost.
4.  Sustainable without being pretentious.  This is just a good place to get burgers, fries, and a shake without the guilt... well, other than the calorie guilt.  :)

GO GO GO!
author: Christine K.

description:
**BORING**

Bland, dull, stale boring burger and fries. If you want a good burger go to Urban Burger on Valencia.
author: Giovanni L.

description: Super Duper is probably my favorite burger place in San Francisco. Reliably good, clean, and I love their pickles. Juicy patty with a great, high quality bun. I've also had a chicken salad from here and that was also good. They just have a high standard of ingredients, making it easy to enjoy their food and want to give them my business. Also, it's often hard to walk by without stopping in for some of their Straus soft serve. Truly one of life's best treats. I find them also very reasonably priced for their standard of food and the wait has never been long.
author: Victoria J.

description:
I have now made it a habit of going there every Friday evening before meeting my friends for a drink. I always get the same thing, the mini burger with all the works and cheese, I love it, seriously. The meat is juicy ad perfect, I love the fact that they use organic ingredients and, although I hate pickles, I eat the ones there because they are crunchy and delicious!
 
The ladies behind the counter are really nice and they smile while taking my order, the guy, well, he... um... I don't know if he knows what smiling means. 

I will start ordering other burgers now that Lent is coming up and I have to give up meat on Fridays because otherwise I'm gonna go to hell (that's what my grandma says anyways). Maybe I'll try the veggie one next time.
author: Ezekiel G.

description:
The Super Duper opened up recently in the old Pasta Pomodoro location in the Castro.  They have completely renovated the space to reflect the Super Duper experience: crisp and expedient.  

I've been here three times, twice I've eaten at the restaurant, and once I got my order to go.  The menu is simple, the food is not expensive, but overall very tasty.  One of the best burgers in the Castro.
author: Mike K.

description:
I am not crazy about hamburgers, but I do like one now and then.  When my girlfriend first told me about Super Duper, I expected it would be like Burger Meister or Burger Joint -- a burger shack that makes me feel like a San Franciscan eating a hamburger.  

The first time we went, it all felt regular. Grass-fed meat, old-timey font with futuristic tables, eat.   It was cheap and small and I liked it. We ate, and then I forgot all about Super Duper. The next time we went, I expected to eat and forget about it again. 

Then my life changed.  The guy at the counter said, "Do you like cheese?"   Oh my gosh, I LOVE cheese. He showed me this crazy secret menu (which has since been incorporated into the regular menu) with bigger burgers with even more precious combinations of items. I got a four cheese burger -- jack, cheddar, blue, and parmesan.   And I got a Racer 5 while waiting.  Best Freaking Burger Experience Ever. 

Sometime at one of the next twelve-times-in-two-weeks visits,  I asked my girlfriend very seriously while waiting in line, "What happens if I eat these all the time?"  "What do you mean?"  she asked.  "I mean, like if I eat a four-cheese burger every week? Is it bad for me?"    

Yes, it might be bad. It might be horrible for my health and it might make me fat. I'm not going to think about that now. I am going to go there whenever I feel like it -- often -- and drink Racer 5 while waiting for my blue cheese burger to come out.  So far I have not gotten tired of this blue cheese burger. I hope that day will come as much as I don't. I love Super Duper Burger!
author: Ivy S.

description: I've walked by this little burger joint so many times, so I'm glad I finally popped in for a Super Cheeseburger. Half-pound of Neiman ranch'd cow patties oozing with cheese and topped off with special sauce, red onions, lettuce, and tomato. Bun was really nice and had a good bite to it. Fries didn't look so hot, but I might have to try 'em next time. A little bit of a wait for your order, but the big jar of pickles by the condiments is free for you to raid, so load up on that sodium sourness.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Yea, this is a stupid good burger. & Beer. & Milkshake. (latter two not combined, please).

I will admit, I was sad when I learned that the cheeseburger doesn't come with fixings, and I needed to order the more expensive Super Duper Burger.... but I got over it in one bite. Add a ginormous beer to the mix, and I'm a damn happy eater!

Over the past few Sundays, this place has been THE place to end a Sunday Funday, and I recommend my local Castrolites do the same! Nothing like a juicy, high-quality burger to top off a buzz. 

The owners deserve props for utilizing the formerly sad Pasta Pomodoro space, while also adding their philosophies around food  to the burger scene (Yea, I've read about it in notes on their previous endeavors - interesting ((hopefully successful)) in taking this to a fast/casual food venue)

I'm personally not a big fan of Sliders or Harvey's burgers, and I'm glad to have a neighborly substitute. And, don't worry what these people say, you don't need to be "like In & Out" ... if I remember correctly, their morals are slightly in conflict with our Community's values.

Now call me a hypocrite, because I will say that service is better at In & Out.... and I'm surprised, because service at Starbelly is AMAZING and I was hoping the same ethics would carry over... I guess it's just a fast food norm.. 

(And in regards to the added debit charge for gratuity... yea, I've seen that everywhere I use my card. Perhaps the other person didn't see it as other venues run it as credit vs. debit. Big difference - Same card).
author: Andrew C.

description:
Still super yummy.   The chicken sandwich is amazing.  Grilled chicken breast on a foccacia style bread with a slightly spicy chipotle sauce.  I added cheese and bacon.   Finger lickin good.   The portabello/veggie sandwich was also yummy, albeit not so filling.

Also recently added to the menu are 4 specialty burgers.  If I remember properly, there is a 4 cheese, a blue cheese, a Philly Style and one other variety that slips my mind.

Super Duper is not letting us down.  Go try it out!
author: Monika S.

description:
I love this place. I love that it's in my neighborhood. I love that it's not nasty old Pasta P anymore. What I don't love, is that I live so close - cause I want to eat those burgers all the time!

I'm one of those people that believes that a good cheeseburger is a no fuss burger. I don't need frills, and by frills I mean, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle....BBQ sauce, avocado, sprouts....and anything else you can slap on a burger. There seems to be a problem with burger places thinking they need to get real messy with a burger (i.e. Burgermeister).

Give me bun, meat, cheese, maybe a little special sauce, then bun. I want to taste the quality of the meat, the cheese, and the sauce you've created and that is what Super Duper does well. Fresh ingredients, simple menu, not $10 for a burger, and they serve beer. Sure, there are a few things that need tuning up (like teaching their staff how to pour a pint), but that all comes with opening up a new place. Oh, and the fresh pickles in a jar...they are amazing, but I don't see that lasting long. I took, like four spears :). 

Check this place out - you won't want to visit cardboard burger, I mean, Burger Joint, or over-priced Burgermeister again.
author: evan Y.

description:
I had to come back a second time before I could write a review. 

My first experience at Super Duper Burger left much to be desired. I had trouble with the menu (lettuce and tomato don't come automatically?!?), was talked into a more expensive burger by the staff person, and didn't feel like the final product lived up to the hype. (although the garlic fries are mighty tasty),

HOWEVER, I returned to Super Duper last night on a whim, and my experience improved 100%.  I don't know if they reprinted the menu or clarified the ingredients, but the ordering went a lot smoother and everything I wanted automatically came with the burger. My purchase was also cheaper, and the burger was noticeably more delicious.  

I will definitely go back more often and try some new things. Their soft-serve chocolate dip cones are so tempting. That wooden sign on the sidewalk taunts me every day when I am coming home from work.  And how about that chocolate chip cookie and bacon ice cream sundae? WTF!?!
author: Lisa R.

description:
My review is based on four visits.

The first time, we just ordered the soft serves, chocolate and vanilla, they made us happy.

The second time, ordered a burger and fries.  The bread isn't really spongy, it's sort of "light" in that you can just pinch a piece away and the rest stays super airy.... I like a heavier bread with my burgers, so this didn't work for me.  The meat was fine though.  The fries tasted a bit like it was time to change the oil, and weren't hot.  This made me quite unhappy, I decided these burgers are not for me.

The third time, went with the soft serves again, they sputtered out of the vanilla for the swirl, so it was heavy on chocolate, and a bit melty... unhappy.

Decided to try a fourth time (since the third had been the charm, I was thinking this would be lover-ly again.)  Wanted to try the chocolate dipped cones.  First, they said the machine was running a bit spotty (oh noooo, AGAIN???) and then they offered to put the soft serve in a cup with chocolate and cone.  I decided to go with the suggestion, forked over the $8 for two chocodippedsoftserves, and waited... and waited.... and waited... They were apparently running behind somehow someway, everyone was coming back to the counter to check on their orders, and finally after 15 mins (honestly, i was looking at my watch), I got the two soft serves... they were soppy and soggy, and I wished I had just kept my $8 and left.  

How difficult can it be, with such a small menu, and an emphasis on soft serves on your outside signage, to keep your machine working?No more, I'm over these guys, they suck.

http://dph-extranet2.sfdph.org:7777/pls/eeop_htmldb/f?p=132:2:3055030610926135::NO::P2_LOCATIONID:62358
author: I Love S.

description:
Really tasty burgers and they have Racer 5 on tap.
Its super.  Its duper.  Go.
author: Nick S.

description: Yes, very good. Very fresh.  I'd like to think I'm a burger afficionado... This is a quality burger. And the aioli....very good.
author: Carla R.

description:
This place has delicious burger! I had a cheese burger wrapped in lettuce (what carbs!?) and it was amazing!  So cheezy.  A little too much oil but I hate dry meat.  I just blotted it with my napkin.  They make everything fast and they serve wine! I love it!  I like to work out at golds gym and while on the eliptical I stare at this place and think about my carb free burger ...mmm it gets me through 45 min of cardio! 5 stars for that!!

They are really nice too.  One night (after a perticularly bad evening of being barfed on while walking by the lookout) I went in and the girl behind the counter was so sweet and cheered me up and even brought me a chocolate dipped ice cream with my burger! She didn't have to do that! This place is Super Duper!
author: Monique M.

description:
Went there on day one, 4/12, expecting a decent burger, given the legacy of the owners.  But even at this pricepoint, I thought the burgers were pretty lame and much greasier than I expected.  I went back a week later to make sure, and not only did they get my order wrong, but I was similarly unimpressed.  Is this a good addition to the 'stro? Sure, queens are cheap.  Did I expect more? Absolutely!  Something to go back for??  No, not for an In'N'out clone.

Other rants: Why is lettuce and tomato an option? Fries were cold both times.  Why is a shake as much as a burger?  And a chocoloate dipped cone for $4?  C'mon!  I know this isn't Mickey-Ds, but ice cream is not that expensive.  And the decor? What decor?  (If this place were open all night to serve bar hags, it might take off.)
author: Jose S.

description: What can I say, its a burger joint. Nice, juicy burgers and some decent fries. I was tempted to get the garlic fries but I didn't want to stink. The kicker is the all you can eat pickles. Not the tastiest pickles I've had but hey its free. They even serve beer and wine here.
author: Kenson K.

description:
I'm surprised at all the complaints from people who saw Super Duper before the interior was finished. Seriously? Give them a chance! The interior looks great now! The painted wall is cheerful & fun and the overall aesthetic is very pleasing. 

I loved that almost all of the packaging is eco-friendly (should be a no-brainer here in SF). The food was served on a charming little metal tray (where can I get me some of those!?!).

The food: Very tasty! The burger smelled heavenly when it came out and didn't disappoint. Soft bun, well-dressed, yummy (and reasonably sized) patty. The fries look like they came from potatoes and were crispy, salty, and pillowy soft inside.

For those complaining about grease: It's a burger and fries! If you're going to complain about some grease, order the veggie burger or ask for your burger to be cooked medium-hard. Good meat has fat in it and (guess what!), fries are fried. 

Definitely a habit-forming inexpensive burger experience!
author: Becah D.

description:
I will have to say that this is my favorite burger joint.  What makes the burger so good is not the beef, even thought that is excellent and juicy.  it is not just the fixings, these are excellent as well.  Super Duper stands out with their attention to the hamburger bun!  It is the best!  This is where every other place falls short.

The fries are excellent.  The chocolate chip / walnut cookies are good but I would prefer is they were pulled from the oven earlier to make them bit chewy.

I have not tasted the soft serve ice cream but I am looking forward to it!
author: Bill D.

description: I was so excited to finally try this place. I was expecting giant burgers of some sort but what I got was a ridiculously oily normal-sized burger.  There was nothing spectacular about the burger itself. Aside that, I ordered an oreo shake and garlic fries. The oreo shake was ok--satisfying enough, but I felt the garlic fries lacked garlic. My favorite part about this place was that everything they gave us besides the tray could be composted. Thumbs up for being green!
author: Melissa C.

description:
You are at the Lookout and realize you need something to soak up those drinks.  You are hungry, and SO tired of always getting pizza after a night of playing "bar hopping and boy shopping".  

So what do you do?  Walk half a block down Market towards Castro and stop in to Super Duper to satisfy that food craving.

I had the Super Duper Burger with Cheese and Garlic Fries.  The other 5 in my group all had something similar.  To say the least - everyone was impressed.

All of the food came out warm like it was freshly cooked (as I am sure it was fresh).  The lettuce was crisp which for some reason doesn't happen at other burger joints.  It had just the right amount of sloppyness - not too much, and not too little.  Fries were fresh, but wasn't sure the garlic was fresh?  Or was that Garlic?

Everyone was friendly, it got loud as the night progressed and people stumbled in.  Definitely a place that I'll keep on my lis and frequent again.  Next time I'll wrap my mouth around an Ice Cream Cone!
author: Jason I.

description: This place is the real deal. Ordered the chicken burger, which cam out piping hot and smelled amazing. I opted to get the grilled onions which were also cooked to perfection. The ciabatta bun was toasty and incredibly edible. Fast, friendly service. I will definitely go back the next time I am in SF (and not the DD) and try one of those Spiked Milkshakes :)
author: Roderick S.

description: It was amazing. Great service, amazing food friendly staff. It was so nice. They have these homemade pickles. I personally hate pickles. I tried theirs; it was amazing. They're like the in n out of gourmet burgers. Extremely good. You won't regret visiting this place. The only thing is, parking is hard to find, but that's not the restaurant's fault, it's just how SF is. This place literally made me get my phone out, and download yelp just to write a review. Your welcome in advance.
author: Kyle B.

description:
Ok.  We like to try new places in our hood, but don't think we will be heading back to this one anytime soon.  The price was pretty good, but we would rather go to in-n-out and pay less for better food.  The burgers were tasty, but way too greasy....our buns were soggy from the grease.  We got the garlic fries, and they came out cold.  Overall, the food was tasty, but greasy burgers and cold fries aren't our thing.  This place might do well if they decide to stay open for the after-bar crowd.  Otherwise, we would recommend avoiding.  

One plus is that all of the waste is compostable.  Even the drink containers are made from compostable material.
author: Corey H.

description:
My boyfriend and I just got a chocolate dip coned (him) and chocolate milkshake (me). They were both delicious! The ice cream tasted homemade, creamy, and was incredibly flavorful. The people working there were super sweet; I want to definitely stress that! They were fun, friendly, talkative, and engaging. I wished I would've been more hungry - their veggie burger with tons of possible toppings sounded ah-maz-ing.

Also - the restaurant is super cute - the decor is adorable.
author: Francesca M.

description:
FInally a real burger place in the Castro! 

Sorry but SLIDERS is really bad! :-(

They have special burgers everyday and the fries are very good!
Open till 11PM, Great customer service! Clean and just a great place to eat FATTY FOOD! :-)
author: Aemar E.

description: I stopped by here to grab a quick bite with a friend, I wasn't too hungry so I ordered the french fries with their three dips: mayo, super sauce and chipotle($3.75). There was nothing super duper about the fries or the dips. Pretty disappointing when the fries are bland and the sauces don't add any great flavor. My friend had a burger and said that it was pretty "average". You'd be better off visiting your local McDonald's. Probably be cheaper too.
author: Missy A.

description: Best burger in San Francisco, I'd say. They also have yummy milkshakes and the complimentary pickles are a must have!
author: Sammie C.

description:
Really hits the spot if you're in the mood for a greasy, well-done burger. It's like a fresher In-n-Out; I even order pretty much the same thing (Double Double).

And since it's conveniently located for me, I'll just about never go to a local In-n-Out again.
author: Robert L.

description: For the price, it's a really good burger, totally worth it. It's like a better quality burger chain.
author: Haleh H.

description:
This is a tough review to write, so let's make it simple:

The Good - The quality of the beef is awesome.  I believe that it is, indeed, fresh daily-ground, Niman Ranch beef.  The fries are average on the pretty good side of the spectrum.

The Bad - You know you're in trouble when you touch your burger and the first thing you think is, "where the hell are the napkins"?  These burgers are Greasy!!!  And it's not the good kind of grease oozing out of the meat or the cheese.  This is some kind of artificial butter/grease to make the burger taste better....and it's all over the burger on the outside.

...And The Ugly - I felt a little stomach discomfort from the burger afterwards and I attribute it to that mysterious and omnipresent grease.  All in all, it's the grease that has left the indelible imprint in my food memory and that's why I'm giving this place three stars instead of four or five.  They are tasty though; no getting around that.

However, my vote for the best burger in town goes to either Annabel's on 4th Street/Mission, Bistro Burger or Ziggy's on Drumm across from the Hyatt in The Embarcadero.

Drop me a line if you find a better burger...

Thanks in advance.
author: Rene H.

description: Good food but bad service.  I just cannot stand rude people.  When I visited last time, both of the cashiers were short and rude with me, although I was nice.  I used to love this place, now I will not return.
author: Aban E.

description:
I seriously don't get the reviews about this place--are people that hard up for a super greasy burger in the Castro? All you can taste is grease--a nasty pool of it. Bun so soggy it all just disintegrated onto my tray. I got up twice to get more napkins to clean off my hands before I could resume another bite until half way through the burger, I just couldn't stomach any more of it. My friend I was with said "it use to be better" but had the same reaction.

Having said that.. the desert is where it's at. The ice cream's really good. If I do come back, it'll be for a pecan pie sundae.
author: Michael A.

description: Very juicy burgers, good garlic fries. A little pricier than most burger places (our order came to $22 for 2 people), but that's a small complaint. I'll eat here again.
author: Vol T.

description: Some post-gym meals are created more equal than others.  Just like Napoleon was more equal than Snowball, so is the Super Duper burger more equal than the burgers served by its neighbors.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Super Duper must have a good PR squad because I was practically drooling for these burgers before the store even opened. I was being informed through blogs, local emails, and other foodie websites that Super Duper was Castro's version of In 'N Out and telling me that I need get my ass in there once it opened. It was like the internets really wanted me to eat at Super Duper. And so I did...

Result - The internets lied to me! The burger was OK, but I was truly disappointed that their SUPERBURGER did not match the internet hype. I expected to leave the Super Duper with the proclamation that "This is the most awesome burger place ever!" Instead I left saying "That satisfied my hungreeees, but this could never satisfy my craving for a juicy succulent cheese burger of deliciousness."

Don't be mad at me Super Duper. I think you have the potential and you get a thumbs up for location, so I am not going to give up on you just yet!
author: Lisa T.

description:
Went here last night and ordered a Double Super Duper (i.e., a Double Double in In n Out lingo), fries, and a Scrimshaw.  The food came out fairly quickly.

I loved my burger and it is easily my favorite burger in that price range, beating out Urban Burger, Burger Meister, Burger Joint, etc.  The patty was so moist and juicy without being a mess to eat.  I would have liked a bit more secret sauce but it wasn't that big of a deal.  I just dipped my burger in ketchup.  The fries are above average but not great.  Still like them better than the Urban Burger fries, but not as good as Burger Joint's thick cut peanut oil fries.  Oh, and the beer was perfectly crisp and cold, which surprisingly, is rare.

This isn't a burger that you'll go around evangelizing about, nor is it a "destination" burger.  But for those of us who live in the neighborhood, Super Duper is a fantastic addition.  You can easily get a *very* good burger, fries, and soda for around $10.  Where else can you do that in the Castro/Mission?

Really loved it.  I might even go back tonight.
author: Courtney N.

description:
Simple menu, simple food.  The burger was flavorful, juicy, and some may argue a bit greasy, but overall a good burger for the price.  I ordered the double, shared some garlic fries, and was plenty satisfied.  also, make sure to get the homemade pickles by the condiment bar, they were delicious. 

I will definitely be back to grab another double, shake, and some fries to share, but this place has nothing on shake shack in nyc.  not sure if that's what they were going for, but they have a long way to go.
author: David M.

description: This is what burgers should taste like.  Every now and then I thnk I will actually give up red meat.  And then ... Super Duper!  Great management and staff.
author: Gordon W.

description:
Damn, that was a tasty burger! 

After two visits to this just-opened establishment, I'd say I'm pretty happy with the newest burger joint in the gayborhood. It's certainly not the best burger I've ever had, but for a late-night meat craving, it sure hits the spot. Still, I think there's lots of room for improvement here. 

The restaurant itself seems unfinished, or finished terribly on the cheap. One wall is clad entirely in bolted plywood, and the entire place itself is very scaled back and bare. It almost made me wonder if the owners (who also run the very nicely decorated Starbelly and Beretta) were waiting to see if the place makes it a bit before adding some more decorating flourishes. 

The menu is pretty simple, which didn't bother me. Still, the notion of charging extra just for veggies on a burger is a bit weird. Also a bit annoying was how the woman taking my order kept trying to upsell me--"Want lettuce and tomato?" "Want something to drink like beer or wine?" She seemed almost rebuffed when I skipped the veggie$ and just ordered an i¢ed tea. Sorry ma'am... as if you couldn't tell, I've already had some beer and wine.

As for the food, I thought it was pretty good. As to the greasy comments people have made... well, um, it's a fried burger. If you want it more well done, I suggest trying one of the charred briquettes over at Sliders. The cheese-garlic fries were a letdown tho; the cheese was more a sprinkle of Parmesan with some garlic. When I asked it they could make REAL cheesy fries with some cheddar, I was told no. Boo. (The regular fries were pretty decent tho.) I also agree with other who've said that while the pickles are a nice touch, the brine could use some tweaking. 

Still, as long as my live holds out in the Castro bars, I'll definitely stagger in sometime again soon.
author: Aaron L.

description:
As good as it gets for a simple, fresh, fast burger. This is fast food ambiance, not restaurant. Good meat, good bun, good toppings, cheap prices. Because the meat is Niman Ranch, it makes a guilty pleasure a little bit less guilty and a lot more pleasurable. 

Do NOT come on a Sunday eve when the drunkard spillover crowd from bars fills the place. They are DRUNK and loud and appear to be just out of high school. No doubt it's better during the day or on other nights of the week.

But I came for a burger, not atmosphere, so my five stars are for the food alone.
author: Chris J.

description:
3.5/5 it's a spot!

i normally don't eat in the castro, in fear of all the judging eyes. but i will definitely eat here. it's a little pricey for a burger and fries, but i guess i could not get the double next time and spare 2 bucks. your call, i think it's really filling. 

couple downsides are that it's a really tight space at peak hours, and when we went last night they forgot to put in one of our orders.
author: Alvin D.

description: Watch OUT!  IN n OUT there is a new joint around. Grass Fed Beef, garlic fries, cookies and creme milkshakes...yummy Cardiac Special. Parking is a hassle but worth it. Enjoy fast food without the pink slime stuff.
author: Shirley P.

description:
When i was in San Fran looking for a good meal, we stumbled upon this spot,

first of all the smell dragged me in...burgers were made fresh. the fries were fresh and delicious indeed, everything was well portioned and delicious...

Con: needs a bigger menu if anything, but what they have, they know, and do very well

Quick tip, there odd sounding bacon desert isnt that bad, you gotta be open minded to it...but there ice cream is fucken legit!...only thing i wish would be different would be there cones for there ice cream, cheap and flavorless, expected more, waffle cone would be soo nice!
author: Steve M.

description:
A step above your regular burger joint.

The well seasoned, tasty burger and a wonderful bun made this a memorable place.  The skin-on fries were very good too.
author: Timothy T.

description: The burgers here are a bit greasy but nonetheless satisfying and delicious. Burgers are juicy and cheese is a must! The added bonus would be the soft serve ice cream, yummy!  The fries are not bad either.
author: Jennie W.

description:
Yummy!  What is up with the occasional one stars?  Don't these people know burgers are supposed to be greasy?  Super Duper burgers are delicious and the service is divine!  Way better than In n Out - and I love In n Out.

Great and simple selection of burgers and a fabulous veggie burger.  I'd give them 6 stars if they had sweet potato fries.
author: Pepe P.

description:
Not horrible, but not awesome either.

There are a ton of places one can grab a burger in the Castro (chow, home, blue, harveys, etc) and unfortunately this place just doesn't stand out. Yes, this place is new and has a few kinks to work out, but I expected more from a place called "Superduper".

Service: Overall it was pretty good

Menu Selection: A bit too simple. Why not a BBQ burger? Why not add fried pickles? Maybe a turkey burger? And how about some sweet potato fries? What about tater tots?

Atmosphere: The place seemed bigger when it was Pomodoro, and it was definitely a lot more welcoming than the current minimalist decor.
author: Tom A.

description:
Really good "guilty pleasure" place... and inexpensive!

Good burgers made from good ingredients.  Not quite on a gourmet level, quality-wise, but well above anything from a fast food place.  

Make sure to leave the paper wrapper on while you eat or you'll have grease EVERYWHERE!  I found this out the hard way.   Also had the fries and a chocolate shake, which are both great.  The "mini" burger is actually quite big (a quarter pound) and should satisfy the average person.
author: Christopher M.

description:
This place is sort of like In-N-Out, but with Niman Ranch Beef and Organic ice cream.  Simple delicious food.

And I honestly think they have the best french fries in the city.
author: Courtney K.

description:
We were deciding between here and Burgermeister, we even walked all the way down here to check out the menu (obviously didn't check out all of your reviews first). As we were perusing it outside, one of the employees on his way back in said, "Come on in, guys, everything's good!" He was so jolly and friendly that we had to stay.

We each had the Superburger (one double), regular fries, garlic fries, and 2 fresh squeezed lemonades (sweetened with brown sugar). The milkshakes looked delicious and I would have gotten one after dinner if the line hadn't been out the door.

I think my experience was somewhat marred by the fact that I was hoping or expecting a big, fat, juicy burger. Instead, I basically got a higher quality version of In-N-Out. Don't get me wrong, I love In-N-Out and the burger was definitely good, however, just off the mark of being amazing. Condiments are limited (ketchup and mustard) but they also have what I believe to be homemade pickles. The price is totally right on.

The regular fries were pretty decent, skinny and hot (like how I like my men... zing!). The garlic fries were cold :( And the cheese was like crumbly parmesan. I would have brought them back but I absolutely hate wasting food so I just dug through for the crispy ones instead.

If I'm in the neighborhood, I would come back and it's definitely worth a try for anyone that loves a good burger.

The nice employee was just as charming when he was cleaning my table and almost made me bump it up to 4 stars. Keep it up!
author: Salina Z.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. My boyfriend and I come every time we're in the mood for a classic casual burger. No crazy frills or thrills, just one tasty ass burger! 

We always get the small 4oz burgers.. sometimes cheese, sometimes bacon, but ALWAYS a Straus creamery cone. Maybe i'm just a Straus fangirl, but they make the best damn dairy products in california (yes, i said it). DO NOT leave without one. 

When people ask about what "kind" of burgers they serve here, i think of the Burger Joint in the NYC le parker meridien.... sort of like a fresh, in-n-out style burger: very classic, and oh-so-cravable. It really hits the spot and the portion is perfect. They also have some great home cut fries!
author: Sandy H.

description: Loved this place.  Stopped by here after a 70 mile ride to Nicasio valley and back with some friends.  Awesome atmosphere and really tasty burgers and fries, oh and shakes... Boy was I bad that day....... :)
author: Jason O.

description:
I went to this place for the first time today and I have to say that it lives up to the hype. They have some amazing burgers and delicious fries. However, I was a bit disappointed with the amount of grease in their burger. 

I took a bite and the grease was dripping off the burger. It was kind of a bummer since it is supposed to be organic beef. 

I like that they have tables outside so you are able to do some people watching as you enjoy your tasty burger.
author: Chris V.

description:
Only recently have I started eating beef again and Super Duper has some super duper hamburgers!!! A bit on the greasy side, but the special sauce is deeeeeelish! I really enjoyed my hamburger, fries, and my super sour fresh lemonade. For dessert, I patiently waited for the vanilla soft serve cone dipped in chocolate... AWESOME! The only thing not awesome about it is the price... it costs around $4, which is about how much you're spending on a hamburger. Hmm... BUT on another plus side... the service is excellent! Everyone working there is friendly and patient as that place can go from bare to slam packed within 15 mins. 

I'll have to update my review after I try the soft serve sundae with chocolate chip cookies and BACON! Mmmm.... Excited beyond belief!
author: Misty G.

description: Stopped here on my way to watch the World Series. Ordered the super burger. What can I say, it tasted like any other burger. Wasn't to fond of the super sauce. I did like the homemade pickles that they offer at the counter.
author: Marck N.

description:
I've been here a few times, and both times, Super Duper has neither been Super or Duper. It's just been OK. 

For one thing, but I am not rating on this ... the restaurant looks sort of unfinished, with the walls adorned with plywood. Maybe they are going for that, but I don't know. 

I tried the Double Cheeseburger and it was a very good burger. Not as big as I would have thought, but a decent size burger nonetheless. Served with lettuce, tomato, onion and something called Super Duper Sauce, it was a juicy mess. Home made pickles are available. 

My only disappointment are the fries. In a word, they suck. They lacked any flavor whatsoever. I've tried them plain, with garlic, and both times, I've had limp, tasteless fries. Even with the garlic, it seemed to miss that key ingredient. I'll pass on those when I go back. 

A specialty is the Lemonade which they say is made with brown sugar. It looked different, but I didn't try that. Shakes are respectable. Served on quarter sheet bake pans, ala Taylor's and TrueBurger, I will go back, but not for the fries.  Outdoor seating is available.
author: Michael M.

description:
This place is pretty damned awesome.  Niman Ranch beef, homemade pickles, outrageously good garlic/parmesan fries, lemonade made with brown sugar.  Just a lot of nice touches.  

Had the single burger special...can't remember what it was called but it was cheap - less than $5.  

Much better than Burgermeister or any other burger in the 'stro.

Don't change a thing, guys.  We love you.  We need you.
author: jeff n.

description:
I'm definitely liking this new addition to the neighborhood.  The way to go seems to be a super bacon cheeseburger.  I have some friends who went early on, got a shake, and thought it was too runny.  When I went this week, I got a shake and it seemed a little too thick to drink through the narrow straw.  Maybe they just need wider straws for the shakes. 

I agree with other posters though who say the owner is genuinely interested in feedback, so I'm hoping they are able to figure it out.  It's so close to my house, I see my burger intake going up dramatically in my future.
author: Julie B.

description:
So delicious and so affordable! 

We ordered the veggie burger with cheese and the portobello burger with Humboldt Fog blue cheese, along with the regular fries and trio of dipping sauces. The veggie burger was really tasty, it had a really fresh, "healthy" flavor that I appreciated (rather than the greasy ones you get in most places). The portobello burger was also a hit. It doesn't say on the menu, but the portobello is breaded and deep fried, so it's crispy and meaty rather than runny with juice dripping down your hands. Somehow it wasn't greasy either--the most "healthy" tasting deep fried thing I've ever had without sacrificing the flavor. The blue cheese on top was perfect, totally worth the extra buck.

The fries on their own were okay, but the three dips were really tasty (all mayo-based). Also, they have home made pickles available at the condiments counter (amazing!). 

Also, I like that everything is organic/local/etc. but it doesn't comprimise the taste, and the decor of the place is super hip rather than the usual hippy granola vibe of similar restaurants. Can't wait to go back!
author: Christine B.

description:
Hell Yeah. This place rocks!

Being a vegetarian who craves for a burger could be a challenge at times.
But with Super Duper in town, what could be better? They serve an great portion of Breaded fried giant Portobello mushroom burger with cheese! 

drools~

Dessert is fabulous here. Their addictive organic Strauss sundae couldn't get any more thicker. Plus, there are all the toppings that include crispy bacon, scharffenberger chocolate sauce, fresh strawberries, pecan pie, etc. 

wee... you'll fly high. 

I think I'm going back there tomorrow.
author: Rika P.

description: I had always gone to their location downtown (4th and mission) but was happy to find out their was a location so close to me. We were greeted by two of their workers with enthusiasm. The place was packed, I was surprised that our orders came out so quickly! As we finished, the place had cleared out enough that the workers even said goodbye to us and invited us to come back again, which is almost unheard of in many other busy San Francisco sit down restaurants. Loved the location, the ambiance and the customer service. Definitely making this my new spot!
author: Francesca M.

description:
I went here for the first time, today.  It's a clean, bright place with friendly staff and quick service.

I had the single Super.  While I ate every bite of it, I was surprised at how bland the burger was, even with their super sauce, which didn't really have any flavor of its own.  I ended up plopping dollops of catsup and mustard on it to make it a real burger.  The burgers are also a bit on the small side, which is fine if you're a dieting chick or something, but no good for the rest of us.  I'll try the double next time.

The regular fries were excellent, crispy, hot.  Big props for getting that right.

A lot of people talk about the greasiness of the burgers, but I didn't find my burger to be very greasy at all.  Sure, greasier than a puck from McDonalds, but less greasy than an In n Out.  Not a big deal unless you're a little piggy who gains five pounds just by walking down the cooking-oil aisle.  And you know who you are.

Nice culinary upgrade in a neighborhood famous for its mediocre restaurants.  I'll definitely go back.
author: Andrew L.

description:
The burger is perfect. Cheap, organic, the bread is idea in both consistency and mass to meat ratio. Get the double. It's CHEAP! How come Burgermeister and Acme burger are SO expensive, with Super Duper being so greatly cheap.

Homemade pickles are awesome. Eat them. Eat a lot of them.

One thing I was a little perturbed by, was the Gold's Gym across the street. HORRIBLE PLACEMENT. The front of Super Duper is all glass. Across the street is the two story Gold's Gym with well washed, large glass windows. Let's cut to the chase, I feel bad eating a burger (that is oh so good) and seeing them; they feel bad seeing me eat them. Some blinds, a canopy, or an awning would be great here. You NEED IT Super Duper.
author: Robert P.

description: VERY good burgers here! Actually the best ones I tasted in San Francisco, after trying several ones. The burgers are very tasty, so good. OK, a bit juicy, but so good!
author: Alex P.

description: You might be super (dare I say duper?) greasy and artery clogging.  But you're in my top 5 burger spots baby.
author: Juv C.

description: Best burger in town. Maybe in the world. Juicy, flavorful, not too heavy - and the shakes and pickles are good too!
author: Formicas F.

description: favorite burger in the city + the workers arent zombies. the thousand island sauce is delicious!
author: Paul W.

description:
I love their organic aspects of the restaurant. They very big on composting and organic food.

Though the food is NOT the best described as healthy. But it's a very affordable restaurant. Cute place for a date.

No wifi here but it's in the Castro district so you can shop around after you eat. Beside their signature burgers, they have ice cream, not that good. I don't recommend it
author: Tin L.

description:
Super Duper - not so super on a Friday night.

1) Really, $4.75 for an In-N-Out burger equivalent (lettuce, tomato, cheese)?
2) Huh, $4.00 for Garlic Cheese fries that were 95% some grated parmesan cheese and a few flecks of garlic
3) Special sauce, whahhhh? No zip, no zest, no zap, no "special", just some mayo and ketchup mix...
4) They were blowin' out fries order after order, why were our warm, not hot, and not so crispy?
5) $4.00 for a medium sized soft serve cone dipped in chocolate...seriously?
6) What up with the unfinished plywood walls?  Don't get it.

Saw a few different friends there and then today. We all agreed, pretty overpriced, "okay" food, but so many other options for great burgers in the area!!!
author: Mark M.

description:
