This place is new, so it isn't surprising that there are still some kinks to work out. 

Atmosphere is lacking. The place feels like it is still under construction and gets very noisy since there is nothing to absorb the sound of people talking and cooks clattering about in the kitchen.

The burgers are forgettable. No flavor and quite greasy. The fries were a bit better, but not memorable either. 

It's not worth stopping in for a visit yet, maybe in a few more months it will get better.
author: Jess J.

description:
You know, I don't really eat beef all that often, but I had to try the burger here seeing that it is only one block away from me. I also tried the chicken. And the garlic parmesan fries. And the strawberry milkshake.

All in all, this place is a'ight. The burgers are definitely above average, but won't blow you away. The fries are actually kind of sad. The toppings are a little skimpy and, well, sad looking. 

The strawberry milkshake though - that thing was awesome. I've gone back for that a couple of times.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Super Duper's burgers are more reminiscent of In 'N Out Burger than Burger Bar, but that's not necessarily a negative. They're ample and not too greasy, and the fries are skinny and crispy. The servers are efficient and friendly, and would rather call your order by name than by a number. A Niman Ranch burger will set you back $3.75 and a cheeseburger is $4.25 (add $2 each for a double). Fries are $2.25 and milkshakes and ice cream are also available.
Super Duper Burger also has something you'll never find at In 'N Out: a couple of well-selected beer taps. Granted, the beer variety isn't as extensive as Burger Bar's, but the light, refreshing North Coast Scrimshaw pilsner and the piney Racer 5 IPA from Bear Republic are more than adequate. You can eat inside the cozy restaurant or, on a sunny day, sit at an outdoor table.
Whether you're in a blue state or red state, conservative or liberal, evangelical or atheist, burgers are as American as the 4th of July, diners and barbecues, and it's no wonder they are such a great match with American ales and lagers. Unlike mass-market American beers, which only add cold and wet, American craft beers like Scrimshaw and Racer 5 offset the savory umami flavors in the burger.
author: chuck l.

description: If a milk-shake brings all the boys to the yard, how come you can't find a milk-shake in the Castro?  Oh wait, now you can!  Along with some 100% natural ground beef... and I'm not just talking about the clientele.  Plus beer and wine, and home made pickles.  5 stars... even on a cheat day, it doesn't feel so bad (just skip the bun).
author: Laura S.

description:
Amazingly simple menu but serves the purpose of being a burger joint. The beef is of pretty decent quality (my husband compares it to Bullshead in West Portal). Burgers are not "monster portions", which is perfect for chicks. Guys can get the super double and be reasonably satisfied. 

Definitely a repeat!
author: Sandy Y.

description:
Ok, I committed a cardinal Yelp sin and docked a restaurant that had just opened up.

The place is still under construction - i went back yesterday and it had definitely improved - more employees, cleaner, menu up, etc.  (Though why you would open a resto that isn't finished is beyond me... you were just asking for poor yelp reviews).

The burgers, while initially underwhelming given the hype this place got, are becoming addictive.  It's clear the owners are just going for "simple is better" and once you throw your hopes for green garlic aioli and shaved truffles on your burgers, these are pretty solid and well priced.  Super Duper will eventually be a solid 4-star burger spot.
author: Anthony L.

description: We're all about fresh food and high quality ingredients, so we were excited to try Super Duper Burgers during our trip to San Francisco. My husband and I both had the mini burgers with cheese - I got the regular fries and he got the garlic cheese fries. SO GOOD! The meat is juicy but not greasy and the buns are awesome. We loved this place and would recommend it to anyone! Wish I'd been more hungry to try one of their milkshakes. :)
author: Amanda R.

description: Awesome burgers, fries, and shakes.  And the friendliness of the staff at this location is just incredible.  Love this place.
author: Mike A.

description:
How could the meat hungry Castro be without a decent burger specialty joint for all these years? This brought me back to the early heydays of the 90's very reminiscent of the Hot N' Hunky burgers that once was thee Castro's burger joint before they suddenly disappeared. 

Thinking that the good old days, and my last memory of a great burger at a specific place and time could never be topped, for me it has. I got the simply stated super burger, 8oz of juicy carnivore glory, I think I went a bit overboard by adding bacon AND cheese, next time it's one or the other, but for trying the place for the first time, no regrets on the virgin tour here. Yes, I felt like Madonna touched for very first time, like a virgin, when my heart palpitated....but it was fine! My dining buddy got the mini, probably a more portion conscious and smarter decision, plus she got fries that we split (good move). The bulk of the staff was very enthusiastic with the exception of the kid with the knit cap on such a balmy evening. I tipped as I paid for my order thinking that It would at least make him crack a smile or say thank you, but that too cool for school hipster-twink spell was just too strong. He held pouring my draft beer hostage for about 15 minutes, but it was perfect timing with my order being ready at the same time, maybe that's just how they do it there, but oh well, cost you one yelp star away from a perfect 5, no biggie. 

The website states "fast food burgers at slow food values" but you'd never feel like you were at the golden arches or crack in the box. 

Welcome back to my Castro meat fix!
author: B H.

description:
I have been on a quest to try all of the so-called "best bugers" in SF. Super Duper is my winner. I'm also a pretty big fan of the Serpentine burger, but Super Duper wins based on bang for your buck. 

There's really not a lot to say, these are just awesome, flavorful burgers. All of the ingredients seem fresh, the burger looks great and not like a greasy mess. The fries are good, and they serve beer. The service is always incredibly nice, and I love their milkshakes. 

The one thing I would avoid is their sundae with bacon, this sounds awesome but in execution it's kind of gross. It was just crumbled up burnt bacon on top of the regular ice cream, not a pairing. If I lived in the Castro I would be 600lbs from eating here every day.
author: Beth D.

description:
If all they sold were pickles. I'd still go. They make them on them on the premises and are FREE! Yeah, I know right, totally awesome. 

I personally like the Super Duper burger single patty with bacon and plain fries. The garlic fries are bomb, but a bit messy.

All in all. I highly recommend Super Duper for an awesome cheap burger!
author: Manny A.

description: Excellent burgers, fries (garlic fries, especially), and soft serve.  Did you know Super Duper has delicious chocolate chip cookies as well?  One consideration at this location is the scarcity of parking.  My wife and I have opted for take out here and you call in your order ahead of time, and double park briefly (sorry other Market Street drivers) and pick up your order.  Service is speedy and friendly, and the foil paper wrappers will keep the burgers toasty and fries warm until you get home.
author: Chris T.

description:
OMG first of all this place has made it to my top 5 burger joints of all time!!

When I first walked in I really loved the place, the setup, the design and of course the food!  I went here by recommendation from a friend who lived in San Francisco.  I must say it was well worth it!  I ordered the double when in all honesty the single would've been enough and this is coming from a guy who LOOOOVES food and can eat large quantities.  I also had the garlic fries which were superb.  Very simple concept but the flavors tell it all.  You're able to add in what type of toppings or whatever they're called in your burger so the choice is yours!  But they do have some toppings that are not free but are only like a few cents to add.  Definitely recommend it if you're in the area.  its in the middle of the city so if you enjoy people watching.  Definitely recommend the patio its small seating area but has a bordering wall surrounding the patio to add a little bit of privacy as well.
author: Chad P.

description: BEST BURGERS I'VE EVER HAD!!!!!! This place is amazing!!!!! I got a super duper burger (2 patties) with cheese and bacon and garlic fries. DELICIOUS! If you want a burger in San Fran, this is the place!
author: Beth P.

description: Okay, I'm not a huge fan of burgers..and to be honest I haven't had one of their burgers..but friends I go with say they are GREAT, along with the fries, and ice cream.  I've only had the chicken sandwich..and it's my favorite chicken sandwich in the castro.  The place is hip, the service is friendly and fast..and the food is great!!!
author: Kevin G.

description:
Not much of a menu really but the milkshakes are so damn good you wanna go back for a second helping because since I'm on a diet, they're low-fat.
Being that this place is environmentally responsible, they get an A+ in my book.
author: Joe V.

description:
HELLO!  These burgers are screaming!  The concept is simple:  nothing fancy.  I do not know what they do, but these are like melt-in-your mouth yummy yummy yummy burgers.

The garlic cheese fries are awesome too.  And they have a jar of all-u-can-eat pickles :-)

The burgers are kind of like In-n-Out, but just better in every way.
author: Kelly A.

description: Had my first 4 oz. with fries today. I like the branding but the food didn't deliver. It was Super OK not Super Duper. Fries, ok. Burger was juicy and merited the warning on the chalkboard but just a little bland. I can't Super Recommend it but it's an ok burger joint.
author: Nathaniel R.

description:
I didn't want to compare this place to In-and-Out, but I think that's what they're going for.  It was basically gourmet In-and-Out.  Yes it costs about twice as much, but you get what you pay for.  
-Niman or Prather Ranch beef (can't remember which) 
-House-made pickles, and I love the idea, but they fell a little short.  
-Beer.   Can't get that at In-and-Out.  $4
-Grated Parmesean and fresh Parsley on the Garlic-Cheese Fries

Bottom Line:  Burger, Garlic-Cheese Fries, Racer 5......$12.  Not Bad.
author: Dan L.

description:
2 1/2 stars. was really hoping that something interesting or special would go into the old Pasta Pomodoro location on Market. Superburger is neither. The sparseness of the decor reflects the sparseness of the menu which, in turn, reflects the mediocrity of the food. Not that the food is bad at all, but I would not pass up Urban Burger or Barney's, for example, to go back to SD. In fact, I think a lot of regular restaurants in the Castro have much better -- and more substantial -- burgers than SD.

I did appreciate that the burgers were not greasy and that the Double gave the option for a decent size. The garlic and cheese fries saved the day. The staff got the order in front of us wrong, as well as ours, even though it was not at all crowded.

So next time we have a quick burger fix in the 'Stro probably will just go back to Sliders.
author: Eric P.

description:
Awesome burger! Very clean, great fast service, great prices and did I mention the burger was great!
In the 20 minutes or so that I was waiting for the 37 home, I was able to order and eat a burger and drink with plenty of time to relax before the bus arrived. I hadn't planned it that way, things just worked out :)
I'll definitely be back again, this time maybe I'll stay a while.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
Best burger in the Castro.
It's affordable, the restaurant is clean and has clean bathrooms!
When I think of burgers in the Castro, I used to think of Sliders, which smells weird, is super greasy, overpriced, and just overall unappealing. I'm so happy Super Duper is here.

Really friendly service also- the person at the cash register remembered me on my 2nd visit, which was probably 2 weeks after my first visit. I would definitely recommend it.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Great food, great atmosphere,one star off for the white dude that calls you when your order is ready,  he looks and acts like he hates his job. Didn't smile once. Acted like us ordering food was a hassle for him to take our small order.
author: Jourdain D.

description: After a full day of walking around in the castro my boyfriend and I deceided to go to super duper burger based on all the good reviews on this place. The burgers were delicious and the fries were even better, somehow they messed up on our order and gave us an extra burger on accident. Best mistake ever, I highly reccomend :)
author: Stephanie R.

description:
i chose to eat here, and my 3 willing friends were just as surprised as i was how great it was.

they have everything right, from including tax in the menu costs, to a simple yet broad menu.

lastly, the burgers are just good.
author: Ameer N.

description: SUSTAINABLE PERFECTION. Seriously. Get the mini burger..... medium rare. Fries. MMMMM. And if you are feeling fatty, get the vanilla shake with malt and chocolate sauce...... AMAZING. Seriously an amazing and affordable spot. Nice staff.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Very friendly and hot looking workers here.  The organic soft serve was only OK and the chocolate shake was also OK.  I was too full to try the burgers.  Perhaps next time.

Note:  There are two restrooms here.  One for men and other other for women.
author: Food S.

description:
Had the super (double) & garlic cheese fries.

Tasted okay, but greasy.  Paper holding burger has puddles of oil in it.
Not enough garlic in fries and cheese looks like generic parmesan like what you get at pizza places.

Marlowe burger much better.
author: David L.

description: Go here from time to time too grab a burger and a coke. Wouldnt say a "quick" berger though since it does take some time, but its worth the wait. I wouldnt recommend going around lunch time (11-2) though since the line usually goes out the door if it's not raining. Worth the price and wait.
author: Brannon T.

description: Awesome burgers and incredible milk shakes.  Must try
author: David D.

description:
Good, but not great. 

I liked the burger, which had some tasty meat, but I didn't feel like there was that much flavor going on in terms of the whole thing. And you can get pickles on the side, which.. Idk what it is but the pickles in San Francisco don't taste right lol Might just be me. 

Garlic fries were good, but they're not too special. Very oily, by the way. 

Ice cream was pretty great, wish I'd tried a shake. 

Overall, a good experience with solid burgers. However, if you're looking for something amazing, I would definitely try out Roam Artisan.
author: Sydney E.

description: Garlic Fries, need i say more? The burgers here are worth every penny! A must!
author: Jónatan P.

description: In my $10 combo meal, I get a better burger than at most high end places in the city. New favorite burger in SF. Juicy, Niman ranch deliciousness.
author: Janett R.

description: I love Super Duper. The burgers are really good. Given, there are much better burger places, but in the middle of Downtown/Financial District this will be the best place you'll find. This place is rather knew but they definitely got acknowledgement quick. They are conveniently located on market one block away from Westfield mall. They have just the mini burger and the regular, and you can choose what you want with it. The average stuff really. It's a nice place to just sit down and eat. There is a lot of seating, but you can expect it to get full quickly. There are always a couple seats open though! You pick up your own food and it isn't really a hassle, their fries aren't bad also. I would definitely come back and the burgers are really cheap here so it's perfect if you're on a budget!
author: Veronica L.

description:
Definitely a great addition to the neighborhood!

The burgers are small so don't go thinking you're going to get a ginormous patty.  I must say that the small patty is grossly disproportionate to the rest of the burger.  That said, it's still deelicious!  I was also surprised that the garlic cheese fries weren't that garlicky and the cheese is just grated over the top.  I was expecting more garlic flavor and melted cheese on top.  I do love their homemade pickles though.  (Would be even better if they were pickled longer!)

The place is clean and the staff is very nice!  I need to try the milkshake next time!
author: Vicente G.

description:
BurgerQuest 2010 - The adventure continues. Maybe I should just put my weight as the lead line on these burger reviews. You could tell by the rising number when each review was done in relationship to the next. No, no, I'm not doing that. Yikes. 

Having grown up in SF, I'm mentally prepared for when she throws a summer heatwave fastball at me but 85 out of the clear as a muthafuckah blue? I'll take it and a bike ride for burgers with the best gal. Some places get good and bad reviews for the major moves and missteps. Super Duper scored its stars with the little plays that don't show up in the boxscore (as the sportswriter cliche goes). 

To wit: 

-Menu items including tax and totaling up to nice even amounts. Why doesn't everybody do this? Crikey. 
-That same menu being simple and clear (if cribbed from In-N-Out) 
-Self serve homemade pickles were sweetish but a nice waiting nosh 
-good friendly service and sensible basic seating/deco 

The burger itself was also in the In-N-Out mold which is not a bad thing and a borderline great thing for a serious city dweller who doesn't venture out to the chain world very often. Be aware this is a smaller sized burger. A lot of people have had their appetites desensitized by the Fuddrucker/Red Robin/$6 burger monstrosities out there. This is a good, sensibly sized burger with excellent proportions of meat-veg-cheese-bun-sauce. By fast food standards this would be much less, better quality meat, more, fresher veg, and way less sauce. The whole thing was a nice little ensemble. My only critique would be an option to have the patty cooked to order, both our burgers were uniformly medium and for good beef like that I would have gone medium rare. But I quibble. 

Regular fries were skinny, tasty not of the overly soft In-N-Out style (a good thing). The garlic-cheese fries were not my thing but She dug them, the cheese is more the shaker style Parmesan than melted cheddar or nacho or whatever else you might be used to in your lactose fry condiment. The garlic is lighter than what I'm used to but sticks to the "moderated palate" thing these guys seem to be going for. Lemonade and ice tea were nice, under sweetened which was awesome and you could really taste the citrus. We split a soft serve cone for dessert and it was the bomb dizzle. Puts a crappy McD's cone to shame (I know, gross, but where else does one get soft serve cones readily these days?). I'm assuming the shakes would be equally thick and creamy with this soft serve as the base. 

Overall, a very solid, reasonably priced option for your burger fiending. If I find myself hungry in that neck again I won't hesitate to trade my currency for their tasty goods. 

The missus wanted to ding them a star for their lack of Tabasco sauce or user accessible condiments in general. I held her off this time but, guys, get some more sauce options beyond ketchup, yellow mustard, and chipotle mayo por favor.
author: Milk N.

description: Best Veggie Burger in town! Excellent service and tasty sides! Oh and the chocolate dipped soft serve is to die for.
author: James V.

description:
the chicken sandwich is ok, but for sure this burger's better than umami's.  

**you wont see girlies carrying yoga mats in this district though.  be prepared to see brief clad santas around xmas time (w/ bells on, of course).
author: Lady K.

description: Went here based on reviews from fellow yelpers and an urge to try garlic fries when visiting San Francisco and I'm sure glad I did! Got the mini burger with cheese, bacon, avocado and all the toppings. It's one of the best burgers I've had and wished we had more time in the city to eat here again. The garlic fries were alright, but not that much of a garlic taste to them but still were alright. Tried the chocolate shake and it's a must.
author: Thao B.

description:
WHAT HAPPENED TO THE FRENCH FRIES? Having been at this location before, I was looking forward to what use-to-be their dependable fries especially with a burger. What arrived were fries that were thicker-cut than I recall having previously, but that's not the major problem . . . the worst part . . . they were SOGGY, and LIMP and very BLAH tasting. If I didn't know better I would say they were having performance anxiety.

Thought maybe it was an off day, but when I asked about them later, the counter person said, the recipe had indeed changed, and many other customers have been complaining about them. I read in the news that the original owner is building his empire  opening other partnerships and such, but please FIX YOUR FRIES. Use to love the original.
author: Shelley F.

description: Super Freshly ground meat everyday! Super yummy crunchy fries, Super nice staff, Super cute place, Super delicious homemade pickels and my Super Duper Burger was Super Duper Fresh and delicious! All this Super Duper goodness for only $7! You can't ask for more.
author: Karen T.

description: Definitely a good burger.....right price.  The vanilla soft ice cream cone dipped in chocolate a must have if you go.  The french fries are average.....but the homemade pickles are the best.  I am definitely going back when in the neighborhood.
author: Doug B.

description:
So the food was great-- tasty and not greasy AT ALL, the spiked milkshake was sooo good, and the bleu cheese was perfect (and homemade)-- but this shout out is for the people who work there.
The cashier was nice and made some great recommendations, and was also very calm at a time when they were pretty busy. Then there was the manager (or owner?) who not only checked on us during our meal, but was right there showing me how to open the bio-degradable straw without breaking it.
Then, a blind man entered and the manager was attentive and helpful, guiding the guy through the ordering process. Seriously, great work Super Duper. It's not often you find a relaxing dining experience in the city.
Thanks!
author: Hope K.

description:
If you want a simple grass fed burger that's in the neighborhood, this get's the job done.  (so far so good, went twice)  It's tasty for the price, slightly greasy but ok'ish.  Neiman's Ranch meat is fresh/great. (I only eat range fed/organic beef)  
~Please get some ketchup without high fructose corn syrup though!  I have to get it to go so I can use my whole foods ketchup at home.
author: Jon S.

description:
We came on a Tuesday evening dinner time. The place was crowded, and yet, by the time we finished ordering a table opened up. Our blue cheese veggie burgers with avocado came and they were delicious. So were the garlic fries and the fancy three-dip fries. Great place to go for lunch.

The crowd was an eclectic mix of tourists, hipsters, and gays. The service was attentive and the prices reasonable.
author: Kenny H.

description:
I haven't sampled the entire menu (it's not vast) but I have to say finally an awesome burger in SF. 
Every other place has something wrong with it. Toast and Burgermeister are ok but I don't like the bread. Luna Park's is too dry. This was juuuuust right.

It's so close to my apartment too! I love it.
author: Trixie R.

description: Super Duper makes a pretty good burger. They make 4 oz patties so you get 2 on a regular burger. I got the special sauce, lettuce, tomato and cheese on mine. I also had the fries with the three sauces, mostly because I am a serious sucker for fries. If I am in the area and needing a burger, I would go back. Maybe get some avocado next time...
author: Shanna T.

description: Kinda greasy spoon, but you know a place is good when the hamburgers are irregular shaped
author: Matt B.

description: Never thought I would find myself in this place but now that it happened I'm glad it did.  The burgers are superb.  The fries and garlic fries are fine but the burgers are delectable.  They've got beer on tap which is cool but the burgers are divine.  Prices are fair and staff is alright and the burgers kick a**!
author: Sin F.

description: A "that hit the spot" type of burger, not amazing, but satisfying. Simple menu, quality ingerdients, clean establishment, eco-friendly, pleasant staff, and reasonable prices. No complaints, except to say that I wish they had whole wheat burger buns :(
author: Bluey B.

description:
The burgers taste SOOOO good, with their topping of secret sauce.  I care not that they are a little greasy and a tad small.   I enjoy the basic bliss of burger/bread/cheese/magic sauce, I forgo additional toppings.

Fries are pretty good-could be more crispy, but they're perfectly salted.  And the soft serve ice cream is by Strauss, which is local and tasty and all that good stuff.  Burger, fries and drink are plenty filling.

The place is clean, staff is sweet as pie.  This place isn't trying to be high-end.  All the elements just come together here for a really enjoyable basic burger experience.  I love you Super Duper!
author: tucker l.

description:
I'm a fan of this place.  Good tasting burgers and how could you not love garlic fries.   If you are on a health kick you could get a grilled chicken sandwich, but why bother being on a health kick, those are no fun.  

The staff is always smiley and friendly, which I appreciate.
author: Sergio C.

description: Oh man.  This place is def going in my "oh so delicious" burger box.  Came with my bf, place was empty ordered 2 bacon cheeseburgers, fries and drinks.  Food came out very fast. Burgers were flavorful and moist.  Tasted very very fresh!  We left very satisfied.  We'll return for more burgers and hopefully some soft serve for dessert.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Went here after hearing glowing reviews.  I'm a burger lover, so naturally I'm on burger tour of San Francisco.

The menu isn't very deep here, but the food was spot on.  Perfectly cooked burger, and excellent fries.
author: nate m.

description:
Ate here earlier this week.

The burgers are spot on.  This of this as a version of in and out in the Castro.  Small menu, simple food, but done will.  

You can pass on the desserts.

The burgers are smaller then most, but tasty.  $9 out the door for a burger, soda and fries.
author: Ken p.

description: One of my favorite burger joints in the city. Conveniently located on market in the heart of downtown. Nice and big. There is also an outside area to people watch while your yumminess on your burgers. The burgers are just perfect. Great and juicy on all parts. This is a no-brainer place to check out. You will thank me later.
author: Darin Bom N.

description:
5 star burger joint.

Highlights
- burger.  great meat, ground daily.  cooked to order.  really nice looking, you can tell they put love into construction.  just cause it's a burger doesn't mean it can't be pretty: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=HMi16CwlsKFXj2yyfXbovQ

- strawberry shake - made with fresh strawberries.  a real winner.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hXeusGZQvH5oMxaR6XgYwA?select=NHlJ3TOFGQGqkwPnaCgrEg

- homemade pickles.  the way to my heart.

- the owners each came up to ask what we thought.  nice touch.

- can't wait for tomato season.  given the connection with starbelly, maybe they'll use heirlooms?  (I'd pay extra...hint, hint...)

- grease issue - not sure what people are talking about.  it's a burger.  that involves a little grease.  but in this case, not a ton and not nearly as much as most places (because, thankfully, the meat is a reasonable size - not very american but better for me!).  if you don't want grease, grab a carrot from the farmers market.
author: Chris A.

description:
YUM! 
Great Burgers
Fare chicken sandwich.
Amazing and I do mean amazing Pecan Pie Hot Fudge Sundae, I eat that instead of dinner sometimes.
author: Troy C.

description:
Nice spot to hit if you're craving a good old-fashioned burger and fries.  No complaints at all.  Juicy Niman Ranch meat plus some garlic cheese fries hit the spot just right.  

They also have self-serve homemade pickles that are ridiculously good.  

Definitely a good option if you're in the area (although not as good a deal as the incomparable In 'n Out, whose burger is similar in size but half the price).
author: F. P.

description: Good burger.  Opted for the "mini" which is a 4oz. burger.  The bigger burger is 8oz. but  it's a double burger, so you get 2 4oz. patties.  4oz for me is plenty.  Get it with all the fixings.  The fries were good too, but I think if you don't get a fresh batch it'll be pretty soggy.  The free unlimited pickles are a nice touch.  Good pickles, considering I don't like pickles all that much anyway.  Not sure if I'd make a special trip here just for the burger, but if I'm in the area and want a burger, I'll stop here.
author: Jason Y.

description: Love love love Super Duper Burger!! So greasy and good! Get ready for a mess and to smell like burgers afterwards, but isn't that kind of expected when you eat good burgers? I love coming here and getting garlic fries, a little carafe of wine, and a super duper burger. Like the other reviewers have said, there will be a line, but it moves fast! The best part is all the beef is grass fed, so it eases your conscious while chowing down! Highly recommend for greasy grub!
author: Katie L.

description: I had high hopes for this place but wasn't impressed. I had a standard with ketchup, tomato, and pickles, and I thought it tasted like something I could make myself, nothing special. I'm also not a fan of the sweet pickles they offer, so that affected my "meh" review as well. I know a lot of people love this, but I think I'm more of a 'Roam' burger girl.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I tried the super burger for the first time and enjoyed it.  I also liked their pickles.  The patty was cooked just perfect.

TIP:  If you're hungry, you need to order two burgers.
author: Ricky M.

description:
Yeah, the portobello mushroom sandwich was tasty, the cashier was friendly, and the place is spotless.  I like that the posted prices include the tax, too.

But, $9 for a portion-controlled mushroom sandwich and fries tripped my cost-benefit meter into negative territory.  Soda would have been, what?, another $2?  

The room noise is over-bright, too, as if it were designed to get you to eat and leave quickly.

I am glad that a burger joint has quality vegetarian and chick-a-tarian choices.  But, I am not glad enough to go back.
author: Galen W.

description: Really good. The line may look intimidatingly long but rest assured, it moves fast! Ive had a taste of all their burgers before at their soft opening but didnt care for their chicken. When I recenty visited, I only felt like chicken so I hoped they had improved it since I last had it....and they did! the chicken burger was juicy and flavorful. I added bleu cheese and it was an amazing sandwhich. Their fresh squeezed lemonade is awesome and their garlic fries are also nom-alishcious. they forgot my 3 side sauces that I ordered for my fries tho.... But I probably didnt the extra calories anyway!
author: Amy S.

description: Amazing burgers. Juicy and delicious. Excellent service and I definitely have gone back for more.
author: Eric F.

description:
YOUR GONNA WANT TO READ THIS B.S!!!

1 Star only because they have decent food.

The service there is HORRIBLE! Me and my Co-workers ate there often, because it was close. We always received bad service and had barley enough time to actually eat our meal because they are so freaking slow.

But what stopped us from going was this -
We called in our order, had the girl repeat it back to us to make sure it was right, then we headed over.
We got there and I see a bag go onto the pick up counter where the guy is supposed to grab it and call out the number. I wasn't sure if It was food or not so I just waited. after 20 minutes I go up and ask if he can get us some sauces ready to throw in our bag so we could leave and salvage our lunch time. He asked me for my name and looked at the bag and hands it to me. Im staring at him like "what the hell dude" and tell him its been sitting up there for ever and is probably cold and soggy now. He didn't seem to care so I left with my co-workers. We get all the way back to the store and find out that each of our burgers is WRONG! 

By that time I had enough. I marched my little self back down there and asked for Jessica who my receipt said placed my order via the phone.
I very calmly and respectfully explained that my order was wrong. She IMMEDIATELY gets defensive and says "Well what do you mean? I repeated it back to you on the phone." In a snotty tone. I just looked her dead in the eye and calmly asked "Then why is it wrong?" she got more of an attitude with me, trying to say its what I wanted. Then her bosses jumped in and apologized and started talking to me and told Jessica to go ring in other customers at the register next to us. As Im talking I look over and I see Jessica starting to cry while talking to a customer. Then 10 seconds later she is full on sobbing. Im standing there thinking "Are you serious?!" as she excuses herself in the middle of someones order to go break down in the bath room. I was extremely calm while interacting with her, even though I was throughly pissed the hell off and was even more enraged when she tried to argue with me. There was no need to cry.
Her bosses just decided to comp me my meal that I had ready, since I had no time for them to correct it. 

Listen here Super Duper, Yall have good food, but clean your freaking attitudes up! When me and my Co-workers come in and drop about 50 dollars a day on our lunch, we deserve your damn respect and a smile. Act like you like your jobs! Get it together.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Three stars for the burgers and fries.  Good, solid hamburger, but nothing really special or memorable.  But priced fairly, with convenient late-ish hours.  I'll come back when I feel like a burger.

One extra star for the extra-friendly and helpful counter guy.  In this case, that made the difference for me.

The real house-made lemonade is good too!
author: David T.

description:
Went here today for lunch and we ordered superburger & garlic cheese fries. Omg - it was so GOOD! I have been on this burger kick lately and this place fits the bill. 

The burgers are Niman ranch and YES, they are way juicier. Seriously I could not stop talking about the burger for the next 3 hours. And the garlic cheese fries were hella good.  Very garlicky.  I don't know how they did it but you don't see the chunks of garlic yet the flavor is there. Nice touch adding the Parmesan cheese. Nothing like glamming up the fries a tad. 

Will definitely be back when the burger urge kicks in. Saw on the menu that they have organic soft serve. Saw several people walking out with tall cones and milk shakes...definitely going to try that on the next round.
author: Cris H.

description: Not the best burger but it's tasted good. I mean I think I have gotten to the point in my life when I want amazing food all the time and this was just alright, so I'll pass. A bit on the greasy side. I prefer Guys but definitely a place with bacon jam or avocado come on now...
author: Loren B.

description: best. burger. ever. I am so happy that I found this place. The burger and garlic fries combo, amazing. . best bang for your buck. It is fresh food made fast, not fast food. quality food made from quality ingredients. you need to go here.
author: Lucy P.

description: Yum.  Great burgers.  Decent prices.  For the quality of their burgers you definitely cannot beat their prices.  I'm definitely coming back.  And I'm really glad I ordered my burger with bacon.  Bacon makes everything better.  I now have a newfound appreciation for Super Duper after getting ripped off at Umami Burger.
author: Melanie C.

description:
This will probably be one of those joints that will survive the test of time because we are all suckers for a mouthwatering burger.  If you're not feeling the urge to trek it all the way to the wharf or Daly City for what feels like an In n Out burger experience, look no more...Pretty similar theme except that there's no window to watch those ambitious potato mashers who look like they're on crack, smashing potatoes at a rate of 1000/minute.

The burgers were okay and the menu was a bit disappointing given the name.  Just know that a "super duper" means lettuce and tomatoes.  Yep...that's it.  The fries and burger were SuperDuper salty and my vanilla shake was watered down but still pretty good.  Friendly staff and a bin to compost, which I thought was original.  All in all, the place was okay and worth trying to support what looks to probably become a neighborhood gem.
author: Darren B.

description: got the burger with bacon. solid burger but still miss my corner bistro days in NYC.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
I'm always up for a burger, so when Super Duper appeared on Market Street where the old Pasta Pomodoro was, I had to check it out.

I ordered the superburger, which is basically a cheeseburger with the works.  My husband ordered the chicken sandwich.  We both got fries and drinks.  Tab came to just over $20.

The burger was good.  Not fantastic, but good.  The girl at the counter cautioned that they cooked their burgers medium and asked if that was ok.  It was fine with me, but they might want to recalibrate what they think is medium.  Mine was medium well at best.  Still moist, but not medium.  As others have noted, the super sauce is nothing to write home about.  My husband said the chicken was really good - very spicy.  I'll definitely give that a try next time.  And they keep a jar of pickles next to the condiments, which is nice.

One thing I really like about the place is that everything is either reusable (aluminum trays) or compostable, including the cups and straws.  This place is definitely doing the right thing when it comes to materials.  

Bottom line - the food's on par with most diner burger joints.  Fine if you're hungry and not looking for a seriously good burger.  For that you'll have to check out Urban Burger or Burgermeister.
author: Dan S.

description:
Oh, dear. I'm gonna get so fat.

This place just moved in around the corner from my boyfriend's studio -- aka where I spend most of my days. We went in for lunch today, and were blown away. The food was inexpensive and delicious, particularly the portobello mushroom sandwich! And the pickles were crunchy, abundant, and tasty-- next time I might just skip the fries and get my crunch factor from the pickles exclusively!

In a perfect world, there'd be more options for wine other than red or white, and the fries might be a little better (our shoestring fries got cold quickly, and weren't as omigod awesome as the sandwiches), but really -- with food this good and this cheap nearby, my resolution to cook more at home might be going out the window.
author: Nora S.

description: I ordered the veggie burger and it was really good! The bun was toasted, not too greasy and the burger had great flavors. I also enjoyed many, many  pickles which you can help yourself too- I love pickles so a self-serve bar is a very nice addition in my opinion. I'd definitely visit this place again!
author: Natalie M.

description:
I gotta go with Ed U again on his review of Super Duper.  I was told that SD could challenge In-n-Out and since I've been on a burger binge of late I decided to stop by after drinks at the Page to see what SD had to offer.

I got the Super Duper Double and fries and saw that the meat was Niman Ranch so was looking forward to some flavorful hamburger.  The burger was pretty juicy and had a total Taylors/Gotts feel to it.  Once I dug in, however, I was not impressed and was a bit disappointed.  Maybe it was the high expectations?  Whatever it was, it just didn't have that impact that left me smiling.  I'll rather go to In-n-Out or Pearls in the city if I'm gonna go sans cloth napkin and Super Duper just didn't live up to their namesake for me...
author: Gene X.

description: Good burgers and chix sandwich, fair fries; didn't try the chix salad, but looked great so will have to try that next time. Ice cream is pretty good, although I've had better "hard chocolate shell" topping at other places. Still, recommended!
author: Ali S.

description:
Being a vegetarian for a year and a half, I decided to take a one month carnivorication in early summer and this place was one of my first tourist attractions.

Location: Awesome location right in between the Church and Castro MUNI stations. Easy to get to via public transportation, walking or driving. There's a plethora of things to do before and after dining or lunching here. This area is an oasis for social living.

Space: This decor of the place is very modern while simultaneously reminiscent of a high school cafeteria. It reminds me of a trendy cafeteria-style restaurant in New York City. The actual arrangement fo the tables is kind of awkward. There are rectangle tables, round tables and high tables and it's kind of really awkward to navigate through. This is specially inconvenient since you have to go pick up your food once it's done.

Ambience: Gays, gays, gays are more gays. Didn't see many lesbians. But did I mention that its packed with gays. I think this is the high school experience these gay boys never got to experience because this place if full of "clics". You walk in and people stare you down, there are conspicuous whispers followed by group chuckles. Only this time they're not laughing at your effeminateness or your homosexuality, they're laughing at your underdeveloped pecks, lack of abs or bad haircut.

Food/Drink: This of the burgers and fries from In N' Out. That's exactly it. Only there are two difference. One, all the food here is organic, locally grown and free range. Two, it's more expensive than In N' Out. While it's more expensive for the exact same taste, I do appreciate the local quality of it rather than giving it to a Jesus-Freak of a large of corporation. The burgers are generally good and the fries are fantastic. Not much in the drink area outside of soft drinks.

Service: Cute.

Overall: Awesome place to stop by, get judged, judge and get a quick, delicious meal.
author: SF N.

description:
its on market street near the castro...no parking is easy around here.

i'm disappointed.  my relatives, my friends have all said, this is a great burger.  I respect each and every one of them.  i believe what they say.

they said its in the castro district and its very good.  its worth it.  

well, its not.  for the price, 4.50 for a mini, which means one patty...regular means 2 patties.  I did not get the flavor i wanted out of them.

my biggest problem.  it tasted bitter and salty.  they use green leaf lettuce...was that bitter?  i don't think so.  i tasted the bun, it seemed fine, PERFECTLY toasted though.  I tried the tomato.  the super sauce.  the sauteed onions.  the burger itself.

I COULD NOT FIGURE OUT why it was so salty and bitter when i took a bite.  Nothing seemed to be the answer but all together it was bitter and salty.

i'm sad because this is the first 1 star i've ever given.  i don't think i'll come back unless someone is treating and wants me to give it a second try.

ALSO, I DRIPPED GREASE FROM THE BURGER ON MY SHIRT AND I DIDN'T UNWRAP IT, IT STILL LEAKED!  I had to go home and change before i went anywhere else.
author: Bing D.

description: This joint doesn't need my help to be popular. The burgers and the chicken sandwiches are so good I have trouble deciding which to get. If you strip out each individual ingredient they are quality on their own. The only negative thing i can say is that they are a little messy, but that is an idiotic criticism of a burger. If you go at lunch they will combo the fries and drink just like the larger chains. If you go 15 minutes before they close, they don't act annoyed though they probably are. I call that great service. I'm not fat, but I do have high cholesterol, so you know you can trust my opinion on burgers. I've put in the necessary time.
author: Tyler M.

description:
Ok, so the "cheese fries" are pretty much just french fries with a sprinkling of your run of the mill grated parmesan.  What!?  No ooey gooey melty cheese goodness!?  I like how they tried an alternative to the typical American cheese, but it's be nice if they still used a melt-friendly one, like jack cheese or something. 

Next up was the fried portobello mushroom burger.  I hate to say it, but I was disappointed with this, as well.  There just wasn't much flavor and the oil was literally dripping off it.  I couldn't get myself to even finish it. 

Truth be told, the nice woman behind the register let me know about how they prepare the cheese fries, when I placed my order.  I still had to give them a try, but it was kind of her to give me a heads-up.  In fact, the only reason I give this place three Yelpy stars instead of two, is because of the friendly, honest staff.  But fix that ooey gooey melty cheese fries thing ASAP please, ok?
author: Ryan L.

description: Wow this place is great real deal burger joint!!! If you love burgers come to this place, its clean cool staff and free homemade pickles great fries haven't tried the shakes but will def go back for that and the pies and sundae can't wait to go back
author: B D.

description: I became vegan a few months ago, and lost eight pounds. Recently I discovered Super Duper, which is conveniently located right by my Muni layover on my way home from work. They have killer french fries and good beer (Racer 5), and I'm pretty sure those eight pounds are on their way back.
author: Janna M.

description:
Been waiting to visit for a while now. Today was the day for a Super Duper Burger. Super? Not really. Tho the guy at the counter was friendly, he immediately told my friend and I that the hamburger and cheeseburger were sold plain, nothing on these, and I didn't even attempt to order yet.  Nevertheless, I ordered the Super Duper Burger (which I told was with 1/4lb of beef) with bacon, an order of garlic fries and a drink. The food came out quickly and looked good, however, the burger looked awfully small.  Actually, the meat was McDonald's hamburger size, with no flavor, and watery-juicy.  I did think that the garlic fries were good, though. I'm not a fan of shoestring fries, but they were good with lots of garlic and Parmesan cheese. 

After our meal, my friend ordered two soft serve sundaes from the menu. I opted for the sundae with crumbled chocolate chip cookies and bacon . Once ready, it looked fabulous, however again, it was not what I expected. The vanilla soft serve was quite tasteless, as was the chocolate chip cookie. The bacon was the only thing I could actually taste. 

This place wasn't the best, but I will not make a trip back. In 'n Out Burger is much better - and tastier. Even the sundaes at McDonald's are better.
author: Jonathan P.

description: The burgers were great, the staff not so much. We ordered the smaller burgers, which were just right, and the parmesan garlic fries, which were unremarkable (the ones across the street at slider bar were much better), but the cashier was either having the worst night ever or just has a nasty attitude in general.   There is better food within a few steps that comes without the attitude.
author: Melody M.

description: Great burgers and fries not the best in sf but great for the location it's in. I would go back it's a good messy burger.
author: Cindy S.

description: Great veggie burger - nice and juicy.  Garlic fries are absolutely awesome!  Friend had Cookies & Cream shake (spiked) and said it was yummy and strong.  He enjoyed his regular hamburger, though wasn't too keen on the bun.  Another friend had the chicken and said it was awesome and juicy.
author: SF G.

description: Great burgers. Malt shakes are soooooo good.
author: Mike P.

description: The finest quality burger I've had in a long time. I was looking forward to this meal for about a month and I had really high expectations. It was suprising to see this place without a line out the door during lunch time. I've heard such great things about this place I really thought it would be packed. Anyway, I got a double with cheese, fries and a Coke my usual at any burger joint. The meat is similar to a Fatburger the fries are skinny but I don't think they taste like Mc Donalds as some people have said. Everything was really good and you can totally taste the quality of the ingredients. I expected this place to be good the only surprise was that it was just good and not great. It was not flavorful like a great burger should be. I'll go back in a couple of months or so and get a good burger I'm sure but I really hope it's great next time.
author: Lacy G.

description: Super duper has very nice burgers.  The mini burgers are the perfect size and not the HUGE scary burgers that so many places serve you now.  Also the soft serve is wonderful but getting the chocolate dip can lead to a messy experience.  Be sure to grab a lot of napkins because the sauce from the burgers can get everywhere too.
author: Madeline W.

description: For organic, this place is deliciously cheap. Te wait for food is quick too! I got a super burger 8oz and shared it which filled me and my partner up. Their garlic fries are delicious as well. Fries are not soggy! I got the vanilla dipped cone which was yummy but messy. I did try my friends cookies and cream milkshake spiked (spiked milkshakes = plus $1) which was delicious and worth the extra buck!
author: Lauren B.

description:
...my boyfriend put it best with 'this place would have been the shit if they put more salt, pepper & secret sauce on everything...'

the burgers were juicy, not over cooked, perfect melted cheese, veg tasted fresh and the fries were pretty tasty too...not your average greasy garlic cheese fries.i liked them..but as mentioned above: SALT, PEPPER & the SECRET SAUCE they said they had...
author: Sarah F.

description:
In N' Out with organic guilt free ingredients. I know that is a lofty statement but I stand behind it. I love sweet soft serve and love it even more when it is dipped in that hardening chocolate, another awesome great item on their menu.

I am pumped that this has opened up and is so great and reasonably priced but a little worried for my waistline. Love Super Duper..
author: Katie H.

description: In all fairness, I've walked in there one time in my life (this afternoon) and had one thing from the menu....a Cookies and Cream milkshake.  And, it was delicious!  The only problem is that after being somewhat surprised to see one size option that would cost me $6 ($5.75 to be exact), I was even more surprised to see the size of the cup.  It was really small.  Way over priced at $6.  Either lower the price or at a minimum, provide larger cup sizes to make the $6 seem like a good value.  Thats all.
author: Chill Dude S.

description:
Always leave with a bellyache.

Great pickles, but it's like a lead weight in your stomach.  It's quick and it's pretty good but just can't have it anymore.
author: Jim O.

description:
The burger is juicy and tender, the bread is fluffy, and flavor is good.  It's not really a "wow", but definitely solid.  Size is more shake shack / in-n-out than diner.  The fries are really tasty.  I could see myself coming back.  

I like the decor, but it's surprisingly dirty for such a new place!  Also, the biggest disappointment is the milkshake.  Super watery.  If I needed a list to help me decide between here and in-n-out, it'd look like this:

                SD   |   INO
              ___________
burger     win
fries         win
shake                 win

But I don't.  I hate thousand island on my burger.  And I hate tasteless fries.  So SD ftw!  But clean up.
author: Wendy C.

description:
The staff is very friendly and helpful, it is clean yet as a vegetarian ''light'' I think they gouge you on their alternative options. 
The fries are out of this world :)
author: J K.

description: Super Duper you are just that! The burger was juicy tasty and oh so good. Can say anything but WOW! And bonus the cookies and cream shake is make with homemade chocolate chip cookies not Oreos. Cheers to you Super Duper.
author: Greg B.

description: If you want food that will harden your arteries, then skip the Mini and get the "Super", it's $6.50. Love these little burger places especially those that serve 8 oz of cow, dripping with their special sauce, with onions, lettuce, tomato on a toasted bun. The bun and the meat is what makes a good burger.  Bun was  bite-able and the burger, thick. It tasted like really good burgers that you might get from a friend's house. Fries was also good, and with IPA, everything was delicious. A little bit crowded, in this little cafeteria-like setting, but once seated, life was good.
author: Reyz A.

description: So I want to go ahead and say that I love Super Duper Burgers and the burgers rock at all the locations. My problem with this location is the service. A bunch of hipster douchebags seem to work here and they all have Los Angeles attitude which fucking sucks in SF. When I was ordering my food I was pleasant as usual and the guy behind the register had super emo attitude like someone had just kicked his puppy into the street and it was run over by a dump truck. When my order was called Hipster douche #1 slung the tray so hard it almost flew off the counter and to top it all off Hipster douche #2 ran into me while I was getting a soda causing me to almost spill it and my tray of food. Do you think he apologized?? Nope. I will never come back here. It will be worth a MUNI fare to the other locations. I hope a homeless crazy comes in there and shits on the counter. Assholes! Where is the picture of the steaming pile of shit to recommend as the store front photo.
author: Joda L.

description: Cheap, cheap, cheap.  A great place for a quick cheap bite to eat.  Nothing amazing in terms of food.  But still a good little burger joint.
author: Douglas P.

description: I love Super Duper.  The burgers are great!  The garlic fries are very garlicy, yum! And, the people working there are always really cool and friendly.  They seem to have a genuine interest in whether or not you are enjoying your meal.  I think I've been asked every time that I've eaten there, and not in a rote, scripted way.  It's also walking distance from my house, so that's a big plus for me.
author: Michael P.

description: Not sure how this is compared to In n Out, it isn't nearly as good and doesn't taste similar to me at all. It's also twice the price. I don't think I'll go back.
author: Captain B.

description:
Comparable to In-N-Out but not as good.

Tasty and fresh. Clever decor. Compact and neat packaged little patty and buns =)

Free pickles!! whooO! Can't go wrong with that. Not pickled enough. maybe new batch? I liked how they used 1/4 sheet baking trays as serving trays! cute idea.

Super hard to find parking
author: Tiffany T.

description: I like Super Duper. The food is decent (although my FIRST burger there lacked flavor, I thought). Ever since, everything has been good. I especially love that they have soft serve ice cream. :)
author: Jason B.

description: I would say this place is like a restaurant version of In N' Out, which by no means is a bad thing.  Only problem with this place is that they overcharge for their fries, which are decent, but not $3ish for their garlic fries.  That being said... burgers are great
author: Chris L.

description:
Super Duper is your typical no-frill fast-food joint minus the kitschiness and minus the cheese factor of major franchises. The burgers are greasy, somewhat decent, very very very small, and a bit pricy for a fast-food joint. A "super" with cheese and bacon and a small drink cost me around 12 bucks. I usually skip the fries, so didn't have any.  And the word super is definitely a misnomer and somewhat misleading. There was nothing super about my greasy burger and my "super burger" was hardly 4 ounces!  I would be reluctant to go back to this place.

It's right on Market street with their doors and windows open usually, so it's very noisy. The place reeks of raw meat & grease. The staff seems jaded or unhappy to work there. Do you blame them? Their soft served ice cream machine is broken most of the time or the guys don't have proper training how to make the perfect chocolate covered swirl in a cone. Their downtown store is slightly better but they don't know how to make the perfect soft served either.

Ultimately, if I'm going to pay that much for a burger, I'd rather go to BurgerMeister on Church street and get a side order of attitude by the angry tattooed guy who thinks he deserves a tip!
author: Marc N.

description: Being born and raised in California, I have always been loyal to In-N-Out.  I never dreamed of comparing a burger to In-N-Out, but Super Duper takes a close second.  The burgers are amazing, super juicy and flavorful, and cooked just right.  The Point Reyes is, by far, my favorite.  And the spiked milkshakes are amazing!!  Oh, and their made-in-house pickles.
author: Henry R.

description: I've been looking for a casual neighborhood burger spot for a few months now. I went tonight and now declare Super Duper the winner. The food is very reasonably priced, and it's delicious. I got a mini burger, regular fries, and a chocolate shake. The burger was juicy and super flavorful. The fries were perfectly cooked (crispy on the outside, fluffy in the middle) and well salted. The shake was chocolatey, rich, and not too thick. The space doesn't have much ambiance, but it's still a notch or two above your run of the mill fast food chain. Service was friendly and quick. If you're in the Castro and want a burger fix, this is the place to go.
author: Ashley T.

description: High quality beef cooked just right with plenty of toppings. Easily the most greasy burger I've ever consumed.
author: Darin D.

description: Its kind of hard to find a decent burger in sf. This was a solid burger for the amount you pay. It probably makes for perfect drunk food. I got the combo, but I'm having a hard time remembering if the fries were worth it. Whatever that were decently cheap and served as an adequate spoon for ketchup!
author: Nik K.

description: Holy hell, I suppose I have never tried a real burger till trying Super Duper. Now they definitely know how to make delicious patties. So much flavor. Had it as we waited for the Filipino parade to roll thru. It was such a delicious treat :)
author: Erelyn A.

description:
Fantastic milkshakes! I HIGHLY recommend the chocolate-strawberry, made with real strawberries.
The milkshakes are gluten-free (except for the cookie one), as well as their softserve Ice cream. (I had to contact both super duper and Straus who provides their softserve to find this out.) 
I'm not really sure about the other food.
author: Lady A.

description: Back to normal, they got my order the way I like it and it was  as good as the first time I had it. The fries were a bit to salty, that"s why i didn't give it 5 stars.
author: Chris D.

description:
I like how there are more burger places in the Castro - I normally go to Blue for a burger, but when I want one a little chaper and a little faster, I go to Super Duper.

The interior isn't awesome, it still feels under construction, but the burgers were definitely better than In-N-Out.  

Wasn't a huge fan of the homemade pickles and I haven't tried the fries or the shakes yet, but I'm just so excited that it's a lively addition to the Castro and it's not another sushi place or overpriced salad joint or cheezy french bistro.  :)
author: Diane L.

description: House-made pickles, perfect sized burgers, compostable packing -- I LOVE this place. Definitely worth poppin' the allergy pill for the gluten intolerance. Very few places are worthy of that.
author: May W.

description: Finally, a restaurant that proudly celebrates and revels in the true glorious, juicy, greasy, fatty, rich roots of the burger. true burger without apology!. exquisite.
author: Rick H.

description: This place is pretty bomb for the price and all the ingrediants seem really fresh and wholesome. Id rather spend 8 bucks here for a full meal than 15 for the same shiz at places like burgermeister that are way overpriced.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Pretty super - burger was super juicy, boardwalk style fries were super, even homemade pickes were super; plus having soda water w/ lemon available was super!
author: John C.

description:
I happened to stumble on this place with a few friends and I was surprised. I was expecting much, but the burgers were surprisingly good. 

It was a little confusing because I asked for a cheeseburger and the waiter responded, "you know the cheeseburger doesn't have any lettuce, tomatoes, or onions." So of course my response was, "Can I get it with LTO?" He said... "that's the Super Burger." SO I got the super burger and I loved it. Very clean tasting, and easy to eat without everything falling apart. The fries were also golden brown, very thin, crispy, and lightly salted. Yummo.

If you're ever in the Castro, it's a good place to sit outside and enjoy a cold beer with some friends.
author: Tracy L.

description:
Delicious burgers and soft-serve ice cream, and the prices aren't that bad, considering the location. BUT.
I saw this place when I was walking home from work, so I persuaded 
some work mates to try it for lunch a few times. Like I said, good food. No problems. Then I stopped in after work for a cone. The machine was on the fritz, so I had to get chocolate instead of vanilla. No big deal; it was great. A week or so later I stopped by again after work for a cone. The counter guy took my order and my money, served someone else, ate something, went in the bathroom, then walked out the door. His replacement began taking orders. The cones and such are made by the counter guys, so I figured no big wait. I sat right up front, facing the counter. A big wait. The new guy was making cones and shakes the whole time, though I could see that the machine was on the fritz again. It got to the point where I wanted to see if I'd ever get my cone, but after the first guy came back-- he'd been on a break, apparently-- I finally got up and mentioned that I'd been waiting 15 minutes while other cones were flying out the door. The other guy said 'gosh' or something and rushed in back, apparently to fix the ice cream machine, but the one who'd taken my order still acted like I didn't exist. Finally he said, 'what did you order?' like he'd never seen me before. Then he got the cone-- smaller than usual, but I chalked that up to the fritzy machine. Then, miracle of miracles, he gave me my money back. 
It seems that it should be easy to find job candidates with good customer service skills in this economy, but that hasn't been my experience. I wonder why that is.
author: Robert C.

description: They have fixed the to-go ketchup situation.  You can now order fires to-go without taking mental stock of your fridge.
author: Luke M.

description:
I'm excited there's a new food joint in my neighborhood! This place is pretty cool.

Honestly, it is a little like In & Out, but more gourmet.  I do have to say the only negative thing about the burgers, is that the meat patty is on the thin side- so next time I will have to order a double patty.  The fries are great! I got 2 orders, they are super crispy!  

The decor was not done yet, but that didn't bother me.  I did overhear the management and owner say something about the noise level and high ceilings, so they are working on that!

So glad it's close to my apt!!!
author: Alvin M.

description: This place makes a damn good burger. Been here one time so far and they did not leave me disappointed. The burger was a perfect size. The bacon was nice and crispy. My buddy got an egg on his burger which made me very jealous. Service is good and the food comes out within 10-15 minutes.
author: Darius A.

description: So I asked my two kids, ages 13 and 10, what they wanted for lunch following a long day of walking about the City.  "Burgers!" they exclaimed...so I launched my Yelp app on my iPhone which promptly recommended Super Duper.  As soon as we entered we knew we'd found the right place.  I dispatched the children to snatch a table on the second floor while I placed our orders.  The Niman Ranch beef burgers were exceptional.  We couldn't be more pleased.  The staff was very friendly...genuinely...not prompted by any script placed by management in front of their cash registers.  "Thanks, Dad, for the great burgers!" I was told.  What can top that?
author: J M.

description: Just thinking about this burger makes my mouth water. It is that good.  An adult burger joint, complete with decent beer to wash that tasty burger down.  (or a milkshake if that's more your thing.)  I know this is a loaded statement, but in my book, it's the best burger in California.
author: Gardner H.

description: Am I the only one who hears South Park's 'Big Gay Al' singing in my ear whenever I pass this place? "I'm super, thanks for asking. All things considered, I couldn't be better, I must say. I'm feeling super -- no, nothing bugs me. Everything is super when you're ... don't you think I look good in this hat?" Well, my partner in crime and I stopped by here after throwing down drinks Sunday, and appreciated the simplicity of its menu. They're trying to do a few things really well versus offering 10,000 mediocre items. I'm not the biggest red meat eater you'll ever meet, but I went for it, anyway, and thought it tasted just like a backyard barbecue burger. So, if you love picnic juiciness or In-N-Out, this will appeal to you. Truth be told, I was most impressed that they serve wine! Thuper-duper!
author: Gregor G.

description:
My friends had told me about the great new burger place on Market Street, and I had to go to find out for myself.  Yes, indeed, it really is a good, reasonable, healthy choice (Niman Ranch grass-fed beef), and has friendly, smiling staff.  

After a brisk 3-mile walk, my friend Rob and I decided to drop in and sample Castro's latest eatery.  We wanted the basics, so we each ordered a hamburger (plain, with bun and sauce), and left for under $10; tax and cashier's tip included.  Zach brought over our burgers quickly and with a smile.  

I've been making a new effort to eat healthy foods, and I felt good about every delicious bite of my Niman Ranch burger at SDB.  In the past, I seldom ate red meat, but I think I'll become a regular here.
author: Roger R.

description: The stars have aligned for burger lovers. Super Duper has awesome tasting, backyard style, hand slapped burgers at a price that won't destroy those hard earned dollars. When I say hand slapped, I mean the pattys are not the cookie cutter patty perfectly cut in a circle. It's the kind that your bearded friend would ground and pound together at the neighborhood BBQ. The meat is cooked medium and they pickle their own pickles, whatever that means.
author: Vien T.

description: I just found this place the other day. The burgers are insanely good, the fries are incredible and the ice cream to top it all off, there goes my diet. The staff are all very nice, everyone seemed to really care about what they are doing. Everything had a very old fashioned style and taste to it. I would recommend this to any burger lover!
author: Don H.

description: Really good burger, but probably not quite good enough to justify the line you will wait in. Love the pickles.
author: Andrew L.

description: My first experience at Super Duper and it did not disappoint(at least not at this location). Yum! Juicy burgers with special sauce dripping from the bottom.. I think I died and gone to burger heaven for a minute. The garlic fries was alright. The lemonade reminded me of NYC.  The organic beef taste really good and fresh! The fluffy bun was the perfect size.  I want another one! Also, the place was pack around 7pm which means only good food all around.
author: Kelly C.

description: Came here with Christine K. for a cheap dinner.  I just had a regular burger, no frills.  Verdict?  DEFINITELY SUPER DUPER.  My burger was tasty, well-sized, and made from happy healthy cows that eats grass.  Ok, so I feel kinda bad for the cows... but that won't stop me from having another super duper burger... and next time it will be with garlic fries and ice cream for dessert.
author: Peggy N.

description: The burgers are soooo good!  The burger was just so tasty and the special sauce was just perfect.  The garlic french fries and the milk shake, oh my heavens, soooo yummy.  The fact that it's all organic is just a plus!  Love it, love it!
author: Soo K.

description:
I've passed this place wanting to eat here many times, but never had the time to sit inside.  Finally, S.Heart, friends, and I made it in on a Sunday evening.  I like its location.  Bright and open.  

I got the mini burger with cheese, lettuce, tomato, red onions, super sauce, and jalapeno peppers.  Everything about the burger was great, except the jalapenos were mediocre.  They had more of a pickled taste, rather than spicey hot.  I won't get them next time.  The onions were fresh, and not of the type that leave your breath smelling for hours, even next day, like what In-N-Out does to me.  The patty was thick and juicy.

S.Heart and I also shared garlic fries.  The portion was small for two people, and being $2.75.  They were truly delicious, though.  Reminiscent of Gott's garlic fries, but less green garlic-y.  No need to get a sauce - the cheese and garlic are satisfying enough.  

I would like to try a milkshake next time.  They cup they serve it in when dining in was huge.  

Prep time is fast - your order is ready quick.  Whether you're in a rush, or would like a sit-down meal, Super Duper is good for both.
author: T L.

description: I've only had a cookies & cream shake here (so far) and it was DA BOMB DOT COM. They don't seem to use your typical Oreo cookies -- my friend Ashley P. remarked it tasted more like vanilla wafers. I believe they also added some brown sugar -- basically, it wasn't your typical milkshake. This one was a little more on the liquid side, rather than that typical thick one from your local diner -- not that there's anything wrong with that at all -- but it was a lot easier to drink. I can't believe I didn't know about this place until now. I hear the burgers are DEEELISH. I can't wait to try one with egg!!!
author: Jonny A.

description: This is the first super duper I've ever been to, needless to say I was not disappointed!! I can't wait to go back...!
author: Terry S.

description: I came here on a free burger day, but really enjoyed it.  It's like an elevated fast food burger joint complete with yummy organic soft serve.  A little pricey, but you're paying for better quality ingredients and taste.
author: beverly l.

description: Where else in SF can you get a two grass-fed 4oz. patty burger for under 7 bucks? The fries are so-so, but the beer AND wine on tap make up for it. Need to come back for the organic soft-serve.
author: Eloy T.

description: Not the best burger I've had in my life, but probably the best one I've found in San Francisco so far.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Bad employee sours the experience

I went to Super Duper for the first time today. It seems like a good concept. We ordered a Super Burger and a Cheeseburger, a strawberry shake, and garlic cheese fries. Total, $16.

The burger was pretty decent but my partner didn't realize the cheeseburger only had meat, bread, cheese and sauce. The shake was kind of flavorless. The fries were tasty but a little cold and soggy. 

Now for the service. There was a male employee who looked young, was wearing jeans that kind of were slipping off his hips (I could see his underwear clearly), put his foot on a chair while wiping down a table, and picked up dirty customer's cups by sticking his fingers in them when clearing tables. Oh, and he didn't wash his hands afterwards. He also bumped into me several times as he squeezed by our table to get through when there was a clear path on the other side of the restaurant. I put my leg out to deter him from crossing again and again, but instead he just decided to step over me several times and stick his ass in our faces as we ate. RUDE. He had no problems yawning greatly through out our meal and just looked like a lame employee that didn't know what he was doing.

There was a manager there, but he didn't do anything about it. 

I will go back for their cheap and ok tasting burgers, but I'm getting it to go next time.
author: Foodie F.

description: Delicious burgers anytime of the day or evening. Great service with a smile. Sumptuous homemade pickles. Enough said.
author: Ruben G.

description:
definitely think they're going for the shake shack vibe...the sign outside even resembles it. but whatever. i cannot wait to come back here to try another DELICIOUS veggie burger or try something new. the lemonade with brown sugar is really good too - not too sweet and just tart enough...although id recommend putting some ice or something in it. the glasses are hot so i ended up drinking lukewarm lemonade...

the actual restaurant is spacious and has lots of seating options. very clean [including the bathrooms!!] and very helpful and friendly employees.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Really great burgers at a great price. Everything is great here ... fast service, quality ingredients, very affordable prices. This is my #1 place to go when in the mood for a burger.
author: Rex W.

description: Burgers are good. Not great. But certainly not worth the price. Go for the smaller sized burger if you get fries. More than enough. The counter Staff is quick, but not at all friendly. The look pained to be working there. Don't expect any chat beyond telling you what your total is. Better off going to In & Out Burger. Same quality food, more friendly.
author: John P.

description: I used to LOVE the burgers here, especially with their special chipotle sauce, but lately, the burgers have been oozing grease. The bun is just plain soggy with grease, too. It's really sad to see a place that takes such pride in their fresh, free range, and organic ingredients to ruin them with what I imagine is either a poorly maintained fryer or an inexperienced fry cook (first rule of cooking: taste everything).
author: Maggie S.

description: Finallyyy, a veggie burger that isn't the frozen and flavorless kind! I could see the pieces of corn in the patty and the flavors weren't overwhelmed by the hummus. Would have been better with hot sauce or spicy hummus. The garlic fries and pickles are awesome!
author: Lauretta L.

description:
Updated 9/2012:

As far as I can tell, the portabella sandwiches are being removed from all the Super Duper menus.  They still have one vegetarian patty on offer, but as a vegetarian that just means I will eat here half as often.

----------------------------

Burger places are so convenient, so fun and usually so not for vegetarians.  Sure there's usually a frozen garden burger patty if you're lucky. Not at Super Duper!  Their portabello mushroom sandwich is just as good as their other items.  They coat the mushroom in a cornmeal crust which, in addition to making it taste great, significantly cuts down on the "I've got black portobello mushroom juice all over my hands" mess factor. Overall it is like a healthier In & Out.  The homemade pickles and brown sugar lemonade are great!
author: saru k.

description:
I had heard good things about this place, so I decided to give it a shot. Got a mini cheeseburger and garlic fries. The service was good (gets REALLY busy, so I don't blame them for the wait) and employees were friendly and helpful. 
The food was freshly cooked and was pretty tasty. Definitely not the best burger I've ever had, but it was pretty juicy. It didn't pack a super powerful kick of flavor, but it wasn't necessarily bland or boring. It was a tasty, well cooked burger. I was a little disappointed only because I had heard how 'super duper' it was. It was a decent burger, but nothing to write home about. If you're in the neighborhood and craving a Burger, I think this place is a little bit cheaper than Burger Meister. I enjoyed my meal but I haven't been back since, only since there are a few other places I prefer. I would have liked the meat to be a bit more seasoned, but not everyone feels the same.
author: William M.

description: What's happening, guys.  We don't get a burger fix very often and usually you leave us very satisfied.  Today (3/21), we stopped in for lunch and were very surprised.  We ordered two mini combos and the buns were stale, the burger was overcooked and the fries were tasteless, like they were cooked but still frozen - not cold, but it's hard to describe, maybe like they were stale or freezer burned.  Very disappointing to give up our burger fix for.  You're going to be off the list for a little while.
author: Kenneth N.

description:
I'm not normally the kind of person to write something lame like "OMG," but O. M. G.

I'm from Philly, just got back from a week in SF. One of my last days there, a friend said I just *had* to try Super Duper. We skipped lunch at a conference and snuck out to grab lunch. Their slogan is accurate - fast food burgers, slow food values. 

I ordered the grilled portobello sandwich, added avocado, cheese, their special sauce, tomato, and lettuce. It was absolutely fantastic! 

The next day, it was getting close to lunchtime and all I could think about was that incredible sandwich... so out we went again! 

We got to eat outside on the first day, which is always appreciated when the weather is nice. The second day, we ate upstairs and had a great view of the whole restaurant. There was a good 10+ minute wait in line the second day, but it was still totally worth it. 

Can't wait to come back to SF and get my new favorite sandwich again.
author: R G.

description: Does a perfect burger exist?  Yes it does and it resides at Super Duper.  The meat is so juicy and well seasoned and the bun so light and airy.  Such a perfect combo.  It was so good I had to order a second one after I finished my first...new favorite burger place.
author: Joe O.

description: As far as burger joints go, this place is spectacular.  The burgers are mouthwatering!!  I chewed so fast in excitement that I bit my lip.  The fries also taste fresh..no week old frozen fries here.   Can't say enough about how tasty these burgers are.   Go!!
author: Kurt L.

description:
i enjoy coming here whenever i am at the castro.
