this is a manifestation of how good design in environmental graphics to marketing makes it more appealing.

love the 50s retrospect on the design with a contemporary twist. 

it is clean, affordable and definitely filling.
author: Leopoldo U.

description: Good buirger, bacon ice cream, good price, solid overall. Really recommend this place for people who are just out for a burger, though it is very high level quality.
author: James O.

description: Great burger and even the fries are better. Blue Cheese Burger was my choice. I can't get back out there soon and get back there!!
author: Tom M.

description: This is the place to go for one of the tastiest burgers in town. It's not over loaded with sauces, you taste the burger and the fresh toppings. Home made pickles are great sides. The regular fries are perfect too.
author: Spencer F.

description: This may be the best veggie burger I've EVER had.  And I'm a veggie.  it comes with hummus on it and it's the perfect size.
author: Jeni S.

description: Went here with friends and coworkers for my going away dinner before I left SF. My coworkers were hyping it up, but coming in I didn't really I super high expectations. But super duper proved me wrong. Their burgers are really good and are reasonably priced. Very filling too.
author: T.C. J.

description: Wow! 4.31 for a cone! I feel like I m in Australia paying ridiculous prices for food. Other than the price, the cone was quite satisfying. It was just right. Not too sweet. Even though the cone was quite large, I didn't feel overwhelmed. I would recommend it but wouldn't pay 4.31 again. It was worth trying out. Reminds me of Shake Shack in NY.
author: Richard L.

description: Cheaper than, faster than, better food than burgermiser. Also I may be in love with the girl behind the counter. What more reason is needed to eat here
author: Jason H.

description: The burgers (beef and chicken) are good but greasy.  Fries are average.  Adequate until a Five Guys gets to SF.
author: Dave B.

description: Very tasty burgers for cheap!  I really like the burgers.  The mushroom-swiss so yummy with avocado. =D  Garlic fries = very yummy too!!
author: John H.

description:
I had the cheddar burger - medium rare. For the price, it's the best burger I've had in SF.  Minus 1 point for not taking AMEX.

Compared to other burger joints in the area, it's not a fair comparison to In'N'Out (most of them are on the freeway anyway) and it's tastier and a little cheaper than Urbun Burger in the mission.   It's closest relative, Burgermeister (on Church btwn Market and Duboce), is a very poor relative indeed.
author: Dave F.

description: Did I go at a wrong time???? My burger was really just ordinary, it was bland and it had so much oil(not sure how you can make an oily burger:)). The special sauce did not help the burger a lot. They have some good reviews so I will give it another try when I am in this area. The service was really good for a burger joint.
author: Nirmal S.

description:
When I walked in, I noticed everyone ordering burgers that looked really greasy. It didn't really appeal to me, so I opted for the chicken sandwich with chipotle aioli. It was pretty tasty, but not the best chicken sandwich I've had. 

I loved the fact they made their own pickles and they are free with your order. The only things I would come back for are the fries (which actually taste like potatoes!) and the soft serve ice cream. It's rare to find some good soft serve ice cream so when I heard this place had it, I was skeptical. I was not disappointed. Get the ice cream!
author: Gloria A.

description:
This place is AWESOME!

I was up in the City today, didn't have much for breakfast, and it was about 2pm in the afternoon, and I was getting really hungry.  A burger and some fries came to mind, because I hadn't had a good burger in a long time.

I thought about some of the other burger joints, but I wanted something not so "chain-y".  So I started walking around, and stumbled across Super Duper.  The menu sounded really appealing, so took a chance and wandered in.

I ordered a super cheeseburger, with fries, and a vanilla malt.  While I was waiting on the food, I saw the jars with homemade (!!!!) pickles in them!  I love pickles, and have never had homemade ones before, just ones from the supermarket.  WOW.  I wanted to pick up the whole jar and run out with it.  I wonder if they sell jars of them?  I gotta ask next time.

As I'm downing about my 10th pickle slice, the food is ready.  The burger is GREAT.  Very tasty, all the ingredients are fresh.  Fries are hot, nicely salted (I added a little bit more because I like fries on the salty side), and the malt is perfect.  Not too liquidy, and not so thick you can't drink it with a straw.

I will not bother to go anyplace else for a burger in the City after going here.  They are that good!
author: Chris S.

description: This place is trying to be Shake Shack, but it's just not. My burger was pretty flavorless, and it was overwhelmed by the sesame bun. I also got a shake, and they must have used freezer burnt ice cream, because there were tons of annoying ice crystals in it. I wouldn't go back.
author: Nolan S.

description: Burgers are excellent (though a little small), waiters are cute and beer is cold. Highly recommended.
author: Mike J.

description: oh super duper.  you have now become my favorite burger in SF.  Chez Maman might still beat you but they are 2 totally different burgers.  super duper is no shake shack - that statement is true.  i do wish super duper had onion rings too but it is my new fave in SF.
author: a g.

description:
if my eating buddy will give me an option where to have a cheap, tasty burger between this aspiring burger joint AND in-n-out, i will definitely pick the latter.

so, the prices are very affordable, however, the burgers were not savory. i found it kind of bland. 

the patties were really greasy, bun is just ok and the garlic fries were not something to brag out. these are served on their aluminum baking pan trays.

the beverage selection of  red/white wine, beer and homemade lemonade selection didn't even cause a stir.

the dining room and bathroom uses the same type of  recycled, brown paper towels.

i'm not so sure if i'll be back.
author: Nelle A.

description: Been looking for a new burger place and this is fantasmic. I've been here a half dozen times now and this place is easily one of the best places in the city.
author: Taylor J.

description: I've been to all the top burger spots in San Francisco and these guys do a top notch burger.  I HIGHLY recommend it.
author: Michael S.

description: The meat was under-seasoned and the buns were ok... the cheeseburger had no veggies(!) but i dont know who else would order that way, except a meat-only lover like me. The size was good though, i ate it all and didn't feel overly full or still wanting more. The fries weren't, like, how do i say, fried enough or something. it seemed stale almost. good for the price, but i wouldn't really go out of my way for it again. super ok buger, i guess.
author: Sydel S.

description: Bubble bubble for the 4th time I am sick from their burgers. There is something wrong with the grease they use it cant be the meat. Every single time the burger has given me a horrible stomach ache. I am not one to eat healthy so its not like I can't handle greasy food. I have heard this from different people. The burger itself is amazing tasting! I only go if I  will be close to a bathroom.  The Milk shakes are amazing also!
author: Mike R.

description:
I work in the Castro, and the usual places for lunch and occasional dinner were getting old.....Being a huge fan of the cheeseburger (if my body would let me I'd have one every day), I was happy to see there is a new place. Sliders got gross, Harvey's always overcooks their burgers (medium rare is always charred and never pink inside- I'm someone who never returns food but twice I've had to return the burgers for being charred well done when asking for medium rare), the Cove is good if you want a more home cooked thicker patty....Super Duper is great for when you're craving In n' Out, but don't want to go to the wharf of Daly City to get one...and it's got organic ingredients, so you may be having a sinful meal but at least it's not that sinful.....
 
The beef is Niman Ranch (no hormones, antibiotics, family ranchers own), and the burgers have that classic fast foodish taste- very close to In n' Out. The cream for the soft serve cones (I think they even have chocolate dipped) and milkshakes is Strauss ...organic from Petaluma. The lemonade is real lemonade, sweetened with brown sugar (more sour than sweet) ....They have portabella mushroom burgers and chicken sandwiches too. They even make their own pickles. They've got nice and salty fries, and offer them with parmesan cheese and garlic. You can also order a Racer 5 beer or another quality microbrew (in a pint glass on tap). The odd thing is that you pay 50 cents more for tomato, lettuce and onion, rather than cheese, so make sure you actually ask for those things because they don't come on the regular burgers or cheeseburgers. 

I've seen it be compared to Pearls and not fare that well in comparison...but as someone who loves Pearls and lived down the street for it..when I moved away three years ago I was spending around $20 on a buffalo burger fries and shake (and I'm sure by now the price has gone up), so I don't think it's fair to compare it to a place that costs quite a bit more. Also, i've seen a complaint or two about the employees not asking how the customer wants their meat cooked....If you don't take initiative and tell burger places how you want it cooked, it's standard to make them medium. So it's not the burger place's fault for not asking, if they don't ask, you should tell them, not blame it on them.

I love this place and recommend it to my clients on almost a daily basis.    The staff is friendly...I still have to exercise a little self-control and not go that often because the burgers are dripping with grease....but I'm so happy this has moved into the neighborhood. The reasons I give this place four stars rather than five is that it is greasier than any fast food burger I've had, I've had once where my order was completely forgotten (but they were very apologetic about it which is what keeps me coming back and recommending it), and I still have times where people with identical orders get theirs first, which I find odd...on a lunch break from work I've got limited time....But I think that the ordering things are improving and will be fine as the place is open longer. I also was unaware of the 20% tip surcharge on card orders (I already tipped in cash, which means I tipped 40%!), and I think that the tip surcharge should be posted so we are aware of that- I understand why they do it (because some people are cheap and don't get how tip earning jobs work because they never had one)...it's just uncool to not notify the customer that's being added.  Yet, as I said I love this place and highly recommend it for it's food and friendly service.
author: Nick M.

description: Simple and to the point! Good burgers at a great price. I have never waited in a line here, and always had a great experience. The burgers are amazing. For $10.50 (including tax) you get a fresh, burger with all the fixings, fries, and a soft drink! How can you go wrong? It's quickly become one of the best parts of the neighborhood. I still haven't tried their ice cream or frozen yogurt, but I hear it's to die for as well!
author: Ryan B.

description:
Delicious burgers! The mini burger combo & fries was very affordable and they also have some beers on tap here.  I tried both the garlic fries and regular fries and they were both delicious. I regret not getting the shake but there's always next time! 

Great burger spot in the Castro, quick and easy to get to, with high quality meats.
author: Jasmine M.

description: I live for a good cheeseburger and am pleased to say that I've found another. I'd heard mixed reviews about Super Duper so my expectations weren't too terribly high and I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and efficient, the cafe itself is cute (a la Spork) and the food was great. Don't bother with the single - it's all about the double, and I'll be heading back for another. The fries were great too and the brown sugar-sweetened fresh lemonade is the perfect accompaniment with a nice tart edge. Don't forget to try one of their fresh pickles too... okay, I had three!
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
Perfect no frills burger.  Very good ingredients (the meat patty of the burger was very yummy).  My favorite type of fries (crispy on the outside, soft on the inside).  Chocolate shake was perfect.  

Note: my husband got the cookies n cream shake which seemed to be chocolate chip cookies in a vanilla shake.  Which I really liked!  But isn't the typical thing you think of with a cookies n cream shake...
author: Jenn C.

description:
Its my birthday, and so we decided to eat at Super Duper. I got a double burger, fries, and a chocolate shake. So lets rank this;
The shake came out first, and it was very well done. It taste like mushed up cocoa and thick milk thrown together. Its perfect, and a very nice introduction. 
Then the burger and fries came out, not a long wait at all. The burger was very greasy, a bit too much as your hand will defiantly get soaked. But nonetheless it was very well cooked. Its hard to criticize it, other than saying a little more seasoning would have helped. But unless you've had the best burger in the world you wouldnt have noticed.
The fries were nice as well, although a bit salty. Like near McDonalds salty, kinda much for a well done place. Also i tasted the cookies' and cream shake, and it tasted relly bad. Like just milk and weird chunks, wasnt thick enough. It could've just been that drink, and not all of them though. But i drunk my own shake around the same time and it was nice and thick so i doubt it melted.
So overall, if it werent for the bad cookies and cream and overly salty fries i'd give this a five star rating.
author: Darrell O.

description: Finally, a delicious burger place in the Castro!    Burgers are delicious and inexpensive.  A great place to eat cheap.   And they serve beer and wine.
author: Andy M.

description:
So this place is like the better version of inn and out burger. The fries are better, especially the garlic parmesean Yum!  Since i'm vegetarian I went with the portebello sandwich but it looks like a burger. It was not as good as shake shack's shroom burger in NYC but much healthier, and larger portions. I thought their brown sugar lemonade was a bit sweet, and have yet to taste their pecan pie but it sure looks nice. There is an upstairs and downstairs, and although there is a lot of seating, it fills up quick. I love their fresh home made pickles too! The place is pretty modern and aesthetically appealing, bright colors,  vintage prints, stainless steel and wood, kinda like chipotle but with more americana. I like the music here too. The only thing I would change are the paper towels, they are the harsh brown ones custodians use to clean up with, not good for wiping the corners of your mouth ouch, their manual ketchup pump was a bit overzealous, you pump it 2 or 3 times and it comes out with a vengeance when the pressure gets high enough. The staff were pretty friendly. I gave it 3 stars because it doesn't beat shake shack, mostly because their cheese didn't melt on the fried breaded mushroom and the cheese isn't as good and gooey as the one at shake shack, and I had to pay extra for that disappointment :(

*************NO LONGER SELLS PORTOBELLO SANDWICH********************
I told my friend in december that I liked super duper burger until they stopped selling their mushroom burger. He's like WHAT, that's the best thing there (coming from a non-vegetarian). We both shook our head. You have gone way down in my esteem super duper burger, really disappointed. Shake shack Please open a franchise in S.F. you will blow these fast food joints out of the water!
author: Onika C.

description:
i tried this joint today... sad to say, it didn't cut out for one of the best out there. let me introduce myself (again).. im MARC and im VEGETARIAN.. this is me being sarcastic. lol.... they only have ONE vegetarian choice...not exciting, really. then as much as cheesy garlic fries sounds great, it wasn't really the BEST garlic fries OR cheese fries, like the ones in santa cruz or gilroy.

overall.. vegetarians and vegans would be bored to death. maybe carnivores won't. not sure. 

ps. portions weren't like in and out....somewhat skinny girl portion.lol
author: Marc K.

description: I work in the downtown area and pass by the place often, decided to check it out and it is not bad. Ordered the mini burger, garlic fries, and a lemonade w/ brown sugar. It sure packed a big punch for such a "mini" burger. The roll was soft and the patty was juicy, garlic fries was not overwhelmingly garlic-y (which is fine with me). The lemonade was refreshing. Its a little bit on the pricey side compared to the fast food chains but, quality over quantity.
author: Hendy L.

description: Good solid burger.  Their super sauce was delicious, their fries were well done, and the malt shake was good.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a cheap burger fix.
author: Erick A.

description:
Don't see what all the hype is about. First of all, this isn't grass-fed beef. The menu says "vegetarian-fed" beef - that doesn't mean grass-fed, it just means that they aren't feeding the cows other animals, which should be expected (I hope!). You can tell it's not grass-fed because the beef has the waxy, greasy taste associated with regular grain-fed beef, not the lean, mineral taste you get with grass-fed.  

Also, why not step things up and make fresh-cut fries?  Those frozen ones they are serving up just aren't that good.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Review is for the ice cream only, because that's why I go there!

The vanilla is to die for. I always get a dipped vanilla cone and it's so delicious. I need to start getting the kids cone because the regular is so much ice cream! 

Organic. Tastes like real ice cream and not like vanilla chemicals. 

Huge fan. I crave these all the time!
author: Holly S.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had in SF. The milkshakes are great too, as are the homemade pickles!
author: Danielle B.

description: I went there once and that's all it took for me to place judgement.  The hamburger was alright - nothing bad, nothing spectacular.  I mean, it's pretty hard to mess up a hamburger right?  The reasons for the 1 star is this: 1) Their napkins are the cheap brown hand towels that you find in restrooms.  2) The staff were lazy.  I was finished eating and the staff wouldn't clean my table.  I was sitting outside and the wrappers and napkins began falling on the ground (b/c of the wind) and they seemed to not care.  It was more important to sit around and do nothing than keep the restaurant (and neighborhood) clean.  Trashy!  With bad service and average food, there's no reason for me to recommend or return.
author: Shaun W.

description: My favorite meal in the world is a cheeseburger.  Everything is fresh and delicious!  This is the best burger in San Francisco!
author: Susie S.

description: Amazed by the quality of the burger itself.  It was way more than I expected and went all in.  Ordered the "super combo" with the works.  Added bacon and cheese.  Can't wait to try the rest of the menu!  Please invite me!  Haha!
author: Leighton A.

description: The most natural tasting burger I ever had.  Also had the best pickles(unlimited) I ever ate.  Garlic fries stayed Crunchy and delicious.
author: Shark L.

description: This place is good, but I hardly super duper.  I've had the Super Duper burger-- Niman Ranch beef patty, lettuce, tomato, onion, cheese, and their special sauce.  They have regular fries and garlic fries, which are well-seasoned and tasty, but nothing to write home about.  I think it's great that they use all organic ingredients, but I don't think it makes it taste any better than your average burger joint.  In-N-Out's burgers are far better in comparison, but if you're in the Castro and feel like having a burger, Super Duper is a good alternative.
author: Anne A.

description:
by the same people as Beretta and Starbelly .. so its no surprise that its quality all around ... reminds me of a fancy In and Out Burger .. simple menu .. pretty much just Burgers .. shakes and fries ... 

got a cheeseburger and fries ... everything was A+ .... with a beer only came to 10$ ... im going back !
author: Micah W.

description: It's good, not great, just good. The variety on the menu makes this place slightly a step above In 'n' Out, but not much. It still feels like a faster-food burger. Not exactly fast food (like McDonalds) but not exactly a restaurant experience either. Also, a burger, fries and a shake will set you back close to $15. That's a little steep for what you are getting.
author: Alfredo A.

description: Enjoyed the Burger,  however the fires were lackluster.  The double choco shake was disappointing, at nearly five bills, it should have been creamy and thick, not watery.  I don't get the built in sales tax gimmick, you're still paying it and it simply makes the menu prices seem, well, super duper expensive.  It it were not for the ingredients and compostable serving items, I would probably opt for a different burger experience.
author: Rafael R.

description: A deal for high end burger. Can't stand the wait at their sister res...Starbelly cross the street young man. There you will find something to hold you through a night of street play.
author: One P.

description:
My second time here in a week, and this place is a keeper.  The owner really cares what people think and came over to me to ask me how everything was; really wanted to know what my experience was like.  The first time I had a cheeseburger, and it was honestly the most flavorful cheeseburger I've had in a long time.  There's a good helping of fries when you order them, and your soft drink is served in an eco-friendly cup (the small things make me happy).  
This place is great if you want a meal that won't leave you feeling like a small whale afterwards.  The second time I got the chicken breast.  Gotta say, so far the burgers outdo the chicken, but it was still good.
I think the sauce with housemade mayo really makes the difference here, if you're looking for a place that will stand out above other burger joints.  Everything is fresh, the service is friendly, and I don't mind the limited menu.  Couple of beers and a red and white wine on tap? Wasn't even expecting it here, so cheers to Super Duper! More so for being located directly across from my gym...
author: CJ C.

description: Gets packed, but it's a fun place to stop in for lunch! Solid burger, and good fries.
author: Niko D.

description: The  burgers here are in fact super duper!  Maybe it's the "special" sauce, maybe it's the patty size that is just right, or maybe it's the crispy fries that top the whole meal off.  All in all, tasty, not overwhelming burgers with good fries add the "super" to the "duper" here!
author: Linda P.

description: Super Duper is the best burger in town. We try and make it over there AT LEAST once a week. the fact that it is right across the street from my gym tempting me everyday is tough lol. The burgers are amazing. the french fries are great.. and i LOVE the cookies and cream milkshake!
author: Scott L.

description: I eat here at least once a week. The burgers taste great. Spiked milkshakes rock. No complaints whatsoever.
author: Rene R.

description:
Might be the best burger in SF!

always friendly service, great ice cream and environmentally aware business model.

3 cheers!
author: Anthony B.

description: It's cheap, the burgers are tasty and greasy, there's beer and sodas, the garlic fries are finger-lickin' good. If you need a quick, easy bite, do it. You won't regret it.
author: Chris H.

description:
just had lunch here and it was a-ok. 

i was really hoping to be blown away, but.. you know, it was average. 

at best it was a mediocre in and out burger. folks were friendly and im hoping the extra wait was because they were doing something delicious to the burger

if i worked closer i may be back.. hmm...

.. it needed more oommmph.
author: Art A.

description:
super duper indeed.
relaxed atmosphere. straight forward menu selection. prices that include tax and rounded to the nearest quarter. an entire restaurant full of bearded pot-bellied men. the very definition of a burger joint.  i tell ya, fantastic. 

the double cheeseburger with bacon was money. it hit the spot for sure and was equally washed down by a delicious chocolate shake. the garlic/cheese fries are good but weren't my favorite. if only they could have been steak fries. 

their frozen yogurt is awesome. tried the super sundae with chocolate chip and bacon. yes, bacon. 

done deal. 5 stars.
author: Jonny Bobby G.

description: Thought it was ok, nothing special and wouldn't go out of my way for it. Had a "super" with cheese, it was fine. Seems like they perfer to cook the burgers well-done and tends to make them a bit dry.  Flavor was decent. place is about as clean as a fast food place, which is fine.  Just no "wow" factor for me here.
author: Dilly M.

description:
went to a happy hour near by last friday and decided to pop in to super duper for a go. limited menu, but i figure that can be a good thing sometimes so they can focus on making those few things exceptional, but as it's only been open for a couple of weeks, i don't think they're quite there yet.

super-duper burger - good, but not sure what makes it super-duper. i know there's some super-secret sauce, but as i was a bit tipsy, there was nothing that really stood out here.

chicken sandwich - also good, but nothing amazing.

veggie sandwich - probably the best of the three sandwiches we tried. big honkin' breaded portabello, which was actually really good. also didn't hurt that i ordered it with bacon. :D

fries/garlic cheese fries - love me some fries, but unfortunately the batch we got seemed to have been sitting around for a while. even the second order of fries i ordered came out only slightly warmer. 

strawberry shake - somehow the strawberry shake i ordered became a chocolate one, but i was fine with that. unfortunately the shake was a bit watery/slushy. definitely not cold enough (or maybe not enough ice cream?). not a fan.

definitely the best part of the experience was definitely the friendly folk at the registers. both were super duper nice and super duper funny. loved them!

anywho, i hope super duper works out some of the kinks. it was rather busy when we visited, and the food came out pretty quickly, but i'd sacrifice some of the speediness for a better product. regardless, it's nice to have a place to just jump in real quick for a bite, and it's a welcome addition.... just work out the kinks!
author: Alex C.

description:
Super Duper is your typical American burger joint only infinitely better.  Their normal burgers come with 2 stacked meat patties, which is great for fatties like me who always get the double-double at In-n-Out.  The burgers are great, but they're actually my least favorite thing here (aside from the homemade pickles; I can't stand their homemade pickles!  They have a funny sweet taste to 'em).
What is the most delicious??  THE FRIES.  Skip the fries with the fancy 3 dips and opt for the garlic fries, which are phenomenal.  But seriously, the best thing they have goin for them is...SUPER DUPER SUNDAE!
For ~$6, you can get a sundae with like 8 different toppings (including bacon), and it's simply majestic.

I have been to this location many times as well as the new location in the Marina, and they are both top notch and churn out the same excellent-quality food+service.

I recommend these guys over nearby BurgerMeister!
author: Nathan R.

description: Fantastic burger, got the super duper burger combo and it was a lot of food. This is really good food, great prices for what you get, fast and efficent, have I said it is really really good.
author: Dave O.

description: What struck me about my cheeseburger is how "fresh" it tasted. Flavor-wise, it was pretty good but not "oh my god i have to come back asap" good. That said, I will be back. Oh, and the pecan pie sundae is quite decadent....
author: Maximillian M.

description: Hand made pattie cooked on a flat grill. Nice and crispy outside,while still juicy inside. Unlimited free house made pickles, great homemade lemonade, good value for the price!
author: John L.

description: Juicy, tasty burgers. I like their basic single patty cheeseburger (and the homemade pickles).  A welcome addition to the neighborhood (for an omnivore).
author: Meredith G.

description: Tried them last night and I would say they are pretty good not great but pretty good.  They were so busy last night I did not want to wait for a table to open up so I ordered mine to go.  The burger was juicy and the fries were very fresh tasting.  All in all a nice addition to the Castro even though we already have Sliders it's nice to choices.
author: Pat C.

description: Burgers are a classic food that can go terribly wrong.  This one is near perfection.  I love that you can choose 4 or 8 ounces.  Toppings - yes lots of them so you can really tailor this to your liking.  Fries are great.  Homemade pickles - get out!  Strauss Creamery shakes and cones round out a super duper experience.
author: Gail D.

description: Totally. Great milkshakes, to start. Scrimshaw on tap, also great. They put fresh parmesan on top of their fries, which definitely works for me. I tried the chicken sandwich and it give it seven thumbs up. A little spicy, good flavors, cooked just right. I am eager to return and devour a burger. Incredibly nice and bubbly server who seemed to enjoy her job, which is always good to see. I would say that the portions are not huge at first glance, but I left feeling satisfied. Quality stuff. I will be back.
author: Isabel L.

description: When it first opened, it was kinda of a cool burger joint. The quality of the burger is okay. but it is disapointed thta the soft served ice cream has no dairy taste at all.
author: Marty N.

description: I heard the garlic fries were good but mine weren't so good. Soggy, little cold, ok at best taste. The burger was so so. Not so much into mayo and that's what the super sauce tastes like. My lemonade (w/ brown sugar) was lukewarm but it was kinda tasty.
author: Eric R.

description:
I REALLY REALLY want to give Super Duper a five star rating. Great menu, decent veggie options, and have a super green business model. Awesome! And I've enjoyed eating here more than once in the past.
But this last trip, I specifically asked for the fries with the fun dippy sauce. When I didn't get them I asked the girls behind the counter and they told me "well, that costs extra... do you wanna pay for that?" I was like whatever. But then I re-added the math and guess what? You DID charge me for it. All I'm saying is your fierce protection of 15¢ worth of dipping sauce left a previously happy customer with a pretty bad taste in his mouth...
author: Stephen S.

description: Had the super the day before the SF marathon and couldn't believe how great it tasted. Went back for my after race meal. The burger comes from grass fed cows, which is what we ate when I was a kid. All the store bought meat and normal restaurants use grain fattened meat. It definitely tastes different. Thanks for taking me back to my childhood Super Duper!
author: Gabe G.

description: Finally ... truth in advertising!!! SUPER delicious burgers. SUPER awesome garlic fries. SUPER creamy shakes. SUPER DUPER homemade pickles. What's not to love? Their commitment to a green experience with fresh ingredient and recyclable materials is a real bonus. Dining here may not be nutritionally correct, but that's not why you go to a place like this. So just settle in with your SUPER burger and fries, and ENJOY!
author: Stephen K.

description: I love this place.  The service is great, they have beer on tap and the food is fantastic.  This may be sacrilege but I would say that it might even be better than In N Out.
author: brett b.

description: Went back again and I just can't eat their greasy tiny burgers anymore.  Too bad.  We could have used a decent burger please nearby.
author: Chris G.

description: Went here for lunch today and I have to say... wow! The burger I had (The Super) was easily one of the best I've had, in the city, and the shake was excellent as well. The garlic fries were nothing to write home about, but everything else, including the friendly service, was top notch. Absolutely LUSCIOUS!!!
author: Will M.

description: Yummy burgers and tasty fries. Fresh, hot, not too greasy, done right. Shakes are good too with Mitchell's ice cream!
author: Graham H.

description: My new favorite burger joint. Tasty, cheap, clean, and always great music playing. The staff is friendly and service is quick. I just keep forgetting the name.
author: Bruce B.

description: I met a friend of mine for a bit e to eat early and catch up. The menu was straight forward: build your own burger (or chicken...dont know about any veggie chouices, didnt check) which was cool, very organic (I dont care about that stuff, but if you do) the service guy was nice ( a bit too hipster for me, but its SF) . @ 8ooz burgers 2 garlic fries and 3 fountains drinks 22 bucks before tips. It was worth it. It was very good. The fries could have been much better, but the burgers were good. The only reason I didnt give it a 5 is that the space is tight and that the lay out makes it loud. VERY VERY LOUD! Regardless of the volume of the patrons. The staff was good. If you are alone and want to ear plug away at your iphone/ipad (I dont know/didnt check about WiFi) and enjoy a great burger this i DEF the place in Castro (MUCH better then the Orphan Andy GARBAGE). But NOT for a conversation. Unless its empty. Its a shame, because I cant really see what the owners can do about it :((((( Great place guys! ( would go again)
author: M F.

description: They have lovely soft serve ice cream, hard to find sometimes but now I have found this place, I'm a happy camper.
author: Natasha C.

description:
delicious food, quality ingredients, friendly service, and reasonable prices...

the BEEF: niman ranch, and ground daily--which retains freshness and flavor.

the FRIES: high on the yum factor and only $2. the garlic fries are $2.75, and are so good, you'll wanna slap your mama.

the SHAKES/ICE CREAM: organic strauss cream from petaluma.

the PACKAGING: it's all compostable. 

the EXTRAS: cheese $.50, bacon, avocado, point reyes bleu, roasted portabello for $1 each. grilled onions are FREE. y'heard. most places charge.

the "mini" burgers are $4.50, and much closer to what a serving of a burger should actually look like. but since we're convinced bigger is better, and that we're still really cute even when we're too fat to fit in our jeans, they offer a "super" burger as well for $6.50.

tax is included in the prices, and not tacked on at the end. it makes me feel like i'm home, in oregon. gawd bless no tax (or at least fooling me into believing i'm not paying it).

THEY SERVE BEER AND WINE.

the end.
author: Andy P.

description:
finally, a good burger place in the castro/mission area. no longer will i go to Burgermeister, Burger Joint, or Urbun Burger to get gouged for a decent burger.

the food here is very affordable, contains good ingredients, and is very satisfying. the burgers are similar to In-N-Out style, but much tastier. friendly service too. this is high quality fast food.
author: Daryl F.

description: Great place for a quick burger. I work in the Castro and it's always nice to have another place to go to for lunch. I personally love the veggie sandwich consisting of fried portabello goodness. On top of that, I scarf down a couple complimentary home-made pickles [: YumO.
author: Christine P.

description:
For vegetarians: the fried portobello mushroom was perfect. Crunchy outside meets hearty fresh portobello inside. Very filling and a good take on the mushroom.
Garlic fries - perfect. And a lot cheaper than most places.
Strauss ice cream cone dipped in chocolate - yes please. 
I loved it!
author: Meg B.

description: Super Duper has a great staff very friendly but the cooks can not cook a well done burger. Ive visited Super Duper 4 times and every burger has always been Super Duper raw. I was hoping there would been some hope for this place ,Im always willing to support a new business but Im done with Super Duper
author: Kristo V.

description:
Before we get started, I have to qualify this review by saying that Super Duper gets four stars for some things, but two stars for others, giving it an overall "I'd go back" for the things it does really well, and I'd opt to skip the rest. Here's the long and short: if you're hungry for a well crafted, relatively inexpensive burger accompanied by crisp, truly flavorful fresh fries for about eight bucks in the Castro (where you can also dine al fresco) then go for Super Duper. You can add bacon to any sandwich.

What you'll get is a pink (not gray) in the center, juicy burger crowned with fresh snappy lettuce (as well as the rest of the usual topper options) sandwiched on an unrepentantly white starch, sesame studded bun. The burger isn't as big and flavorful as one of those out of control Mission Burger burgers, but this is a quality burger, not the dumbed down, dreaded hockey puck. Many people have compared SD to In N Out, but I would propose that Taylor's Refresher is a more apt comparison, and SD is less expensive. Only one piece of advice: skip the unfortunately namby-pamby iced tea and do the lemonade. They're both house made. Finally, take the overly assertive home-cured pickles under advisement, they're a little too fermented (mine were almost fizzy). If you want more detail, read on. Keep in mind, your choices for burgers in this price range in the neighborhood mostly SUCK by comparison (e.g. Bagdad Cafe, Cafe Flore, and that crazy place with the merry go round grill on Castro street that I've never tried but I've heard isn't very good).

Many reviews have compared this restaurant, unfairly in my opinion, to In N Out. This is not a chain, and there's a lot of care put into what they do. A more apt comparison, I think, would be Taylor's Refresher.  Brought to you by the same folks who put together Beretta and Starbelly, SD is taking a whack at the road side burger stand that none of us can actually remember, but we're all sure must have been there at one point before the big chains ruined it for everyone. I had a very good burger: it was a perfect medium, actually pink in the middle rather than the uniform grey we've been led to expect, and best of all, it was full-fat juicy.  It's not the most flavorful beef in the world (compared to many of the other double digit burgers at Mission Burger, Starbelly or Chow) but then again, it was only four bucks! 

I also loved the fact that all the disposables at SD are compostable. Meals are served on (Taylor's Refresher-style) aluminum quarter sheet pans lined with parchment instead of throw-away plates. They use compostable corn-plastic cups, the fries are served in those familiar, joyous red and white paper french fry trays that I never get tired of. The ketchup and mustard, which you pump yourself, goes into equally compostable tiny paper cups (the kind they use in prison to organize medications). The napkins aren't napkins, they're gas-station paper towels, which is fine with me if it's better for the environment. All the trash bins are green.

My biggest disappointment was the iced tea and pickles. I should have gone with Coke, which would have been appropriate to the restaurant's vibe, but unfortunately I would have had to pump is out of one of those detestable 7-Eleven style soda fountains. If I were SD, I would consider glass bottles and frosty pint glasses. Or at least find a soda fountain that isn't made of black petroleum products.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
i had this brilliant thought--after retrieving my library books from the eureka valley branch across the intersection i'd have dinner.  lately i'm burger  hunting, so this stop made sense.  

the place is sensibly laid out and the counter staff were super friendly (although i think she was stretching it when she said the name "henry" was sexy ... i'm sure it was a sexy name in the 1890s, but not so much now).  

i had the super with fries and unsweetened iced tea (the  unsweetened iced tea is a concession to my diabetes--i'd already planned to eat french fries and my burger, so any other carb cutting would be  helpful).  the food came up quickly and i parked at one of the tables by the window ... tastiness all around, and i should have taken jeph's advice to go for the double.  

my only real annoyance: "super sauce."  sure, i get it that restaurants want something that distinguishes them from the others, but why is it so hard to say what super sauce is?  i reviewed the menu outside the door and another menu over the counter and neither said what super sauce was.  since this comes on every sandwich it seems kinda important that you should say wtf it is (in this case, it's an aioli ... and i skipped it ... putting something like that on a hot sandwich is just gross!).  

still, i nommed in the castro for  under $10 ... would definitely go back.
author: Henry M.

description: I thought I would love it since they had the simple menu. Everything is overpriced, the burgers are very greasy, and just painfully average in every way. I couldn't tell there was any sort of sauce even thought there supposedly was a "super" sauce in the burger. If you're a standalone independent new burger place in the city, I expect you to be better than In-N-Out burger, and this place fell short in just about every category.
author: Eric R.

description: I decided to come here because of rave reviews and especially because they are 'cheap' but you get what you pay for. I had a regular cheeseburger and my BF had a double. Both were mushy and flavorless but a step up from I guess fast food but in no way better than in and out-the milkshakes were good. I will not go again. I am glad that they were cheap because if they charged any more I would be miffed
author: Kitty L.

description: Really amazing and fresh-tasting burgers, super hot staff, awesome garlic fries, and all you can eat pickles! The shake was also thick, just the way I like it! :) Definitely will be back!
author: Joy C.

description: Had a great Chicken sandwich, on a fresh bun.  Down side is the fries. They're just so blah!! .  It'd also be nice if they had a little bit more in the way of condiments.  Great chicken, hold the fries!
author: Dennis N.

description:
Visit on 05/20/2011, Friday, ~03:30 p.m.

So loud staff behind counter couldn't hear the customers.

Burger was average, with no flavor (should lightly salt and pepper during cooking, at a minimum; not the same if added later).
Staff forgot (or didn't hear request during ordering) for fries, which had to pay/come separately and later.
Cookies are thin, too crispy (slightly burned), and have no significant flavor.
Be careful, or staff will make flavored shakes with flavored ice creams (shakes should ALWAYS start with vanilla ice cream).

Staff literally dumps (small) pile of parmesan cheese on garlic fries, although not noted on menu or requested. Ugh! Staff insists they are garlic-cheese fries, until directed to menu which only lists "Garlic Fries". If I had known to expect, I could have avoided.

No remedy(-ies) attempted by staff. Just a blank, awkward stare.

Much better choices exist for burgers in the Castro.
author: N P.

description: I came for lunch and was really disappointed with their burgers. The burger was not anything special and sort of on the small side when it comes to portions. The taste was okay, but had way better in the city. I dont think I'm coming back.
author: Leon C.

description: This place is a nice alternative to In N Out Burger. That means I don't have to drive down to Daly City or the Fisherman's Wharf area. It's literally a hop, skip, a roll, and a shimmy down to the Castro. They have a basic menu...burgers (vegetarian too), fries, drinks, shakes, and soft serve cones. At the counter, I noticed they offer a few special burgers too. It's easy, affordable, and good. It's great for a quick meal before hitting the bars (or after) and it's family friendly too. This place is super solid!
author: Fil L.

description:
went tonight for an early dinner... and, hmm...

so i read the reviews and they seem wishy washy...so had to go try it for myself.

its true, the burgers are oily and have no flavor. i expected the pickles to be good at least, but they weren't even pickled.

i had the super duper burger single and some garlic cheese fries... it was just ok. if the actual meat had some flavor and didn't have tiny bits of hard rubbery stuff in it, it would have been totally better. i guess they aren't using lean meat?

in the end, the service was ok, the place looked alright..but i don't think i'll give it another go.
author: sue k.

description:
nothing beats corner bistro in nyc. hands down.
but on my burger hunt in my current locale of SF, i did enjoy the Super Duper (single) and fries. the pickles near the condiments were a delicious addition to the simplicity of the menu.

also, despite the super duper name, you will not walk out feeling like a bloated mess (unless you want to, in that case, order the double with bacon).

will be back. will try a shake the next time.
author: Jacquie P.

description:
I went here about a week ago. SO GOOD! I live in the neighborhood and I think this is a very welcome addition.

 My dining companion and I had read the reviews here before trying it out, so we came in with a healthy critical eye. We both had the Superburger and the regular fries. I thought the price was really good for the quality of the meat, and the burger was well constructed. As a pretty big fan of In-N-Out (the only burger at this price point that I will eat) I couldn't help but compare. This is a more straightforward burger than my Animal Style at In-N-Out, but the flavor was fantastic. The Superburger also had probably double the meat, which made for a better flavor profile-the meatiness is central.  It's a very classic, nicely crafted cheeseburger that's honestly more comparable to and probably better than Taylor's (or whatever their new name is) than it is to In-N-Out, but at an In-N-Out price. We ordered two cheeseburgers, two orders of fries, a beer and an Iced Tea and it came to just under $20. I like that!

The fries were tasty and hot, but seemed like they had been reheated or overcooked as they were a little darker and crispier than they should have been. If the fries could be made fresh, there is nothing I would change about the food. It was that good. 

The place definitely seemed unfinished design-wise, but I like what they've got going on so far.

!!!!***Two bonuses: fresh housemade pickles! and beer on tap!!!!***

 I like the direction they're going and I'm glad they're in my 'hood.
author: C Z.

description:
This spot is very low key and definitely kid friendly. There was a group of 5 toddlers enjoying their soft serve ice creams right next to us. I started it off with the portobello sandwich with aged jack cheese...um yum! And my bf had the house special, the super duper burger and an order of the regular fries. My meat eater of a boyfriend tried my portobello and actually thoroughly enjoyed it! SHOCKING I know! I liked the size of the burgers as it wasn't overwhelming and left you feeling satisfied not stuffed...but then came dessert.

The super duper friendly manager/maybe owner? Luis brought us out two samples of the desserts. Which was awfully nice of him! One was the pecan pie soft serve sundae and the other was the strawberries and honey soft serve sundae. Both were scrumptious and made us want to order a dessert of our own! Dang you Luis! So I had the vanilla and chocolate swirl soft serve cone dipped in chocolate and the bf was a little more adventurous and went for the chocolate chip cookie and bacon sundae. In his exact words of why he tried it: "I love bacon, I love ice cream, and I love chocolate chip cookies". Haha. Mine was good, but definitely not worth making an extra trip back for. And his bacon was a little burnt so it didn't have the salty taste that it should have had. But when he mentioned that to Luis, he showed up with another sample serving of the bacon sundae with the bacon cooked just right! Now that's customer service! And sure enough, my guy finished that serving as well.... because hey, it would be rude not to, right?!

Anywho, I highly recommend this place if you're craving a healthy style burger! And I didn't mention this before, but the prices are really great too! So get out there and support a brand new business!
author: alex f.

description: I like this place a lot! Good burgers, good fries. The one in the Castro is definitely better better than the one next to Mel's at Powell. 3 stars instead of 4 because the price is kind of high. The deserts are pretty high priced, I'd recommend getting dinner here and then going for dessert somewhere else if you still have room. This is a pretty good place if you want to get filled up off of a burger and fry!
author: Robin J.

description: Wow! This is THE place to get a burger. It as fantastic! I think they put crack in the meat or something cause after eating one, I almost got another one. The meat is so juicy and the fries were perfect. And they're homemade pickles! Yummy! Look out In-N-Out, you've got a competitor.
author: jason m.

description: Unbelievably good cheeseburger. Not to mention the free rough-cut pickles you can take along in a little tray. I ordered at a busy time on a weeknight, and even so my order was finished in less than five minutes, and cheerfully done. I didn't think it was possible to outdo In-and-Out on the basic burger, but it did. Spoken as a lifetime burger aficionado!
author: Charles L.

description: free pickles!  i ate three tubs of them, which left only 20% of my stomach left for the burger.  will be back to try the shakes!  get the parmesan fries -- very stinky.
author: Amy S.

description: Try the Philly Burger!!!  It's the best burger I've ever had in this city.  The milk shakes aren't that bad either.  The strawberry milk shake is good, though a bit tart from the fresh berries.
author: Jason B.

description: I love the fact this place is bold enough to have a limited menu of excellent choices - all done great.  Wonderful shakes.  Fries are only OK.  Beer is a plus. A great place to go if you want a burger/beer.
author: p w.

description: Great Burgers made with wholesome ingredients. The burger was flavorful and the fries were crispy. Service was pretty good. My only complaint was the burger. It was a little on the small side. However the french fries  were great. A burger special costs $8 that includes burger, fries, and soda.
author: Claudia B.

description:
Super Duper is great!  For the price and quality, you can't really go wrong. 

I especially love the veggie sandwich.  Fried Portabello mushroom, jack cheese, and all the fixings. mmmmm. Neiman Ranch meat, great!  Everything compostable, wow! 

Also, the garlic fries are a must try. not too garlic-y  sprinkled with parmesan cheese. yum!

The ambiance is cute, the staff is friendly.   The soft serve at the end of the meal is perfect.  I will def be back here!  

Thanks!
author: Anna E.

description: Awesome, in every sense of the word. Delicious fries (those who say other wise are jaded), great burgers, an option for beer or wine, killer music, and all priced within reason. This is not a destination, it is an everyday experience. A REAL burger, served economically and tastefully. Shared a Superburger and the chicken sandwich with my soon to be hubby, couldn't of been happier. It is such a good feeling to find a business that cares enough about it's own neighborhood that they search for local vendors!!!! An absolute must try for those looking for a farm to plate connection!
author: Ashley B.

description: The parmesan fries are delicious, as are their shakes. But the portabella burger was lacking, and would have been tons better had it not been fried. I know they are trying to do something different but marinating and grilling is better than battering and frying. Overall good, but now I just go for the fries.
author: Misty D.

description:
"WHERE'S THE BEEF?"

SERVICE: Some kinks to work out. Friendly staff....just a bit of the right hand not knowing what the left hand is doing. 

FOOD:   Their homemade pickles are an interesting touch...but not that great...Need a bit more bite. Burger patties are small.  I felt the pain of the old lady in the 80's Wendy's commercial.  Better choices for a good burger...
author: Mike O.

description: I actually find it kind of sad that burger and pizza places do well in the Castro but quality restaurants seem to go by the wayside. I really like Starbelly, though the menu is starting to feel old to me, so I thought I would try out Super Duper for a late lunch. As a vegetarian I was hoping for a good veggie burger, but the only veg option they offer is a portabello mushroom sandwhich. I was not excited about this at all, but the way it was breaded really made it feel more substantial than your typical veggie sandwhich. I still wish they offered a good homemade veggie patty though. There aren't many options for cheese and things like that yet. My milkshake was tasty but not thick at all, closer to strawberry milk as another reviewer has stated. I can't imagine going back unless the menu changes often with different tempting vegetarian burger/sandwhich options. Overall I feel like this place is just average right now, and it feels a little too fast food for me.
author: Mark S.

description:
Alas, Super Duper is slipping.  Don't really care why but I might just walk over to Slider's next time.  Quieter and better fries.
Really, it doesn't matter how good, sustainable, grass fed whatever, if the food sits on the counter a few minutes before it gets to the customer.  Burgers are a delicate combination of condiments,sauce,meat and bun that is infused by  the juiciness of the burger when hot, not overwhelmed by grease when the burger has cooled just a bit too long which is what happened to my burger.  It wasn't delivered promptly and the fries seemed twice cooked. This was at 11:30am and I was one of two customers in the shop.  Please just get the properly cooked burger to the table and let the customer decide if it should cool off first.   Please don't say I should have checked or could have checked on it, there were just two customers and it's your job, not mine.  It was a bit mealy, pink in the middle and I noticed another customer took his burger back, you might want to check in with the cooks.  MacDonalds would have beaten you today.  The cashier, a woman was SuperDuper. :(
author: Terri C.

description: My husband said his burger was fantastic, so this review is solely for their veggie burger: I was really excited about the prospect of a giant, fried portabella mushroom, but it ended up not having much flavor and was really oily. The fries were great though. Just not a great place for a veggie burger.
author: Tamara M.

description: This place is great for what it is... a burger joint. They make great burgers and great fries. What else do you need? Well the service was great as well. Very fast and friendly. I would recommend this place if you want a quick bite to eat and are not trying to "impress someone".
author: Bobby B.

description: Great inexpensive burgers that don't sacrifice quality.  Love the homemade pickles.  Definitely better than In-N-Out...can't believe these two are being compared really.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
hey, this rating is based on the fact that it's cheap and good.  i know it ain't four-star dining...it's all relative, people.

anyway, this place kinda reminds me of the Shake Shack, which i fell in love with in NYC.

the burger is greasy....but like my buddy said...."you know...good, greasy".....

fries were pretty good.

the sundae wasn't really a sundae in my book, it was more like soft serve ice cream with a couple of toppings (choc chip cookie...chips ahoy?...and bacon...just wanted to try it, and it just proves that bacon is good with ANYTHING).  it was okay.  i'd probably prefer an extra burger or a shake over this the next time.

the burger isn't big, and if you want veggies on it, you have to order their super duper.  never thought veggies would elevate a burger to super duper status, but whatever.

i like hamburgers.  i like fries.  i like inexpensive, tasty food.  i like super duper burger.
author: Miss P.

description:
while i realize that this place may not be the BEST EVER, my burger was  juicy and delicious, the produce looked fresh and crisp (FYI, it is definitely not iceberg as a few less produce-savvy reviewers said, it seemed to be butter lettuce or baby romaine).  All i know is that i spent 20 dollars before tip for 2 super burgers, garlic fries, and 2 large (20 oz?) beers.  a great deal.  

a few amendments:  the special sauce was a little less bold than i had hoped and the garlic cheese fries should be rebranded as parmesan fries. i was really hoping for some melted cheese and garlic chunks but got a parm-dusted pile of fries with a bit of parsley or something.  in a city that has amazing garlicky fries at the ballpark i think people have something different in mind.  they are yummy, but a bit mis-represented as "garlic cheese" fries.
author: Logan M.

description: Super Duper is super duper!!! Had the super burger, fries and lemonade. Fries were perfect!! Crispy and just salty enough.  Burger was delicious. From the bun to the raw onions. All complemented each other. Fresh made lemonade was nice too. And the funnest way to end a meal-- a chocolate vanilla swirl soft serve dip!! It was yummy. Plain and simple.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I checked this place out for dinner, after my dentist appointment. The prices were good. $4.25 for a cheese burger however if you want lettuce and tomato you pay extra .50 cents ( I thought lettuce and tomato was a staple in the burger?) The fries were $2.25 . Didn't wait long at all for my order.  Both the burger and fries were very tasty and you get lots of fries. They also serve beer and ice cream for desert. I had burger , fry and ice tea for under $10.00 not bad. They stay open until 11pm.  I am sure they will receive lots of hungry people that have been drinking at the nearby bars. It was OK, I don't know why they displaced Pasta Pomodero that place was always crowded. I will go again if I am in the neighborhood.
author: Susie S.

description: Just OK.  Nothing bad but zero special.  Not sure if open late but if it is could be a good after-bar spot....if you are looking to be blown away it's not gonna happen here, but you won't be bummed out either.
author: Brian H.

description: Great customer service and good pickles, but their burgers and buns aren't that great.  Way too greasy.   If they tweaked their recipe a bit, it probably would be much better.
author: Dan P.

description: A Shake Shack wanna be for sure...and seriously...charging for lettuce and tomato?  seriously??  the pickles are good...and shakes FAIL.  WAY too much milk and not enough soft custard.   Too bad...because I so wanted it to be the West Coast Shake Shack.
author: Sonia C.

description: The quality of the beef is so good that you can taste the difference between this and your average burger place. Delicious!
author: Jonah R.

description:
A solid burger joint. I've been there three times already, twice for burgers and once for a chocolate dipped cone.

Food/Drink:
The burgers are great, I usually get the double. They're cooked perfectly and even the double doesn't make me feel "gross" like a lot of establishments that specialize in burgers. 

The fries are mighty tasty and I enjoy the parmesan cheese variant. 

The ice cream is stellar. The soft-serve choco-dipped cones are to die for and the sundaes are spectacular too. 

I love that they have beer on tap. I've had the lemonade once, wasn't quite sweet enough for me, but wasn't half bad. 

The Service:
Excellent. The manager/owner dropped by last time we were there and asked us how everything was. After we ordered sundaes he brought out a small sample for us to try of the third type of sundae which we hadn't ordered, it was as tasty as the other two. The second we left I looked back and they were already cleaning our table- don't understand the cleanliness gripes from other yelpers.

The Decor:
It's easy to order and we've never had a problem finding a seat. I really don't understand the people knocking this place on the "plywood" style walls. It's an interesting choice and I don't think it inhibits the experience. If you're looking for something a little more classy, why not try Berretta or Starbelly, which is right across the street. This is not the kind of place I'm going to put on my Sunday best for a classy date. IT'S A BURGER JOINT!

Hope you stick around Super Duper, you're A-okay in my book!
author: Scott H.

description:
this place offers serious value!
-excellent fried portobello mushroom burger.
-pt reyes cheese is stinky like a blue should be.
-fries are good but not hot enough. human size portion. not insane.
-ice cream was really good - organic!! esp the choco dipped.
-the blondie cashier is new & confused, but the owner/manager guy was on top of the scene.
and unexpectedly great pickles.
author: Kim Y.

description: best juicy burger in the city!!!!!  the ONLY thing that would make this place better, is having sweet potato fries!!  and, the ice cream/chocolate dips are delightful and the rest of the deserts (cookies, pecan pie) are AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!
author: Roni G.

description: After an exhaustive search, this definitely rises to the top of the SF burger world.  Recent visits to Umami Burger and even Marlow have left me dismayed---why do they want to ruin a simple burger?  A burger, after all, should taste like a burger, and that is exactly how Super Duper burgers taste.   Every detail of this establishment is well thought through, from the design to the execution.   I got the Super Duper burger with portobello mushrooms and blue cheese added and couldn't have been happier.   And as an added bonus, the fries are awesome too.
author: David T.

description: Great burgers!  get the double beef with cheese.  They are small but tasty.  Better than the oversize burgers.  just plain good and juicy.  Garlic fries are covered with Parmesan cheese.  If you go, grab a shake, then sit outside on the sidewalk and watch the people run on the treadmill across the street at Golds gym while you stuff your face. LOL!
author: D D.

description: I really like their burgers. They are juicy and meaty and bursting with flavor. The fries were thin, crispy, and salted just right. Not much on ambiance but if you want a damn good burger, then this is the place.
author: Nick B.

description: best burger ever...best fries....best shakes....best burger experience...this will be a weekly ritual...
author: Ricky G.

description: Pretty solid meals.  I have gotten the chicken sandwich with Chipotle aoli several times, and have always been happy with it.  Milkshakes are awesome.
author: John M.

description:
Seriously good burgers. It's like in 'n out burger but made with better meat, and a lot more style, and while they're pretty simple (one could almost say too simple) they're effing delicious. Even the single hamburger, which has nothing but meat, sauce, and bun was juicy and delish. Not greasy, but still really juicy. 

It does seem like they're not quite open yet though - there was a printed menu pasted to the wall, and things still look a little unfinished. But: the food is super super good, and I think it's gonna be awesome once they get it all finished!
author: jackie t.

description:
The photocopied menu is is as sparse as In n Out, but the food doesn't come close. 

Like some of the other negative reviews, the burgers were small and incredibly greasy.....probably made appear  worse by wrapping them up in greaseproof paper, which resulted in the grease running all over the tray, my hands and face. To make things worse, the public bathroom style paper towles for napkins didn't do a great job of mopping it up.

The fries were similarly small in portion size and very bland. It was good to see beer was served on tap, but they both disappointed in taste.

This place is brand new. You could say the paint hasn't even dried on the walls....except for the fact that they haven't been painted yet. It almost feels like they aren't even committed to keeping this as a viable business until they see if their burgers are a hit or not. If they don't do something to improve the food, I doubt they will be around long enough for many people to give them a second chance.
author: Sean O.

description: This place is good for burgers and fries.  When I'm in the Castro I try to go here if I'm in the mood for burgers.  The burgers appear to be handmade as well as most of their ingredients appear to be fresh or made on spot.  The fries fit right in as well. I'm a burger fan and this is by far one of the better burger places in SF. The place is small and loud.  I understand restaurants like being loud to entice people that it's "happening" but I wished they'd put a rug or something in there LOL.  Ohh well on a nice day eat outside :)
author: Rodney P.

description: Easily my favorite burger spot in the city. Their chicken sandwich is extremely good too.
author: Anthony A.

description: The mushroom burger was delicious, but overall the food is a bit overpriced for what you get.
author: Camiel B.

description:
A perfect burger brings back memories of happier times - childhood BBQs, poolside burgers, backyard cookouts and long road trip vacations.  

Super Duper nails the burger perfectly - juicy, flavorful, topped just right (so desperately needed in the Castro).  The fries are crisp, and just the right size to indulge yourself or share with a friend.

The simple, straightforward menu is very reasonably priced, food is served quickly and the staff are friendly.  

Go.
author: Steve M.

description:
Thumbs down on Super Duper for serving raw meat.  Period.

BF and I went there tonight - only one request was made on the Double Super Duper cheeseburgers - and that was to make sure the meat was at least cooked well done.

After we both bit into the burgers, it was obvious they were cooked barely above rare.  Mine was a deep pink throughout and his was cooked on 1/2 and completely raw on the other 1/2.

I had enjoyed really good burgers there earlier in the week & raved about it to my BF and a few friends.  However, after an experience like this, I'll be very reluctant to go back.

Yes the place is new & there are kinks to be worked out.  But, I've cooked burgers for years, and it's not difficult to make sure they are done.
author: Ben M.

description:
I really want to support new businesses in the neighborhood, but there were a lot of things about Super Duper that'll keep me from coming back for at least a while... 

First the pluses: the burger was really good, if greasy, and my partner liked his chicken sandwich.  

On the downside, hmmm..  fries were overly-salty and not hot, milkshake was terrible (comes from a slop machine, like McD's but not as good), tables are uncomfortably small and badly placed (it seems like there's less seating than Pasta P ?), chairs are those awful cold metal prison-like things (why does anyone think those belong in cold SF?), lighting & layout makes it unwelcoming, similar to Sliders.

And the view of people working out across the street at Gold's makes you reflect on how unhealthy the food is you just ordered.  Does the Castro really need yet another unhealthy food place?  Some imagination or innovation would have been nice.

I'd have to say the same meal at Inn & Out is better, and Burger Meister on Church is definitely much better in all regards.
author: Jeff P.

description: Dropped in here after my abs class at the Sports Club LA/San Francisco so I suppose I should feel guilty about eating here, but I pass by it almost every day and have wanted to see if the buzz about the place was worth it.  I ordered the Mini-Burger combo - but the burger really isn't Mini - think more of a standard 1/4-1/3 pounder and you'll have a better visual.  They have a double version of this, but that is more food than I need especially after a workout.  So let's start with the burger -  toasted bun, very good, meat - thick and juicy and each one is hand made  - they said expect a 10 min wait, but mine was up within 3-5, so the must have had some ready to go, still a really good made-to-order burger.  Think 5 Guys, which I haven't seen yet in the Bay area, but I was a loyal follower back in Ohio.  You can choose what you want from a decent list of toppings including Super Sauce - probably like Big Mac, not sure what was in it.  For $1 more you can get more things added and there is also an up-charge for cheese (I went without) to get the real taste of the meat.  The combo comes with regular fries, which looked homemade, but they were a little card-board like - not bad, but I've had better at both 5 Guys and In-n-Out Burger.  Even McDonalds are better.  You can also order some dipping sauces for these for an extra $1.  I saw a lot of the garlic and cheese fries coming out to tables and if I go back (and I will) I will make sure I order some of those - the garlic smell was very powerful and they just looked great.  It seems SFO like their garlic as we are close to a city that has a festival every year.  Diet Coke from the fountain rounded out the combo.  Napkins are like something you might see in a cheap washroom, kind of scratchy, but they did the job.  I'd like to try their homemade lemonade on the next trip with brown sugar, that looked really tasty.  Seating area is crowded and not very fancy, but that is the whole experience, it's really about the burger, nothing about the experience in the location to talk about, but the lines to get in and find a seat say this is worth a repeat visit.
author: Steve A.

description: The veggie burger is deep fried. The other burgers are ok. I prefer In-N-Out for a tastier and much less expensive option.
author: Joe B.

description: i love super duper because, well..the burgers there are just that-SUPER DUPER!  the burgers melt in your mouth, and i am always disappointed when im all done because i always want another!  fries are good too, but the burgers are definitely the reason i keep coming back again and again!  always friendly customer service too!
author: Gary H.

description: The burgers are so good!  The bun is fresh and grilled, the toppings are good, and the price is just right. Garlic fries are awesome too!  This will be my new favorite neighborhood burger place!
author: LT B.

description: I love the burgers and buns--excellent taste and quality. You should probably start with a single as the double will leave you in a meat coma. The one thing I would change is the fries: while tasty, I think they are too thin.
author: John B.

description: I. Die. O. Me. O. My! I don't even eat meat and this place makes me weak at the knees with their veggie burger, blue cheese, hummus, home made fries, 3 dips that put in n out animal style to shame, and some delish home made lemonade! The owner and the staff are all great and complement the smooth and easygoing vibe that I love about this place. Located RIGHT in the castro, it makes it easy to people watch outside and have them watch you with drool coming out their mouth. Another plus: I left my cell phone there once at lunch and that night, the manager called my friend from my phone letting him know that I had left it there. Sure enough, when I went, he personally handed it to me. As I write this I am craving super duper burger. mmMMmMMmMm
author: Amelia L.

description: Probably the best burger I've ever tasted, they were so juicy! Loved the fresh garlic fries!
author: Ronny W.

description: veg burger, they have the best vegan burger ever!!!
author: B H.

description: Bloody burger, hair in fries and the manager, Ryan was extremely rude when I showed him the bloody rare burger that my 10 year old was supposed to eat.  He told us to wait back in line to get our burger redone and gave us attitude for the restaurant's mistake.  Even his staff was looking at Ryan and rolling their eyes. Our first burger was supposed to be plain and they served it with condiments.  Then the second burger was rare.  20 minutes later and 3 burgers later Super Burger finally got our order correct but we had to deal with the rude attitude of the manager.  Would never go back and would never recommend this place.
author: m b.

description: just the spot for a late night greasy burger to calm the beer churning in your belly.  the garlic fries are pretty good - but the garlic sprinkled on top is raw, so hopefully both you AND your lucky partner like garlic ...
author: Chong C.

description: Their cheeseburger is one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life.  Get the double, AKA, the "Double Duper."  I'm sitting here staring at the clock waiting for it to hit 11AM so they'll open.
author: Jared R.

description: warning: this is NOT shake shack. not even in-n-out. but a good choice for a burger, decent fries, and a beer if you're craving it after some hard core shopping in union square. my burger was actually cooked medium rare when requested, so that's a plus. $1.50 to spike your milkshake is another plus.
author: Nini G.

description: Niman Ranch beef burgers, delicious garlic fries, Strauss soft serve. Super Duper aims, shoots and scores. Fair prices and good hours too. Someone here complained about the place not recooking an egg, but you can't just take food that someone potentially slobbered on and put it back on the grill. At any rate, I really enjoyed my meal and will be back. Highly recommended if you're looking for a quick, tasty and reasonably priced meal in the Castro.
author: Jennifer V.

description: I think this is the best burger in SF *for the money*.   Most places are trying to charge $10 for a high quality burger, and this is half the price.  They use good quality meat, and the patty is juicy, and cooked right.  The bun is nice and light, it lets the meat do the talking.    I also like the fact that they keep the menu simple, and the outdoor tables are a nice bonus.
author: Andrei A.

description: Yes! Finally a delicious, perfectly sized, eco-friendly, fast food hamburger for me (the mini size) for the right price! The meat is juicy and tasty. Fries are awesome. And to top it off, they have chocolate dipped soft serve!
author: Patty S.

description: Wow, this is the new benchmark for great burgers! You can really taste the hi-quality ingredients. The atmosphere may not be the coziest one but the food is definitely awesome!
author: Jerry L.

description:
****UPDATE******
The new posting from Deborah B. from Super Duper where SHE explains her take, that SHE has posted as a letter from HERSELF, was first sent to myself and the other person who experienced the same dishonest business practice as a letter from a B of A representative earlier today. I find it very interesting that now Deborah B is representing it as her own words.  I also would like to point out that Deborah B has not apologized for any "confusion" or tried to rehabilitate a lost customer. So as it is Deborah B. doesn't seem to really appreciate my business. Which is a non issue now because she will receive none from me. Eat there if you want but they are going to charge you 20% extra on your bill and tell you that you are wrong for questioning it. Great customer service Deborah B. There was a time when I though Pasta Pomodoro would be in your space forever due to its popularity. Well that's just not the case. It seems northing does well in that space for very long. I wish you luck.





######### WARNING###############
I went to Super Duper for lunch today 6/8/10 and was there around 12:30pm. I payed using my Visa Debit card and I tipped in cash. I struck out the area on the credit card slip for tip because I tipped in cash. Later in the day I got a call from my lunch companion who alerted me that she had just went to confirm the charge online and Super Duper added 20% to her credit card charge. So I checked my online banking statement and low and behold the ass behind the counter did the exact same thing to me.  DO NOT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE STOLEN FROM. Even if you pay in cash , you are supporting a group of thieves. We don't need to support dishonest merchants. I hope the Castro Merchant's Association catches these guys in their game soon. I will be calling them next to alert them of our experience today. Super Duper, you lost 4 customers today with more to come as I will be telling everyone I suggested your establishment to, not to eat there.
author: Dennis V.

description: Cheap burgers, alcoholic milkshakes and more. Try the home made pickles and make sure you look for the underlined items on the menu so you know what "everything" means.
author: Steve L.

description: Super Duper vs In n' Out...tough call. I grew up a few blocks from the original In n' Out so you know where my loyalties should be...but but Super Duper is so darn delicious! Nothing better after happy hour in the Castro, in terms of food that is.  So let's keep these fresh beef'ed, everything loaded, fried egg and bacon topped, endless pickled if you wanna, any way you call it delicious burgers to ourselves shall we? Our secret, don't tell anyone, lest we run out of pickles or have to stand in longer lines.
author: Jason J.

description: I love this place. Neat and quick service. Juicy greasy burger. You need at least 3 napkins.
author: H D.

description: The burgers were looking a bit greasy on the grill so I opted for the chicken sandwich, which was generously portioned but slightly overcooked, and topped with a homemade chipotle sauce that complemented the chicken well.  Vegetables were fresh and the self-serve pickles were a nice touch.  Nothing notable, but a respectable meal nonetheless.
author: Jeremy C.

description: they've got a formula going and it's a great burger in a cool atmosphere
author: Jack G.

description: Great food. Best Burgers in town! Cleanliness iffy.
author: Jay Z.

description: I want to love you super duper. But if you are spending $11 dollars for a burger and fries the least you could do is keep your dining area clean. I ate my whole meal while there were trays pilled up on the table next to me and my table was dirty. Other times the whitish tile floors were disgustingly dirty. McDonalds has figured out a way to keep its restaurants relatively clean. I think this restaurant needs a manager. Oh yeah, there was no mustard.
author: Darryl D.
