description: I was SO UPSET when Pomodoro closed -- it was a favorite weekly haunt for many years for either sit down or take out.  But as the Castro/Upper Market slowly slides into a string of fast food outlets and trendy boyclothes stores, Super Duper is a very OK nextgen for that space.  Somewhere in between InNout Burger and Burger Joint (my other favorite near me, over on Haight) lies the very tasty and very very well priced superburger at Super Duper (you have to have lettuce and tomatoe, right?): $4.75.   The fries are great but the serving are too big -- no wonder we're all getting tubby...   The fresh strawberry shakes are exquisite in my book with the whole tab running just north of $11 before counter tip.   My biggest secret is that I love soft serve, so these folks won my heart when they announced chocolate/vanilla swirl -- who cares if it's way overpriced -- I'm in -- I've already been just for dessert at 10pm and have had two meals in the week they've been open.  I do worry what will happen when it gets crowded -- people will stack up in front of the counter waiting for the custom cooked burgers to pop out.   Also, great paper sacks for take home but they should lose the foil backed packs that aren't recyclable!  All in all, I welcome them to the neighborhood.
author: Mark B.

description: This is going to be my new favorite place to hit up during lunch.  Forget the subway sandwhich across the street.  It's all about SUPER DUPER burger joint.  The place is very trendy and the staff is super nice.  I ordered the single hamburger and fries and after eating it, i didnt feel fat at all!!!!.  This burger is amazing.  Their garlic cheese fries are so delicious.  No its not like nacho cheese, its actually fries seasoned with garlic and some sort of cheese powder.  Its so delicious.  Their marinated pickle is very delicious too.  I was tempted to steal the whole jar.  But didnt want to be tacky.  I just bagged a few pickles.  While I was waiting for my burger, I finished the bag of pickles.  I didnt even save one to place in my burger.  Oh well.  Pickles were delicious by iteself.  It was self marinated.  A little spicy but that's ok for me.  I love spicy food.   See u soon super duper burger!
author: Mimi S.

description:
My brother who is an Executive Chef heard about this place from a fellow co-worker. We had to stop by. It's a high end Burger place. 
I woke up and had to write a review. I had the 4oz burger with Avocado, lettuce, & cheese. Perfect size. And you know how on most burgers the avocado falls off and or there isn't enough by your last bite....not true here. My brother had the 8oz with bacon. The natural juices nice, warm, and  perfectly clear! A wonderful piece of meat. I have not eaten meat for a about two months. This did not hurt, turn, upset my tummy or give me any sort of sickness or discomfort. This was a perfect place to go to get my 1st bite of meat after not having any. 
They have two beers on tap and a few options of wine.(better get enough for your meal as the line is consistently thick) But the selection compliments their burgers very well. 
I had the opportunity to speak to one of the owners. The meat is brought in everyday. The sauces are homemade & the only thing not made in house is the soft serve ice cream. Everything else is in house. They have a very neat and clean look but to compliment it they are very clean!! They have jars of Pickles that are made every day! I love pickles. 
The set up could be a little different as the line goes right thought the restaurant and through the set up of places to eat. Yet there is a small loft area upstairs that looks like a nice place for a group or meeting.
Possibly another system to keep the line down......?.......
I will be back!!!
author: betsy c.

description: wow, you can definitely taste the quality of the ingredients here.  the meat in the burger is great, the fries were crisp with plenty of parmesan (although I found the garlic to be a tad lacking), and the soft serve with fresh strawberries was a good finish.  all in all - worth my frickin $10 or so dollars.
author: Ernest S.

description: i love the burgers and fries in here .....i work at the area...and i will come back again....All ingredients are fresh and so delicious!!! It's also cheap..
author: Ozzy D.

description: real juicy superb quality meat if i didn't have any knowledge about food i would even say they use Niman ranch - grass fed what ever you call it meat . from bun to toppings to meat that thing was perfect , very moist unlike other places , not giving names now where its just huge and dry and needs a bigger bun , i suppose who ever opened that place , have been so many times to in n out , five guys or shake shak it stand close to these places that's just my opinion maybe i was so hungry that day , awesome fries as well
author: NAEL K.

description: This place ROCKS!  Decadent, guilt-producing indulgence in the form of a Super Duper Burger with shoe string fries and fresh lemonade or a milkshake for ultra-decadent guilt.  The Super Duper burgers are flavorful and delicious, the lemonade ideal, the milkshakes to die for and the french fries perfect!  (Familiar with the book "How to Read a French Fry"?)  The portions are generous for the price.  (I can't even finish a Super Duper burger in one sitting.)  The place is impeccably clean, including the lavatory, and service is friendly and prompt.  If you have a hankering for a good burger, it's worth the trek across town and close to Muni!
author: Tug M.

description: the food here is ok. nothing special but nothing really wrong w it. my favorite would have to be the garlic fries though. cant find those eveyrwhere... and their shakes are also pretty good. the chocolate was very good. very chocolatey, it even had little chocolate crumbles on top of it. the burgers are decent, nothing special, and their secret sauce is basically just thousand island, nothing new. i would probably suggest my burger well done next time bc they were a little soggy, but oh well. filled me up at that point in time. :)
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Okay, with a name "Super Duper Burger"  you better damn produce, right?  Well, the burger is on the small side, maybe I should of ordered the double "duper"; however, with the single I wasn't completely impressed.  Mind you, it is decent, but does not match the name of the joint.  At the same time, their fries are YUMMY - and it's a generous serving!  I also ordered their shake which was also good, but on the skimpy end - volume-wise.  All in all, I like the place - it is on the tiny end, but there is limited sidewalk seating which will be great when the days are super warm.  Lastly it deserves good marks because it's very economical during these tough times it nice to see establishments offer a good meal for a reasonable price - and Super Duper Burger does just that.  I'd also recommend this joint for a first date, hell if the date is going south, one can always scope out the boys leaving Golds across the street.  Next time, I'll try their chicken sandwich.  Cheers!
author: Tiberius A.

description: Super Duper? More like Super Pooper! My husband and I came here today despite the weak reviews to try the place out. I order a "Burger" with everything on it and no tomato. He ordered a "Super Burger" with extra grilled onions and bacon. What we received was, Me: A "Super Burget with extra grilled onions and everything on it, including a tomato (to which I am allergic)" and Hubby got: A "Burger" with lots of raw onions. When I complained that they messed up both of our orders, the girl at the counter looked at me blankly. They gave my husband a new burger, or rather took off the raw onions and added grilled, but still no bacon in sight. OH! and refused to give him the "Super" he ordered, because they mistakenly made mine a "Super". I was forced to give him one of my patties. Nonetheless, I am never going here again. Waste of $20.
author: Gabriella M.

description: just found this place! its great. i had the chocolate and fresh strawberry shake with garlic fries. no burger, i know but will definately come back. All organic and good food!
author: Doug H.

description: they're obviously experimenting with the recipe for the homemade pickles and it's paying off! they keep tasting better and better every time i go!
author: Daniel S.

description: Now that's the best damn burger I've ever had in San Francisco.  The fries are crisp and the pickles are to die for.  Great prices too.   I am a fan!
author: G A.

description: Great burgers! Very tasty and innovative food combinations, fast & friendly service. Yes, the food is more expensive than McDs, but considering the prime ingredients used I think the price is very reasonable - less than a burger at a restaurant ,such as a Zuni burger - another of my favourites. The complimentary homemade pickles are a nice extra touch. I had a memorable fresh strawberry shake and some garlic fries as well.  My girlfriend had a chicken sandwich which she said was great.  It was almost like a blackened chicken sandwich with a Mexican marinade and served with some fab chipotle sauce.   All in all, everything far exceeded our expectations especially for such reasonable prices.  I think the only thing that is a concern is that parking in this area can be a pain at peak hours.
author: John H.

description: I ordered a double super burger (no cheese) and fries to go and when I got home, I realized that while I was charged for the extras of lettuce, tomato and onions, I received a regular double burger with no extras. Luckily I had a half of a tomato in the fridge to augment the otherwise plain (I think there was some "special sauce" on there, but the amount was so minute, I'm not sure) and greasy burger. I know that a previous reviewer said the greasiness that many wrote about came from the cheese, I have to disagree. Orphan Andy's delivers a far superior burger and fries!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Been here three times already, plan on going back often. Its simply really nice to have a decent burger place with moderate prices that has really great customer service. Nothing is better than being greeted and noticed by the cordial girls always taking orders. They always check in with us half way through to see if everything was ok, which I love. The only thing I might advise is if you are looking for a huge man burger, you might want something else. The burgers aren't huge, more they are appropriately sized. Overall lovely fun experience.
author: Jay S.

description: If you wanted to blow your diet, this wouldn't be the place to do it. I was overall underwhelmed by the place. Its surprising considering how long the lines are out the door to this place. i wouldn't say this food was horrible tasting but there is nothing special about it at all. i would have rather gone down the street to burgermeister on church. they make a decent burger and have a lot more selection for a chain restaurant. we also ordered the garlic fries which were nowhere close to a place like gordon biersch for garlic fries. actually, i've even had better garlic fries at smart alec in berkeley and those are baked and healthy for you. overall, I don't think I'm going to be coming back here when I have so many other choices in the city for food. I'm glad that they serve alcohol. maybe that will make the food taste better for me next time! I didn't try the milk shake even though I heard some reviewers rave about it. I gotta say the prices were not too bad for a "so so" meal. More than anything else, I'd rather have gone to In-n-out for a much more satisfying burger experience.
author: Bryant L.

description: Had a very nice meal here over the weekend,  loved the fries,  perfectly cooked and seasoned.  I do however, as much as I enjoyed my cheeseburger was very disappointed in the actual size of the burger.  Seemed to be about the size of something I could get at a fast food outlet. It tasted very nice,  I also was not sold on how super the Super sauce was,  not much there.  I should also add that I thought that the service was fine,  and enjoyed the space.
author: tom s.

description: Finally something between the awful $6 diner burgers and the high-quality $10 burgers in the Castro. This is middle ground I can certainly live with. Delicious!
author: Ian N.

description: so good !!! highly recoomend this place !!!
author: sharon n.

description: Super Duper: think of it as a budget Beretta, a stripped-down Starbelly.  For what it claims to be, a basic burger barn, it's fine.  I had the small basic cheeseburger and fries, both of which were very good.  The burger is small enough to eat handily without it exploding everywhere.  Who says portions of everything have to be gargantuan...that's why America is so fat now.  The French fries were hot, crispy, and delicious, AND...they even have milk (not on the menu, but if you ask for it they will provide.)  It offers a great value for the money and an alternative to McDonalds (at one end) or Burger Bar (at the other end.)  It's almost like a neighbourhood In'n'Out.
author: Tom R.

description: The Burger was fine for the price. Its small but sufficient and has good ingredients.  The Fries were a total loss, they tasted like all pre frozen fries which are heated just before serving. The outside was crisp and the inside was overdone yesterday.Making real fries would totally change the feeling of the food. Ill try it again but it feels like a fast food palace with nowhere to go but downhill.  Ill go back for the beer!
author: carmine g.

description: i'm on a hunt to find the best burger and super duper is definitely up there. everything tastes AND looks fresh! can't go wrong w/ the double patties. :)
author: Emm Y.

description: Superduper might have chosen their name more carefully.  There is serious room for improvement.  The atmosphere feels strangely clinical and unfinished, yet modern.  The highlight of the meal came with the efficient service and the tasty pickle.  I was a little distraught that they did not keep mayo out for fries.  My partner and I both ordered the Double Superburger.  It was greasy as many others have said, and I don't mind greasy.  The bun was the biggest problem having zero character, and additionally, it was not toasted which might have helped balance the grease.  There was very little sauce that I could discern, and so the burger had to basically stand on it's Niman ranch legs and they were not strong enough to hold it up.  The garlic-cheese fries were also not something particularly good.  The fries were cooked correctly from what I remember, but there was very little garlic, and the parmesean tasted pretty cheap and was way overdone.  Honestly, the entire shop stank of that cheap parmesean giving it a slight funk.  I'll admit that I didn't try the soft serve, but I've had Straus soft serve, but it's not necessarily something unique to this establishment.
author: Chris F.
